title: Freddie Prinze's Will Omits His Father and ExWife
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 1 (UPI)Freddie Prinze, the television star who shot himself last week, left the bulk of his estate to his mother and 10monthold son but specifically omitted as beneficiaries his father and estranged wife, according to the will filed for probate yesterday.

title: Sayers in 2d Hall of Fame
description: Gale Sayers, who was elected to the Pro Football Hall of Fame last month, was among 11 players named yesterday to the College Football Hall. The 33yearold former running back, now athletic director at Southern Illinois University, became the youngest person to be honored by the National Football Foundation in the last two decades.

title: Feeding, and Heeding, the Poor
description: Reform in the name of efficiency threatens to wipe out one of the most humane institutions in the United States Senate. As it emerged from the Rules Committee, misshapen and bent by a number of powerful interests, a proposal to streamline Senate operations would eliminate the Select Committee on Nutrition and Human Needs and tuck its functions into a subcommittee of the Agriculture Committee. It's not exactly sending the chickens off to live with the foxes, but the image will do.

title: Dollar Is Generally Lower In Europe, but Dealers Cite stabilization
MAJOR CRIMES WANE WITH THE COLD WAVE
EDWARD WRIGHT DIES
description: Edward L. Wright, a former president Of the American Bar Association, died yesterday in Little Rock, Ark. He was 73 years old.

description: 1. Empty the oysters into a sieve placed over a mixing bowl. Let drain. Reserve the oyster liquor.

title: Podgorny to Visit India This Month
description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 1 (AP)President Nikolai V. Podgorny of the Soviet Union will visit India at the end of February, the Indian Government announced today. He will be the first Soviet leader to come to India since a visit by Leonid I. Brezhnev in November 1973.

title: Carter Discusses Human Rights And Arms Issues. With Dobrynin
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1  President Carter told Ambassador Anatoly F. Dobrynin today that the United States would not back down omits commitment to strengthen human rights in the Soviet Union and elsewhere, the White House said.

title: Chinese Poster Deplores Backwardness of Economy,
Freight Car Orders Top Deliveries
description: The American railway car industry will deliver 50,000 freight cars while orders will be at the 55,000 level, members reported at the 62d annual meeting of the board of directors of the American Railway Car Institute.

title: Robert Nash Dies at 84
description: Robert Arthur (Bob) Nash, the first captain of the first New York Giants professional football team in 1925, died yesterday in Winsted, Conn., where he had lived for 15 years. He was 84 years old.

title: Moonshine a Lure in Battle Against Boars
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn.  A mixture of corn, sugar and yeastthe recipe for moonshine whiskyhas been thrown into. the battle of the Great Smoky Mountain National Park against a horde of wild boars.

description: On The Lovely Women

Chinese Farms Studied
description: American experts are studying the prodigious increases in China's agricultural yields to determine if there are features that may be exportable. Page D2.

5 Reported Slain in Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES, Feb. 1 (Reuters)Five left  wing guerrillas, including three women, were killed today in a gun battle with security forces in the Buenos Aires suburb of Ciudadele, the police said. They said the guerrillas opened fire from two cars on security forces at a roadblock.

title: All About: Getting Toasty With Electric Blankets
Wine Talk
description: IT WAS the clerk in a liquor store who started it. The '72 bordeaux, he said, are not fit to drink. We wouldn't have them in the shoo.

About Real Estate
description: Three years ago two of the venerable Yiddish publications in the city, The Workmen's Circle and The Jewish Daily Forward, migrated northward from the Lower East Side. They moved into the old Harper & Row building at 45 East 33d street, forsaking the 12story Forward building at 175 East Broadway, across the street from Seward Park.

title: U.S. Plans to Bolster Aid to Egypt By $190 Million to Ease Unrest
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1The United States, in a major gesture of support to President Anwar elSadat of Egypt, has informed Congress that it will transfer $190 million in aid funds to help Egypt deal with an economic crisis that led to an outburst of riots recently when Cairo attempted to raise prices on food and fuel.

title: Tennis Is an Art Form for Teaching Pro
description: Tennis prosthat is, those who get paid for teachingare a diverse breed. Some are frustrated tournament players; some are dreamers; some., are genuine students of the game; some enjoy the work; some despise it.

title: Personal Finance: Help on Tax Filing
description: THE W2 corms have been sent out, the Internal Revenue Service is putting on more staff, and private taxpreparing services such as H & R Block Inc. are bracing for what could be their biggest year ever.

title: Private Lives
description: IT WAS a small boldness, but they count, too. In the cellars of the night, when the mind, starts moving around old trunks of bad times, the pain of this and the shame of that, the memory of a small boldness is a hand to hold. We weren't always cowards. There have been moments for which we needn't apologize.

title: HOUSESENATE PANEL ADOPTS COMPROMISE ON GAS LEGISLATION
Carey and Beame, in the Capital, Hopeful on Westway
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1  Governor Carey, Mayor Beame and Senator Daniel P. Moynihan emerged from an hourlong conference today with the Secretary of Transportation, Brock Adams, confident that the Cabinet member would allow the $1.2 billion Westway highway project in Manhattan to go forward without delay.

title: Dow Is Up 3.99 as Market Begins Month With a Moderate Advance
description: February got off to a promising start in the stock market yesterday as a wide range of issuesfrom the energy stocks to the recently battered drug groupparticipated in a mild rally following January's sharp selloff.

title: Drought Perils 13 Western States
Living Abroad: Montreal
description: RELIEF is on the way for the legions of people who drink modest wine in heavily French Montreal. With the exception of beer and cider, alcoholic beverages in the province of Quebec are sold only through government outlets where service tends to be surly and cursory. Now. Quebec's new reformminded government, which wants to make the province an independent nation, is trying to attend to popular needs. One of its first reforms is the sale of table wines in ordinary food stores. This means the wine will be closer to hand, for although there are more than 100 government, outlets in the Montreal area, few of there ever seem to be conveniently located.

title: School Aide Getting $25,000 Fine
description: The New York City Board of Education is planning to impose a record fine of $25,000 upon a $16,510ayear school lunch employee who was suspended last August, along with two superiors, because of irregularities in the awarding of more than $2 million in purchase orders.

title: 60Minute Gourmet
description: THERE is no doubt that tastes in food are sometimes cyclical. During the 1930's when I was an apprentice and then a young chef at the Restaurant Drouant in Paris, there were numerous dishes that appeared on Paris menus that contained or centered on cooked oysters. And then for a long time cooked oysters were seldom heard of on French menus.

title: We can't afford diplomas. But this note'll do.
description: CHICAGO  Recently, a friend's daughter reported that her freshman year at a wellknown Midwestern college was turning out to be a drag because. the school's going broke. She and her parents had considered academic reputation, size, location, and their own finances in making a final choice, but like most people they had not inquired into the college's finances.

title: Stars Coach Is. Annoyed With Switch
description: The North American Soccer League's coach of the year in 1975 is fed up with the league moving his team to a different division for the fourth time in five years.

title: Yeo Is Taking Posts At Bank in Chicago
description: Edwin H. Yeo 3d, who served as Undersecretary of the Treasury for Monetary Affairs since 1975, will join the First National Bank of Chicago as chairman of the asset and liability management committee and as executive vice president, the bank announced yesterday.

title: DAVID E. FINLEY DIES
description: David E. Finley, former director of the National Gallery of Art and past chairman of the United States Commission of Fine Arts, died early yesterday in his home in Georgetown. He was 86 years old.

title: Dividends
description: TUESDAY. FEBRUARY 1, 1977

title: Southern Motels Lure Crowds With Live Music
description: RALEIGH, N.C.Thirtyfiveyearold Arthur Epps, who calls himself King Arthur when he is behind a. microphone, has had his ups and downs as an entertainer, singing on street corners in New York, recording his first single when he was 16, composing the sound track for a grade B movie in the early 1960's, playing and singing in barrooms and clubs across the country.

title: Ernest Gottscho, 81, Who Served As Geological Survey Translator
description: Ernest Gottscho, who retired in 1969 as a librarian and translator for the Geological Survey of the United States Department of the Interior in Washington, died Monday in the Holly Manor Nursing Home, Mendham N.J. He was 81 years old and lived in Mandham.

title: MONTREAL CRIME UP IN POLICE SLOWDOWN
description: MONTREAL, Feb. 1A police slowdown, begun here yesterday in a contract dispute, has been accompanied by a sharp rise in armed robberies in the Montreal metropolitan area.

title: House Coffee Inquiry Slated
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 (AP)Two Congressional subcommittees said today that they would conduct joint hearings on the price of coffee. The hearings will be held here Feb. 22 and 23 by the House Subcommittee an Commerce, Consumer and Monetary Affairs and the subcommittee on Domestic Marketing, Consumer Relations and Nutrition. The panels are headed, respectively, by Representatives Benjamin S. Rosenthal of Queens and Frederick W. Richmond of Brooklyn, both Democrats.

title: Fun in Budget for Byrne
India Cricketers on Verge Of Victory in .Test Match
description: BANGALORE, India Feb. 1(Reuters)After the anguish of three crushing defeats, India appeared on its way to victory in the fourth cricket test following an assault on England's second innings here tonight.. In 9.5 avers, India's bowlers reduced England to eight runs. for four wickets and though Roger Tolchard and Tony Greig denied them a further breakthrough, it appeared unlikely that the home team would be denied tomorrow.

title: Editor of The Post Denies That Disagreements Led To Resignation by Sann
description: Edwin Bolwell, editor of The New York Pbst, said yesterday that he had had no disagreements over anything with Paul Bann, The Post's longtime executive editor, whose resignation was announced Monday.

title: TELEVISION TODAY
description: Morning

title: Council Redistricting May Not Be Done by Deadline
description: ALBANY, Feb. 1Redistricting of the New York City Council in time for next November's election appears virtually impossible because Democrats and Republicans have failed to agree on an enlarged Council.

title: Paul M. Atkins, 84, Consultant On Finance and Management
description: Paul M. Atkins, a retired financial and management consultant, died Monday in Mountainside Hospital, Glen Ridge, N.J., after a long illness. He lived at 199 Inwood Avenue in Montclair, N.J., and was 84 years old.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Feb. 1Governor. Byrne was interrupted 16 times by applause, none of it thunderous, during his 40minute annual budget address today to a joint session of the Legislature, but it has to be recorded that he asked for it at least six times.

title: Child's World
U.S. Steel to Increase Tin Mill Products Prices by 4.8%
description: The United States Steel Corporation yesterday tested the Carter Administration's new policy of taking an active role in curbing wage and price increases.

title: GAS UTILITIES ADDED 341,000 CUSTOMERS DESPITE WARNINGS
description: Even as they were warning of the coming natural gas crisis in recent years, many of the nation's gas utilities were adding customers and encouraging use of gasconsuming appliances.

title: Market Place
Snow Lays Siege to Watertown
description: WATERTOWN, N.Y., Feb. 1Six feet of snow covered the ground, with drifts rising to 25 feet. All roads were closed, and as many as 2,000 oars were believed snowbound. Dairy farmers were losing an estimated $500,000 a day because they had to dump milk that they could not. get off their farms. Four barns collapsed. trapping 150 head of cattle.

title: Albany Pases Bill To Protect Buyers Of Money Orders
description: ALBANY, Feb. 1The State Legislature passed an emergency bill this evening to bail out thousands of holders of worthless money orders in New York State and to protect future buyers of money orders from loss if the company that issues them fails.

title: 80 Million Saw Roots Sunday, Setting Record
description: Eighty million Americans the largest television audience in the history of the medium, watched the final episode of Roots, the dramatization of a black family's life during the American slavry era, the National Nielsen Ratings reported yesterday.

title: Aide Linked, to Spying By I. R. S. Is Cleared
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1Dougald D. McMillan, the Justice Department lawyer who was transferred out of Miami after being linked in press accounts to the alleged sex spying activities of Federal informants there, has been cleared of the charges after a long investigation, it was learned today.

title: California Imposes Curbs on the Use of Natural Gas To Aid Shipments to Har dHit Eastern Half of U.S.
description: With forecasts of below freezing Rihruary weather threatening continued widespread unemployment in the eastern trplf of the country, California yesterday imposed restrictions on natural gasincluding: a ban .on all luxury usesto let its utilities ship gas supplies to the South and Middle West.

title: Waldheim Will Undertake A Little Shuttle Diplomacy On His Mideast Mission
description: GENEVA, Feb. 1Secretary General hurt Waldheim said today that he would try a touch of shuttle diplomacy during the Middle East peace mission he begins tomorrow by visiting Egypt both before and after he confers with Israel's leaders.

title: Music: Emil Gilels, Pianist
description: EMIL GILELS, one of the most popular of Russian exports, played a rather curious program last night in Carnegie Hall. Either he was trying to prove something, or merely dumped together a group of disparate pieces.

title: Free Press and Petra$
Advertising
FIRST SUPERTANKERS WITH ATOM POWER PROPOSED FOR U. S
description: A letter of intent for construction of up to three supertankers that would be the world's largest and the first propelled by nuclear energy has been signed by a Kashmiriborn British shipping magnate and the Newport News Shipbuilding and Dry Dock Company.

description: President Carter told the Soviet envoy at their first meeting that the United States would not back down in its commitment for strengthened human rights in the Soviet Union and elsewhere. He called this a commitment on a position, not an attack on the Soviet Union. Plans for next month's resumption of strategic arms negotiations in Moscow took up most of the onehour White House meeting. [Page A1, Cols. 12.]

title: Drought Perils 13 Western States
description: DENVER, Feb. 1  Extremely dry weather is endangering next summer's water supplies from the Rocky Mountain states to the Pacific Coast, according to the latest data from the Department of Agriculture. Lack of snow is also threatening crops, especially wheat, in the plains of Kansas, Nebraska, the Dakotas, Oklahoma, Texas, Wyoming and Colorado.

title: Steel Union Election Is Awaited As Key Test in Organized Labor
Business Records
description: Tuesday, Feb. 1, 1977

title: Cold and Gas Shortage Put Many In Nashville Unemployment Office
description: NASHVILLE, Feb. 1Ellen K. Griffith, a 20yearold sales clerk in a suburban shopping center, and her fiance, Roger D. Everson, 21, started the new year off enthusiastically with plans for marriage. But as they sat together today in the state unemployment office here, the wherewithal to make those plans come about appeared uncertain.

title: MONTREAL CRIME UP IN POLICE SLOWDOWN
description: MONTREAL, Feb. 1A pollee slowdown, begun here yesterday in a contract dispute, has been accompanied by a sharp rise in armed robberies in the Montreal metropolitan area.

title: Fine for Kepone Pollution Is Reduced to $5 Million
description: RICHMOND, Feb. 1. (AP)Federal District Judge Robert R. Merhige Jr., declaring that the Allied Chemical Corporation was contrite and sincere, today reduced its $13.2 million fine for violations of Federal pollution laws to $5 million.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: H.E.W. Begins Study on Subsidies For Emergency Utilities for Poor
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 (UPI)Rejecting a plan to divert some Federal day care funds to emergency utility subsidies for the poor, the Department of Health, Education and Welfare has begun a study to determine what subsidies might be made available later.

title: Ice on Chesapeake Cripples Shellfish In in 2 States
description: BIVALVE, Md., Feb. 1The coldest winter for Chesapeake Bay and Potomac River watermen in four decades has crystallized thousands of miles of crabandoyster filled shoreline, turning one of the world's richest fisheries into a glistening, icebound deep freeze.

title: 22 Poles Back Dissent Elsewhere
description: WARSAW, Feb. 1 (Reuters)Twentytwo Polish dissidents today issued an open letter expressing solidarity with Czechoslovaks and East Germans demanding human and civil rights.

title: Pentagon Officials Say Billions in New Strategic Weapons Are Needed
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1Topranking Pentagon officials told a Senate panel today that they needed billions of dollars worth of new strategic weapons if they were to fulfill their assigned deterrent task of being able to knock out the bulk of the Soviet Union's industrial and military capacities in a fullscale war.

title: Unemployment Lines Are Swelled by Gas Cutbacks
description: ENGLEWOOD, Feb. 1By 9:30 A.M., the state's big unemployment office here was walltowall people. The jobless were filed into 10 lines, each about 35 feet long, for the long wait for processing or payment.

title: People in Sports
description: It took the Denver Broncos only a day to name a replacement for John Ralston, the head coach who resigned Monday. The new man is Robert (Red) Miller, who most recently was the offensive coordinator for the New England Patriots.

title: Durable Goods Orders Up 7.7%, Best December Gain in 6 Years
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 (UPI)New orders for durable goods increased 7.7 percent for the biggest December increase six years, the Commerce Department said today.

title: BYRNE'S BUDGET ASKS $4 BILLION, A RECORD
description: TRENTON, Feb. 1Governor Byrne presented to the Legislature today a record $4 billion annual state budget, said it was one of the most frugal in New Jersey's history and complimented himself and the Legislature for tax reform and fiscal restraint.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Feb. 2Ann Klein, Commissioner of Human Services, said today that a thousand or more disturbed children, 200 of them severely retarded, were getting virtually no education from the state, and that several thousand others got less than their constitutional right.

title: Testing Quebec's Separatism
News Summary
description: THURSDAY, FEBRUARY 3, 1977

title: South African School Calm In the Eye of Apartheid Storm
Young Stops Over in Britain
description: LONDON, Feb. 2Andrew Young, the United States delegate to the United Nations, met today with British experts on Rhodesia before continuing on a 10day trip to Africa. It appeared unlikely that he would encourage an American initiative there now that the Britishorganized talks on black rule in Rhodesia have stalled.

title: Price Inquiry Is Set Into Coffee Market By Federal Agency
description: Representative Frederick W. Richmond announced yesterday that the General Accounting Office, the investigative arm of Congress. had agreed to study the international coffee supplyanddemand situation.

title: Books of the Times
description: Changing is a book that sneaks up on your respect and wins it by stealth. At first you prickle with suspicion and hostility. There is Liv Ullmann's mournful visage looking out at you from both the front and the back of the dustjacket, as if to suggest that her words must be as comely as her features. There are her opening sentences; I am sitting here, my thoughts carrying me around the world and within myself, trying to record the voyages on paper. I want to write about loveabout being a human Deingabout loneliness  about being a woman. You want to draw a blind over such sentences. You find yourself thinking what occurred to Miss Ullmann herself, according to an interview that appeared in these pages recently: that if the author were not an internationally famous film star her book would never have found a publisher.

title: Big Board Issues Its Reports Of Changes in Stock by Insiders
description: The New York Stock Exchange issued yesterday its latest reports of changes in stock ownership by large stockholders, directors and officers of their listed companies.

title: Tale of Confusion: Alarm Said Lethal, but It Wasn't
description: The Police Department's relay to all of its commands'of a Teletype message Yesterday from the United States Marshalls Service regarding a lethal form of powdered tear gas In talcum form called Lance was precise and fearful.

title: French Clothes That Don't Try To Be Anything But Romantic
S.E.C. Charges Indonesia Oil Chief In Shakedown of Big U.S. Concerns
DrugTesters Run a Different Kind of Race Beyond the Roaring Crowds at Aqueduct
description: In a chilly barn behind the mile chute at Aqueduct yesterday, the man in charge of getting samples for drugtesting said he made one concession to the cold weather. We don't ask the catcher to stay around all hours, said said Dr. Jim Brewer. If he doesn't have a sample within two hours, we send the horse back and the catcher home. The catcher is in charge of providing urine samples, which are shipped to a horsetesting laboratory in Jamaica, Queens, and to one at the University of Cornell in Ithaca, N. Y.

title: CORRECTION
description: The Times incorrectly reported yesterday that ABC had withdrawn from the bidding for the rights to cover the 1980 Olympic Games in Moscow. It was CBS, not ABC, that withdrew from the bidding.

title: JOHNSON SECURITY ADVISER CHOSEN ARMY SECRETARY
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 (AP)Clifford L. Alexander Jr., who was a national security adviser to President Johnson, will be nominated to be Secretary of the Army, the White House announced today.

title: Yonkers Drivers
CHOICE OF ARMS AIDE IS FACING OPPOSITION
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2  President Carter announced today that he would nominate Paul C. Warnke as the chief negotiator on arms control matters. The nomination is expected to touch off a debate in the Senate over the formor Pentagon official's views on arms reduetion.

title: CONGRESSIONAL DEMOCRATS PRAISE CARTER'S ADDRESS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb:, 2 (UPI)Congressional Democrats said tonight that President Carter's address would stimulate a sense of national purpose and confidence in its Government.

title: Washington &
description: WASHINGTONEven though there is a pressing need for new buses in cities around the nation, two of the three largest bus manufacturers are laying off personnel and the third may follow suit in a month, reducing to a rivulet the stream of new equipment for transit systems.

title: 2 Youths Die in Jersey Crash
description: PENNINGTON, N. J., Feb. 2 (UPI)Two youths were killed and two injured when their car crashed into a tree shortly before last midnight as they returned from a skiing outing. The dead were Jeffrey F. Ratico, 17 years old, the driver, and Patrick Ford, 15. The injured were Kenneth Paul, 16, and Louis Natale, 16. All four were from Ewing Township, N. J.

title: Issue and Debate
Special Prosecutor to Investigate Shooting, of Youth by a Detective
Wyoming Adds Knaus
description: LARAMIE, Wyo., Feb. 1 (AP)Bill Lewis, Wyoming's new head football coach, completed his staff of assistants today by naming David Knaus as defensive tackle coach. Knaus worked with the junior varsity program at Texas Tech last year and was a graduate assistant in 1975 after graduating from the school.

title: Nets Stun Celtics, 9989, As 3 Newest Players Star
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Feb. 2The New York Nets, whose specialty this season has been negative surprises of the Oh no, not again variety, produced a positive one tonight by upsetting the Boston Celtics at the Nassau Coliseum, 9989.

title: SelfControl for Controllers
description: Much of the contract between the New York City Board of Education and the United Federation of Teachers is open to challenge. Groups of parents and educators deplore its basic thrust of increasing the eventual pay of individual teachers while reducing their total number. They contend that classroom education will suffer. They may be right, but the Board of Education, the union and City Hall are united in supporting the fruit of their long negotiation.

title: Albany Legislators Say an Easing Of Marijuana Curbs Is Probable
Leafs Roll as Turnbull Gets DefensemanRecord 5 Goals
description: TORONTO, Feb. 2 (UPI)lan Turnbull of Toronto scored five goals tonight, becoming the first National Hockey League defenseman to achieve that many in a game, as he powered the Maple Leafs to a 91 rout of the Detroit Red Wings.

title: The Stage: Brothers, a OneDimensional Drama
description: In Eric Krebs's Brothers, two brothers spend a summer building a house and cementing their sibling rivalry. The younger brother, Max, is all thumbs and calluses. The older one, Tom, is a born builder and a bit of a dreamer. Brothers is about missed opportunitiesthe two characters are past the point of connection or even of collaboration. The play itself is an exercise in futility.

title: ExF.B.I. Agent Named To. Aid the Investigation Of Reilly's Prosecution
description: HARTFORD, Feb. 2A former agent of the Federal Bureau of Investigation was sworn in today with the title of inspector to assist a oneman grand jury and a special prosecutor in trying to determine whether the State of Connecticut had committed any crimes against Peter Reilly in trying him in the killing of his mother.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: The Knicks Say Thanks to Fans With $1,200 Donation for Neediest
description: Members of the New York Knicks basketball team, despite recent losses, took time out to get together and chip in $1,200 to aid the 65th annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund. A team spokesman put is simply:

title: 60 Yugoslavs Ask For Lifting of Curbs On Travel Abroad
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Feb. 2A group of 60 Yugoslav proponents of civil rights disclosed today that they had petitioned the Government of President Tito to end a practice of arbitrarily denying passports to some Yugoslav citizens.

title: The Standings
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Cabaret: Jo Sullivan Excels With Loesser's Songs
description: The parade of Broadway composers who have been selling their wares at the Ballroom, the SoHo restaurant and cabaret, since last fall is taking a slightly different turn this week. The composer whose music is being featured is Frank Loesser. But, because Mr. Loesser died in 1969, it is his widow, Jo Sullivan, who starred in Mr. Loesser's The Most Happy Fella, who is singing his songs.

title: The U.N. Today
WEATHER TAKES TOLL OF NATION'S WILDLIFE
description: The oil spills off Cape Cod and in the Delaware River last December benefited waterfowl by inducing many birds to go South before the cold, wave stunned the East Coast, the United States Fish and Wildlife Service reported yesterday.

title: Tennis
description: AT RICHMOND

title: Top Adviser to Beame Registers as a Lobbyist For Voluntary Hospitals
Going Too Far to Save Energy
description: CINCINNATI, Feb. 2 (AP)The Cincinnati Park Police built a fire in the fireplace of its headquarters in an attempt to conserve energy but wound up with a $6,000 fire instead. Capt. Norbert Tieke, commander of the force that patrols city parks, said that staff members discovered, too late, that the ornamental fireplace had no flue and was never intended to be used.

title: Carrot, Stick and Ethics
description: The news from Congress on the ethics front is preliminary but welcome nonetheless: The carrot seems safely in hand, and there's good progress toward securing the stick.

title: Lead Poisoning Tests Scheduled
description: The New York City Model Cities Administrator, Heyward B. Davenport, announced that more that 1,000 children between the ages of 3 and 6 would he tested this month for lead poisoning the South Bronx. The testing will be undertaken by the Comprehensive Pediatrics Screening Program, a communitybased preventive health care program that has been examining South Bronx children for the last five years in an attempt to identify physical and emotional problems.

title: AIRLIFTS CARRY AID TO SNOWY BUFFALO
Topics
description: However questionable the cultural values of American commerce or of Soviet politics, there is no denying the staggering heights they can attain in ioint production.

title: Hunt Says Star Breaks Faith
description: Hiving satisfied his ambitions at the tournament level, wth victories at Wimbledon, Paris, Rome, Dallas and Boston, Bjorn Borg said yesterday that he Would give World Team Tennis a threeyear fling.

title: Bridge:
description: Generalizations about bridge, whether technical or nontechnical, are hardly ever completely valid unless they are totally banal. Consider, for example, the following proposition concerning pair contests: The bigger the gap in ability between the strongest pair and the average standard of the rest of the field, the better the chance that the favorites will win.

title: Benitez Clowns to a Draw
description: The arrogance of youth cost Wilfredo Benitez of Puerto Rico his unblemished status as a professional fighter last night in the Madison Square Garden ring.

title: Wickedly Intelligent Humor Enhances Otherwise Engaged
MOSCOW AGAIN CHARGES U.S. NEWSMAN IS AGENT
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 2 (AP)A Soviet publication again charged today that an Associated Press correspondent here was an intelligence agent and accused him of illegal currency operations. The AP has been asked to withdraw the correspondent.

title: Stockton Loses To Barazzutti Of Italy, 64 62
description: RICHMOND, Feb.2The first upset of the $100,000 World Championship Tennis circuit tournament came tonight when Corrado Barazzutti of Italy toppled Dick Stockton, 64, 62, and advanced to the quarterfinal round.

title: Housing Ruling Sought
description: A Bergen County Superior Court, which dismissed a suit charging exclusionary zoning in four communities, was ordered by a state appellate court to decide whether minorities can obtain adequate housing.

title: Oilers Appoint Peppler to Williams's Job
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 2 (AP)Pat Peppler, former interim coach and general manager of the Atlanta Falcons, today was named assistant general manager of the Houston Oilers only one day after the Oilers dismissed Torn Williams from the job.

title: Basketball Game Reset
description: ALLIANCE, Ohio, Feb. 2 (AP)The Ohio Conference college basketball game between Ohio Northern and Mount Union will be played next Monday night. It was postponed from Saturday night because of poor weather.

title: Secretary in Contempt
description: A legal secretary was charged with contempt of court for refusing to answer four questicns on a jurorqualification questionnaire. She faces a sentence of up to 30 days in jail and a fine of up to $250. State Supreme Court Justice Alfred M. Ascione said that the law allowed him no discretion about finding the secretary, Sylvia Malakoff, in contempt, but he urged that the questionnaire be revised to eliminate unnecessary questions.

title: A Senate Panel in Jersey Urges Concorde Landings at Kennedy
description: TRENTON, Feb. 2The New Jersey Senate Committee on Transportation and Communications has urged that the Concorde be allowed to land at Kennedy International Airport for a limited test period.

title: In Memoriam
description: OLESKERRebecca. In loving memory. Sadly missed. Children & Grandchildren

title: Business Brisk as Weather in East
description: Evidence keeps mounting that the West's loss this year because of generally poor ski conditions in the Rockies has been the East's gain. Reports from ski areas, ranging from the Poconos to upper New England disclose that the season so far has been extremely prosperous for almost all Eastern resorts. Phil Camp of Woodstock, Vt., who is executive director of the New England Ski Areas Council, says the brisk business has come at a time when ski area operators in his region ere embarked on the most ambitious promotion campaign in many years.

title: S.E.C. Charges Indonesia Oil Chief In Shakedown of Big U .S. Concerns
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2A former head of the Indonesian state oil company masterminded a shakedown of dozens of major corporations for $1.11 million to set up a New York restaurant, the Securities and Exchange Commission charged today.

title: Nassau to Study Water
description: The Nassau County Health Department plans to identify and eliminate the sources of chemicals in the county's ground water that are suspected of causing cancer. The program, expected to be completed in two years at a cost of more than $755.000, will involve three types of sources  industrial plants, municipal and community facilities and consumer products.

title: Senators Hopeful on Canal Treaty
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2TWo highranking Senators who strongly support a new Panama Canal treaty said today that such a pact would not now command the required twothirds majority vote.

title: 63 Environmentalists Urge Gas Tax Rise, With Curb On Population and Smoking
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 (AP)The United States should limit population growth, ban smoking and impose higher taxes on gasoline to help improve the quality of life 63 environmental leaders say.

title: Santee Takes Early Lead in Figure Skating
description: HARTFORD, Feb. 2 (AP)David Santee, who says his target is a 1980 Olympic gold medal, began moving toward that goal today by placing first in the senior men's compulsory figures at the United States figureskating championships.

title: It's Time for a World Hockey League
description: Some of the Cleveland Barons agreed yesterday to accept a 27 percent deferment in their salaries to keep the National Hockey League franchise in business this season and the other members of the team have until Friday decide. Meanwhile, the National Basketball Association talking. of changing its schedule next season in order capitalize on divisional rivalries. And today World Team Tennis is expected to add a Soviet franchise. Those three developments may not seem related. but they are. It's time for the National Hockey League to become the World Hockey League by adding teams from Europe, including three from the Soviet Union, and absorbing four teams from the World Hockey Association create a sixdivision 30team league with global significance and a true world championship. In the process, the World Hockey League would eliminate the weak and financially troubled N.H.L. and W.H.A. teams. It also would provide stronger divisional rivalries. And if the Soviet Union is willing to join a tennis league, it's probably willing to join a hockey league.

title: India Takes Cricket Test With England by 140 Runs
description: BANGALORE, India, Feb. 2 (Reuters) India won the fourth cricket test here today, but a splendid innings of 81 runs not out by Alan Knott, England's wicketkeeper, made them work unexpectedly hard to achieve it. The final margin of victory was 140 runs, which was considerably less than appeared likely at the start of the day when England resumed at 34 runs for four wickets. England had begun its second innings yesterday needing 318 to win and in 9.5 overs lost its first four wickets for eight runs.

title: Agent Says Billy Carter Is Getting Many Calls
description: NASHVILLE, Feb. 2 (UPI)A day after announcing that he had been signed as Billy Carter's agent, Tandy Rice said today, the number of requests received was absolutely mindboggling.

title: On the Choice of Themes by Princetonians
Groundhog Sees His ShadowOr Was It just TV Lights?
Anguilla's Chief Minister Is Removed From Office
description: THE VALLEY, Anguilla, Feb. 2 (UPI)The British Governor General ended the 10year reign of Chief Minister Ronald Webster today in this tiny Caribbean colony.

title: City U. Accused by Levitt Of Overbilling New York To Finance Illegal Frills
description: The office of State Comptroller Arthur Levitt has charged City University officials with maintaining an illegal slush fund, amounting to thousands of dollars. that has been used tinance such activities as outoftown travel and entertainment.

title: Utility Pays $15,000 Fine
description: WATERFORD, Conn. Feb. 2 (AP) Northeast Utilities paid a $15,000 fine today for violating federal nuclear safety regulations, a spokesman said. The spokesman said that we still believe there are mitigating circumstances, but that continuation of the matter would not be in our best interest.

title: Ohio Senator Calls for a Gas Study
description: Senator Howard H. Metzenbaum Democrat of Ohio, saying a credibility gap exists in the current natural gas shortage, has asked the Interior Department to investigate whether natural gas producers have been deliberately withholding supplies from market.

title: Love Blooms in Reunion Here
description: She came down by limousine from the Rye Town Hilton, where she was playing in a Futures tournament, a satellite event that separates the maybes from the promises in women's tennis. She was wearing a denim skirt and a blue sweater, and her nails were painted red, the color of a claret. She acted as if she hadn't seen him in months.

title: Doughnuts Fall Victim To Shortage of Gas
description: Customers at Chock Full O'Nuts counters could get coffee and other items this week, but no doughnuts, because of the restrictions on the use of natural gas in the company's bakery in Secaucus, N. J.

title: The Cast
description: BROTHERS by Erie Krebs. Directed be Dino Naarzano; setting by Allen Cornell; lighting by Roy Waterstradt; production stage manager, Mary Burns. Presented jot tho SoHo Shoe Company, in association with George Street Playhouse. At the SoHo Artists Theater, 465 West Broadway.

title: East German Mobilization Linked to Maneuvers
description: BONN, Feb. 2 (Reuters)East Germany is calling up military reservists, informed sources said today, apparently as a mobilization test connected with maneuvers scheduled for May.

title: ExTax Collector Sentenced
description: NEWARK, Feb. 2 (AP)Walter F. Callender Sr., 57 years old, a former East Orange tax collector, has been sentenced to six months in prison for malfeasance and nonfeasance. Judge Ralph Fusco of Superior Court also sentenced Mr. Callender to a onetotwoyear suspended term for embezzlement and obtaining money under false pretenses. He was accused of taking $780 from Mrs. Anna B. Matthews, 80, as payment for delinquent taxes but not crediting the woman with the payment on municipal records.

title: Church Backs Effort of 2 Not to Testify In Terrorism Case
description: Two women employed at the headquarters of the Episcopal Church in New York City moved in court yesterday to quash subpOenas that seek to compel them to testifY before a Federal grand jury investigating terrorist bombings attributed to a Puerto Rican group called the FALN.

title: Hambro, Norwegian Diplomat, Dies
description: Edvard Isak Hambro, Norway's Ambassador to France and a former President of the United Nations General Assembly, died at his residence in Paris Tuesday night after a heart attack. He was 65 years old.

title: Defense Lawyer Says Mandel Juror Solicited a Bribe
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 2The lawyer for Walter Weikers, accused of trying to bribe a juror in the trial of Gov. Marvin Mandel, said today that the juror had solicited the bribe.

title: Rock: Kinks, British Cult Band
description: Ray Davies opened the Kinks's set Tuesday night at the Palladiumthe first of two shows therewith his song One of the Survivors. Mr. Davies is a serious, witty and affecting rock songwriter, if not always especially subtle, and his choice was hardly random. The Kinks have indeed survived long past their more innocently rocking beginnings, and all along Mr. Davies has chronicled the process.

title: Advertising
Cocoa and Coffee Commodity Futures Climb
description: Most New York commodity markets moved upward yesterday, led by cocoa and coffee, while prices on the Midwest grain and soybean exchanges continued to drift lower.

title: AIRLIFTS CARRY AID TO SNOWY BUFFALO
description: BUFFALO, Feb. 2It snowed again here today, as it has virtually every day this winter, but there was new hope on an afternoon of bright sunshineemergency money from Washington and massive airlifts of men and machines from New York City and military bases around the country to help this city dig out of the worst blizzard in its history.

title: CORRECTION
description: The Times incorrectly reported yesterday that ABC had withdrawn from the bidding for the rights to cover the 1980 Olympic Games in Moscow. It was CBS, not ABC, that withdrew from the bidding.

title: Sudan Reports Attack on Airport in South
description: KHARTOUM, the Sudan, Feb. 2 (AP)Sudanese authorities said Government forces crushed an attempt today by soldiers of rebel airdefense units to seize Juba airport in the south. The authorities reported that 10 persons had been killed in the fighting.

title: Letters
description: Energy: Of Producers, Users and the Weather

title: About New York
description: The vodka downed neatly in Borough Park with Noik Yankovitch, a Jewish emigrant from the Soviet Union who came here last Thanksgiving, had an ethereal sharpness, like his memories of the homeland winter.

title: The Energy Crisis and Carter: A Test and an Opportunity
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2In the Carter White House, the sudden crisis brought on by the paralyzing cold that now consumes the nation's energies is seen as both a test and an opportunity for the man who campaigned on the slogan Leaders. for a chance.

title: Pertamina's Sutowo Earned $300 A Month But Rode in Rolls Royce
Big Tips Raise Price of a Cab
description: Big tippers and other sports willing to spend several dollars more than the metered fare to get a taxi are bidding up the price of cab rides, or so Sanford Evans discovered.

title: Albany Legislators Say an Easing Of Marijuana Curbs Is Probable
description: ALBANY, Feb. 2With the election behind them and with public attitudes on marijuana continuing to relax, Republicans in the State Senate will very possibly accept a bill that would ease the restrictions against the possession of small amounts of marijuana, ranking members said today. However, they ruled out a bill that would reduce penalties for its sale.

title: Brown Orders Slowdown in Work on Missile for Navy
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 (UPI)Defense Secretary Harold Brown reversed Ford administration policy today by ordering a slowdown in development of the seagoing model of the cruise missile.

title: President Signs Natural Gas Bill, Marking First Legislative Victory
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 2President Carter signed into law today the bill he had requested to let the Government shift natural gas from surplus areas to shortage areas to keep houses warm and essential services operating.

title: AIDE OF MRS, GANDHI. RESIGNS, INCREASING HOPES OF OPPOSITION
description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 2Opponents of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, elated by the surprise defection of her senior Cabinet minister, conferred tonight on how to encourage further defections and unify opposition in the campaign for next month's Parliament elections.

title: U.S. Miscellany Sampler at Library

description: LOGANDr. Myra. A memorial servlcos for Dr. Logan will ha held at 1 PM, Sat.. Feb. 5th, 1977 at St. Martin's Episcopal Church. 230 Lenox Av., NYC.

title: House Gives Assassination Panel Authority to Continue Temporarily
Home Heating Oil Up 12% In Area Since Last Winter
description: Prices of home heating oil in the New York metropolitan area have increased by about 12 percent since last winter, according to major dealers, and the rise shows no signs of abating.

title: J. Clarence Davies Jr. Dies at 64
description: J. CLarence Davies Jr., a prominent New York City real estate executive and civic leader, died yesterday at the Southwest General Hospital in Cleveland, apparently of a heart attack. He was 64 years old and had homes at 215 East 68th Street and Lake Placid, N. Y.

title: Edward Thommen, 59, Director, Actor and Drama Teacher, Dies
description: Edward Thommen, director, actor and drama instructor, died Tuesday at the Sidney Farber Cancer Research Hospital in Boston. He was 59 years old.

title: Bateman and Kean Debate, and Mostly Agree
description: TRENTON, Feb. 2Senator Raymond H. Bateman of Somerville and Assemblyman Thomas H. Kean of Livingston, the two major announced Republican governorship candidates, kept it friendly today before a group of Mercer County Republicans in a campaign debate at the Inn of Trenton. Calling each other Tommy and Ray, the two moderate Republican Legislators attacked Governor Byrne and the Democratic Party and adopted the same or similar positions on a number of major issues. Mr. Bateman said he and Mr. Kean were friends and would still be friends on June 7, primary election day, because that's what it's all about.

title: Informal Presidential Chats Were Created by Franklin Roosevelt
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2Every President since Warren G. Harding has talked to the American people live over the airwaves, but the cozy, informal kind of fireside chat given by President Carter tonight is the distinctive creation of Franklin D. Roosevelt. He used the technique to good, often dramatic, advantage in 26 times n 12 years.

title: Data Release Ordered
description: Three community school boards that had refused to collect pupil and staff ethnic data for their districts, despite orders from the Board of Education, were superseded yesterday by Chancellor Irving Anker

title: U.S. ARMY IMPROVING AIR DEFENSE FORCES
Corporation Affairs
description: The Kaiser Bauxite Company and the Government of Jamaica announced yesterday the signing of an agreement to form a partnership for the mining of bauxite in that country. The new company Will be known as the Kaiser Jamaica Bauxite Company.

title: Carter's Economic Talks Abroad May Be Broadened, Mondale Says
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2  President Carter's midyear meeting with the leaders of Western Europe and 3apan may include political as well as economic discussions, Vice President Mondale suggested today.

title: Article 1  No Title
LEAD POISONING TIED TO WORKERS' CLOTHES
description: The children of lead workers may develop lead poisoning from exposure to the toxic dust carried home on the workers clothing, according to a study of smelter employees and their families in Tennessee.

title: A Spokesman Who's a Worrywart
description: WASHINGTONMary Finch Hoyt, the recently named East Wing coordinator and White House press secretary to Rosalynn Carter, knows what it is like to lose a campaign.

title: WALDHEIM STARTING TOUR OF MIDDLE EAST
description: CAIRO, Feb. 2Secretary General Kurt Waldheim of the United Nations arrived here today for a 10clay Middle East tour intended to get negotiations started for an ArabIsraeli settlement.

title: Commercial Conversions Offer Novelty
description: There is a certain kind of apartment that has thin white walls, low ceilings and the most compact possible arrangement of rooms. It sits within a new building of white brick, and by now it is as common a part of the landscape as the New York cabdriver or the pigeons of Central Park. For years, builders have justified the standard New York luxury highrise apartment perhaps as mean a piece of architecture as ever carried the word luxury before iton the ground that it was the only economical alternative in a city of high land costs, high labor Costs and high taxes. To build with the generous space, unusual room arrangements and quality materials of the apartment houses of 50 or more years ago would yield a building no one could afford to live in, they argue.

title: Meadowlands Drivers
St John's Wins, 8266, Ending Georgetown Jinx
description: St. John's basketball teams have had considerable trouble with Georgetown in recent seasons, losing three in a row to the team from the nation's capital. But the Redmen put all that behind them last night as they easily beat Georgetown, 8266, before 3,081 persons at Alumni Hall in Queens and a local television audience.

title: Eritrea Said to Gain War Initiative
description: ADDIS ABABA. Ethiopa (UPI)At score of dusty and isolated outposts along Eth'opia's wild northern frontier, Africa's longest war is being fought between Americanarmed troops and Arabbacked guerrillas.

title: Winter Is Expected to Add $139 To Average Family's Fuel Bills
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 (AP)The unusually cold winter will cost the nation's households an average of $139 more in heating costs for the season, according to a Library of Congress tudy released today.

title: The Males Prevail in Paris
description: PARISIn France, the personnel in the top restaurants is traditionally male, and there are few signs of change for the future. Forty years ago, in my father's time, we employed waitressesI prefer not to, said Andr Allard, proprietor of Chez Allard on the Left Bank.

title: Du Pont Manager Is Shot to Death By Gunmen in Northern Ireland
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Feb. 2 (UPDGunmen today killed the British manager of the Du Pont International plant, Londonderry's largest .employer, shooting him six times in the head and chest.

title: SAMIA MEGALLI
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 (UPI)Samia MegaIli, mentor and friend to a generation of foreign correspondents in Egypt, died last night in George Washington University Medical Center after a long illness. She was 47 years old.

title: Lee R. Dice, 89, Is Dead
description: Professor Lee R. Dice, a specialist in genetics and former professor of human genetics at the University of Michigan, died Monday in his home in Ann Arbor, Mich. He was 89 years old.

title: News Summary
description: THURSDAY, FEBRUARY 3, 1977

title: Market Place
Town Near Buffalo, Buried by Snow, Struggles Out
description: LANCASTER, N.Y., Feb. 2For nearly a week, this town of quaint small homes, light industry and dairy farms 17 miles east of Buffalo has been virtually buried under mounds of drifting snow dumped by a ferocious blizzard that struck with little warning.

title: Carter Ignores Instant Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 (UPI)President Carter does not object to instant analysis of his public speeches as some White House predecessors did, a spokesman said today. Barry Jagoda, special assistant in charge of the media, told reporters that, in preparing his televised talk for delivery tonight, Mr. Carter was aware there would be time afterward for commentators to discuss his remarks. He does not mind, Mr. Jagoda said.

title: Oliver and Roberts Are Named To New Jobs at The Daily News
description: Richard Oliver, city editor of The Daily News, has been appointed metropolitan editor, and Sam Roberts, assistant city editor and chief political correspondent, has been named city editor, Michael J. O'Neill, editor of The News announced yesterday.

title: G.O.P. Seeks Air Time To Respond to Carter
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 (UPI)The Republican National Committee has asked the three major television networks for equal broadcast time to respond to President Carter's address tonight.

title: Navillod Wins in Italy
description: SELLA NEVEA, Italy, Feb. 2 (AP)Alain Navillod of France won an International Ski Federation special slalom race today, beating Paul Frommelt of Liechtenstein and Odd Soeril of Norway.

title: Move to Bar Pay Rise for Congress And Top U.S. Aides Fails in Senate
IckxMass Porsche Records Fastest Time
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Feb. 2 (AP) The turbocharged Porsche 935 of Jacky Ickx and Jochen Mass showed awesome sped today in the first official day of practice for this weekend's 24 Hours of Daytona endurance race, but neither driver came close to times they had posted in an unofficial session yesterday.

title: WasteDisposal Planned
description: The Newark City Council unanimously approved a 20year contract with Combustion Equipment Associates of New York for disposal of solid wastes. According to Alvin I. Zack, the City Engineering Director, the contract will result in the first resource recovery plant in the state. Combustion Equipment Associates is already under contract with the Public Service Electric and Gas Company to convert the flammable portion of the garbage dumped at its planned facility into a powdered type of combustible fuel, Mr. Zach said. The facility is to be constructed on Raymond Boulevard near the Jersey City line, and Newark will pay its opto dump nearly 700 pounds of garbage a day at the site of the resource recovery plant.

title: New York Seeks Additional Time To Repay Notes
description: New York City, failed yesterday, as expected, to come up with a plan to pay off the holders of nearly $1 billion in its shortterm notes, but at the same time officials reported that the principal banks and municipal unions had taken important steps toward resolving their differences over how those shortterm notes should be repaid.

title: U.S. Envoy Said to Have Protested To Seoul on Lobby in Washington
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 2The United States Embassy in Seoul knew of most facets of South Korea's fiveyear covert effort to influence American policy and lodged strong protests with senior officials of the Korean Government, according to knowledgeable Federal officials here.

title: Misses Massey, Skinner Share Lead in Golf at 150
description: SARASOTA, Fla., Feb. 2 (AP)Debbie Massey of Bethlehem, Pa., and Debbie Skinner of Chula Vista, Calif.. were tied at 150 today after two rounds In the Ladies Professional Golf Association qualifying tournament. Miss Massey posted a twounderpar 70 in the second day of the 72holeevent at the 6,300yard Bent Tree Country Club. Miss Skinner carded a 72.

description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2Here are a handful of miniessays to follow up on leads, and toestubbings in recent columns.
