title: Rockets Conquer Knicks In Tense Battle by 105103
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 5A key offensive rebound and a layup by Dwight Jones in the final minute were the decisive plays as the Houston Rockets beat the New York Knicks, 105103 tonight. But after the tense game ended Coach Red Holzman of the Knicks still was not convinced his team had been beaten fairly at the Summit area.

title: Home Clinic
description: Q: I have read that when insulation with a vapor barrier is installed, it should be put up with the vapor barrier facing the inside. When we did our attic a few years ago, we faced the barrier away from the house. We would now like to know the consequences of such an installation, and whether or not we should redo the insulation in the proper way.Mrs. R.H., CrotononHudson, N.Y.

title: A Labour Secretary's Priorities
description: WASHINGTONF. Ray Marshall, the new Secretary of Labor, looked tired. Just hours before, he had been sworn in by President Carter. Immediately afterward he had held a news conference to announce a special jobs program for veterans. Earlier in the day he had attended a Congressional prayer breakfast in a Washington hotel and on his way back had been caught in a cold weather traffic snarl that had forced him to miss several appointments.

title: The People's Pharmacy
description: In a zealous attempt to steer people away from expensive placebos, pharmacologist Toe Graction is too sanguine about granny's home remedies (honey for outs and scratches; meat tenderizer for bee stings), but thereis enough welldocumented drug information here to merit at least a perusal. Graedon is adamant about comparisonshopping for prescription drugs; in most instances generic equivalents are safe and cost much less. A notable exception is Digoxin, a digitalis drug whose potency varies significantly from brand to brand  something Graedon seems unaware of. His chummy yup, folks style is offputting, but his caveats are mostly worth remembering. He is unequivocal about the uselessness of most overthecounter preparations.

title: Coloradans Train in Sussex
description: ONE of the worst snow droughts on record in the Rocky Mountains forced a group of professional skiers from Colorado to turn to the snowcovered Hamburg Mountains last month as a training ground for future competitions.

title: In Suburbs, Quest for Space Pits HaveNots Vs. Haves
description: With most of the nation's people concentrated in sprawling, increasingly urbanized regional centers, questions of highdensity living are generating intense interest. This is the third of a series of articles exploring the subject.

title: New Look at Justice
description: Seekers after justice differ between those who are cautious and those who are venturesome, those who stick to familiar precedents and those who boldly expand their scope. The Justice Department is now undergoing such a change in its leadership. Nowhere is the impact of this change likely to be greater than in the enforcement of the nation's civil rights laws.

title: An Islander Star's Island Life
description: I WOULD say it's a pretty indepth story of the emotions and feelings and physical ups and downs that have happened throughout my career in hockey. It's the story of a hockey player's life up until the age of 23.

title: From Connectecotte To Nutmegian
U.S. Tightens Tanker Rules
description: The United States has acted to reduce the likelihood of pollutioncausing oil tanker accidents by issuing more stringent safety regulations for major ships, including those that, are foreignregistered using domestic waters. The regulations, issued by Transportation Secretary Brock Adams, require radio navigation devices, testing of steering equipment and closer communication with authorities on shore.

title: Albany Is Pressured for Art's Sake
description: An Intensive lobbying effort aimed at persuading Governor Carey and the Legislature to increase the state's $27.3 million budget for the arts by $10.2 million has begun, according to Ainyas Ames, chairman of Concerned Citizens for the Arts of New York State, with a 40,000copy mailing of howto manuals to communities throughout the state.

title: Soviet Says Buildup In Arms Isn't Aimed At Surpassing U.S.
After All, Beauty Is Only Tin Deep
description: THIS is not the season to worry about washing the car, you say. I agree and I'll even go further: There is no season for washing the car, and I rarely have mine washed except for very state occasions where others might look at my dirty car and heap shame on me and mine.

description: TodayCape Cod K.C. 32d all breed show, Cape Cod Mall, Route 132, Hyannis, Mass.: 1,079 dogs; to 6 P.M.

title: Editors Choice
description: THE LIFE AND EXTRAORDINARY ADVENTURES OF PRIVATE IVAN CHONK1N, by Vladimir Voinovich. Translated by Richard Lourie. (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, $10.) A funny satire pitting a wise simpleton against some manic Soviet types in the army and down on the collective farm.

title: Winging It Through
description: WATCHING the New York television stations nightly news broadcasts up here in what the weather forecasters like to call the outlying suburbs has always been a singularly discordant experience, filled with fascinated horror at what goes on in the world and relief that so little of it seems to have any relevance to Fairfield County and the rest of the state.

title: LETTERS
description: The Greenburgh Housing Authority is considering a shift to oil heating from electric heating. The reasons cited are the current hard winter and the high cost of electricity. Officials say billS ranee from $200 to $375 per month. But one tenant gets it down to $104 per month by having the thermostats turned down. Mr. Kreisberg, the authority chairman, concedes ... that the Housing Authority had no way to enforce economy in heating (on its federally subsidized tenants).

title: The State and the Gas Crisis
description: WARM and toasty are words that New Jersey residents may have to drop from their vocabularies. Although the heating emergency eased somewhat in the state last week, naturalgas supplies were expected to remain tight through the remainder of the winter, and possibly into summer.

title: Donations to The Chairmen
description: Last year, as they have in the past, special interest groups showed their appreciation of a Congressional fact of life. the power of committee chairmen in the House and Senate, in campaign contributions, $548,000 worth.

title: Colleen Dewhurst's Open Door
description: THE kitchen door of Colleen Dewhurst's farmhouse in South Salem kept opening and closing, admitting and releasing ,a steady flow of relatives (her two sons), friends of relatives (teenaged), a television crew (retrieving equipment) and cordial German shepherds (only two, but active.)

title: Rethinking Victimless Crimes
description: In Connecticut, it is legal to bet on jai alai and dog races, but not on tennis matches or track meets. It is all right in New Jersey to purchase a threedigit number from the state's computerized PickIt, but not from runner on the street. Casino gambling will be permitted men in Atlantic City. but nowhere else in New Jersey. Las Vegastype betting became legal in New York City last week, but only for religious and charitable organizations. New Yorkers may drink at home at any hour, but not at a neighborhood tavern from four to eight o'clock in the morning. In New York State, certain sexual activity is legally permissible for married couples but illegal for unmarried people.

title: Back to Basics
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5If you want to understand the hard choices and tough decisions facing President Carter the difference between campaigning for the White House and governing the countryyou have to get back to basics and don't have to look much farther than your local post office.

title: Fellini's unlovable Casanova
description: ROME. In cavernous Teatro 5 of Rome's Cinecitt, Donald Sutherland stood alone, while a makeup man patted chalk on his false nose and chin. Federico Fellini emerged from the darkness of the studio and slipped a conch shell into the actor's hand. Sutherland put it to his ear. You hear the sea, the wind? Fellini whispered. And do you hear that sound? Sutherland was puzzled, and the director whispered again: There it is, that soundFellini, Fellini. . ..'

title: Marriage Announcement 15  No Title
description: Barbara Jane Boers Engaged to Student

title: Marriage Announcement 21  No Title
description: Margaret Smith And Clergyman Wed in Queens

title: Anne Derry Is Married to Roger G. Whidden
description: Anne Derry, daughter of Mrs. Max Monroe Derry of Winnetka, III., and the late Mr. Derry, was married in Washington yesterday to Roger Graham Whidden, son of Howard P. Whidden Jr. of Hillsdale, N. Y., and Mrs. George Ortman of Bloomfield Hills, Mich., and Castine, Me. The Rev. Sanford Garner performed the ceremony in Christ Episcopal Church, Georgetown.

title: Who Speaks for the Children?
description: In deciding whether to approve, reject or cosmetically to compromise on the contract between the United Federation of Teachers and the Board of Education, the state's Emergency Financial Control Board is bound to consider only whether the agreement's cost conforms to the city's financial plan. The financial facts are highly complex, and political argument on many sides has made them more so. They involve substantial differences between the way that salaries are periodically stepped up for teachers and other members of the municipal work force, and they involve estimates of the extent to which these increments further inflate future pension costs.

title: Yonkers Teachers in Limbo
To the Editor:
description: In 1969, as a college student, I made the Grand Tour, and one of the highlights of the trip was the English Cemetery on the outskirts of Florence where Elizabeth Barrett Browning is buried. It was especially meaningful after having spent the afternoon at Casa Guidi, near the Pitti Palace, where the Browings lived in Italy, where a loquacious concierge showed us through the apartment.

title: Article 1  No Title
Sanctuaries for Foreign Trade?
description: GOV. ELLA T. GRASSO has strongly endorsed the creation in Connecticut of foreign trade zones that would provide dutyfree sanctuaries in the state for commerce and industry.

title: The World
New Man Charts a Course For River Museum
description: WITH his appointment as director of the Hudson River Museum, Richard Koshalek falls heir to what some observers consider a hatful of headaches. Filling a position that has been vacant for five months, he will have to raise about $600,000 to keep the museum open for the fiscal year that begins June 30.

title: The dance World  Hanging On By the Thread of a Leotard
description: The temporary, or possibly temporary, dissolunon of the Paul Taylor Dance Company, the new musicians contract with New York City Ballet, the cancellation of the Joffrey Ballet's spring season, the acknowledged financial difficultiei of American Ballet Theaterdance is

title: Eve Diseases in Dogs Called Similar to Humans' News of Dogs
description: Human beings as well as animals stand to gain from the significant strides made over the last decade by the University of Pennsylvania School of Veterinary Medicine in researching inherited eye disease in dogs. Dr. Lionel F. Rubin, professor and chief of ophthalmology at the school and a nationally recognized leader in the field, made this observation to about 375 people who attended the 1977 symposium last weekend in the Annenberg Auditorium in Philadelphia.

title: Typhoon Viewed as Boon for Guam
description: TUMON BAY, GuamLast May a resident looked around at this American territory's badly faltering economy, its unemployment, its divided school system and its bickering residents. What this island needs. he said, is a good natural disaster to pull it back together again.

title: Changing Your Eating HabitsNaturally
description: ONE may, resolve to cut down on sugar and eliminate additiveladen processed foods from the diet, but it may be difficult to do this cold turkey. As William James said:

title: Jetset chefs
description: On a given night the guest artist might perform in Japan (Paul Bocuse), West Africa (Andr Daguin) or Australia (Michel Guerard). In New York, all threemight perform on almost successive nights. Audiences are exclusive. They pay up to $70 a ticket, occasionally more, but go away enthralled. After pocketing his fee, the artist goes away also, to appear the next day somewhere else. The jet airplane has affected all the performing arts, not the least this one, The artists in question are not opera singers but French chefs, the new French chefs, newly famous, promoting the new French cuisine in new ways, promoting their own restaurants hack in France too, of course.

title: Psychology &
description: Free to Go Sane By Gerald G. May. Paulist Press, $8.95.

title: Daytona Races to Honor 75th Birthday
G.O.P. Taslein the 95th Congress Is Just to Cope
description: WASHINGTONIt took the House of Representatives precisely one hour to approve, by a straight party vote on the opening day of Congress last month, two dozen rules changes previously adopted by the Democratic caucus. With stunning swiftness, the 292 Democrats used the occasion to weaken the already decimated 143member Republican contingent by limiting the use of quorum calls and other delaying and obstructive tactics that are the major weapons of a badly outnumbered minority.

title: Time for TimeofDay Rates
description: THE Long Island Lighting Company's new timeofday rates went into effect last week amid a great deal of opposition, some doubts and little apparent joy among the customers affected.

title: Thank You, World
description: To the Editor:

title: The Region
HOTEL OVERBOOKING
description: I think I have a solution to the problem of noshow hotel guests mentioned in your Notes column (Travel Section, Nov. 21). When a person fails to arrive and does not telephone to cancel his reservation, the hotel should either call or write him and request that in the future he please take his business elsewhere. As a travel agent, it is my opinion this would stop people doing this. Also, the hotel would be able to keep sates lower for everyone.

title: Kialoa and Dora IV Win in Sailing
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Feb. 5Kialoa, Jim Kilroy's 79foot ketch, shared fleet honors with Dora IV, the 61foot sloop under charter to Ted Turner, in the St. PetersburgtoFort Lauderdale ocean race.

title: Getting It: The Psychology Of est
description: A more calm and professionally informed view is that of Dr. Sheridan Fenwick, a Columbia University psychologist who took the est training and makes a brave attempt at analyzing the appeal of the est package. She finds it an eclectic mix of Synanon, gestalt, Scientology and encounter group techniques, unwholesome chiefly because of the secrecy and totalitarianism of the organization created by Erhard, a.k.a. Jack Rosenberg, a.k.a. Jack Frost. Authoritarianism helps make it work, she concludes, along with the enforced sensory deprivation and the group setting250 people at a time get the treatment. The compressionchamber effect produces both the hysterical confessions and the euphoric testimonials. Fenwick is reluctant to call it brainwashing but admits to being disturbed by the absence of sophisticated research designs to test the longrange benefit or harm est may inflict. It's hardly an incendiary expos, but Fenwick's openminded scrutiny should deglamourize the est movement.

title: To Improve Carter's Economic Program
description: Cost effectiveness is a good concept that is emphasized by the U.S. Government when making procurements and awarding grants. To achieve cost effectiveness, alternatives must be considered. The idea of cost effectiveness, however, seems to have played only a minor role when Mr. Carter devised his program of economic stimuli.

title: You and Your Aging Parents
description: Anyone whose world extends beyond narcissistic chimeras owes it to him or herself to look at Barbara Silverstone and Helen Kandel Hyrnan's examination of aging. They deal without evasion or euphemism with the misconceptions surrounding old age, as well as the inescapably burdensome realities of a father or mother's physical decline. From the games old people play in order to milk the maximum of guilt and devotion from their grown children, to the denial mechanisms of sons and daughters unable to face up to a parent's increased dependency, the authors cover the psychological terrain with grace and poise.

title: Alvin Curran Mixes Music at the Kitchen
description: Bluesy jazz piano solos, an ocarina echoing through a tapedelay system, and collages of childrens's voices, birds, and electronic sounds flowed into one another smoothly at the Kitchen on Friday evening as Alvin Curran presented his Light Flowers, Dark Flowers, a piece for solo performer and tapes. The format of combined live and prerecorded music by a single performer is becoming increasingly attractive to younger composers, so that concerts like Mr. Curran's are becoming fairly commonplace. But very few composers have been able to blend such disparate materials with as much success.

title: Connecticut/This Week
2 BLACKS DUE TO BE NAMED U.S. MARSHALS IN ALABAMA
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Feb. 5For the first time in Alabama, two black men, one of them an associate of the Rev. Dr. Martin. Luther King Jr. in the early days of the civil rights struggle here, are scheduled to become United States marshals.

title: Send Your Children to the Libraries
description: Since my sophomore year at University of California, Los Angeles, I have become convinced that we blacks spend too much time on the playing fields and too little time in the libraries.

title: What's Doing in UTAH SKI COUNTRY
Surprise Package
description: The furor at the International Team Trials a month ago, when two players withdrew from the finals on the verge of victory and later resigned undera cloud from the American Contract Bridge League, has tended to obscure the fact that, as a result, the United States will be represented in the 1977 world championship in Manila next October by a team of the highest quality.

title: Mary Schmidt Goes Prom Mozart to Previn
description: An excellent recital was given by Mary Helen Schmidt in Alice Tully Hall on Tuesday night. It was the debut in New York of the Minneapolisborn pianist, who has studied in part with Dora Zaslaysky at the Manhattan School of Music and who is now on the faculty of Augustana College in Sioux Falls, S. D. She played with a minimum of physical fuss, producing a fine tone and having technical security. The performances were thoughtful, wellplanned and consistently natural.

title: The Lure of the Orange Valley
description: THE Appian Way is one of the newest of the many unpretentious Italian restaurants that seem to thrive in, Orange and West Orange. Oldtimers will remember this place as Stash's, once a fixture in the Orange Valley.

title: U,S, ANALYSTS PRAISE SOVIET ARMS PLAN
description: American Intelligence analysts suggest that Soviet methods of weapons design, markedly different from those of the United States, may largely account for the rapidity with which the Russians are able to build and deploy new arms.

title: ChillFactor Reports Cool Skiers' Plans
description: In a winter that has produced much more than the average amount of frigid weather in the East, recreational skiers, contemplating trips into ski country, have been weighing their proposed expeditions with more than the usual amount of consideration. A key reason is the windchill factor offered by radio and television forecasters. While reporting the temperatures on any given day, which perhaps may range between 15 and 20 degrees above zero, they give wouldbe travelers cause for added thought.

title: The Latest Fashions in Old Instruments
description: There are fashions in musicmaking just as there are in women's fashions and art collecting. Sometimes these musical fashions take hold and become a permanent part of the thinking of the age. Sometimes they appear, have a brief vogue, and then they disappear again, eddying down the drain of history.

title: On Your Own
description: Feel that your job is the major source of your headaches and psychic malaise? KathyMatthews is ready with 99 alternatives to a 9 to 5 job. Few could be called careers, but the book should give your fantasy life a real workout. Somehow. selling apples on the street has escaped her very imaginative listperhaps became it might be a depressing reminder that a 9 to 5 is often something you can no longer get, rather than something you can no longer put up with. There's a small, obligatory section on starting your own business (write to the Small Business Administration) and another on not getting rooked into the workathome schemes advertised in the back of cheapy magazines.

title: City College 66, John Jay 59
description: City College defeated John Jay, 6659, yesterday in a basketball game on the winner's court. Trailing by 7 points in the opening minutes, C.C.N.Y. rallied to take a 3325 halftime lead. In the final minute of the second hatf, Clement Story of the Bloodhounds brought his team within 3 points but Ron Glover made two free throws to clinch the game for the Beavers.

title: On Leaving the Cocoon
description: FOR THE FIRST days of the new semester, the weather was not at all obliging. In fact, it was deplorable, Muck fell from the sky and met muck  mudlaced streets and treacherous stretches of ice beneath puddles impassable to pedestrians.

title: A Town Cuts Traffic Injuries
She's a New Jersey Girl
description: TWENTYTHREE years ago, a boy from Newark married a girl from Brooklyn.

description: Engagements

title: I Don't Want to Be RysanekI Need My Roles
Documentaries: From Mining Coal To 'Pumping Iron
description: Great themes like war and peace and social and political change don't necessarily make great fiction films. They tend to get in the way of the creative imagination, to intimidate the filmmaker into adopting the sort of piety and uplift that once marked the work of Stanley Kramer when he was busy solving the problems of race relations and saving the world from the horrors of nuclear holocaust. In such films characters who should be people tend, instead, to become fixed positions, predetermined points on society's compass, mouthpieces that say all those things that are expected of them as if they were actors in a commercial for God.

title: A Mental Health Crux
World Hockey Ass'n
description: Indianapolis 5, Birmingham 2. Calgary 4, Phoenix 1. Cincinnarl 8, New England 3.

title: W .J. Crum, Figure In Saigon Inquiry, Killed in Fire at 58
description: HONG KONG, Feb, 5 (AP)William J. Crum, an American businessman named in a 1971 Senate investigation of illegal activities at American military post exchanges in Vietnam, died today in a fire at his home here. He was 58 years old. [Hong Kong police are investigating the death, Agence FrancePresse reported.]

title: BEAME GIVES BACKING TO A RUNOFF PRIMARY
Los Angeles Chicanos Fear School System's Proposed Busing Integration Plan Will Hurt Bilingual Program
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 5The Los Angeles MexicanAmerican community, tne largest in the nation, is concerned that the city's proposed school busing program for integration will result in a downgrading of bilingual education and fewer teaching jobs for MexicanAmericans.

title: Women, Blacks Register Gains In Carter Posts
The Burns Flare
description: Not every economic pundit believed, however, that the severe winter would wreak lasting damage upon the economy this year. One dissenter was Arthur F. Burns, chairman of me Feaeral Reserve Board. Much loss of income will be made up quickly, he said, adding that spring will come.

title: The High Cost of Cold Weather
description: The shortage of natural gas and the bitter weather that has caused it are having a serious and growing economic impact, both public and private, in New York State and New Jersey, states already undergoing serious economic strain. (Connecticut so far has sufficient supplies of gas and has not yet been seriously affected).

title: The Effects of Ice on Scotch
description: In countries where Scotch has been consumed for centuries, ice and whisky rarely mingle. But on this side of the Atlantic, the picture is quite different. While a small percentage of American Scotch drinkers take it neat, better than35% drink it on the rocks. The rest of us add varying amounts of water, club soda, etcetera. And ice. Always plenty of ice  the great American drink requisite.

title: Winter's Flowers Promise Spring
Anheuser's Bonus
description: Bonus time is nearing for 2,815 whitecollar employees of AnheuserBusch Inc., who brewed the company's beer and drove its forklift trucks during a 96day strike of brewery workers last spring.

title: LETTERS TO THE NEW JERSEY EDITOR
Late TV Listings
description: 9:30 A.M. (Channel 4) Here and Now: Dr. Frederick Backer, psychiatrist and expert on terrorism.

title: Dow Off, Weather Stocks Up
description: MARKETS IN REVIEW

title: NursingHome Patients File a Suit Challenging Massive Medicaid Cuts
description: A suit challenging massive cuts in benefits for Medicaid patients in nursing homes in New York State has been filed in Federal District Court in Manhattan.

title: Sadat's Answer is a Stern One
description: Responding to last month's riots over higher food prices, President Anwar elSadat of Egypt has signed a decree banning strikes, demonstrations and a wide range of other political actions. Mr. Sadat insisted he was determined to eliminate opposition to his policies from what he called Communists taking their orders from Moscow. He said they had been plotting to overthrow the Government.

title: I Reuse to Commit Myself To One Style
description: A though Murray Louis has been an established choreographer for over 20 years, he is a rarity: an internationally known figure in modern dance, who has consciously and avidly avoided developing a choreographic style that might be called uniquely his own. This is not to suggest that Louis is lacking in originality or that his work is an eclectic amalgam of modern dance styles. It is simply that throughout his career in mcdern dance he has resisted labeling himself as a dancer or choreographer of definite identity.

title: Bee Pollen: Wonder Drug or Humbug?
description: Every morning on the French Riviera or any other of the world's verdant places, swarms of bees rush out to collect their daily bread. These days, a portion of their effort is winding up in the stomachs of athletes, and the questiona natural consequence of to bee or not to beeis whether tis nobler in the mind, or in the legs.

title: San Juan's New Wrinkle: Horse Racing Under Stars
I'll Take the Credit  Any Credit!
description: If you have ever wondered what it takes to get an assignment writing for television let me say Mit talent helps but the big word is credits. That's an entertainment industry term, meaning not what you can do, but what you've done.

title: Daniel Plante Cantata in Premiere
description: It's not really fair to expect composers to be verbally articulate about their own music. Some have been, of course, but they are exceptions. A tonguetied composer has always seemed to be be the main stumbling block in Pierre Boulez's Prospective Encounters series with members of the New York Philharmonic at the Cooper Union over the last few years, and Friday night's concert fell afoul of the same problem.

title: St. John's Five Wins From Niagara by 7266
description: St. John's, keeping its eye on a postseason basketball tournament, struggled on its Alumni Hall court last night before defeating Niagara University, 7266.

title: Criminals At Large
description: What Brian Garfield did for the New York male in Death Wish about five years ago, Bob Ottum has done for the New York female. Death Wish, it will be remembered, was about a man who, after his wife had been raped and killed, takes matters into his own hands and starts eliminating the city of its muggers. When it was made into a popular film starring Charles Bronson, there were cries here and there about the morality of the conception. No man, whatever his provocation, is above the law, etc.

title: Human Rights: It's Harder to Admonish Allies
description: WASHINGTONPresident Carter is clearly honoring his campaign promise to speak out on what he perceives to be, human rights violations in other nations. In the last two weeks, Czechoslovakia and the Soviet Union have both been accused by the State Department of such transgressions and Mr Carter has told the Soviet Ambassador that he

title: Winter Kill No Sure Cure
description: NEW JERSEY gardeners are anxious, and rightly so, about the effects of continued subzero temperatures on their plantings. We might as well face itit is very likely that the percentage of winter kill will be high this year.

title: Over the Abyss
description: The development of Richard Snibbe's new house design is a more or less prosaic tale. But the house itself Is a real cliff hanger.

title: JOSEPH SAVAGE DIES
description: Joseph P. Savage, who as an assistant state's attorney in Illinois participated in the prosecution of Nathan F. Leopold Jr. and Richard A. Loeb for the kidnapping and murder of Bobby Franks in 1924, died at his home in Palm Beach, Fla., Friday after an extended illness. He was 82 years old.

title: DIN
description: To the Editor:

title: A WhatIsIt?  The Season's First Flower
description: Everyone looks for the first visible signs of spring. As soon as there is a break in the winter deep freeze, there is no better harbinaer than witchhazel.

title: Britain Begins Year of Festivities To Mark Elizabeth's Silver Jubilee
John Paul Stevens Is Proving to Be Wild Card in High Court Rulings
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5At the Supreme Court one day, in the chambers of one of the nine Justices, the talk turned to a pending case and then to its possible outcome.

Long Island/This Week
Melbourne
World News Briefs
description: World News Briefs

title: Howard Proposes Major Transit Plan
description: REPRESENTATIVE James J. Howard, the Monmouth County Democrat who heads the House subcommittee that draws up surfacetransportation legislation, has a jumbo package in mind this year. It even dwarfs the twoyear, $4 billiov, publicworks economic stimulus program proposed by the Administration.

title: Votes in Congress
description: I. Natural Gas Emergency: by 91 yeas to nays, the Senate passed a bill authorizing the President to declare a temporary gas emergency, and to make allocations to assist in meeting requirements for higher priority gas uses, Jan. 31.

title: The Shadow Box Gets Too aniatic For Its Own Good
description: I don't know that I have ever before found myself faulting a play for becoming more dramatic than it ought to have been, but that's the situation I was caught in by the time Michael Christofer's The Shadow Box lowered its last lights on a collage of solo voices, all of themsoftly lamenting the oncoming cloak of death. Death is the exclusive subject of the intelligently written, lustrously performed work that has been directed by Gordon Davidson for New Haven's Long Wharf, and during its entire first half I felt myself deeply committed to the restive but intensely realistic victims living out their limited lives in private cottages scattered about the grounds of a hospital.

title: Europe's Heroin Addicts
description: Seemingly unrelated events, including such disparate circumstances as the end of the Vietnam war and the continuing world recession, have converged to produce an alarming rise in heroin addiction in Western Europe. In 1970, there were no more than few hundred heroin users there. Today the total is estimated at more than 30,000.

title: Floridian From a Building Family Chosen Housing Under Secretary
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4Jay Janis, a member of a prominent Florida construction family, has been selected as the next Under Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, according to wellplaced sources in the department. The post is the second highest in the agency.

title: No Profits in Cars
description: The new subway systems in such urban centers as Washington, D.C., Baltimore, Atlanta and San FranciscoOakland would appear to mean a business bonanza for the companies that produce subway cars. But the opposite has been true.

title: Teacher Tenure Termed Unusual Safety Zone
description: Frank Fiorito's defense of tenure for teachers (Jan. 16) is yet another exam ple that detracts attention front the real issue: Row do the school systems of this state assess the. competence of the posttenure teacher? Despite what Mr. Fiorito believes, there is something that can wreak more havoc on the young than unstable and evershifting teaching staffs, and that is stable, nonshifting ineptitude in the classroom.

title: Buffalo Is Heartened by Promise of U.S. Aid
description: BUFFALO, Feb. 5Winds whipped more snow onto the mountainous drifts tier e today and business was at a virtual standstill, but people were feeling a lift as a result of President Carter's declaration of this region as a major disaster area.

title: GreenhousesOut in the Cold
description: HOME gardeners across the state who maintain greenhouses in or near their residences are feeling the effects of this extremely cold winter and the energy crisis.

title: East Germans Take Lead In World Bobsled Racing
description: ST. MORITZ, Switzerland, Feb. 5 (AP)East Germany's No. 1 sled, defending champion, held a commanding lead after the first two runs of the fourman world bobsledding championship today.

title: Assassination Panel Extended
description: The House of Representatives has temporarily reestablished its Select Committee on Assassinations to look into the murders of President John F. Kennedy and the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

title: Correction
description: In the issue of Jan. 23, the price of The Iliad, Or The Poem of Force by Simone Well was listed incorrectly. It is available from Pendle Hill, Wallingford, Pa. 19086, for 95 cents.

title: NATO LEADER SAID TO BE FAVORED FOR C.I.A. CHIEF
description: NEW YORK, Feb, 5 (Reuter)Admiral Stansfield Turner, commander of NATO forces in southern Europe, is the leading candidate for nomination as director of the Central Intelligence Agency, Time magazine reports.

title: Stun GunsEffective Deterrent
description: THE Supreme Court of the United States ruled recently that use of deadly force in apprehending a felony suspect violated that person's civil rights and, therefore, was illegal. The Court's ruling probably will change police procedures throughout the country, but will have little effect on the Middlesex County Sheriff's Department; this is because Sheriff Joseph A. DeMarino adopted stun guns in 1973, making his the first police force in New Jersey to acquire such nonlethal weapons.

title: NewDrive in Housing for Poor
description: WHEN 24 of Suffolk's 26 towns and municipalities getting Federal communitydevelopment money promised in Federal Court last week to try harder to get such housing built, it looked like enough of a victory for the county's advocates of housing for the poor.

title: Facts on. Home HumidifiersContinued
description: A home humidifier can be either a fully automatic permanently builtin unit, or it can be a portable, console type that resembles a piece of furniture and so can. be installed in any room or even moved if desired. In homes with forced hot air heating systems the most common, and most efficient system is to install a permanent unit next to the furnace (on either the main supply duct or the return duct) that will automatically disperse the needed amount of moisture into the air each time the furnace comes on.

title: Article 3  No Title
This Week in Sports
description: Thursday night's doubleheader at Madison Square Garden sends Manhattan against Connecticut at 7 o'clock and Seton Hall, with Glenn Mosley, the nation's No. 1 rebounder, against Dayton at 9 P.M.

title: Briarcliff College on the Brink
description: BRIARCLIFF COLLEGE, the small but wellknown liberal arts college for women that has been part of the Westchester County education landscape for nearly threequarters of a century, is in deep financial trouble and discussing a possible merger with either Pace University or New York University.

title: On Taking Pictures in Cold Weather
description: As much of the country suffers through one of the coldest winters on record, many avid photographers have stuffed their cameras into a closet, and those brave souls who do venture out all too often wind up grumbling about poor pictures and equipment failure.

title: Courting Platform Tennis
description: DURING a spirited game of platform tennis at the Norwalk PaddleTennis Center the other day, a player leaped for a ball against the fence and got his nose stuck in the wire screen.

description: For metropolitan New York apartment houses, the combination of frigid weather and higher pergallon prices of fuel oil has been taking a bitter toll in terms of tenant suffering as well as dollar cost.

description: Six years ago, Mrs. Maureen Nielsen, chairman of the annual New Jersey Horse Industry Exposition, had a sudden thought.

title: Selected Letters of William Faulkner
Do We Need So Many Colleges?
description: THE State Commission on Financing Postsecondary Education has released its longawaited report and, predictably, the debate is already in high, gear. Spokesmen for various sectors of New Jersey's higher education establishment (I among them) have begun the ritual of public and private dissection while we wait for the answer to the inevitable question: Will the report be votedup or down when it comes before the Board of Higher Education?

title: Buck Stops Here To Be Sign of Carter
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., Feb. 5 (UPI)A symbol of Harry S. Truman's decisiveness will soon be back in the White House's Oval Office.

Bronx Woman in Portugal Builds Dairy Farm Amid Political Turmoil

title: New Population Trends Transforming U.S.
Ukrainian Debutante Ball
description: Twelve young women of Ukrainian descent will be presented next Saturday at the Debutante Ball of the Ukrainian Medical and Ukrainian Engineers Associations of America. Proceeds from the invitational event, to be held in the Grand Ballroom at the Pierre, will go toward scholarships for medical and engineering students.

title: New (Old) Look for Roslyn
Upbeat New Mayor
description: MOUNT VERNON'S near future rests with a man who knows its recent past, from a boyhood in Frog Town near the once bucolic Bronx River to the south side urbanrenewal area that was his postwar home.

title: Strategic Superiority

Ford, the socalled Team B whose task was to reevaluate the data on Soviet strategic objectives, I have become painfully aware of the emotion and confusion that surrounds this subject.

title: Hawks 99, Bulls 96
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 5 (AP)Len Robinson and Ken Charies combined for 42 points tonight in leading the Atlanta Hawks to a 9996 victory over the Chicago Bulls.

description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 5Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, opening her reelection campaign with an impassioned speech here today, apologized for the inconvenience and hardship that some people have suffered during India's 19monthold state of emergency.

description: Aryeh Neier, executive director or the American Civil Liberties Union, warned yesterday that attempts by parents and others to kidnap and deprogram members of religious groups constituted very daneerous (trend) that could be used against political as well as religious dissidents.

title: Linda Fratianne Takes U. S. Figure Skate Title
description: HARTFORD, Feb. 5  Linda Fratianne, a runnerup to Dorothy Hamill last year, turned in a dazzling freestyle program and overtook Barbie Smith for the national women's figureskating title tonight.

description: DeborahLynne Peter Affianced to Engineer

title: Brazil Taking Root Along 46th Street
The Little White Hen and the Emperor of France
description: By Gommaar Timmerman. Illustrated. 32 pp. Reading, Mass.: AddisonWesley Publishing Co. $5.95 each.

title: All the State's a Stage
description: THEATER FLOURISHES in Connecticut and, in some ways, one wonders why. You might have thought that the relative closeness to New York would have had a dampening effect on local enterpises, but not a bit of It. There are More theaters distributed through this state than any other in the Union and distributed is the key word, because nowadays most of the larger Connecticut towns have their own professional theater company.

title: School Custodians Scored on Contract Labeled Too Costly
description: The reportedly nocost contract recently negotiated by the New York City Board of Education and the union representing school custodians represents a legal rape of the taxpayers and will actually cost the city about $10 million an organization of 16 community groups has charged.

title: Making Room for All
description: OUR nation has the capacity to do justice, love mercy and walk safely on its city blocks. Instead, out of a compelling need to maintain selfinterest above other moral needs the suburbs have zoned unjustly, accepted privation and walked exclusively with their own kind.

title: Hawaiians Want Navy Isle Back
description: HONOLULU, Feb. 5To some native Hawaiians the island of Kahoolawe is comparable to England's Stonehenge. To the United States Navy the island is a target for practice bombing and strafing.

title: Paintings That Prod
description: THE PAINTINGS of John Ford are taskmasters of a sort. Not aggressive drill sergeant taskmasters bent on getting across their point through authoritarian boisterousness and intimidation. These paintings do not sternly command, nor taunt and strongarm us. They are rather taskmasters of a more sedate variety, urging us, but never to the point of exhortation, inciting, advising, encouraging and leading. They are friendly, benign taskmasters that make us work to understand them, that generally prod us to explore their intricacies.

title: TOP POLICE OFFICER IN MONTGOMERY QUITS
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala. Feb. 5Montgomery's top police officer resigned today after he had failed a polygraph test to determine whether he was telling the truth about an attempted coverup of police misconduct.

title: Crash Puts Women Out At Daytona
Amending the General Assembly
description: IN 1868, a Surrogate Court Judge in New York State made a comment that, while aimed at Albany rather than Hartford, still haunts the Connecticut Legislature today. His passing remark, No man's wife or property is safe when the Legislature is in session, is often repeated as a joke about the atmosphere and the procedure of the Connecticut Legisiature and how it is perceived by the news media and much of the public. Where has the Legislature gone wrong?Our Constitution in Connecticut provides for three equal branches of government: the executive, the judicial and the legislative. Are they any longer equal? They are in form but not in fact. What can the Legislature do to meet its responsibilities?

title: JOHN RICHARDSON NAMED HEAD OF FREEDOM HOUSE
description: John Richardson Jr., who recently completed eight years as Assistant Secretary of State for education and cultural affairs, has been named president of Freedom House, a nongovernmental organization that monitors human rights around the world.

title: Radio
Sewers and the 201 Study
Assessing Soviet Strength Is a Team Task
description: WASHINGTONProbably the most important document to be placed before President Carter in his first days ofIkce was a thick report captioned NIE 11/8, the latest Naltonal Intelligence Estimate of the strategic capabilities mid intentions of the Soviet Union.

title: Notes: Fair Warning On Air Fare Hikes
description: The choice among aerial alternatives has long set the traveler's head spinning. Consider the bewildering air fares alone: first class, economy, midweek coach, night coach, excursion, A.P.E.X.. O.T.C., A.B.C., I.T.C., I.T.X.,to name but a few. Bad enough. But even after he has made his selection, the traveler is not always home free: There may be a suddenly announced price rise, courtesy of the Civil Aeronautics Board.

title: Some Cold Water On Organic Gardens
description: WE tolerate in the name of politeness almost any absurdity voiced in the name of faith, and the ambiguous thesis of organic gardening can only be described as yet another of America's new religious superstitions. Westchester has its share of believers.

title: Palaces for a Pittance: The Pousadas of Portugal
A LEAKING OIL BARGE IS AGROUND IN HUDSON
description: A leaking barge carrying about 2.5 million gallons of heavy crude oil ran aground Friday night in the Hudson River, and the Coast Guard said yesterday that it was in danger of sinking.

title: Museum Offers Offbeat Film Fete
description: AMAJOR film festival at the State (Museum in Trenton marks what may become a significant development in the visualarts policy of the art institution. A sevenweek program of motion pictures produced independently by talented American and foreign filmmakers over the last 40 years represents the first time that the museum has embarked on such an ambitious cinematic endeavor of this nature, an endeavor that may become a permanent part of the museum's curriculum.

title: Miss MenefeePhillips Picks Unusual Program
description: Katherine MenefeePhillips chose an unusual program for her flute concert Friday night at Carnegie Recital Hall. None of the six pieces she performed is very often encountered, and all but one Franz Doppler's Andante and Rondo for two flutes and piano (Op. 25) are conservatively styled 20thcentury works.

title: Nanette Alden Plans Nuptials
description: Dr. and Mrs. James Cooper Alden of Gwynedd Valley, Pa., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Nanette Alden, to David Elton Trueblood 2d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arnold Trueblood, also of Gwynedd Valley.

title: For 12 Couples, the Symphony Is Their Own Sound of Music
description: Joan and John Korman have a thoroughly together marriage, and, as she says, I can't imagine living any other way.

description: Miss Revere Fiancee Of Peter Kimmelman; March Wedding Set

title: Letter to the Editor 3  No Title
description: LETTERS

title: Harris Leaps 96 Feet For SkiJumping Title
description: Special to The New York Times

title: A Sound Investment
Daring Middleaged Man
description: ROMEWhen Giulio Andreotti became prime minister of Italy last year his position seemed very much like that of a daring middleaged man on a flying trapeze that was just about to dump both him and his country into an unknown yawning pit.

title: Defense: Dangerous CostSaving Plan
description: The Association of the United States Army (A.U.S.A.) recently announced that U.S. defense contractors will be given increased profit margins depending on the amount of effort [they are] making to promote foreign military sales.Profit 76, a Department of Defense program, encourages United States defense contractors to market weapons systems worldwide because of the potential benefits to the overall [U.S.] procurement program. A.U.S.A. cites the costsaving results of this plan: Whenever weapons and equipment can be produced for the U.S. and foreign governments on the same production line the unit price is driven down.

title: The Matter of Ethics in the Legislature
America's Dry Belt
description: The tropospheric wind pattern that has been producing unusual cold in the Eastern and Middle Western United States is having a different effect in the West and Southwest: extremely dry weather that is threatening urban and rural water supplies and crops. Parts of the Pacific coast were already In drought.

title: The Last Mile for the Nation's Subways?
description: A century ago Eli Beach, a parttime inventor who was editor of Scientific American, took some astonished New Yorkers below the city streets and unveiled a secret projectan underground railway. That first subway was 312 feet long and cost a little more than $1,000 a foot to buildincluding the train, with its grand piano, velvet upholstery, paintings and frescoes.

title: Turner Changing. Course for America's Cup Trials
description: Ted Turner had arrived on the America's Cup scene. He had his collection of trophies and extensive 12Meter experience, winning the World Cup with American Eagle. Ted Turner, at the age of 36, was caught in the excitement and the joy and the knowledge that he would now command an America's Cup candidate. It was 1974, and it wasn't long before he would lose the swagger. The cups in the closet meant nothing when weeks passed and no amount of hull surgery and wet sanding could change his fate. He and Mariner were losers.

title: Carter's Aid Is Sought For Olympic Proposals
Any Emergency Can Be Perilous For a Governor
description: ALBANY, Feb. 5Disasters, natural or manmade, offer both opportunity and peril to chief executives, as Governor Carey was well aware when he proclaimed a naturalgas emergency in the state and activated sweeping powers to decide who gets the scarce fuel. Three years ago, at the start of his brief administration, Gov. Malcolm Wilson faced a similar situationthe long linesand general chaos as the gasoline pumps resulting from the Arab oil embargo. While political leaders all around him, including the Governor of New Jersey and the Westchester County Executive, imposed effective mandatory gasoline rationing based on odd and evennumbered license plates, Governor Wilson for weeks clung to voluntary system that clearly was not working.

title: LETTER FROM SARAH LAWRENCE
description: WHEN I was first referred to as a freshperson (instead of a freshman), I thought had said something rude. Now I know better. Being a male at Sarah Lawrence can be quite a trying experience. Here the oppressed minority are men.

title: Letter to the Editor 2  No Title
description: To the Editor:

title: A Showcase at a Cathedral
description: THE Island's plentiful and talented artists are ambitious movers who inform the world of their talents through displays in metropolitan and notsometropolitan areas. Their work crops up expectedly in leading museums and galleries everywhere and unexpectedly in other places too.

title: BOTSWANA HALTS PARENTS FROM RHODESIA AT BORDER
description: BULAWAYO, Rhodesia, Feb. 15 (AP)Rhodesian blacks seeking to visit their children, among 400 reportedly kidnapped by black nationalist guerrillas, were turned back at the Botswana border today.

title: Barons 3, Black Hawks 2
description: RICHFIELD, Ohio, Feb. 5 (AP)The Cleveland Barons battered Chicago's goalie, Tony Esposito, with 52 shotstying a club recordand held on for a 32 N.H.L. victory over the Black Hawks tonight.

title: Connecticut Police Seek Changes In State's Wiretapping Regulations
description: HARTFORD, Feb. 5 (AP)The Connecticut state police want authority to bug rooms and tap more telephones to catch gamblers and narcotics traffickers, according to the force's lobbyist.

title: Defending Lawson's Reputation
description: ART MAILBAG

title: Leon Balst's Revolutionary Stage Designs
description: If the StravinskyDiaghilev Foundation gets its way, New York will one day have a specialized and intensely evocative theater museum. It will be devoted primarily to the careers of two men who had an enormous impact on the arts in the 20th century: Igor Stravinsky, composer,

title: The Work Is Innocent
description: It is a spectacular achievement, while you are still growing up, to write a good novel about growing upwhich is what this author did at age 15 (Hide Fox, And All After). Now, at the ripe age of 22, Rafael Yglesias looks over his shoulder and tells what it was like. Another bull'seye.

title: JAMES LEON FILLIS, 85, TRAINER OF SHOW HORSES
description: James Leon Fillis, owner of the Columbia Riding Club in Eastchester, N.Y., for more than 30 years and a veteran trainer of show horses in the art of dressage, died Friday at his home, 158 Highland Avenue, Eastchester. He was 85 years old.

title: Columbus, Its Schools Shut, Turns to Teaching Over TV
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Feb. 6With the public and parochial schools closed here for the next month because of the natural gas shortage, pupils will be offered instruction tomorrow on television and radio, in newspaper pages and university classes and, for the hardy, outdoors.

title: Susan Browse Married To Jeffrey L. Seligman
description: Susan Browse, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Bert Browse of Long Beach, L.I., and Jeffrey L. Seligman, son of Thelma Seligman and Bernard Seligman, were married yesterday at the Regency Hotel. The ceremony was performed by Rabbi Asher Abittan of the Sephardic Congregation of Long Beach.

title: Offer of Mediation On Split Oil Prices Rejected by Yamani
description: JIDDA, Saudi Arabia, Feb. 6 (AP)Saudi Arabia has turned down an attempt by Qatar to mediate a uniform oil price increase for the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries, Sheik Ahmed Zaki Yamani, the Saudi Oil Minister said today.

title: Teachers Urged To Fight for End Of Budget Limits
description: TRENON, Feb. 6  The New Jersey Education Association yesterday called on all teachers and school executives in the state to pressure members of the Legislature to abolish the law limiting spending increases for public schools.

title: 1,576 New York Plants to Reopen With the Aid of New Gas Supplies
description: A total of 1,576 industrial plants witn more than 117,000 employees will begin reopening today in upstate New York with the help of new gas supplies after week's shutdown because of the brutal cold and lack of gas. Gasheated schools upstate will also reopen today.

title: College Basketball
description: AT LOUISVILLE, KY.

title: Music by Da Costa in Premiere
description: Yesterday afternoon's Symphony of the New World concert at Carnegie Hall offered a world premiere, Noel Da Costa's Ceremony of Spirituals, and it was by far the most effective piece of the day.

title: In Buffalo, Digging Out From Storm, It's Hardships, Humor and Heroics
WOMEN ACTIVISTS CALLED 4YEAR TARGET OF HOOVER
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 6 (UPI)  The Federal Bureau of Investigation investigated women's liberation groups for at least four years up to 1973 and compiled a file on the politics and sexual preferences of activist women across the nation, The Los Angeles Times reported today.

title: Credit Analysts Say Cold Wave May Tend to Raise Bond Prices
description: The bond markets are now over their January slump, and they may well rally in the near term, Allen Sinai of Data Resources Inc. confidently predicted late last week as the credit markets were staging their first strong price advance of 1977.

title: Matthews Returning As Y.&R. President
description: After a brief tour as Assistant Secretary of Commerce that followed a career in advertising, Leonard S. Matthews, 55 years old, is returning to the business as president of Y. & R. National. It is the unit made up of the six geographically dispersed fullservice agencies acquired in the last four years. They have total billings of about $100 million.

title: Big Trucks, Small Case
description: One of the few useful consequences of the oil crisis three years ago was the Federal law imposing a 55mileanhour speed limit on interstate highways. It saved energy in the ensuing year but, even more rewarding, saved about 5,000 lives.

title: It Hurts to Fight Fire With Fire
description: The American press longs to leap far ahead of Government in reporting events abroad. That's why it hates to hide behind Government to protect its rights of access and communication.

title: Assistants Picked by Bell Praised By Critics of His Own Nomination
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 6In his first two weeks as Attorney General, Griffin B. Bell has .begun selecting top assistants who are being applauded by some of the same groups that opposed his own nomination to head the Department of Justice.

title: Margaret B. Lovely, 76, Dies; Director of Brooklyn Charities
description: Margaret B. Lovely, a director of the Catholic Charities of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn, and the Queensboro Council for Social Welfare, died Friday in Long Island Jewish Hospital after a long illness.

title: Israel Arrests 9 in Bombing
description: TEL AVIV, Feb. 6 (AP)Security forces arrested nine Arabs suspected of planting a bomb that killed 15 persons in downtown Jerusalem a year and a half ago, a military communiqu said today. Officials said the guerrillas had put a refrigerator packed with two mortar shells and explosives in Jerusalem's Zion Square on July 4, 1975. Searches uncovered improvised explosives and the light van used to deposit the refrigerator, the communiqu said.

title: Chess:
description: It usually takes many more moves to punish a positional mistake than it does to pounce on a tactical error, but the retribution may be no less inexorable.

title: Texas University Found Guilty in Sex Bias Case
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Feb. 6The University of Texas discriminated against a female professor by paying her less than it would have paid a man and by changing her duties when she complained to the Government about underpayment, a Department of Labor judge ruled last week. In issuing the opinion, Administrative Law Judge William Naimark authorized Labor Secretary F. Ray Marshall to cancel $29 million in Federal contracts if the university fails to correct the violations. Mr. Marshall is on leave of absence from the University of Texas economics department.

title: Advertising
description: Newsweek magazine, which two years ago with its new agency, Foote, Cone & Belding, introduced its Mightier Than Maude campaign extolling the reach of print over TV and then converted to a Beat the Squeeze theme when TV prices began to climb, is prepared to start another highly competitive effort aimed at the thinking media person and client. The theme is ZeroBased Media Planning.

title: Criminals Repay Victims In U.S.Funded Program
Front Page 2  No Title
A Harsh Winter Lashes Elderly and Poor
description: The two tired women in the basement of the church were symbols of the city's worst victims of the bitter winterthe elderly and the poor.

title: U.S. Company, Big Sugar Grower, Now Woos Tourists in Caribbean
description: LA ROMANA, Dominican Republic  Gulf and Western Industries, the largest American investor on this Caribbean island, has converted part of its huge sugar plantation here into a winter playground for the rich and famous to attract tourism.

title: Topics
description: We leave to critics on other pages the charge lately leveled by a group of poets that the American Poetry Review, a major outlet for contemporary poetry, is suffocating ... new voices. A serious matter if true. The accusatory manifesto, however, seems peculiarly prosaic in its accounting approachof 658 contributions, it notes, only 116 were by women ana only 56 by black, minority or third world writersand in its call for the publication of a proportional number of highest quality men, women and minority poets. Until the Muse begins to allocate poetic talent equitably according to sex, age. race, religion, ethnic origin and other variables, the phrase proportional number will not sit comfortably with the phrase highest quality.

title: A Library That Finally Sets the Record on Women Straight
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.Radcliffe College collects not only women but women's collections, in fact a whole library on women's history.

title: Ethiopia's 2 Top Leaders Said to Reach Accord
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Feb. 6 (Reuters)The two top men in Ethiopia's ruling military council, which was rocked by violent conflict last week, are believed to have worked out a formula for cooperation after repeated disagreements in the past.

title: Aspin Favors Arms Talks Over Increased Firepower
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6Les Aspin, a Democratic member of Congress specializing in defense issues, believes the possibility of a Soviet bloc surprise attack on Western Europe should be dealt with politically rather than with strengthened firepower.

title: It's a Humbler Capital, but Rank Still Has Privileges
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6Limousines are out, sweaters are in. and humble pie on every official menu in town these days. But despite the new gospel of less, the old axiom that rank has its privileges has not quite faded away.

title: Old Reform, New Risk
description: Once again the quadrennial cry to abolish the Electoral College is heard in the land. The familiar argument cited that the shift of a few thousand votes could have given Gerald Fond, who lost the popular vote, an Electoral College majority. But in reality such a result has not occurred since 1888, when Benjamin Harrison edged out Grover Cleveland. In every modern election, no matter how close, the electoral result has paralleled the popular vote.

description: By Reuters

title: Sudan Says Other Nations Directed Rebellion
description: KHARTOUM, the Sudan, Feb. 6 (Reuters)Vice President Abel Alier of the Sudan today accused unnamed foreign powers of engineering the rebellion last Wednesday in Juba, capital of the southern province of Equatoria.

description: Results of Late Saturday College Sports

description: ENTRIES

description: LONDON, Feb. 6Following are the lyrics of Jubilee Hymn, which Sir John Betjeman, Britain's Poet Laureate, composed with Malcolm Williamson, the Master of the Queen's Music, in honor of the 25th anniversary of Queen Elizabeth:

title: Puzzle of Executive's Death Stuns Texas
description: HOUSTON  Foster Parker, 58 yearold president of Brown & Root Inc., went into a Houston hardware store on Jan. 8 and paid $172.52 for a .357 Magnum Ruger pistol and a box of Remington cartridges.

Amy Carter Is Baptized In Immersion Ceremony At Family's New Church
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6 (Reuters) President Carter's 9yearold daughter, Amy, was baptized today in the Baptist Church ceremony of immersion in water.

title: Commodities
description: Despite some of the most bearish wheat market news in years, prices of the bread grain rose 8 cents last week, to $2.80 a bushel for the nearest delivery, March. This represents a gain of $400 on one futures contract.

title: Kirby Lane Is Victor By Nose at Santa Anita
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Feb. 6 (AP)Floridabred Kirby Lane beat Properantes by a nose to win the $135,900 Charles H. Strub Stakes for 4yearolds at Santa Anita today in the first $100,000 race of the year.

title: A Picture of Expected CarterPress Relations
description: What can we expect from Jimmy Carter? We can anticipate fairly soon, think, some sort of runin with the press. This is widely and quietly predicted by a number of journalists who have spent the last year or so in close quarters with him.

title: NATO AIDE IS CANDIDATE FOR INTELLIGENCE POST
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6 (UPI)A White House aide said today that Adm. Stansfield Turner, commander of NATO forces in southern Europe, was one of several candidates for nomination as Director of Central Intelligence.

title: Marco Polo Sings a Solo, a Play By John Guare, Opens at the Public
description: A question often asked of a critic is, What do you do if you genuinely don't understand a play? Now the true answer to that, even if not the answer always vouchsafed, is that you try to bluff it. But with John Guare's Marco Polo Sings a Solo this critic even found himself at a loss for bluff. I had no idea what Mr. Guare was trying to do to my mind, which was possibly my loss rather than Mr. Guare's fault. But I rather doubt it. Obscurantism is too obscure to be really funny.

title: Haywood's Team Drives Old Porsche To Victory in Daytona 24Hour Race
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Feb. 6A fisherman, a doctor and a man who captured America's premier endurance race twice before, won the 24 Hours of Daytona today. They thought they would be lucky.

title: Late Arrivals Swell Yonkers Crowd, Handle
description: YONKERS, Feb. 6At 12:30 P.M. today the crowd for Yonkers Raceway's fourth Sunday of harness racing appeared to be distressingly small in the biting, subfreezing cold. This was a halfhour before the first post time.

title: A 3Ton Circus Star Retires
description: VENICE, Fla., Feb. 6 (AP)After 29,700 performances under the Big Top, Marcella, the 7,000pound elephant star of the Ringling Brothers Barnum & Bailey Circus, is retiring.

title: Nehmer of East Germany Captures Bobsled Title
description: ST. MORITZ, Switzerland, Feb. 6 (AP)Mienhard Nehmer, the Olympic gold medalist from East Germany, won the world fourman bobsledding championship today, retaining the title he captured at Innsbruck, Austria, last year.

title: Arkansas Five Is Winning Games, Influencing People
description: A basketball team with a 191 wonlost record, 110 in the Southwest Conference and ranked nationally in the Top 20 is something new at Arkansas. The Razorbacks are bringing to mind the days when their football team won six conference titles (195970) and a national championship. The scramble for basketball tickets has caused the enlargement of the seating capacity in the gymnasium from 6,300 to 10,000.

title: DR. MARGARET HANDY, 87, PEDIATRICIAN IN DELAWARE
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Feb. 6 (AP)Dr. Margaret Handy, one of the nation's first women pediatricians, died here last night after suffering a stroke. She was 87 years old.

title: Senate Committee Attacks International Agencies
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6The Senate Government Operations Committee will charge tomorrow that some of the 65 international organizations to which the United States belongs are extravagant, ineffective, biased and uncertain of purpose.

title: Bridge;
description: The first New York Blue Ribbon Individual Championship began here Saturday, and proved exciting for players and kibitzers alike. In the first day of play at the Manhattan Bridge Club, 228 West 71st Street, the ebb and flow of fortune for the 36 competitors, qualified by past performances, could be followed by all concerned round by round.

description: John Richardson Jr., who recently completed eight years as Assistant Secretary of State for education and cultural affairs, has been named president of Freedom House, a nongovernmental organization that monitors human rights around the world.

title: Cathy Makstein Is Married
description: The marriage of Cathy Makstein, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Markstein of Woodmere, L.I., to Richard Levy, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Levy of Manhattan and Pound Ridge, N.Y., took place yesterday at Temple Israel in Lawrence, L.I. Rabbi Joel Zion and Cantor David Benedict officiated. The bride, who recieved a B.S. degree in nursing from Adelphia University, is on the staff of Mount Sinai Hospital. Her husband is a graduate of Oklahoma University. He is with Lou Levy & Sons, manufacturer of ladies coats.

description: ACROSS

title: CORRUPTION IS BROAD ON THE WATERFRONT, AN INQUIRY INDICATES
description: A continuing investigation by the Justice Department has produced information charging wholesale corruption of the waterfront industry throughout the country, according to sources close to the inquiry.

Negotiations Intensified On New Teacher Contract
description: Staff members of the Emergency Financial Control Board were meeting last night with mayoral officials, Board of Education aides and Albert Shenker, president of the United Federation of Teachers, in an effort to resolve their differences over a proposed contract for the teachers.

title: News Summary
description: International Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's principal political opponents in the March 16 parliamentary elections held a rally at the same fairground in New Delhi a day after Mrs. Gandhi addressed a throng there. The crowd was larger more enthusiastic and more responsive than the one that heard Mrs. Gandhi. Jaya Prakash Narayan, who 19 months ago had called for a campaign of passive resistance against Mrs. Gandhi's Government, said the future of democracy in India would be decided at the elections. He was accompanied by Jagjivan Ram, who resigned from Mrs. Gandhi's Cabinet on Wednesday. He attacked the Prime Minister in personal terms. [Page 1, Column 3.]

title: Rock: Quartets
description: Although Thin Lizzy and Queen come from the British Isles and both appeared at Madison Square Garden Saturday night (they are doing a 45date tour together), there is little in common between the two rock quartets.

description: New Corporate Bonds

title: Decline in Training Cited
description: Convinced that there has been a deterioration in the ability of students to write well, colleges and universities around the country are moving vigorously to improve their teaching of composition.

title: Grover Washington Gives Jazz Concert
description: The trouble with pop jazz concerts is that pop jazz works best on records, where jazz soloists are wrapped in elaborate packages, with lush strings, brass, layers of electronic keyboards, and large, insistent rhythm sections. No matter how much personality the soloists assert, they are still identified by their public with music that is not easy to recreate on the stage.

title: Bail Hearing for Boyle Set Today
description: MEDIA, Pa., Feb. 6 (UPI)A bail hearing is scheduled tomorrow for W. A. Boyle, 74 years old, who is serving three consecutive life terms for ordering the murder of Joseph A. Yablonski, his opponent in an election for the presidency of the United Mine Workers Union. Mr. Boyle's attorney asked for the hearing 10 days ago after the state Supreme Court ordered a retrial.

title: School Attended by Amy Carter Reflects Problems In System Largely Abandoned by Capital's Affluent
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6If President Carter has the time to become familiar with the new school that his daughter Amy attends, he will learn a great deal about the troubleplagued public school system here and what it is trying to do to improve itself.

title: Amnesty International Asks for a U.N. Inquiry Into Slayings in Uganda
Enthusiasm About Nuclear Power Turns to Anxiety in West Germany
description: BONN, Feb. 6Nuclear power, which West Germans have enthusiastically accepted for years to insure future economic growth, is suddenly becoming a nemesis.

title: Miss Choi, Soprano, Heard in Poised Recital
description: Though her appearance Saturday afternoon at Carnegie Recital Hall marked HyeYoung Choi's New York recital debut, the soprano has had considerable performing experience here and in her native Korea, The experience showed; a handsome woman with a conquering smile, she proved a poised singer with a special ability to communicate positive feeling.

title: Brown Places 60 on California Regulatory Boards As Lobbyists for People Instead of Special Interests
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Feb 5There were no fireworks or bands playing or color guard, just a few words and the rattle of coffee cups in a motel conference hall to mark the occasion. But when it was over the state of California had taken a significant new turn in changing the way government works.

title: Old Friends of Rosalind Russell Meet in Her Memory at Shubert
description: The applause of a Broadway audience swelled for the late Rosalind Russell last night for the first time since 1958, when she left the role of Auntie Mame. She had made her Broadway debut in Garrick Gaieties 28 years before.

title: John T. McGillicuddy Jr., 75, Dies Former President of National Casket

description: RICHMOND, Feb. 6 (AP)Tom Okker of the Netherlands held off a thirdset rally by Vitas Gerulaitis and won the Richmond tennis tournament with a 36, 63, 64 victory today.

title: Denney Brothers Victors in Ski Jump
description: GILFORD, N.H., Feb. 6Jim Denney, the defending champion from Duluth, Minn., who established a hill record of 272 feet in a tuneup meet here yesterday, won the national Class A skijumping championship today, but his younger brother Jeff created the day's biggest stir.

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: Lentil soup, it would seem, comes in all sorts of nationalities and flavors. It would also seem that half the readers of this column have favorite recipes for lentil soup, which they would willingly make public.

title: High Schools Test Reading By LEONARD BUDER
description: All 300,000 New York City high school students will be tested in reading as part of a major new effort to evaluate and improve their academic performance.

title: Bergen Town Officials Challenge Women on U.S. Aid
description: LEONIA, Feb. 6A request, for Federal aid for a center offering referralservices counseling and other help to women in Bergen County ran into a barrage of sharp questioning yesterday from town officials who control the funds.

title: Airliner Chartered by U.S. Flies 140 From Tanzania
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Feb. 6 (Reuters)The United States today sent a specially chartered Boeing 707 to Kilimanjaro airport in northern Tanzania to bring back 140 American tourists stranded by the closing by Tanzania of its border with Kenya.

title: San Diego Is Wary of Refugees From Snow
description: SAN DIEGO, Feb. 6Mrs. Dorothy Alden, a spry widow in her 80's, landed at San Diego's Lindbergh Airport after two days of hop, skip and jump flights to escape from her snowpiled home in Ypsilanti Mich.

title: Net Win 3d Straight, 9490, as Hawkins Scores 37
description: SAN ANTONIO,. Feb. 6The Knicks continue to struggle on the road. The San Antonio Spurs, with the worst defensive statistics in the National Basketball Association, put on sparkling defensive effort today and routed the New Yorkers, 11996, at the HemisFair Arena. This was New York's second defeat in Texas in less than 24 hours. They were ,beaten by the Houston Rockets. 105103 last night.

title: Aid to Tokyo Rose and Miss Yoshimura Reflects JapaneseAmericans New Confidence
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 6The pardon of Tokyo Rose and the trial of Wendy Yoshimura, who was a fugitive from the authorities with Patricia Hearst, are cited here as showing a new willingness on the part of JapaneseAmericans to become involved in controversial causes.

title: Repression and Response
description: SAN FRANCISCOJust before Jimmy Carter took office, Leonid Brezhnev sent word that the Soviets would not take any early action to test the new Administration. The breathingspace has proved brief indeed.

description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Feb. 6Despite. reported Yugoslav refusals to give the Soviet Union naval bases for its Mediterranean squadron, some Western analysts are uneasy about the extensive use Soviet warships are being allowed to make of Yueoslav facilities.

title: 2D SURPLUS REPORTED BY U.S. POSTAL SERVICE
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 6  Postmaster General Benjamin F. Bailar has announced that the United States Postal Service, which has had chronic financial problems, had an operating surplus for the second consecutive quarter, with the surplus in the last quarter reaching $69.8 million.

title: Waldheim Meets With Saudi Leaders
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia, Feb. 6 (Reuters) Secretary General Kurt Waldheim, on the third leg of his Middle East tour, began talks today with Saudi leaders on steps for reconvening the Geneva conference on the Middle East.

description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Feb. 6 (AP)Darrell Griffith, a University of Louisville freshman, sank two free throws with 1 minute 29 seconds left in the game, and Providence College then missed on three scoring opportunities to give Louisville a 6864 basketball victory today.

title: In Memoriam
description: COSTMarch (Margaret Mackle Morrison) Novelist and biographer. Died Feb. 7, 1973. Death cannot kill what never dies.

title: Robin M. Mims Bride Of Peter A. Mindnich
description: Robin Marie Mims, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Jean Boyd Mims of Silver Lake, S. I., was married yesterday afternoon to Peter Anthony Mindnich, son of Mr. and Mrs. John David Mindnich of Short Hills and Elberon. N.J.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: JANUARY JAMBOREE It's fiesta time again at Mamma Leone's, with multicolored lights adorning the pinkstucco exterior of the popular midtown eatery. For the 17th year, a 16night, preLenten carnival will entertain diners at 239 West 48th Street (between Broadway and Eighth Avenue). The management also hopes that the lighted facade and the fun inside will bring a splash of brightness to the surrounding theater area these gray, chilly evenings.

title: Colleges Bolstering Courses To Improve Writing Ability
description: Convinced that there has been a deterioration in the ability of students to write well, colleges and universities around the country are moving vigorously to improve their teaching of composition.
