SHOP TALK
description: THOSE with a yearning for yarn, looms to weave it on, wheels to spin it with and lessons in how to make beautiful things from it, will find paradise at The Niddy Noddy.

title: THEATER
description: THIS is the story of two professional theatrical companies, one in Stamford, the other in Mamaroneck. Both raised their curtains in the fall of 1975, and both exist in areas of some affluence. The Connecticut company is already expanding to a second theater, while the Westchester company still rents space and is approaching the close of its second season proudly anticipating a profit that is less than the price of an orchestra seat for a Broadway musical.

title: Space Rock  Into the Weird Blue Yonder
description: The term normally applied to the furthest reaches of progressiverock experimentation is space rock, but both halves of the term are a misnomer. Space suggests a strict linkage to science fiction. Indeed, while the titles and album cover art often play with cosmic mythology, the music itself does not always necessarily do so. Rock, in turn, implies some connection with the bluesbased basics of rockandroll. But much of this music has completely transcended any connection to rock as perceived in even the most generous sense. And some of itlike Philip Glass's recent workis being produced by composers who have had no connection with the rock world at all.

title: LETTERS TO THE WESTCHESTER EDITOR
description: As a golden oldie now a fulltime matriculating student at Sarah Lawrence, I would like to offer an adult'seye view of campus alienation and the barb addressed to continuingeducation students by the sophomoric Jim Farber [Letter From Sarah Lawrence, Feb, 6.]

title: Vermont Men Win Ski Carnival
description: HANOVER, N.H., Feb, 12Although the University of Vermont failed to place one of its performers among the first two finishers in either of today's giant slalom or ski jumping events, the Catamounts retained the Dartmouth Winter Carnival Cup.

title: Meanwhile, Back in Riverhead
East Side Catholic Parishes Try to Bring Church Closer to the People
description: The poll of East Side Roman Catholics to determine what factors most influence churchgoing, released last week, was conducted as a result of a deliberate decision by the area's priests and laity. The findings are already shaping policies in several of the parishes.

title: Baylor, Frank McGuire Among 5 Elected to Hall
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Feb. 12Elgin Baylor, Frank McGuire and three others have been elected to the Basketball Hall of Fame, hall officials announced today.

title: Soviet Defends Drive on Dissidents And Alleges West Is Abetting Them
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 12The Soviet Union today published a defense of its campaign against dissidents, denouncing them as pawns in a coordinated Western assault on dtente and Communism.

title: Pornography and Censorship
description: ONCE again the New Jersey Assembly will have to contemplate legislation that, we are told, will protect us all from pornography. It will also protect us from the free exercise of our right as adults to decide what books, magazines or motion pictures we will read or see. The latest legislation, currently before the Assembly, will treat New Jersey's adults like children. If we let our Assemblymen get away with it.

title: Virginia Tech 89, Army 74
description: BLACKSBURG, Va., Feb. 12 (AP)Virginia Tech took a 268 lead during the first 10 minutes behind the scoring of Duke Thorpe and Ron Bell and cruised to an 8974 victory over Army. tonight.

title: CigaretteTar Tax Urged
description: DENVER, Feb. 12 (AP)Smokers of hightar cigarettes would pay 15 cents more a pack for them under a bill proposed by two doctors who are members of the Colorado Assembly.

title: The Grand Old Teenagers Of Contemporary Music
Rutgers 68, West Virginia 66
description: MORGANTOWN, W.Va., Feb. 12 (AP)Rutgers came from an 8point deficit lead midway through the secand half tonight behind a gamehigh 25 points by James Bailey to subdue West Virginia, 6866, in an Eastern Collegiate Basketball League game.

title: BRIDGE
description: IF a bridge contest between teams representing every county in the United States were a practicable propositionas it is in EnglandWestchester would surely be among the two or three top favorites. The county could call on one player who has competed in the world championship and a dozen others who are prominent on the national scene.

title: Motor Sports Calendar
description: Feb. 18Long Island Sports Car Club meeting at Maple Manor, 242 Maple Avenue, Westbury, L.I. Interested persons welcome. Information: Bill O'Brien Sr., phone (516)3640781.

title: Kathryn Steward Affianced
description: The engagement clf Kathryn Merrill Steward to John Hamilton Lewis Bingham has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Merrill Franklin Steward of North Haven, Conn., parents of the future bride. Her fiance is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Hiram Bingham of Salem, Conn., and a grandson of the late Hiram Bingham, who directed the 1912 expedition from Yale that rediscovered the lost Inca civilization at Manchu Picchu in Peru, and who served as Governor of Connecticut and as United States Senator from Connecticut.

title: Caucus vs. Primary
Landry Promotes Aide
description: DALLAS, Feb. 12 (UPI)Coach Tom Landry of Dallas promoted his offensive coordinator, Jim Myers, to assistant head coach of the Cowboys today. Dan Reeves, who coached the quarterbacks and wide receivers last season, will become offensive coordinator.

title: Notes: The 25th Year Of Elizabeth Regina
Lauren Gray Fiancee Of John K. Watson 3d
description: Mr. and Mrs. James L. Gray of Cutchogue, L. I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Lauren Muriel Gray, to John King Watson 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Watson Jr. of Scarsdale, N. Y., and New Suffolk, L. I.

title: Lorene Dappert Fiancee Of William C. Watson
description: Mr. and Mrs. George Frederick Dappert of Darien, Conn., and East Hampton, L. I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Lorene Marie Dappert, to William Clarke Watson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Morris R. Watson of Kern City, Calif.

title: On Growing Orchids Indoors
description: FOR years, I admired the extraordinary beauty of tropical orchids in flower shows with the same detachment as paintings in art exhibitions  and with no thought of possession. The one belonged in a greenhouse, the other in a museum. Period.

title: Trackmen Believed Paid. To Skip Specific Meets
description: Track and field, the sport of amateurs, is on the verge of another major money scandal, this time over illegal payments to athletes fornot competing in specific indoor meets this season.

title: African Festival Ends, a Decided Success
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Feb. 12  Before 60,000 spectators in the National Stadium, the flags of some 50 nations were shot into the air, and the performers from around the world broke into one last, exuberant dance. The final speecnes were maae, tne last anthems sung and the flame that had been burning for 29 daysa gift from the Yoruba god Sangowas extinguished.

title: Mary Bacon: Independent On or Off Race Track
description: In one of the four small bedrooms in ,the women jockey's quarters at Aqueduct Race Track, cosmetics and tapes of country and western music are strewn across the top of the dresser. A picture of a pig, cut from a magazine, is taped to the door of the wardrobe. It has the word bacon pasted on it, also cut from a magazine. The room is occupied by Mary Bacon, one of the nation's top femle jockeys.

title: POLITICS
description: SAMUEL COLT worried a lot about the General Assembly when it was in session; there was always the nagging suspicion that the legislators might pass a law that would cut into his profits or in some way impinge on firearms production at the sprawling redbrick factory with the blue onionshaped dome on the edge of the Connecticut River not far from the capitol.

title: Carter Looks to Roe
description: IT WAS after nightfall on a recent Friday, and Capitol Hill was about as quiet and deserted as a moonscape. Except, that is, for Bob Roe's longrunning, $4billion hearing.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Feb. 12 (AP) Richard McKinney and Luann Ryon led an American sweep in the world archery championships today as the United States collected all four world titles. McKinney, 23 years old, of Muncie, Ind., won the men's individual title with 2,501 points. Takashi Kamei of Japan was second with 2,480, and the leader over the first three days, Leandro Denardi of Italy, was third. Darrell Pace of Cincinnati, an Olympic gold medal winner, was fourth with 2,476.

title: STAGE VIEW
description: I was going to say that if you could weld Simon Gray's Otherwise Engaged to the last play of his we saw here, Butley, you'd have a doubleedged razor blade in your hand. Except that you don't really need Butley to do it. Otherwise Engaged is doubleedged all on its own and When its witty, wounding words are whipped about in the air like a blade held between forefinger and thumb, it glitters, fascinates andin a mordantly comic wayfrightens.

title: Truism, Truth and the E.R.A.
description: Repeatedly in recent years, society has struggled to legislate or litigate rights that many of us thought obvious or selfevident. Consider those who marched, even died, in the struggle to enact the 1965 act guaranteeing the right, of all things, to vote. Or the clamor over the Supreme Court's Gideon decision about the right to counsel.

title: Dibbs Beats Soloman
description: MIAMI, Fla., Feb 12 (AP)Eddie Dibbs recovered from 04 in the first set and defeated Harold Solomon, 75. 62, in the semifinals of a $50,000 Grand Prix tennis tournament today.

title: Arthur McManus, Environmentalist And ExPublic Relations Aide, 73
description: SYOSSET, L.I, Feb. 11  Arthur T. McManus, president of the Long Island Environmental Council and a retired director of public relations for the Health Insurance Plan of New York, died today at Syosset Hospital of cancer. He was 73 years old.

title: Schoolboy Aiming at Decathlon Mark
description: Back in 1952, Plainfield's Milt Campbell, regarded by many New Jersey's outstanding allround athlete, set a national schoolboy record in the decathlon, made the Olympic team and came home from London with a silver medal to the repeat gold won by Bob Mathias.

title: FollowUp on The News
description: Ramon Gonzalez, a 44  year  old impoverished, crippled Brooklynite, found himself trapped by catches in Social Security welfare rules.

title: U.S.C. Edges Princeton
description: MADISON, Wis., Feb. 12 (AP)Topranked Southern California, competing without its No. 1 player, Bruce Manson, avoided an upset yesterday and narrowly defeated Princeton, 54, in the quarter finals of the national collegiate indoor team tennis championship.

title: A Sumptuous Relic, Castle for a Musical King
description: STAN GETZ stands in the middle of the music room at Shadowbrook, in Tarrytown, his eyes tracing the lute and laurel motifs of the Tiffany glass windows. It is an unusual room, a 19thcentury rotunda in Greek Revival style, with a domed ceiling and Corinthian columns; a room in which, according to local lore, Washington Irving had his last glass of wine before he died. One of the best gifts I ever gave myself was this room, says Mr. Getz, one of the jazz world's most noted tenor saxophone players. The acoustics are unbelievable.

title: Clothing Concern Fined In Customs Case
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Feb. 12 (UP!)The White Stag Manufacturing Company, a sportswear concern was fined $100,000 yesterday for violating Customs laws and was ordered to give $200.000 to charity.

title: For young readers
This Week in Sports
description: Madison Square Garden has five games this week. A doubleheader at 7 P.M. Thursday sends Fordham against Lafayette and Notre Dame against Manhattan. A tripleheader at noon Saturday matches Iona against South Florida, Rutgers against Cincinnati and Seton Hall against North CarolinaCharlotte.

title: If You Go ...
description: . . . on a wilderness outing, try to make plans well in advance. Places tend to get filled early, and the fee often increases as departure date approaches.

title: Macken, France Rated Best in World
description: Four years after he first attracted international attention, Eddie Macken of Ireland has been placed No. I in the world rating for show jumpers.

title: Billy Carter to Buy Peanut Warehouse
description: PLAINS, Ga., Feb, 11 (UPI)Bily Carter said today that he would buy the family's peanut warehouse business in which his brother, President Carter, has had a enntrolline interest

title: Arab Nations Have Weakened Themselves by Squabbling
description: LONDONAs the Israelis and Arabs have been moving politically and diplomatically for resumption of the Geneva peace conference, attention has been diverted from the alternative method of resolving the conflict: through yet another Middle East war. Even the most helpful proponents of the meeting in Geneva agree that renewed fighting is all too possible. It is therefore pertinent to examine the state of military preparedness in the area.

title: FrenchEgyptian Study Says 60 Types of Fungi Are Threatening Mummy
description: PARIS, Feb. 11The 3,200yearold mummy of Ramses II has been found to be under attack by more than 60 different types of fungi and would be threatened with destruction if not submitted to drastic treatment, according to a FrenchEgyptian report made public here today.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONTEST FOR MAYOR IS CLOUDY
description: With the official start of the New York City mayoral campaign possibly only a month away, the race for the Democratic nomination, usually tantamount to election, is still so unsettled that not even the entry list is set vet.

title: New Leaders for Two Sensitive Agencies
description: WASHINGTONIn the autumn of 1975, when the Senate Intelligence Committee was checking allegations that the Central Intelligence Agency had plotted to kill Patrice Lumumba, who had been Prime Minister of Congo, committee investigators visited a former Central Intelligence Agency officer named Bronson Tweedy.

title: Past Forgetting
description: When it carne to the great love stories of World War II, the romance between Ike Eisenhower and Kay Summersby was right up there with the infatuations of MacArthur, Montgomery and Patton with themselves. That, at least, was what everyone, from the humblest G.I. in the European Theater of Operations to Red Cross Ladies in Tacoma, believed. And no one seriously objected. The Eisenhower grin was thought to be worth a couple of divisions against the Germans, after all, and if the Cleopatra from County Cork could keep him happy, well then, more power to them both.

description: To the Sports Editor:

description: The Silent Swedes

title: C. M. Amory, Mrs. Milbank Are Married
description: Elizabeth Griffis Milbank of New York was married at her apartment yesterday to C. Minot Amory. a municipal bonds salesman with First Pennco Securities Inc. State Supreme Court Justice Joseph P. Sullivan performed the ceremony.

title: Levesque Role In Car Accident Leaves Doubts
Court Blocks Abortion Curb
description: BOSTON, Feb. 12 (UPI)  A threejudge Federal panel has blocked a Massachusetts law due to go into effect next week that would force unmarried minors to obtain their parents consent for an abortion.

title: Pamela Cox Is Engaged To Richard J. Kessler Jr.
description: Mrs. Allen Ernest Cox of Southborough, Mass., has announced the engagement of her daughter, Pamela Mary Jameson Cox, to Richard John Kessler Jr., son of Mrs. Kessler of Portsmouth, ILL, and Rockwood, Me., and the late Lieutenant Commander Kessler, U.S.N.

title: He May Ask for a WindfallProfit Limit
May the Kitchen God Smile on You
description: MONTCLAIR THIS Friday will be the traditional Chinese New Year, the first day of the Year of the Serpent, and as usual it will be celebrated with banquets and rejoicing, with forgiveness of one's neighbors for real or imagined transgressions during the past year and with a daylong festival of dragon dances and fireworks.

title: A County Voice and Vote
description: I WISH to correct several incuracies in an article by Frank Lynn [''Silent Minority of Two, Politics column, Opinion Page, Jan. 23]

title: Changing
description: Unabashed by legends, Graham Greene wrote in 1940, Seeing Garbo has always seemed to me a little like reading Carlyle: good, oh very good, but work rather than play, Greene mainly objected to the pomposity of some of the scenarios that were conceived for her, plus the deathly reverence in which Garbo was framed. But of course Liv Ullmann has suffered no such confinement, since she has enhanced several of the finest films of the last 12 years, while the roles that Ingmar Bergman developed for her have outrun the range permitted to most performers. Still, reading her book is a choreor rather, a series of chores: it is quite like working through your drawers and closets, pushing onward until. accumulated objects settle into place. Respectful of this superb actress, you wrestle through golden platitudesA price is paid for fame and Dreams seldom become reality or Love has many faces and The most incredible things can happen in Hollywood. One can become a star overnightwhile waiting and hoping to learn something about her relationship to her art.

title: Sallie Ketcham Betrothed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Russell Dunham Ketcham of Wilmington, Del., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Sallie Ketcham, to W. Laird Stabler 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Stabler Jr. of Montchanin, Del. Miss Ketcham, who attended Ithaca College, and her fiance, a graduate of the University of Pennsylvania, plan to be married in July.

title: Lynn Hagedorn Is Fiancee of Dennis Olla, a Banker
description: Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Alfred Hagedorn Jr. of Sands Point, L.I., of the engagement of their daughter, Lynn Hagedorn, to Dennis 011a, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harry 0lla of Franklin Square, L.I. A summer weddine is nlanned..

title: Henry Ford 2d, Nearing 60, Ponders America's Future
DINING OUT
description: IT'S not a chateau, but Le Chateau probably comes closer to one than most restaurants in America that bear that name. The mansion in South Salem was built soon after the turn of the century, a gift from J. P. Morgan to the minister of his church. As a period piece, the stoneandtimber structure would almost be worth a visit regardless of the food.

title: DINING OUT; Anyone for Scungilli? Yes
description: THREE vigorous sets of mixed doubles, and we were ready for a hearty, informal dinner. We headed for Dick and Dcra's Restaurant, casually clad, our tennis (and dining) partners still in warmup suits. It was on the late side on a Friday evening, but the big, happy crowd in the Massapsqua restaurant made it seem like 8 o'clock.

title: Goober Best of Bulldogs
description: The topwinning bulldog in the history of the breed and the winner of more groups than any other nonsporting dog in America during 1976, was named best of breed yesterday at the Long Island Bulldog Club snecialty. He was Ch. Marine Bull's All The Way, owned by Karl and Joyce Dingman of Richfield, Minn. The show was held at the Holiday Inn in Jamaica, Queens.

title: Richard Strickler Jr. to Wed Diana Hole
Dr. Geoffrey W. Esty, 72, ExAide In Jersey Department of Health
description: Dr. Geoffrey W. Esty, former director of the Division of Constructive Health of the New Jersey Department of Health, died Wednesday in Princeton, N.J., at the age of 72. He had made his home there for many years.

title: INTERVIEW
description: TO commence his second term in the Senate, Lowell P. Weicker Jr. has chosen a rather quiet, obscure path.

title: Two Hearts Beating as One
description: ST. VALENTINE remains the patron saint of lovers, but the truth is that, although there were several St. Valentines, the one that has come down through the times is a fusion of the two bestknown, and a considerable part of the legend of St. Valentine is Probably just thata legend.

title: Notes: Three Conductors Now Share Duties Of Training Orchestra
description: When an organization such as the National Orchestral Association has been around as long as it has 47 yearsit is apt to be taken for granted. But, as New York's major trainer of symphonic instrumentalists, its importance goes far beyond the city limits: it is estimated that 60 percent of its alumni are still active in American and European orchestras. It also has its share of troubles and has to go through periods of change, and one such change has taken place this season.

title: Students Get A Taste of Politics
description: THE speaker, who was introducing a bill to build a solarenergy plant, wore blue jeans, and her long brown hair fell loosely about her shoulders.

title: Indiana Streak at 127
description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind., Feb. 12 (AP) Indiana University swimmers captured their 127th straight dual meet last night. The Hoosiers defeated Illinois, 8835, at Royer Pool. Indiana has never lost in Royer Pool.

title: ART
description: GREENVALE IT is strongly tempting to attribute political and ideological connotations to the exhibition of Chinese art at the C. W. Post Art Gallery. We can hypothesize that such shows reflect the increasing interest in China, that they mark a rapprochement between Chinese culture and ours, and that they pave the way for a greater reciprocal understanding in other, similar cultural enterprises. Hypotheses of this nature are reasonable, for art is one of the most forceful of diplomatic emissaries. Art can function in areas where diplomats and politicians frequently cannot.

title: The job Tax Credit's Hollow Promise
description: There's a bright new fashion in social engineering now pirouetting on the Congressional runway. It's called the job tax credit and its purpose is to enlist private industry in the effort to cut hardcore unemployment. Listen tothe applause: Representative Abner Mikva, the Illinois Democrat, argues that it will have a more direct effect on high unemployment areas than other economic proposals now being considered. Senator Richard Schweiker, the Pennsylvania Republican, compares it, gleamingly, with unimaginative, worn out public job programs. Why is everyone getting so carried away? Fashionable or not, the job tax credit seems to us to have a lot of holes in it.

title: Romantic actress, romantic blouses
description: The blouses of spring are soft, romantic, pretty, a bit nostalgicjust like the young French film actress wearing them on these pages. She's Aurore Clement, star of Louis Malle's Lacombe Lucien and of a current hit in Paris, Yves Boisset's Le Sheriff. She may be more familiar to moviegoers in France than in America, but that should be changed after Apocalypse Now is released later this year. Aurore has the leading female role in Francis Ford Coppola's saga of the war in Vietnam. Actual filming was done in the Philippine jungle, where Aurore found rugged clothes more appropriate than the soft, feminine styles she favors. Aurore lives part of the time in Paris and part of the time in New York, and likes shopping in both cities, seeking out little boutiques and antique clothing stores.

title: ROBERT TYSON, 70, DIES
description: Robert Tyson, for 40 years a professor of psychology at Hunter and Herbert H. Lehman Colleges, died Friday at his home, 448 Riverside Drive. He was 70 years old and maintained a second residence in Chappaqua, N.Y.

title: Ethnic Show in Newark
description: THE MENTION of an ethnic show, such as the UkrainianAmerican artists exhibition at the Newark Museum, can cause some raised eyebrows and a few pinched smiles in certain quarters of the art world. Some skeptics believe that ethnic art is a shibboleth. The skeptics assert that the museums, in their attempt to appeal to everyone, really appeal to no one, and that artists who often don't deserve museum showings get them under the ethnic label.

title: What They Are Saying
description: Chuck Foreman of the Minnesota Vikings, trying to renegotiate his contract, was asked if he would be willing to reduce his salary if he had a bad year: Joe Namath had only one good year and I notice he never gave any money back.

title: Cable TV: County On Verge Of a Boom
description: AFTER years of being shunned by cable television entrepeneurs as doubtful prospects, the communities of Westchester Countyparticularly those in the southern sectionare on the threshold of a cable bonanza.

title: Sour Note for Sweets
description: Tomorrow's traditional Valentine's Day gift of a box of chocolate bon bons will still be more of an expression of affection than a boast of economic solvency, despite the record prices set last week for the raw materialcocoa beans. A Borrowing Binge A clue to what could have been. If the weather hadn't frozen or shriveled the economic statistics, was afforded last week in a report on for consumer credit purchases made last December.

title: The Oranging Of America
description: The spirit that made America what it is today is still operative, according to Max Apple in this remarkable debut.

title: POLITICS
description: WAS District Attorney Carl A. Vergari playing politics when he announced recently that he would close four of his branch offices if the county's Board of Legislators did not restore the $176,000 it had cut from his 1977 budget?

title: The Line Forms
Coverage by Snow Set January Record
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12 (UPI)Sixtyfive percent of the land of North America was covered with snow last month, making it the most extensive snow coverage In 11 years of satellite observations.

title: Monroe Lauded for His AllRound Game
description: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 12Remember when they would say Earl Monroe was strictly a oneonone player, interested only in scoring? Remember, too, when they would say defense was a nonexistent word in the Monroe vocabulary?

title: Banishing the Ghost of Franco
description: MADRIDThe other day, a starchy political commentator in the monarchist daily ABC was moved to issue a word of caution to his journalistic colleagues. Prime Minister Adolfo Suarez was, to be sure, he said, a fine political leader, but not Demosthenes, Cicero, Abraham Lincoln, Disraeli and Cavour all at once.

description: To the Editor:

ART
description: PRINTS have become such suave sophisticated creatures these days that it is dittiont to recognize them simply as prints. In older times a print was easily identified as an etching or a lithograph.

title: Marriage Announcement 3  No Title
description: Deborah Goldstein Engaged

title: SHOP TALK
description: THERE are all kinds of ways to say I love you on Valentine's Day  perfume and flowers, candlelight and wine, or diamonds to spark the flame even more than gushing rhyme. And then there's fur, an ardent gift, indeed; it can ignite a friendship, insulate a relationship, reinforce or reinstate marital felicity.

title: Notre Dame Turns Back So. Carolina
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Feb. 12 (UPI)Don Williams led five other doublefigure scorers with 19 points today and paced Notre Dame to an 8466 rout of South Carolina. He scored 8 mints in the first 10 minutes of the second half when the Irish broke the game open, outscoring the Gamecocks by 2210.

title: Leafs Get 5 In First, Rout Caps by 100
description: TORONTO, Feb. 12 (AP)Darryl Sittler and Lanny McDonald each scored two goals and two assists and Inge Hammarstrom had a goal and four assists as the Toronto Maple Leafs routed the Washington Capitals, 100, tonight in a National Hockey League game.

title: Heiden Wins 500Meter In Skating
description: HEERENVEEN, Netherlands, Feb. 12 (AP)Eric Heiden, 18yearold United States star, took the lead at the halfway mark of the men's world speedskating championships today.

title: Legislative Hearings Scheduled This Week
description: The following public hearings will be held in the New York metropolitan area by state legislative committees this week:

title: A Powerhouse of Chinese Art
description: THE current exhibition at Long Island University's C. W. Post Art Gallery, according to leading Chineseart experts, marks one of the most important displays of Chinese art to be held in the New York area in recent years.

title: Cauthen Facing a Ban
description: Will Steve Cauthen have to file for unemployment compensation?This was the bizarre possibility raised yesterday at Aqueduct, where the 16yearold apprentice jockey rode two more winners; Catalan took the $53,000 Lucky Draw Stakes before the largest crowd of the winter meetingand investigators for the State Labor Department began serving summonses an some of the grateful owners and trainers whose horses Cauthen has been chauffeuring into the winner's circle all winter.

title: Board Considers Having Teachers Reside in the City
NASA Has Kept Busy: It Is Planning To Orbit a 95Inch Telescope in 1977
Cold Winter Proves Boon to Iceboaters
description: ST. MICHAELS, Md.They called It a perfect day. The windchill factor was minus 15 degrees. Smallcraft warnings warnings were posted. But the ice was great,. they said, hard and clear of snow Almost 100 of the fragilelooking craft crisscrossed the Miles River on the Eastern shore. On downwind tacks the 12foot DNClass iceboats were reaching speeds of 80 miles an hour.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: It should by now obvious that stagflation is not just a shortrun problem encountered in the recent recession. It is also a longrun structural problem.The combintion of inflation with high unemployment, and with lower than average growth rates is a salient feature of most developed market economies, still operating well below capacity.

title: SADLOWSKI CHARGES  FRAUD IN STEEL VOTE
description: Ed Sadlowski is charging fraud and refusing to concede the loss of the presidency of the United Steelworkers union though unofficial totals show him losing by a seemingly insurmountable margin.

title: Columbia Bows to Tigers And Falls Out of First Place
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Feb. 12Princeton's cagey Tigers, trained and directed by wise little Pete Carril, gave the Young Lions of Columbia a lesson in blackboardperfect basketball tonight and trounced the upstarts from New York, 8564, in one of the battles for the Ivy League lead.

title: Youth Takes Over in Corporate St. Louis
Riddick Extends Dash Streak
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 12 (AP)Steve Riddick raced to his 12th straight victory tonight in the 60yard dash in the 37th annual Knights of Columbus track meet.

title: Miss Austin in Cup Tennis
description: Hilton Head March 27 through April 3. The 14yearold amateur will be in field with most of the world's top professional players, including threetime champion Chris Evert.

title: Judaism Plays Vital Role in Cure At Coast Drug Treatment Center
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 12The Chabad House has a drug rehabilitation center where Judaism is a vital component of the treatment process. And although Southern California has an abundance of drug control centers, Chabad House has gained attention because it is opened by the most prominent Hasidic movement in Judaism.

title: Around THE Garden
Woman Chief Justice and a Black Are Named to Court in California
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Feb. 12Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. appointed a woman Chief Justice of the California Supreme Court today, and named a black man an Associate Justice.

title: Vilas Extended by Mayer
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Feb. 12 (AP)Guillermo Vilas, the Argentine lefthander, had unexpectedly strong opposition, but ousted yoUng Gene Mayer of Wayne, N.J., 76, 76, 61, in the semifinals of the $50,000 Springfield International, a Grand Prix tennis tournament.

title: The Daring Visions of Four New, Young Playwrights
description: Tennessee Williams and Arthur Miller came to prominence on Broadway. Edward Albee began Off Broadway. Lanford Wilson and Sam Shepard grew out of Off Off Broadway. Today some of the most interesting new young American playwrights have their roots in regional theater. Up to now, the work of these latter writers has not been generally available to New York audiences; but this season two of them are having major productions in New York, and, perhaps, more are soon on the way.

title: Theater
A Key, Maybe, to Phi Beta Kappa
description: THE subject of today's discussion is intelligence, not the C.I.A.'s spooky kind, but smarts. And what occasions it, besides continuous communications from my friends in Mensa, are a couple of messages from Princeton.

title: Will They Dance?; President and Congress May Have Trouble Staying in Step
description: WASHINGTONPresident Carter last week confessed that the White House had made some mistakes in dealing with Congress, and promised to do better. No doubt he will, in one fairly limited sense.

title: Marjorie Martinez, Soprano, in Debut
description: A soprano of American Indian extraction, Marjorie Osceola Martinez made her debut in Carnegie Recital Hall on Friday night. She has a very pretty voice, but, perhaps from nervousness. her use of it was limited. The opening tour Schubert songs and Tour works sung in French sounded alike if tonally appealing. The singer failed to make her words distinct, and there was little vocal coloration. Top tones sounded effortful at first, but became freer in three songs by Samuel Barber and miscellaneous other items.

title: Sunday Observer
Letter to a Child Never Born
Strutting in Style in Israel
description: Israel's growing number of fashion designers and clothing manufacturers donned their best bibs and tuckers at the Tel Aviv Hilton this week and went all out. to woo hundreds of international buyers who had come to see whether this tiny nation's claim that had a part to play in the chimerical world of fashion had any merit.

title: When It Comes to Football, The Name of the Game Is the Name
description: I have long been intrigued by the names of professional football players and thoroughbred race horses. Both seem specially named.est difficulty in returning a deep backhand lies not in the speed and placement of the ball itself, but in his mind's reaction to that ball: his thinking makes the shot more difficult than it really is Further, he becomes aware that these same mental obstacles that keep him from playing his best tennis also prevent him from living his best life.

title: Cincinnati Gunrrian Frees Hostages
description: CINCINNATI, Feb. 12 (AP)Eight hostages escaped unharmed today when a man who had held them clvernight at a home for unwed mothers first dropped his shotgun and then was tricked into believing that a police officer was the son he had not seen for 20 years.

title: With Numbers and Diagrams
description: RECREATIONAL mathematicians on the Island are no doubt familiar with puzzles in which letters are substituted for numbers and the problem is to find out what number each letter stands for. A simple example should suffice for those not familiar with the form:

title: Putting a Headlock on Our Children
description: THE SECRET THOUGHT, the private worm in the apple of those who live in greenest Connecticut is, Now that we have it, let's keep it that way. We clutch our zoning to our bosoms, treasure the homogeneity of our schools, rally to the defense of our peculiar institutions that lock us in as they lock everyone else out. Because that's the function of the lock. Those inside are inside and protected and the world out there remains dangerous and unknown.

title: Fighting Subsides at Guerrilla Camps in Outskirts of Beirut but Arab League's Peace Forces Stay on Alert
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 12Fighting in and around Palestinian refugee camps here subsided today but tension remained high as the guerrillas and Syrian troops remained on full alert following bitter clashes Thursday and Friday..

title: Germany's Instant Millionaire
Music: Guarneri
description: The Guarneri String Quartet added a new work to its repertory Friday night at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, Sir William Walton's Quartet in A minor. No doubt the Guarneri was moved to program the piece as a tribute to the British composer, who is celebrating his 75th birthday this year.

description: SEATTLE, Feb. 11Its advocates say that it will help the client, help the lawyer and help the legal profession, and that, in any event, it is an idea whose time has come.

title: The Tab for Corporate Clients at Leading Law Firms
description: Why are you in law school? a professor once asked his firstyear students.

title: Black Hawks 4, Rockies 2
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 12 (AP)Dick Redmond, a defenseman, fired home three firstperiod goals tonight to lead the Chicago Black Hawks to a 42 N.H.L. triumph over the Colorado Rockies.
