Home Clinic
CITIES IN NORTH FACE REDUCED FEDERAL AID UNDER BLOCK GRANTS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12A Governmentsponsored study has concluded that by 1980, if the law is left unchanged, the chief beneficiaries of a Federal program meant to help revive the decaying old cities of the North will be small towns, suburbs and Southern and Western cities.

title: Nastase Defeats Panatta by 57, 76, 64 As Lights Go Out and Disputes Flare
Criminals At Large
description: About three years ago. Shepard Rifkin introduced a New York cop named McQuaid and put him on a case that sent him to Mexico. If Rifkin's new McQuaid book. THE SNOW RATTLERS (Putnam's, $7.95), is any indication, that will be the pattern of all the books in the series. For in The Snow Rattlers, McQuaid starts in New York and ends up in New Mexico. Possibly Rifkin wants to point up culture contrasts: the tough New York cop struggling with an alien way of thought, up against people who talk and think differently.

title: Purnell: School Defies a Trend,
description: POTTERSVILLE BY TODAY'S educational standards of popularity, the Purnell School should be out of business. It is a livein institution for girls only; it is expensive; it is small (there are only about 95 students, and the school is committed to stay that way). In addition, sex, drugs and drinking on campus are not tolerated, and the curriculum offers courses that at first confound most college admissions officers.

title: POLITICS
description: ANYONE who doesn't believe that political bosses are a thing of the past should talk to Mayor Paul T. Jordan of Jersey City, who could have used some of the old magic during recent weeks.

title: Exploring Kenya Sans Safari
HOME CLINIC
description: MOST houses built in this area during the last 30 years have copper water lines that are joined or assembled with soldered fittings.

title: MUSIC VIEW
description: Tomorrow night the Zurich Tonhalle Orchestra comes to town with a program that contains, among other things, Mozart's Concerto for Two Pianos in E flat. Christoph Eschenbach and Justus Frantz will be the soloists, and their collaboration is worth a general cornment. For they are not a twopiano team. Each has an independent solo career. But obviously they are friends who have much the same thoughts about music, else they would not have spent the hours and hours of practice necessary to work up the splitsecond ensemble demanded by public performances of a major concerto. And so tomorrow their careers intersect, and the history of music will add a footnote to the large number of solo pianists who have temporarily come together as a twopiano team.

title: Qualifying Begins Today For Daytona 500 Race
description: le complicated weeklong process are down a record entry of 82 cars he 40 starting spots in the Daytona stock car race bezins today with poleposition qualifying.

title: NUMISMATICS
description: The collecting of Confederate paper money got a boost from the Civil War centennial in the mid1960's. It may get another from the presence of a Southerner in the White House. But, the most important longrange influence for steady growth and permanent popularity in any specialty is the availability of a good, inexpensive reference book.

title: Sweet Alliance Wins
description: CHERRY HILL, N.J., Feb. 12 (AP)Sweet Alliance raced to a ninelength victory over One Night Affair in the 24th running of the $31,980 Jersey Belle Handicap at Garden State Park today. Ridden by Chris McCarron, Sweet Alliance completed the 11/16 mile in 1:49 3/5 before a meet record of 19,729 fans. A $2 across the board bet returned $3.80, $2.80 and $2.60.

title: Henri, for a Change, Paces Filions in Driver Standing
description: YONKERSIt takes a Filion to beat a Filion and Henri Filion has been beating Herv Filion often enough at Yonkers Raceway to establish a record of sorts for sibling rivalries.

title: New Rochelle: A Mature Suburb Feeling Its Age
description: Seventyone years ago this winter the New Rochelle Chamber Commerce issued a proclamation urging all resiaents to boycott George M. Cohan's show about their town, Fortyfive Minutes from Broadway, which had just opened in New York.

title: Jews in New York Plant Trees For TuB'Shvat DespiteWeather
description: Despite the frozen, icecovered ground, Jews in New York planted trees last week as they celebrated the coming of spring. The holiday is Th B'Shvat, the New Year of Trees.

title: To Mend Their Ways
description: THE night of Nov, 12, 1976, was a shattering one for residents of Hicksville, Levittown and surrounding communities. When they went to their cars the next morning, they found windows shot out.Later, the police arrested three teenagers, who, during their rampage, had fired more than 2,000 pellets from two guns. Estimated damage to the 94 cars was $20,000.

title: Ski Lifts Are to Wait For, Hang From, Worry About
description: It was my first ride on the gondoloa at Killington, Vt. Exactly halfway up, the car came to a halt. I groaned and waited the longest 30 minutes I've ever spent before the gondola began moving again. I never did find out why it had stopped.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: The matter was discussed by Western heads of government at their summit meeting in Puerto Rico last June. And it is almost certain to be on the agenda again when they meet in the spring.

title: Albany Seeks to Cut 18% Interest Charged on CreditCard Balances
description: ALBANY. Feb. 12Legislation aimed at rolling back the 18 percent interest charged holders of credit cards on their unpaid balances was introduced in the Senate and Assembly this week with bipartisan support.

title: Legion Wins at Gulfstream
description: HALLANDALE, Fla., Feb. 12 (AP)Legion led wire to wire today in the $62,400 Donn Handicap at Gulfstream to beat Logical by 1 lengths. Yamanin, the 32 favorite with the crowd of 20,988, was a head farther back.

title: Daughter of Oral Roberts Is Killed With 5 Others in Crash of Airplane
description: ANTHONY, Kan., Feb. 12 (AP)Six Oklahomans, including the daughter of Oral Roberts, the evangelist, were killed yesterday when a private plane crashed into a wheat field in a rain storm.

title: Helping Hand Awaits, Unwed Mothers
description: DURING the last six years, Mr. and Mrs. Joseph McCullough of Haddon Heights have welcomed almost a dozen young women into their home, providing them with shelter and understanding during the final phases of an unwanted pregnancy.

title: Skiing Without the Mountain
America's Moment: 1918
description: Individuals and nations need to believe in mighthaveteens: moments when the course of events could have been profoundly altered for the better. The myth of the paths not taken gives us faith that we can control the future. No period in the international history of the 20th century is more pregnant with mighthavebeens than the end of World War I.

title: Influential Citizens
The Writer As Movie Director
Foreign Sales Helping Florida's Sluggish Condos
Lovers and Losers
Under the River
description: It used to be that shows opened in New Raven or Philadelphia, were whipped into shape on the road and then, if they hadn't also been whipped into submission,took their shot at Broadway. Now they oven in New York and when they lay an egg there, Chef move to Jersey. At least, that's getting to be the pattern in professional foobalL

title: Doctor J's toughest case
description: Dr. J once made a shot in a pro basketball game in Houston that so stunned his own teammates that they stopped dead and watched it in the instant replay on the scoreboard. An adversary in Denver, David Thompson, says he has often had to remind himself to stop gaping in admiration and concentrate on his own game instead, and another opponent says he has had nightmares of the Doctor charging at him in his sleep. If he isn't the best, says Denver's Willie Wise, offering a widely shared view, then I'm in for a treat.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: THE WHOLESALE PRICE INDEX in January rose 0.5 percent to 188.00 (1967=100), compared with a rise of 0.8 percent in December and 0.2 percent in November. The impact of the severe winter has yet to be felt on prices of food and fuel, however; and probably will be reflected in the February wholesale price index . . . The Commerce Department reported that retail sales at $56.6 billion in January were down 2 percent. President Carter threatened to veto any drastic changes in his $31 billion tax refund and unemployment package.

title: Roth and Singer on Bruno Schulz
Drinking Troubles More Families
description: The number of families troubled by drinking has risen 50 percent since 1974. according to the latest Gallup Poll. The sharp increase was accompanied by an 8 percent rise in women drinkers, while the number of men who use liquor, wine or beer remained unchanged, the survey indicated.

title: F .A .A . Investigates Alleged Parts Fraud On Foreign Copters
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12A Federal Aviation Administration spokesman said today that the agency was conducting a continuing investigation into allegations that substandard helicopter parts were being sold for the military helicopter fleets of foreign countries.

title: Alvin P. Hamel, ExExecutive Of Telephone Company, Dies
description: Alvin P. Hamel, a retired vice president of the New York Telephone Company, died yesterday at his home on Staten Island. He was 75 years old and lived at 10 Rustic palace.

title: GARDENING
description: PROLONGED cold weather need not concern gardeners who are worried about their plants. As long as temperatures remain consistently cold, the insulating snow blanket will remain. Bulbs, perennials and sod underneath are protected.

title: Edmund H. Hamann Dies at 76
description: Edmund H. Hamann. who retired in 1955 as head of flavor research and development at FritzscheDodge & Olcott, manufacturers of essential oils, in New York City, died in Greenwich (Conn.) Hospital Thursday after a brief illness. He was 76 years old and lived on Indian Hill Road. Greenwich.

title: The opposition and Sanjay
description: NEW DELHI. A few days after his release from jail last month, Morarji Desai, the 80yearold oppositionist, held a news conference, and the subject of youth came up. With Sanjay Gandhi and his battalions of Youth Congress workers canvassing the countryside, didn't the opposition, reporters asked, wish it had someone like Sanjay campaigning on its side? Without a moment's hesitation, Desai replied: God forbid! You see Sanjay Gandhi being received by chief ministers. having police escorts, traveling in Government planes, the crusty old politician continued. Who is he, anyway?

title: GARDENING
description: PROLONGED cold weather need not concern gardeners who are worried about their plants. As long as temperatures remain consistently cold, the insulating snow blanket will remain. Bulbs, perennials and sod underneath are protected.

title: ILLEGAL ALIENS ESTIMATED AT 64,000 IN GRAIN BELT
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12 (AP)The immigration authorities believe that there are more than 64,000 illegal aliens in eight Grain Belt states and say that there is little they can do to apprehend them.

title: Marilyn Thurber Bride of Ferdinand Lauffer
description: Marilyn Jane Thurber, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Harris E. Thurber of Middlebury, Vt., was married yesterday afternoon to Ferdinand A. Lauffer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Johannes Lauffer of Dauchingen, West Germany.

title: The Game Theorist
Serban's musical imagemaker
description: Elizabeth Swados is one of those not very common people who, if they happen to catch a glimpse of their successthese days, it is pretty hard for her not todon't see themselves reflected in it. They are looking to somethine else.

title: Chekhov's Characters Seem to Be Ourselves
description: Why are there so many Chekhov revivals? Why is there such continuing interest in Chekhov? That is like asking Why so many performances of Mozart? or Why such continuing interest in Bach? Chekhov's texts are of the quality of Shakespeare's and Beckett's. Inspired dramatists of this rank write of their particular period, but with a consciousness that transcends it.

title: Is Hollywood Making the Wrong Remakes?; Wrong Remakes?
description: From King Kong to A Star Is Born, the film market is being flooded with overblown remakes, most of which are about as valid and necessary as it would be for Tatum O'Neal to have a facelift.

title: BRIDGE
description: The surprising and dramatic events in Houston last month had two consequences for the players not involved in the withdrawal of Dr. Richard Katz and Larry Cohen. The team that was losing suddenly became a winner, and the team that was winning not only lost its chance to compete in the world championship but was left in a fragmented state for future tournaments.

title: Port Concern Said to Admit Fraud
description: The officers of a waterfront containerrepair company have admitted that they concealed from the Waterfront Commission that more than $250,000 charged as business expenses by the concern was actually taken by them for personal use and for unrelated investments in Miami, according to the commission.

title: Citywide Hunt Is On For Three Escapees From Rikers Island
Walker Defeats O'Shaughnessy In 3:40.2 for 1,500 at Garden
description: First came the strength. Then the power. And finally, John Walker delivered the decisive kick that again demonstrated why he holds the Olympic gold medal at 1,500 meters and the world record in the mile.

title: Program at Brooklyn Museum Will Mark Black History Month
description: The Brooklyn Museum begins its celebration of Black History Month today with a threepart program dealing with Weeksville, a black community in Brooklyn from 1825 to 1875.

title: CosmosNew Star at the Stadium
description: BECAUSE New Jersey has the best soccer facility in the metropolitan area, it has the Cosmos, a team with high aspirations in the world's most popular sport.

title: Holy Cross 112, Boston College 92
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Feb. 12 (UPI)Ronnie Perry, a freshman, dropped in 29 points and four other Crusaders scored in double figures today to power Holy Cross over Boston College, 11292.

title: Article 2  No Title
Yvonne M. Esposito Is Fiancee of Dr. Patrick McGrath
description: Mr. and Mrs. Vincent Esposito of North Haven, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Yvonne Maria Esposito, to Dr. Patrick J. McGrath of New York. The future bridegroom is a secondyear resident at the New York State Psychiatric Institute at the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center, where his fiance is an enterostomalnursing specialist. The couple plan to be married April 29.

title: House Budgets Cut In Move Reflecting Reduced Oversight
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12Several House committees have reduced their budgets for the first time within memory in response to what they regard as public pressure to reduce the cost of Government.

title: TRUST INQUIRY FACED BY RECORD CONCERNS
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 12The nation's $2billionayear recorded music industry, already troubled by rising costs, disconcerting demographic trends and new Goverment scrutiny of socalled payola, faces a major Federal investigation of alleged antitrust activity.

title: Carter's Style as President Has Drawn Mixed Reviews
description: JEFFERSON, Iowa, Feb. 12Jimmy Carter's public performance as President, which so far has ranged from amiably informal to downright folksy, is getting some mixed reviews from his constituents out in the country.

title: An Introductory Course
description: A group of Long Island gamblers are betting $35 each that a comprehensive course in casino gambling will improve their odds at winning at games of chance, or at least cut their losses.

title: A Victory for Fair Housing
description: FAIRHOUSING advocates in Bergen County have achieved what they contend is another major victory in their drive to end racial discrimination in housing.

title: Putting Transport Into a New Gear
Mary Stephenson Makes Piano Debut
description: Mary Elizabeth Stephenson, a pianist trained at the Juilliard School, made her debut at Carnegie Recital Hall on Tuesday night as a winner of the Concert Artists Guild auditions. Her program consisted of four Scarlatti sonatas, Franck's Prelude, Chorale and Fugue, Berg's Sonata, Debussy's Children's Corner and Chopin's Scherzo in Csharp minor.

title: Adding Up The Grasso Budget
Chris Evert Reaches Final on 62, 61 Rout
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 12 (AP)Chris Evert defeated Betty Stove, 62, 61, tonight and reached the final of this $100,000 Virginia Slims tournament. She will meet Margaret Court tomorrow.

title: Dartmouth 59, Yale 58
description: HANOVER, N. H., Feb. 12 (AP)Larry Cubas scored 10 points in the last 90 seconds, including a 15foot jump shot at the buzzer, in lifting. Dartmouth to a 5958 Ivy League victory over Yale tonight.

title: ART
description: PRINTS have become such suave sophisticated creatures these days that it is dittiLtui to recognize them simply as prints. In older times a print was easily identified as an etching or a lithograph.

title: The Makers Were Locked In on a Number of Programs, but Spending Was the Gray Area
description: ALBANYPutting together a government budget is much like making a mosaic, or doing a Jigsaw puzzle. During a moment of madness, Peter C. Goldmark, New York State's Budget Director, compared this year's effort with the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel. People who work 18 hours a day for long periods often say things like that.

title: Aged Play Key Role In Blood Program
F.B.I. SEEKS TO DETERMINE HOW TIMES GOT REPORT
description: MIAMI, Feb. 12The Federal Bureau of Investigation has begun an investigation, both here and in Washington, to determine how a copy at a Federal grand jury report in Miami reached the hands of Seymour M. Hersh, a reporter for The New York Times, which disclosed parts of it Jan. 6.

title: From Robe to Black Tie, Dior's Man Has His Day
description: Who are some of the best known men's fashion designers? Pierre Cardin, Yves Saint Laurent, Bill Blass. Christian Dior. John Weitz.

title: Mr. Carter Is Offering Only a Fraction of the Mayors Demands
description: WASHINGTONProbably none of the supplicants in line when the Federal Treasury reopened under new management were hungrier or leaner than the nation's big cities. After eight years of what they saw as callous neglect at the hands of two Republican presidents, urban leaders have high hopes that the new Democratic Administration will rescue them from the precipice of decay, bankruptcy and joblessness.

title: Bayi Runs a 3:57.2 Mile; Wilson Ties Mark in 500
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Feb. 12 (AP)Filbert Bayi turned in the first sub4minute mile in the 17 years of the MasonDixon games tonight as he won easily in 3 minutes 57.2 seconds.

title: Cave Vandalism Outlawed
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 12 (UPI)The Georgia Senate has voted to outlaw vandalism in caves. The bill makes it a misdemeanor to crack or break off rock formations, carve or write upon cave surfaces, burn or otherwise mark any cave or natural material therein without the property owner's permission.

title: How Not to Save in Bottling
description: F. D. WHARTON JR., in Returnable Problems [Opinion Page, Jan. 30], wants the consumer to believe that wastefulness is better than conservation.

title: LETTER FROM WESLEYAN
description: SHORTLY after becoming editor of the campus newspaper at Wesleyan University  the first woman to hold that position  I had a deficit budget dumped in my lap. I then had to explain to the five students in charge of distributing money to campus organizations why the newspaper needed additional funds. At the time, I was the only woman in the roam. After I was asked about the details of the budget, one of my interrogators thought he had solved the financial predicament. Well, he suggested, why don't you run a bake sale?

title: THEATER
description: THIS is the story of two professional theatrical companies, one in Stamford, the other in Mamaroneck. Both raised their curtains in the fall of 1975, and both exist in areas of some affluence. The Connecticut company is already expanding to a second theater, while the Westchester company still rents space and is approaching the close of its second season proudly anticipating a profit that is less than the price of an orchestra seat for a Broadway musical.

title: Suffolk Racing Canceled
description: BOSTON, Feb. 12 (AP)Thaw conditions and a resulting muddy track forced the cancellation of racing today at Suffolk Downs. Track officials said the decision was made following a meeting with trainers, jockeys and management. Racing was expected to resume tomorrow with nine races at the 1:15 P.M. post.

title: The Big Three Post Record Profits, but Run Into Foul Weather
description: The General Motors Corporation reported record earnings of $2.9 billion last week for 1976, but the results came as no surprise and new highs are also expected from G.M.'s major competitors, Ford and Chrysler.

title: Club in ew Orleans Apologizes to Young
description: NEW ORLEANS, Feb. 12The president of International House, World Trade Center in New Orleans, has sent a telegram of apology to Andrew Young, United States representative to The United Nations, for an incident that has set off a controversy in the black and white communities here and has been widely regarded as a racial insult to Mr. Young.

title: India's Crown Prince
description: NEW DELHI. For as long as anyone could remember, a warren of hovels and tiny shops squatted on the steps of the Great Mosque of Delhi. Government officials would often fret about the eyesore; it really ought to be cleaned up, they would sigh. But no one did anything about it. After all, there were people involved.

title: Television This Week
description: Today

title: 30 Feared Drowned in Tanzania
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, Feb. 12 (UPI)A boat carrying passengers from one village to another capsized in Lake Tanganyika yesterday and more than 30 persons are feared drowned, the government news agency said today.

title: SYRACUSE FILES SUIT AGAINST INQUIRY COST
description: SYRACUSE, Feb. 12Onondaga County's chief legal officer has filed a suit in State Supreme Court challenging Governor Carey's decision to have the county repay more than $1. million for a state investigation of alleged political corruption in the county.

title: Rocky in the Movie: Yesterday's Fighter?; Stronger and Smarter
description: There comes a time in each of our lives when we must take a stand against what we feel is unjust, and defend what we believe is right. For me, that time is now,

title: DINING OUT
description: IT'S not a chateau, but Le Chateau probably comes closer to one than most restaurants in America that bear that name. The mansion South Salem was built soon after the turn the century, a gift from J. P. Morgan to the minister of his church. As a period piece, the stoneandtimber structure would almost be worth a visit regardless of the food.

title: Correction
description: In The Review of Feb. 6 the name of a former director of the Central Intelligence Agency was incorrectly given. The correct name is Gen. Walter Bedell Smith. The article also incorrectly implied that General Smith, who was director from 1950 to 1953, was the sole guiding architect of the agency in its formative years.

title: 140 New York City School Custodians Are Found to Earn More Than the $31,000 Maximum Permitted
EXPERTS GIVE ADVICE ON BLOOD PRESSURE
description: Many doctors are too quick to prescribe drugs to treat patients who are found to have mild high blood pressure, experts have told a meeting at the New York Academy of Science.

title: Lilco's Winter of Little Discontent
description: THE natural gas shortage, which together with the record cold has had a devastating economic impact on the Northeast in general and New York in particular, has been relatively mild on the Island.

title: U.S. Supreme Court Asked to Rule On Concerns and Double Jeopardy
description: The United States Supreme Court has been asked to determine whether the Fifth Amendment guarantee against double jeopardy applies to corporations as well as to individuals.

title: HOME CLINIC
How Wall Street Gauges Inflation
Stony Brook's Adams Analyst
description: PROFESSOR PETER SHAW, the author of The Character of John Adams,, a highly acclaimed recent psychological biography of America's second President, is an impressive representative of the kind of academic interdisciplinarianism he sometimes likes to poke fun at.

title: Coloradan Captures CrossCountry Title
description: SAN DIEGO, Feb. 12 (AP)Mark Spilsbury, a freshman at the University of Cplorado, broke away on the last mile to capture the national junior crosscountry championship of the Amateur Athletic Union today. The race was run on the 7,000meter course of the University of California, San Diego.

title: Childhood Dramas Recapture The Aura of Another Time
description: One summer morning when I was about 10, a morning shining with the promise of long walks and great adventures, of books to be read and jacks to be played, I woke up early, before anybody else was up. I tiptoed into the kitchen and cut myself an orange to eat for breakfast. I walked out onto the porch, the sun streaming in, the orange the most purely delicious thing I had ever tasted, and I promised myself that no matter what, no matter how old I ever got, no matter what ever happened to me, I would always remember the way that orange tasted and the way I felt that minute.

title: Jane deButts Plans Nuptials
Harvard 68, Brown 64
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.Paced by four men in double figures, Harvard broke a 10game losing streak tonight with a 6864 victory over Brown.

title: My Life Of Absurdity
description: My Life of Absurdity is veteran novelist Chester Himes's 19th book and the second volume of a singularly poignant autobiography. He began writing and publishing fiction while serving eight years for armed robbery at Ohio State Penitentiary. By the time he was paroled in 1936, the 27yearold Himes was publishing short stories in black magazines and contributing rather regularly to Esquire.

title: Jazz PopA Failed Art Music Makes Good
description: Sure I still love to play jazz, says George Benson, a guitarist with jazz roots and a jazzderived style whose last album sold almost twomillion copies. I feel good when I'm playing it, and I feel good after I've played it. I just wish there was an audience for it. The fact is, the people who like regular jazz won't come out and patronize it, and they won't buy a lot of records. And anyway, when I do make a regular jazz record, the companies put it on the shelf. I did a date With Benny Goodman more than a year ago and we were swinging. What happened to it? All that material will come out sometime, but probably not in time to do me any good.

title: Rafiki Is Chosen Best At Ridgeback Specialty
description: Ch. Rutan Mpenzi Rafikios Gera surpassed 96 other Rhodesian ridgebacks for bestofbreed honors yesterday at the 38th national specialty in the Skyline Motor Inn. Ruth Blazej of Schaumburg, a Chicago suburb, the breederownerhandler, said the dog's lucky number was 7. He has always won when there was a No. 7 and he was No. 75 today.

title: STAMPS
description: In its first commemorative issue of the year, the United Nations is taking philatelic note of its most recent specialized agency, an organization established to protect and spur the output of man's intellect, thought, creativity and ingenuity.

title: The Skiing Clinic:
description: Skiing's population in the United States is said to be 5 to 6 million. Many persons close to the industry say a major reason the number is not greater is that the nonskier erroneously believes that shopping for the proper clothing and equipment is too compli cated.

title: The Region
description: Governor Ella T. Grasso has offered Connecticut a budget less austere than the spending programs proposed by neighboring states. While New York and New Jersey call for a halt or reductions in welfare and other social programs, Mrs. Grasso has asked for slight increases.

title: A Ray of Energy Hope
Gas Loss May Cut State's Tax Income
description: THE LOSS of a week of naturalgas supplies to many of the state's major industries and commercial establishments during the recent deep freeze will run into millions of dollars.

title: Nancy Ann Motzkin Engaged to Lawyer
description: Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Motzkin of Kingston, N. Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter. Nancy Ann Motzldn, to Richard J. Schulman, son of Doris Schulman Lee of Scarsdale, N. Y., and the late Dr. N. Jerome Schulman, an obstetrician and gynecologist in New Rochelle, N. Y.

title: Emme Levin Plans Nuptials for June
description: Emme Elizabeth Levin, who is in the management training program of the Chemical Bank, plans to he married in June to Jonathan Thorndike Deland. who is in his first year at the Columbia University College of Physicians and Surgeons.

title: Picture Credits
description: 1JULIAN ALLEN

title: Cures for Knocks in Home Heating Systems
description: When a banging, hammering, clanging or squeaking noise occurs repeatedly in a hot water or steam heating system, one of the first things the homeowner should do is to try and localize the noise  that is, try to figure out where the noise originates or where it is loudest. This is admittedly not always easy, but every effort should be made to listen in different parts of the house and basement. Sometimes is possible to feel exposed pipes in different locations to see if a vibration Drawings above show how to correct knocking sound in steam radiator.

title: Late TV Listings
description: 9:30 A.M. (Channel 4) Here and Now: Dr. Robert Christen, president, New York City Board of Education.

title: Spain Pursuing a Kidnapping Band
description: MADRID. Feb. 12The police today were reported to be pursuing the remnants of an obscure terrorist band after liberating yesterday two prominent rightists the band had held in separate apartments in Madrid.

title: The World
description: LAGOS, NigeriaNigeria is the Brazil of black Africathe biggest, richest, most powerful nation. With a population of between 70 and 80 million people, one out of every four Africans south of the Sahara is a Nigerian. Nigeria's gross domestic productthe sum of all goods and services produced at homereached 827 billion last year, more than all of the rest of black Africa combined, and next year it will probably surpass that of South Africa

title: The showdown at ABC News
description: Sitting in his seventhfloor office at the ABC News Center on West 66th street. Harry Reasoner offers a visitor fresh pineapple slices and a few observations about his rumored conflict with coanchor Barbara Walters.

title: When the Big Thaw Comes
description: Eventually the Big Thaw will come, and whether It marks the end of this difficult winter or not it will have the drama of eons in it. One day the land will lie white and silent under ice and snow, winterbound. Then awarm wind will come. Temperatures will relax. The icy grip will begin to ease. Water, the concerted melt of all the hillsides, will begin to flow. You will hear it You will see it in the mist over the drifts. You will witness, on a minor scale, what happened when the big glaciers began to melt back. This winter's own Ice Age will begin to give way to inevitable spring.

title: A Hot Line for Battered Wives
description: SOMEWHERE out there, beyond the manicured lawns, inside the ranch houses and colonials, middleclass families with marital problems are crossing the barrier against violence.

title: CARTER TO INCREASE SPENDING ON DEFENSE BUT CUT FORD BUDGET
description: PLAINS, Ga., Feb. 12President Carter said today that he would cut the level of defense spending recommended by President Ford in January but that the revised budget would still contain a substantial increase over the previous fiscal year.

title: Miss Post Leads by Shot On 70 for 140 at Miami
description: MIAMI, Feb. 12 (AP)Sandra Post, trying to end a twoyear victory drought, shot her second straight twounderpar 70 and took a onestroke lead today after two rounds in a $50,000 Ladies Professional Golf Association tournament

title: Arminda Canteros, Pianist, in Recital
If Other Nations Change, They'll Do So on Their Own
description: WASHINGTONPresident Carter was saying the obvious last week when he noted his inability to do much more than complain about the treatment of political dissidents in the Soviet Union. I can't go in with armed forces and try to change the internal mechanism of the Soviet Government, he said.

title: The Bookseller
description: Nat Pine, the bookseller, is a small darling man of 84, of enormous dignity and serenity and quiet and vigor (one would take him for no more than 65) whose voice sounds like the dry rustling of good paper and the turning of pages.

title: Films
description: ANTHOLOGY FILM ARCHIVES  Films from the collection. 80 Wooster St. (2260010)

title: GALLERY VIEW
description: Manhattan Island is just bulging with museums, but it is a waste of time to go rooting among them for an orderly and comprehensive survey of American painting from the 17th century to the present day. There is no one building, in other words, which is to American painting what me Tate Gallery in London is to British painting of all periods, or what the Loi, vre is to French painting from the earliest times until the onset of Impressionism.

title: LandUse LawConfusion Reigns
description: STATE and local officials are mulling over the legality of zoning regulations in the handful of communities in each of New Jersey's 21 counties that have failed to comply with the Municipal Land Use Law that went into effect on Feb. 1.

title: Hearings by Council Slated This Week
description: The following public hearings will be held by New York City Council committers this week:

title: UConn 70, Vermont 64
description: STORRS, Conn., Feb. 12 (AP)Tony Hanson scored 8 points and Joe Whelton added 6 in the last 9 minutes of play as Connecticut beat Vermont today, 7064. The Huskies improved their record to 138, while Vermont fell to 514.

title: Lisa Mirabile Is Engaged to Jerry DiChiara
description: Lisa Mirabile, an assistant librarian for the New York law firm of Hughes, Hubbard & Reed, plans to be married in June to Jerry DiChiara, a lawyer with the Legal Aid Society in Brooklyn.

title: WAR CRIME BLAME WEIGHED IN GERMANY
description: BONN, Feb. 9Three decades after World War II, West German and American scholars here have begun taking ma new look at the issue of war crimes and are asserting that the United States and the Western allies shire moral responsibility for some of the worst atrocities.

title: The Golden Door
description: Legend has it that New York City was the golden door to the land of opportunity, that millions of poor European immigrants worked their way into the middle class thanks to the city's booming economy and its free schools. In recent years, the legend has come increasingly under attack, largely from Marxistoriented historians who contend that oppression was more characteristic of the urban industrial economy than was opportunity.

title: FOOD
Leaders of Cyprus To Hold New Talks
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Sunday, Feb. 13Greek and Turkish Cypriot leaders announced tonight that negotiations would resume next month over the future of this divided Mediterranean island.

title: TV as a Tool for the Artist
description: BAYVILLE FOR a long time the typewriter must have sat around doing nothing, until people finally figured out what to do with it. Well, that's where we're at with video. But now we're learning.

title: INTERVIEW
description: THE connection is, really, totally nonpolitical, which is perhaps the most significan aspect of the appointment. I was not active In the campaign. I had not met Mr. Carter before his election.

title: LETTER FROM PRINCETON
description: HAS humor at Princeton gone the way of streaking, gray flannel suits and goldfish swallowing? The Princeton experience has been stern this year, and an observer might give a stern. affirmative answer. Locked in lonely library carrels until late at night, the seniors are writing their theses. Underclassmen hidden behind the walls of stern Gothic buildingt are bent over their books, intent on success, success and more success.

title: Sheets by Design
description: The January white sales, which of late have been awash with color and patterns, are past. Tomorrow starts the parade of new sheet and towel promotions, and the giant textile producers are relying on 30 celebrity names, mostly drawn from the fashion world, to merchandise their products.

title: FifteenYearOld Wins Mount Beacon Ski Jump
description: BEAR MOUNTAIN, N.Y., Feb. 12Mark Levasseur, a 15yearold St. John's High School athlete from Shrewsbury, Mass., won the Mount Beacon ski jumping tournament today.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Like Sappho
Ann Martin Fiancee Of Barry W. Ridings
description: Mr. and Mrs. Alan R. Martin Jr. of Old Greenwich. Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Ann Kennedy Martin, to Barry William Ridings. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Lester W. Ridings of Cedar Grove and Lavalette N.J.

title: The World
description: Rhodesia's Guerrilla War Goes On

title: What's oing in LOUISIANA
description: AMBIENCEA mix of Mediterranean, Caribbean and African cultures enriches Neal Orleans, but it extends as well far into the Louisiana countryside, past Baton Rouge into the western prairieland, northward into the piney hills and the old French trading post of Natchitoches. It is expressed in the architecture, cooking and speech and in the temperament of the people. The preferred season for touring: springtime, which comes early to Louisiana with a profusion of flowersazaleas, iris, daisies and wisteriaand, best of all, the ripening of strawberries.

title: Volkswagen Gives a Raise
description: WOLFSBURG, West Germany, Feb. 12 (Reuters)The 98,000 workers in Volkswagen's six factoties in West Germany will receive a pay increase of 6.9 percent this year, a company spokesman said here today. He said that the raise, in a settlement between Volkswagen and the West German Metal Union, would be retroactive to Feb. 1.

title: Miss Beaven in Final
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Feb. 12 (UPI)Tiny 20yearold Yvonne Vermaak of South Africa made the final of the $20,000 Avon Futures women's tennis tournament today with a 64, 75 triumph over Kathy Harter of Seal Beach, Calif.

title: Soaring Costs, Shrinking Homes
description: With most of the nation's people concentrated in sprawling, increasingly urbanized regional centers, questions of highdensity living are generating intense interest. This is the fourth in a series of articles exploring the subject.

title: PHOTOGRAPHY VIEW
description: A clever picture editor could make a gruesomely fascinating book out of the new photographs by Mark Cohen on view at Castelli Graphics, 4 East 77th Street, through Feb. 26. The subject of the book would be smalltown American lifemore specifically, life in WilkesBarre and the nearby coalmining towns of northeastern Pennsylvania and the tone would be menacing, apocalyptic and highly critical of the failure of the American dream to live up to expectations.

title: Peggy Elizabeth Patterson Is Married To Edward Van V. Sands Jr., a Banker
The Ideology of Dracula
description: MUNICHOf the millions of readers familiar with Bram Stoker's Dracula, published eighty years ago, the majority are unaware that the famous bloodsucking Transylvanian vampire depicted in the novel was theoretically based on a real historical figure who bore the unpleasant name of Vlad the Impaler.

title: Touring
Wood, Field and Stream: Indoor Angling in Ice Shanty
description: LYME, N. H.With more living space than a 25foot cabin cruiser provides, and at far less expense, one can spend his spare hours all winter fishing the lakes and the ponds of northern New England.

title: GiscardChirac Rivalry Becoming Major Event in French Political Life
description: PARIS, Feb. 12The struggle between President Valry Giscard d'Estaing and former Prime Minister Jacques Chirac for eventual control of the rightcenter in national politics has become one of the maior, possibly pivotal, political events of the 19yearold Fifth Republic.

title: DOING A NUMBER ON WORDS
ARCHITECTURE VIEW
description: The subject of this column two weeks ago was a striking new addition to an important college museumthe wing designed by Venturi and Rauch for the Allen Memorial Art Museum at Oberlin, Ohio. What one notices particularly, beyond the exceptional nature of the solution and the collection, is the high level of cultural sensibility and arts expertise that exists in the United States todaynot just in the big cities, but right across the country.

title: Alarich Georg Fenyves Fiance of Wendy Lindner
A Frenetic Visit to Bangkok
description: At 11 o'clock on a Sunday night, Qantas Flight 1 from Sydney and Singapore is a little early into Don Muang Airport. Bangkok immigration formalities are swift and friendly and. bythe time they are over, luggage is waitingbut not for me. The man from Qantas speaks no English, but he understands brown American Tourister better than the tall, multilingual ground hostess from Thai International, who thinks I am some kind of racist looking for a missing passenger. While she reconfirms my onward flight for two nights later, he makes a fruitless search, Then he, she and I start collaborating upon a Property Irregularity Report in English.

title: New Information Offered In Wilmington 10 Case
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Feb. 12 (UPI)After five years of silence, a Morristown, N. J., minister and a Philadelphia social worker have offered information contradicting testimony that helped send the. Wilmington Ten to jail in 1972.

title: Subdivisions for Sharing Privately
description: LYNN and Carl Swanson, a young couple with small children, rent a house on Woodhollow Lane in New Rochelle. Even though the house is not exactly what we have in mind, we want what Bayberry has to offer, says Mrs. Swanson.

title: Medical Care And Bargains
description: THAT people seek a bargain is an axiom of human psychology. The enormous popularity of sales in supermarkets, automobile showrooms and department stores attests to a cherished hope that quality merchandise can be had at a discount. And so it appears with medical care, as we witnessed in a glowing description of the Rutgers Community Health Plan (Jan. 2).

title: The Multilingual Classroom
ITALY ASKED TO USE TROOPS TO SEAL POLLUTED REGION
description: MILAN, Feb. 12 (Reuters)The Italian Government was asked today to use troops to stop people from returning to their homes in the Seveso region after a new outbreak of skin ailments, believed to have been caused by the leaking of a poison chemical last July.

title: The Mother of Us All Has Come to Stay
description: The Mother of Us All is 30 years old next month, and listening to the opera's first complete recording, on New World Records (NW 288/9), both words and music sound as fresh and vital as when they were written. Since its first production at Columbia University in 1947, this second operatic collaboration between Virgil Thomson and Gertrude Stein has received over 1,000 performances all over the countrya remarkable figure for any postwar opera, let alone an American one, and tangible proof of the work's continuing appeal and staying power.

The Nation
description: House Ethics Panel Taking Up Korea Affair

title: For Valentine's Day
description: I have always been firmly on the side of love letters. I enjoy writing them, and I have no objection to receiving them, either. There is also the fact that anyone can write a love letter and almost everybody has; one should beware those who boast of having never written such a thing, for like the similar boast of never having fallen in love, there is either something missing somewhere or else the boaster is subtly begging to be roused from his her frozen state of inanition.

title: A Garden Festival: Dogs in Paintings And the Real Thing
Calling Home From the Boat
description: THE seacoasts of the country boast a highly specialized communication service provided by the Bell Telephone Systemmarine radiotelephone service. And since the waters off the Island are among the country's busiest areas for merchant shipping and pleasure boating, one of the largest marine telephone establishments is maintained at Hempstead by the New York Telephone Company.

title: Israeli women More feminine than feminist

Acknowledging History's Touch
description: IN November 1970, the New Jersey Legislature directed the setting up of a program to register historic sites in the state. Since then, 410 homes, parks, districts, schoolhouses,lighthouses and even a couple of boats have been found to be meaningful enough to be declared historic and given a limited measure of protection from being demolished.

title: LETTERS TO THE LONG ISLAND EDITOR
description: Joe Wyker [An Iron Horse in the asement, Jan. 2] has built a locomotive and tender, not a twocar train as the writer says. A train is a locomotive and a connected series of cars with identification numbers and markers (flags or lights) in place. Further, doubt that Mr. Wyker made up the sale himself if he expects to run his locomotive on the L.I.L.S. tracks. He probably built the engine to his own ideas, for it looks like a freelance Atlantic (4.40), nut copied from any actual railroad engine.

title: Indoor Greenery And Fuel Economy Can Be Compatible
description: There is good news to warm an indoor gardeners heart in these frigid winter days. A vast assortment of house plants will thrive at fuelsaving temperatures of 50 degrees.

description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Feb. 12 (AP)About a dozen demonstrators who favor nuclear power stormed the scene of a speech here last night by Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate.

description: HOUSE PLANT SHOW: Exhibition on plant care, culture and selection; 11 A.M. to 2 P M., conservatory showroom, Brooklyn Botanic Garden, 1,000 Washington Avenue, Brooklyn (Admission 50 cents for nonmembers, 25 cents for members.

title: Garden Display of Art Works on Dogs Adds Color to Westminster's 101st Show
description: Prominent people in the show world not only collect good dogs but also outstanding works of art. The nation's first largescale exhibit of canine art. designed to highlight the annual Westminster Kennel Club show tomorrow and Tuesday at Madison Square Garden, is on display through Thursday at the Garden's National Art Museum of Sport. The emphasis is on dogs dating to the 16th Century in oils, water colors, wood carving, bronze and porcelain.

title: Citibank Uses Minis to Cut Maxi Tasks Into Little Packages
description: On a corner stand in the carpeted office of Robert B. White in the vast Park Avenue headquarters ofCitibank sits the terminal of an experimental electronic mail system that is a key element in the bank's war on paperwork

description: PLEASE don't refer to the University of Bridgeport as the place where P. T. Barnum once houed his circto. With due respect to Mr. Barnum, who was once the Mayor of Bridgeport, students at the university feel the reference is irrelevant.

title: Canadiens 8, Bruins 3
description: MONTREAL, Feb. 12 (AP)Bob Gainey scored twice, once on a shorthanded goal to start the scoring, and Jacques Lemaire added a pair of late goals as the Montreal Canadiens whipped the Boston Bruins, 83, in an N.H.L. game tonight.

description: Radio station WBAIFM remained off the air yesterday in a dispute between the management and the largely volunteer staff over unionization and proposed program changes to widen the diminishing audience of the listenersponsored station.

description: CHICAGOJ. Ira Harris is, simply, diffrent.At an age when most executives are grateful to have climbed to the middle of the ladder in their work, the 38yearold Mr. Harris is at the top.

description: St. John's, led by George Johnson and Glen Williams used its patience, persistence, rebounding and superior shooting last night in defeating Fordham, 8363, before 3,258 at the Rose Hill gymnasium. It was the Rams final home game of the season.

description: I was disgusted, but not surprised, by the decision of Judge Edward Weinfeld in the case of a suit concerning the rights of five black children trapped in the deadend system of foster care (Jan. 21).

description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12Behind the debate here over who should run the United. States Disarmament Agency and try to negotiate a strategic arms agreement with the Soviet Union lies a much deeper philosophical conflict about human character and the possibility of organizing a more cooperative world.

title: 4 DEFENDANTS KEEP TEAMSTERFUND JOBS
Merrythought and Running Tide Win Southern Ocean Yacht Race
description: MIAMI, Feb. 12 (AP)Jack King of Annapolis, Md. and Albert Van Metre of Fort Lauderdale, Fla., steered their yachts to the best unofficial times in their divisions today in the Ocean Triangle, the third event on the circuit of the Southern Ocean Racine Conference.

title: Future Events
description: Feb. 16Chekhov's The Cherry Orchard will be shown at the Vivian Beaumont Theater in Lincoln Center, to rebuild the Delacorte Theater, that summer place in Central Park. What skims off goes to Ellen Stewart's La Mama E.T.C., the Off Off Broadway experimental theater club. The play, to rebuild the Delacorte Theater, that night at the Beaumont, is produced by Joseph Papp of the New York Shakespeare Festival, which put plays on at the Delacorte at its start. Mr. Papp, Ellen Stewart and the cast of The Cherry Orchard will raise a glass of champagne with guests in the Beaumont's lobby after the performance. Dress is black tie, any tie, no tie. Tickets: $50 from William Hicks (6771750).

title: Rx for the State's Ailing G.O.P.
description: IN terms of national electoral politics, the most serious problem facing Republicans is that there are so few of them. Only 18 percent of the electorate are registered party members. What we have witnessed in the past few years is an increasing proportion of the population, the independents, who do not affiliate with either party but who, when push comes to shove, vote Democratic.

title: Newspaper Carrier in California Donates $10 to Help the Neediest
description: Ned Roscoe has a newspaper route in Walnut Creek, a California community across the bay from San Francisco, and he has been reading about the 65th annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

description: WHLE there are problems and complaints, most health officials would agree that the southewestern part of this state enjoys one of the best health and hospital delivery systems in the country.

title: More Rabid Bats Are Reported In the Northeast, Scientists Say
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 12 (AP)An unusual, but not alarming concentmton of rabies in bats has been reported in the Northeast, the national Center for Disease Control says.

title: San Diego's Wild Animal Park: Where People Come Second
description: Wild animal habitats where lions skulk and baboons clamor for center stage around the visitor's airconditioned car have been taking the country by storm. But in the notsowild San Pasqual Valley, some 30 miles north of San Diego. Calif., there is another kind of animal world. Its 2,000 denizens live more as they do in their native Africa, Asia or Australia, free to roam their multiacre enclosures, forage for food among the natural growth or eat food provided by keepers. They mate, produce young and eventually die in a relatively stressfree environment, where only natural predatorscheetahs, lions, tigersare kept isolated.

title: Men at the Top, Public and Private
description: For many business leaders, Washington symbolizes the glory, while the Internal Revenue Service represents the Government's power to strip them of profits. both corporate and personal.

title: President Holds the Line on Westway as Congressman Makes Plea
WALDHEIM FINISHES MIDDLE EAST TALKS
description: CARIO, Feb. 12Secretary General Kurt Waldheim of the United Nations left the Middle East today after a nineday tour during which Israel and its Arab foes spelled out totally opposing positions on the key issue of Palestinian participation in a Geneva peace conference.

title: TV VIEW
description: Feisty is the word for In Search of the Real America, a sixpart monthly public affairs series that starts its run on Channel 13 Tuesday night at 9 o'clock. The feistiness belongs to Ben J. Wattenberg, the creator and narrator of the halfhour programs. who mounts his thesis as though it were a motor scooter and his mustache were the handlebars: Vr000m. According to Mr. Wattenberg, things in America are just peachy keen, thank you, and he's tired of hearing otherwise from what he calls the Chorus of Failure and Guilt.

title: The Joys and Agony Of a College Bicker
description: WITH the regularity of birds flying South, flocks of Princeton sophomores migrated to seven selective eating clubs housed in fraternitylike buildings to engage in the annual pledging process known as bicker.

title: ISRAEL INTENSIFIES SINAI SETTLEMENTS
description: YAMIT, IsraeliOccupied SinaiIsraelis have quietly extended their national watersupply network into this corner of Sinai, which they have been populating to create a security belt.

title: The Hope Collection
description: Some golfers collect scorecards or bag tags or hats or sweaters. Bob Hope collects Presidents. He has played with President Eisenhower, President Kennedy, President Johnson, President Nixon and President Ford. And this past week Gerald R. Ford, now the nation's most famous 18handicap golfer, competed in the Bob Hope Desert Classic as a sequel to his adventures with Arnold Palmer in the Bing Crosby National ProAm tournament. He also is scheduled to play in the pro. ams at the Jackie Gleason Inverrary Classic, at the Byron Nelson Classic and the Hall of Fame open, where he will be the honorary chairman. Gerald Ford might appear at more tournaments this year than Jack Nicklaus.

title: WBAI Dispute Continues
description: Representatives of the staff and management of radio station WBAIFM met yesterday in an unsuccessful effort to resolve aspects of a dispute over unionization and proposed changes in programming that have kept the station off the air for two days. Spokesmen for the staff, which is largely made up of volunteers, said members of a union coordinating committee had told management officials that they would negotiate the dispute only if the station was allowed to return to the air and if the union was recognized as a ??rgaining agent.

title: Dora IV, Imp Share Honors In Yacht Race
description: MIAMI, Feb. 13Dora IV, the 61foot sloop owned by Ted Turner of Atlanta, and Imp, a 40footer, owned by Dave Allen of San Francisco, shared honors in the 176nauticalmile third race of the Southern Ocean Racing Conference. Dora won overall honors in Division I, and Imp placed first in Division II in the race sponsored by the Coral Reef Yacht Club in Miami.

title: SONYA DEANIN, 80, DEAD
description: Sonya Deanin,.long active in the Labor Zionist movement and chairman of the Herzliah Hebrew Teachers InstituteJewish Teachers Seminary at 69 Bank Street, died Saturday at MidIsland Hospital in Bethpage, L.I. She was 80 years old and lived at 29 Langdon Road, Farmingdale. L. I.

title: From the Police Blotter:
description: Two men were shct yesterday morning, one fatally, by an unidentified assailant in a hallway at 450 West 147th Street. The dead man was identified as Collins Farlington, 23 years old, and the wounded man as Philip Pctire, 25. No addresses were Oven for either.... Fakhri Salim, owner of a grocery store at 3619 28th Avenue, Astdria, Queens, reportedly shot one of two men wearing ski masks who tried to hold him up at his store Saturday. The wounded man, who was not identified, was taken to Elmhurst General Hospital with a bullet wound in his head. The second man escaped.... A Bronx grocer robbed only last week and shot more than a year ago in his store at 1106 East 216th Street in Williamsbridge was shot to death during an apparent robbery attempt. He was identified as Cornelius Mitchell, 44.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: An article in The Times on Friday announcing a planned computerization of the processing of Medicaid claims and billings incorrectly quoted a state official as having said that New York City stood to realize 70 percent or an estimated $250 million annual saving. The actual proportion would be 25 percent.

title: Yonkers
CLEANUP OF OIL SPILL HELD 10% EFFECTIVE
description: A Federal environment monitor estimated yesterday that cleanup efforts led by the United States Coast Guard would probably not pick up more than 10 percent of 420,000 gallons of oil spilled 10 days ago. into the Hudson River by a grounded barge north of Bear Mountain.

title: Noteholders Told To Await Guideline On Court Decision
description: The owners of shortterm New York City notes who gathered in a ballroom of the George Washington Hotel for advice yesterday were told to keep your notes in your safe deposit boxes until the meaning of the State Court of Appeals decision invalidating a moratorium on payment of the notes became clear.

title: F.D.A. Imposes Regulations On Sale of Hearing Aids
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13 (UPI)Hearing aids in most cases may not be sold over the counter after Aug. 14 except to buyers who have been examined by a doctor, the Food and Drug Administration announced today.

description: SALINAS, Calif., Feb. 13 (AP)Almost three years ago, Inez Garcia hunted down and shot to death a 300pound man who ?? said had held her down while another man raped her.

title: PANEL FINDS A NEED FOR OLDTIME FARMS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13A large part of American agriculture should turn back the clock to a time when farming was less dependent on petroleumbased energy so as to end food price inflation and help solve other social and economic problems, a study sponsored by several leading foundations proposed today.

description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., Feb. 13 (AP)The Illinois Senate has spent four weeks, 179 ballots, and $36,000 in taxpayers money trying to elect a new Senate president. It has not succeeded.

description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 13 (Reuters) The new United States Ambassador to Lebanon, Richard B. Parker, arrived in Beirut today. Mr. Parker, a career diplomat and Middle East specialist, said of the 19 months of fighting in Lebanon: Lebanon had descended into chaos and came back. Now is the time for reconciliation and reconstruction.

description: Frank Trief, 13, of Brooklyn won a college scholarship worth $4,000 yesterday in the finals of the Pepsi ColaNational Basketball Association Hotshot program between halves of the league's allstar game in Milwaukee. He was the boys winner in the 1315 age division.

description: The bestdressed list is a mixed bag this year, Side by side on the list developed since 1940 by Eleanor Lambert are Farah Diba, the Empress of Iran; Louise Nevelson, the sculptor, and Mary Tyler Moore, the television actress.

Bell said today that he believed the Supreme Court changed the law on school desegregation and narrowed the scope of busing that may be ordered by Federal judges when it recently vacated a Federal appeals court desegregation decision involving the public schools of Austin. Tex.

title: Rich in Art, Poor in Thanks
description: New York is a city on bread and water, and caviar. While it fights for its financial life, the arts flourish. But the arts are not immune to fiscal crisis. The city needs to husband its strengths, and so must others elsewhere who draw on them.

description: PARIS, Feb.13 (AP)13ellino II, who was feared to be aging rapidly when the season began, won the Prix de Paris today for the third straight year, the first trotter in 20 years to accomplish that feat.

That's not too surprising, because he doesn't have any records on a major label and has never played New York before.

title: To Unsteal the Panama Canal
description: It is finally time to resolve the future of the Panama Canal. Negotiations for a new treaty resume today, in Panama, but they are not the decisive arena. The stubbornness has been in American heads and hearts, and elaborately reflected in the United States Senate, which must ratify any new arrangement.

title: Chess:

title: Autopsy Planned on Body of Boy Found in a Lot in South Plainfield
description: SOUTH PLAINFIELD, Feb, 13 (UPI) An autopsy will be conducted early this week on the body of a 16yearold boy that was found covered by snow in a vacant lot here.

title: Bused Black Children in Chicago Improve Reading and Math Scores
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 13Limited busing of black children to predominantly white schools on Chicago's Northwest Side over the past nine years has resulted in higher reading and mathematics scores by the black children while the academic performances of the white children were not affected.

title: Pulling Together
