description: PANAN1A, Feb. 15 (AP)Panama and the United States resumed highlevel negotiations for a new Panama Canal treaty today on the resort island of Contadora off the Panama coast.

title: Something He Whips Up
description: Some men spend their lives on assembly lines, tightening bolts.

title: CARTER'S GOALS HINGE ON GROWTH ABOVE 5%, CONGRESS OFFICE SAYS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15The Congressional Budget Office served notice today that the economic goals of the Carter Administrationa balanced budget, full employment, new social programsmay be in conflict unless the nation can achieve an unusually high growth rate through 1980 of more than 5 percent annually. The last quarter's annual growth rate was 3 percent.

title: Group Holds Protest in Statue of Liberty Crown
description: Six demonstrators chained themselves inside the crown of the Statue of Liberty yesterday for more than five hours until the National Park Service obtained a court order requiring them to leave.

title: Security Life Target Of Netherlands Insurer
description: The Security Life and Accident Company of Denver announced yesterday that NationaleNederlanden N.V., the Netherlands largest insurance company has expressed an interest in making a cash tender offer for all of Security Life's A and B common stock at $25 a share. The offer is conditioned on receiving at least 51 percent of these shares which, if all 1.4 million shares were tendered, would take an outlay of $35 million.

title: Sutton Says No  Positively
description: Trying to scotch continuing rumors that he is really interested in running for City Council President rather than Mayor, Borough President Percy E. Sutton of Manhattan ruled out the Council Presidency yesterday with an unequivocal statement that would have made General Sherman proud. To emphasize the point even further, he made it in a letter to the incumbent, City Council President Paul O'Dwyer, with the salutation, Dear Good Friend.

title: City College Defeats Post On Late Rally
description: Ernest Phillips led a secondhalf City. College surge as the Beavers defeated C.W. Post, 8580, at the winner's gym last night. Phillips scored all of his 14 points in the second period as City College overcame a 6point halftime deficit

title: Shavian Teamwork
description: SAN FRANCISCO

title: Mexican Chief Takes Side of Poor
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15President Jose Lopez Portillo of Mexico called today for the establishment of a reasonable world order and an international system of economic rights and duties to help developing countries overcome their economic problems.

title: Alfred's Tuition to Rise
description: ALFRED, N. Y. (AP)Beginning in September, Alfred University's tuition will increase $250 a year to $3,825 and board will go up $50 to $1,700.

title: Dollar Mostly Up Abroad Except Against the Pound; Gold Price Off Widely
description: LONDON, Feb. 15 (AP)  The dollar firmed against all major European currencies except the British pound today in a nervous foreign exchange market.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
Beame Holds Talks With Mets and Jets
description: Neither the Jets nor the Mets moved an inch yesterday as the principals in the Shea Stadium controversy met with Mayor Beame at City Hall and then Gracie Mansion in an effort by the Mayor to stem the Jets threatened shift to New Jersey.

title: Grace Church: Happy Ending to a Bitter Controversy
description: HERE IS A ROW of old Gothicfronted houses on Fourth Avenue at 11th Street behind Grace Church that the church's former rector dismissed three years ago as a blight, an embarrassment, an albatross around my neck. The rector, Dr. Benjamin Minifie, wanted to tear the houses down to build a muchneeded gymnasium for the Grace Church School.

title: Borg Out With Injury
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., Feb. 15Topseeded Bjorn Borg, just a few hours before his opening match scheduled for tonight, withdrew from the $50,000 San Jose Grand Prix tennis tournament because of pulled stomach muscles. The 20yearold Swede overcame the same problem, with the use of cortisone, to win the Wimbledon singles title last year.

title: Adgate, Miss Cooper Win Slaloms in U.S. Title Meet
description: SUN VALLEY, Idaho, Feb. 15 (AP) Cary Adgate, held up at the start for more than a minute by faulty timing equipment, turned in the fastest time for both runs and won the men's slalom today at the United States national Alpine championships.

title: Sunshine, Sunlight and Shadows
description: It's too bad that the New York State Open Meetings Law has become known as the sunshine law rather than the sunlight law. Sunlight clarifies but sunshine glares

title: Jewish Group to Resume Trips to Mexico Stopped After U.N. Zionism Vote
description: The American Jewish Congress announced resumption yesterday of its travel program to Mexico, suspended late in 1975 when Mexico voted in favor of the United Nations resolution equating Zionism with racism.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Article 4  No Title

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: FOR 10 YEARS or so, beginning in 1876, when they leased a theater at Broadway and Spring Street, Ned Harrigan and Tony Hart were the toasts of the city's immigrant population.

title: Consumer Notes
description: Enforcement of New Jersey's new unit pricing law begins a week from today, and in anticipation of potential problems, a questionanswer session will be conducted this afternoon at at the North Brunswick Holiday Inn by the State Consumer Affairs Division.

title: GOING OUT  Guide
description: CROWN ACCUSTOMED Whatwould George Rose be expected to do as the Interlude star this afternoon at Town Hall? Will he talk about his 25 years in theater? His training in the English classics, his 30 movies, his television work or his Tonywinning role in My Fair Lady?

title: Loss of Workers and a Humiliating Stereotype Awaken Regional Sentiment in Andalusia
description: SEVILLE, SpainIt may not be long before the onceforgotten, greenandwhite flag of Andalusia hangs from the dignified public buildings of Seville and festoons its fine avenues lined with orange trees.

title: Monitor of Wrongdoing in Prison Scored as Lax in Hearing in Albany
description: ALBANY, Feb. 15Stephen Chinlund, appointed to head the State Commission of Correction last July, was criticized today as being unduly deferential to the Department of Correctional Services; whose operations the commission is charged with monitoring.

title: Arts and Music Schools Will Move To Combined Facility Early in 78
description: The High School of Music and Art and its affiliated High School of Performing Arts, now occupying separate facilities uptown and in midtown, will be combined early next year in the building that now houses the Martin Luther King Jr. High School in the Lincoln Center area, school officials said yesterday.

title: Revised Richter Scale Is Offered
description: The Richter scale, which seismologists have used for 40 years to measure the energy released in earthquakes, understates the intensity of major tremors, California geophysicist told a Conference on the Nature of Great Earthquakes in Pasadena Monday.

title: Wine Talk
description: SAN FRANCISCOWine may be the most difficult of all consumer products to buy. The vast array of labels, the hundreds of different varieties, the dozen or so vintages available at any given time, the different regions, the different grapes, all present a formidable and often defeating harrier to the eniovment of the product.

title: High Tides Around New York
description: For high lide at Asbury Park and Belmar, deduct 34 min, From Sandy Hook time For high lide at Altantic City (steel pier), deduct 26 min, From Sandy Hook time For high lide at Jones Inlet (Pt. Lookout), deduct 19 min, From Sandy Hook time.

title: 22,000 Illegal Aliens Caught
description: SAN DIEGO. Feb. 15 (UPI)More than 22,000 illegal aliens were caught along the United StatesMexico border in January, the Federal Border Patrol reported today. The agency said that the rate of illegal border crossings was increasing.

title: Krupp to Swap industrial Goods For Oil in Barter. Deal With Iran
description: ESSEN, West Germany, Feb. 15 (Reuters)Krupp, the West German industrial group, said today it had concluded a Barter deal with Iran under which it would obtain crude oil in return for industrial equipment.

title: Chicago Motorman Says Brake Loss Led to Crash
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 15 (AP1The motorman of an elevated train has told a Federal investigator that all brakes failed shortly before his train rammed the rear of another Feb. 4, killing 11 persons.

title: PBS Picks Programs For 77 FundRaising
description: A Vienna Philharmonic concert, the movie Blithe Spirit and Ingmar Bergman's Scenes from a Marriage will be part of a selection of major programs to be broadcast next month by the Public Broadmasting Service as part of Festival 77, the annual fundraising nationwide campaign whose coal this year is $10 million.

title: The WellGroomed Ones Are Dogs
description: Ch. Ziegfried von Silber Wald, a giant schnauzer, was hurling imprecations across the aisle at Ch. Bourbon von Silber Wald, who cursed back.

title: Without Gardner, Common Cause Faces New Issues
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15Sometimes an organization just gets lucky: In the early summer of 1973, Common Cause sent out a national mailing piece whose envelope was stamped with the words For sale: The U.S. Government in bold letters. Some members were distressed, others were outragedbut not long afterward the Watergate scandal went public.

title: California Composers
description: THE GROUP for Contemporary Music is apparently feeling a bit defensive about charges of insularity these days. Monday night at the Manhattan School of Music the group presented a program entitled Music rrom California. Cynics might have suggested such subtitles for the affair as seek and ye shall find or you can always get what you want, because much of the music sounded rather like what one ordinarily hears from the group's coterie of composers, and because California has produced a wild and wooly range of musical weirdness. But there were two pieces that were genuindly interesting, and the other three had their limited virtues.

title: Friends Say Dubcek Feels He May Still Play Role in Czech Politics
description: VIENNA, Feb. 15Alexander Dubcek, the former liberal chief of the Czechoslovak Communist Party, believes he may still play a role in his country's and international politics, his friends say.

title: CORRECTION
description: In an item in the Notes on People column last Wednesday concerning Harold R.Tyler's joining a New York law firm, the changed name of the firm was given incorrectly. The correct name is Patterson, Belknap, Webb & Tyler.

title: Books of The Times
description: IN JOURNEY OF THE WOLF, Douglas Day, seems to be saying that Spain has progressed from the tragedy of poverty to the tragedy of tourism. Tourism, as he sees it, brings about a poverty of the spirit. Instead of starving for food or the ordinary comfort; of life, the Spanish. peasant or worker now starves for meaning. He has put his life into his new refrigerator and substituted for it a counterfeit image of the television set. According to Mr. Day, technology is the new dictator of Spain and each tourist is its traveling salesman. The rerhaining function of the Spaniard is to serve up his past to foreigners as a folk festival.

title: Alexander's Store For Trade Center Being Negotiated
description: Alexander's Inc., one of the metropolitan area's largest retail chains, is in serious negotiations with the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey to open the first department store in the World Trade Center, the retail company disclosed yesterday.

title: PASSING OFFICERS SEIZE STORE HOLDUP SUSPECT
description: Two police officers captured a holdup suspect yesterday after he reportedly fired a shot at them in the basement of a drug store at 144 Eighth Avenue near 17th street

title: Police Link Slayer of Five To a Militant Racist Party
description: NEW ROCHELLE, Feb. 15The New Rochelle police began today to investigate Frederick W. Cowan's link with a militant racist organization, believed to be the National States Rights Party.

title: REPORTER DETAINED AT CZECH FRONTIER
description: VIENNA, Feb. 15 (AP)For the second time in three days, the Czechoslovak authorities have taken a Western journalist off the PragueVienna express train, searched him for material on the human rights movement and forced him to walk two miles with his luggage to get across the border into Austria.

title: Japan Will Study Questionable Fees In Boeing 747 Sales
description: TOKYO. Feb. 15 (AP)  Transport Minister Haijime Tamura ordered an investigation today into alleged questionable transactions in the Boeing Aircraft Company's sales in Japan five years ago.

title: TODAY AT 2 & 8
description: An inspired Valentine to Edith Piaf. A memorable evening in the theatre! Juliette Koka is nothing short of brilliant!

title: 30 Pedigreed Afghans Die in Fire in Hicksville
description: HICKSVILLE, L.I., Feb.15 (UPI)Thirty pedigreed Afghans, including four breeding bitches and four litters of puppies,died this morning in a fire at the Sunny Shay Grandeur Kennels.

title: And a Dim Dawn for Sunsets
description: Less publicized than sunshine lawspossibly because their prospects are dimmerare sunset laws. Like sunshine laws, they seek to open up government; they require government agencies periodically to prove they are needed. Senators Muskie of Maine and Percy of Illinois are now championing Federal sunset legislation of the kind adopted by various states.

title: Bebop Era Is Reprised At Church
description: BARRY HARRIS, a jazz pianist with a polished and subtly swinging style who is rarely put in the kind of showcase situations that he deserves, was featured in the last of this season's four Heavenly Jazz concerts on Sunday at the Church of the Heavely Rest, Fifth Avenue at 90th Street. Instead of being a Barry Harris concert, however, the occasion turned into a nostalgic recollection of bebop in which Mr. Harris was, for most of the program, simply the pianist in a sextet.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: State lottery officials said they had reached agreement with the New York City vendingmachine company whose president was slain last week.

title: Some Ways to Use Vinegar
description: Here are some of the ways in which vinegar comes in handy. Unless otherwise specified, the vinegar in question is white vinegar.

title: U.S. Man Arrested in Italy
description: PERUGIA, Italy, Feb. 15 (AP)Soloinun Michael Peri, a son of the former chairman of the Jewish Defense League in the Washington area, was arrested today in this city on a warrant issued against him in the United States, the police said. A spokesman for the United States Embassy in Rome said Mr. Peri had been charged with having shot out the windows of two apartments of Soviet Embassy officials in Hyattsville, Md., last May 13.

title: A 5:30 A.M. Phone Call to Carter Starts a Tightly Structured Day
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15Very, very early yesterday morning, a telephone rang in one of this city's bedrooms, shattering its predawn somnolence. rang just once.

title: Polish Hijacker Gets Four Years
description: VIENNA, Feb. 15 (Reuters)A 28year old Pole who hijacked an airliner last fall with a dummy grenade carved out of a loaf of bread war; jailed for four years today. A Vienna court found Andrzej Karasinki guilty of air piracy, but said he would not be extradited to Poland unless he was wanted there for other crimes.

title: New Bond Issues
Blacks Still Hopeful About Carter After Some Early Disappointment
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 15Black leaders, who were among President Carter's most fervent supporters during the campaign, now regard him coolly, tentatively but still hopefully in the wake of his policies and appointments so far.

title: Q &A
description: Q Many recipes call for capers.I use them, enjoy them but don't actually know what they are. Would you be good enough to unfuddle me?

title: Head of Women's Bank Pulls Reins Tighter
description: The best service this bank can do the cause of female equality is make some money, says Lynn D, Salvage, the new president of the First Women's Bank, New York State's first and only women's bank and one of only three in the country.

title: SIX HELD IN ATTACKS ON BMT PASSENGERS
description: Six teenage boys armed with a chain and a steelstudded belt terrorized passengers or. two BMT subway trains in Brooklyn early yesterday morning, beating and robbing three persons, one of them a 79yearold man, the Transit Authority reported.

title: Two Win $29,362 Each In Garden State Trifecta
description: CHERRY HILL, N.J., Feb.15 (AP)Two lucky bettors won the 9112 trifecta in the ninth race at Garden State Park today and became $29.362.50 richer.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Nine Newark police officers and a former municipal court clerk were indicted on charges of accepting bribes to protect a multimilliondollar heroin operation. An Essex County indictment said the 10 defendants had received payments of up to $100 a week to make sure that Al Green, an admitted drug dealer, was not arrested.

title: COVERUP IS CHARGED TO HOUSE DEMOCRATS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15Outnumbered House Republicans, anticipating a Democratic move to claim credit for imposing rigorous new ethical standards on members, are pressing a campaign that implicitly accuses the majority party of covering up past sins.

title: Agreement Insures Bird Coler Hospital Will Remain Open
description: New York State has approved plans removing the threat of the closing of Bird S. Coler municipal hospital, and the ??????? Government has dropped a Feb. 28 deadline for cutting off $17 million a year in Medicaid and Medicare reimbursement for Coler and Goldwater hospitals.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON. Feb 15A New Jersey insurance company specializing in writing industrial accident insurance became so worried a year ago about the decline in manufacturing jobs in the state that it hired a research company to make a detailed study of what Was wrong.

title: Last Things First in the Middle East
description: The sure way to wreck any negotiation is to insist that the main issue on the table must be settled before the conferees take their seats. On his first tour through the Middle East, Secretary of State Vance is understandably eager to prepare a bargaining process, to get everyone seated somewhere. But he is for some reason treading perilously close to that selfdestruct button. He went saying he wished only to listen on this first journey through the area, yet by posing what is probably the wrong question at the wrong time and in the wrong way, he may already have said too much.

title: Bergland Considers Aiding Sugar Prices
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15Secretary of Agriculture Bob Bergland said today that he was considering a plan to set price supports for sugar and tighten the import quota to aid troubled cane and sugar beet growers.

title: 25% of WarSouvenir Dealer's Sales Are Nazi Items
description: Nazi war souvenirs or, as he prefers to call them, Germanic Second World War items, make up almost a quarter of the volume of business that Roderick Jones does in military memorabilia. A retired Air Force man, he is happy in the business he knows best and says he has no qualms whatsoever about that percentage.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Record $3.1 Billion Toy Shipment
description: The United States toy industry shipped a record $3.1 billion in toys, games,,children's vehicles and Christmas decorations in 1976, up 14 percent from the $2.7 billion shipped in 1975. David A. Miller. chairman of the Toy Manufacturers of America said today.

title: Japan, in Time of Transition, Still Seeking Its Proper World Role
description: TOKYOThe accession of new leadership to power in Japan and in the United States, its principalperhaps its onlyally, underlines a sense, palpable here, of a time of change, not so much of men as of national direction.

title: New Life For an Old Elixir
description: Suppose you were told of a liquid that would ease the pain of insect bites or sunburn, loosen the fierce grip of a corroded bolt, impart a gleam to the top of a loaf of homemade bread, open a clogged drain, help prolong the life of cut flowers, tenderize tough meat. clean windows, banish odors, remove stains, restore luster to patent leather and lend zest to salads.

title: CONNECTICUT SCORED ON NUCLEAR SAFETY
description: HARTFORD, Feb, 15An eightmember panel that visited nuclear installations in the state says that the latent hazards of radiation posed by such plants may have been understated by studies on the subject. And it called for the establishment of an agency independent of the utilities to check the plants regularly for possibly hazardous operations.

title: Living Abroad: Leningrad
description: At 8 in the morning, it is still dark. Leningraders, bundled so they look like barrels on legs, rush to catch buses on the large square dominated by the goldendomed Cathedral of St. Isaac. Under a street lamp, a woman in a headscarf and many sweaters sweeps at the light dusting of snow with long broom. She resembles the largest of those wooden dollswithindolls that tourists snap up.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: Miami Union Sues to End New Contract With Hotels
description: MIAMI, Feb. 15 (AP)A local union is asking a Federal court to rescind a new contract that ended a 22day strike against luxury hotels in this area. The suit says 200 to 1,000 union members have not been rehired.

title: Mondale, in TroubleShooter Role, Seeks Improved Ties With Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15Vice President Mondale, styling himself the President's acrosstheboard adviser and troubleshooter, said today that he was working hard to bolster the Administration's somewhat ruffled relations with Congress.

title: Business Records
description: Tuesday, Feb. 15, 1977 Petition tiled by;

title: Electric Burger Grills: Speed vs. Taste
description: Put away your crock pots, your automatic foolproof crepe pans and your fondue pots. The kitchen gadget of the moment is the electric hamburger grill.

title: Joseph March Dies; Screenwriter, Poet Wrote Wild Party
description: Joseph Moncure March, a poet and screenwriter, died Monday in a Los Angeles nursing home. He was 78 years old and lived in Los Angeles.

title: Sony Introduces Betamax Transfer
description: The Sony Corporation introduced yesterday a consumer service that transfers home motion picture color films or 35 millimeter slide transparencies to videocassettes for viewing on the company's Betamax television recorder players.

title: Labor Asks New Construction Industry Picketing Bill
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Feb. 15Organized labor is preparing another major legislative drive to obtain passage of new construction industry picketing bill similar to the one President Ford vetoed last year.

title: Common Market Accepts U.S. Fishing Limit
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15 (AP)The United States and the European Economic Community signed an agreement today recognizing the new American MGmile coastal fishing zone.

title: New York Raises Ceilings on Income In Public Housing
description: In an attempt to comply with Federal regulations and get more upwardly mobile families into its 241 projects, the New York City Housing Authority announced yesterday a sharp increase in the maximum income a family could have and still be admitted to the city's lowrent public housing.

title: New York Senate Votes to Support Suit Against State Insurance Head
description: ALBANY, Feb. 15The State Senate voted formal support today for an unusual lawsuit the chairman of Its Insurance Committee brought quietly late last year against the State Superintendent of 1nsurance.

title: DISCOVERIES Enid Nemy; It's a WalletNo, a Tote Bag
description: It's a WalletNo, a Tote Bag

title: China Sent More Than 80 Tons Of Gold to London in December
description: LONDON, Feb. 15 (Reuters)China shipped more than 80 tons of gold to the London bullion market in December, official figures showed today.

title: Hot Detente or Cold War?
description: MUNICH, West GermanyLenin sent a memorandum to his commissar for external affairs, Georgi Chicherin, in 1921 and it makes impressive reading today. The great revolutionist predicted that the capitalists will open up credits for us for the purpose of supporting Communist parties in other ctiuntries.

title: Bridge
description: Choice Varies on Picking Lead From 3 Small Cards

title: Fight for Milgo Is One of Industry's Sharpest
description: The struggle over which of two companies is to acquire the Miamibased Milgo Eletronics Corporation, whose revenues have totaled $40 million in each of the last two years, has turned into one of the sharpest merger battles in the history of the electronics business.

title: Books of The Times
description: WANTED! The Search for Nazis in America. By Howard Blum. Quadrangle, $8.95.

title: Crosland Said to Be Sinking Fast Two Days After Suffering Stroke
description: LONDON, Feb. 15 (AP)Foreign Secretary Anthony Crosland is sinking fast two days after suffering a stroke, his personal assistant, David Lipsey, said tonight.

title: A. H. Raskin
description: A detente in the cold war that has long embittered relations between organized labor in the United States and Canada may be a significant byproduct of last week's elections in the 1.4millionmember United Steelworkers of America. The choice of Lynn R. Williams, director of the union's Ontario district, as international secretary puts a Canadian in the highest office a unionist from north of the border has ever held in a major massproduction union. In the view of many insiders, his talents make him a good bet for the union presidency in 1981 or 1985.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: About Education
description: Whatever happened to the Class of 76?

title: 60Minute Gourmet
description: Pierre Franey

title: China Said to Voice Wish To Settle Assets Dispute
description: HONG KONG. Feb. 15 (AP)Chinese leaders have indicated to David Rockefeller that they want to settle the dispute over Chinese asssets frozen in the United States and private American claims in China, the Far Eastern Eccnomic Review reported today.

title: A Fluke Goal Helps Kings Blank Islanders
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Feb. 15The first goal ever credited to a goaltender in the 60year history of the National Hockey League was nullified an hour and a half later tonight by the official scorer and not the opposing team.

title: MakeBelieve Tanker Enters a Simulated Port
description: Capt. Edward Kitchens guided a 250,000ton supertanker into the harbor at Milford Haven, Wales, yesterday, made a smooth turn to starboard between two cliffs, sounded the foghorn and glided to a halt next to Texaco's pier. All without leaving La Guardia Airport.

title: News Summary
description: WEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 16, 1977

title: Article 3  No Title
description: Article 3  No Title

title: New Yorkers, etc.
description: THE FIRST CRITIC said the book was written for the readers of Cosmopolitan, and the second said it was KrafftEbbing in a Classic Comics tradition. Then the third critic weighed in. Blue Skies, No Candy, he said, is like all the Nurse Barton books. Paralyzed .. Gael Greene felt paralyzed. She sat there in her bed, her typewriter at her side, and mourned.

title: Nomination of Treasury Aide Held Up by J. C. Penney Kickbacks Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15The nomination of Kenneth S. Axelson, former C. Penney corporate officer, as Deputy Secretary of the Treasury has been held up by Treasury Secretary W. Michael Blumenthal pending the completion of an investigation in New York into alleged kickbacks and other improprieties involving construction contracts at J. C. Penney Inc. headquarters.

title: Vietnamese Accuse U. S. Of Subversion in Area
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Feb. 15 (UPI)Vietnam accused the United States today of using undercover military agents in Thailand and teams of Green Beret troops in Laos to sabotage peace in Southeast Asia.

title: P.B. A. President and the Impossible Dream
description: Samuel DeMilia, the new president of the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association, takes office facing the same problem that forced his two immediate predecessors to quit within the last nine months: anything he can get from the city the membership is likely to turn down, and what the membership wants, he cannot wrest from the city. Although contract terms were agreed to last month by the union leadership and City Hall, the union has refused to submit them to the rank and file until the city also grants amnesty to the 22 policemen who got in trouble during last fall's street demonstrations. On that issue, the city says it will not

title: H.E.W. SEEKS AGENCY WITH POWER TO LIMIT COST OF HEALTH CARE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15The Depart ment of Health. Education and Welfare has proposed creating a new agency with authority to set limits on rising health care costs for the country, Administration sources said today.

title: Miss Harter Gains in Tennis
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 15 (UPI)Kathy Harter of Culver City. Calif., scored a mild upset today in beating Florenta Mihai, 61, 63, in firstround play of the $100,000 Virginia Slims tennis tournament.

title: Radio
description: 67, A.M., WNCNFM. Mazeppa, Gopak, Tchaikovsky; Prelude from Partita No. 3, Bach; Humoresque No. 2, Sibelius; Overture to Fra Diavolo, Auber; Chanson clans la nuit, Salzedo; Liebeslied, Kreisler. 7:407:45, WQXR: Business Picture Today.

title: Britain Receives $1.5 Billion Loan
description: LONDON, Feb. 16 (AP)Agreements for a previously announced $1.5 billion, 7year loan to the British Treasury were signed here today, the Bank of England said. The loan, announced last month, is being provided by a consortium led by the five main commercial banks here, the four largest West German banks, three United States banks and the Royal Bank of Canada.

title: Crosland's Condition Stabilizes Following a Stroke on Sunday
description: LONDON, Feb. 16 (AP)Foreign Secretary Anthony Crosland remained critically ill in an Oxford hospital today, but doctors said that his condition had stabilized since he suffered a stroke Sunday.

title: Mark Twain Returns to Vassar
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N.Y.. Feb. 16Mark Twain, who described his 1885 visit to Vassar as ghastly, has just become the pride of the old college.

title: New President Is Elected at Cornelli
description: The trustees of Cornell University yesterday announced the election, as expected, of Dr. Frank H. T. Rhodes, a former academic vice president of the University of Michigan, as the university's ninth president.

title: Bridge:
description: Even players of some experience have trouble in judging whether their honor cards are good. The point count is accurate enough for the purposes of balanced hands, when notrump is in view, but considerable reassessment is called for when partner has shown a onesuited or twosuited hand.

title: MANY REFUGEES FIND WEST'S BARRIERS HIGH
description: BUCHAREST, Rumania, Feb. 16 After years of persecution and hardship and waiting, we have finally obtained passports to leave this country, to go to the West. But the Westthe socalled free worldwill not have us, it seems.

title: All but 3 Barons Get Back Pay
description: RICHFIELD, Ohio, Feb. 16 (AP)All but three of the Cleveland Barons were paid their overdue salaries today, Harry Howell, acting general manager of the National Hockey League team, reported.

title: Al Fatah, in a Gesture to Syria, Accuses Guerrilla Groups in Fighting
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 16The leadership of Al Fatah, the major Palestinian guerrilla group, today blamed erroneous behavior and contemptible practices by splinter groups within the Palestinian ranks for fighting between Syrian troops and Palestinian elements near refugee camps here last week.

title: MEMORIAL CONTRIBUTIONS
description: are gratefully acknowledged by the

title: World Hockey Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: NEW FORMULA URGED  ON AID TO COLLEGES
description: NEWARK, Feb. 16A proposal that would reduce direct aid to state colleges and channel the money into tuition assistance to students was assailed today by Dr. Edward J. Bloustein, president of Rutgers, the State University, who said the report had been written as if it were about soybeans rather than about higher education.

title: Goldwater Volunteers a Denial Of Report He Hired an Informant
description: PHOENIX, Feb. 16 (UPI)Senator Barry Goldwater, Republican of Arizona, appeared voluntarily before a grand jury today to contradict a report that he wanted to raise havoc on a Navajo Indian reservation

title: Big Board Is Offered Trade Center Space
description: The World Trade Center has offered to rent space to the New York Stock Exchange to accommodate all or part of its operations, industry sources disclosed yesterday. A similar offer had been made to the American Stock Exchange.

title: Uganda Archbishop And 2, Held in Plot, Are Reported Dead
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Thursday, Feb. 17 (Reuters) The Angelican Archbishop of Uganda, Burundi and Rwanda and two Government ministers, arrested last night in an alleged plot to overthrow President Idi Amin, have been killed in an automobile accident, a Uganda military spokesman announced today.

title: The Club: A Shiftin Perspective
description: Eve Merriam, poet and teacher, had long wanted to write a feminist play, and having found role reversal to be a useful device in her feminist theory classes, she decided to use the device in her revue, The Club. In that musical diversion, now at the Circle in the Square Downtown, four Victorian gentlemen spend  an evening at their formenonly club, talking and singing of women. But they are played by women dressed as men. Sexual distinctions become blurred.

title: Washington &Business
description: Promising energyrelated invention and ideas are referred to the Energy Research and Development Administration. Page 59.

title: Money
description: Wednesday, February 16, 1977

title: How to Perpetrate an Outrage
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16Nearly a century ago, Speaker Thomas B. Reed, Republican of Maine, broke the back of minority rights in the House of Representatives by taking away its power to filibuster. The right of a minority is to draw its salaries, Czar Reed scorned, and its function is to make a quorum.

title: About New York
description: What if grinning strangers kept walking up to you on the street and saying your first name over and over like it was the title of a hit musical that has run too long to be permitted to close? So. sympathize with Bella.

title: Democrats Support Bills for Protection Of Battered Wives
description: ALBANY, Feb. 16Women who are beaten by their husbands and other victims of domestic violence would be given greater legal protection under terms of bills introduced today in the Legislature.

title: Minuteman Missile Launched
description: VANDENBERG MR FORCE BASE, Calif., Feb. 16 (UPI)An Air Force Minuteman 3 intercontinental ballistics missile was successfully launched today by a Strategic Air Command missile combat crew from the 90th Strategic Missile Wing at Francis E. Warren Air Force Base, Wyo. ???? Air Force said that the launching was one in a series of operational tests of the reliability of the Minuteman weapon system.

title: G. O. P. LOSES A MOVE FOR VOTE ON PAY RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (AP) A Republican effort to force a recorded vote on a pay increase for members of Congress, judges and high officials was blocked today in the House of Representatives.

title: Stormy Times In East Africa
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Feb.16Earlier this week, President Idi Amin of Uganda accused President Julius K. NYerereof Tanzania of involvement in an attempt to topple the regime or the Uganda strongman. The charge by Field Marshal Amin, which alleged that Chinese arms intended for Rhodesian guerrillas were diverted by Tanzania and sent to dissi dents in Uganda, came as much of East Africa was gripped by increased international friction and mounting political instability.

title: Columbia Swimmers Excel
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, N. J., Feb. 16The Columbia swimming team completed the finest season in its 78year swimming history when it defeated Monmouth, 6350, at the losers pool tonight. The victory, clinched in the meet's final event, the 400yard freestyle relay, gave the Lions a 10I wonlost record. That surpassed the ninevictory total of the 192930 season, and also assured Columbia of its first berth ever in the Metropolitan Conference regularseason championship.

title: Rutgers Runs Over George Washington
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Feb. 16If any opponent expects to beat Rutgers on the basketball court, they had better be prepared to run and run and run for the full 40 minutes.

title: Securities Suits Against Big Board Are Halted by Court of Appeals
description: A threejudge panel of the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit, in New York ruled yesterday that the New York Stock Exchange cannot be sued under Federal securities laws by either limited partners or subordinated lenders of brokerage firms. It did not rule on whether the exchange might be sued by those who buy stock in publicly traded brokerage firms.

title: Harlem Tenants Join in Assailing Slumlord: The City of New York
description: When Frances Smith returned to her Harlem apartment after a week in the hospital last month, she found that a pipe had burst in a vacant apartment above her.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: Joe Ely Presents Originals In CountryRock Repertory
description: Joe Ely, a countryrocker from Lubbock, Tex., who's at the new Lone Star Cafe through Saturday, is a pleasant enough performer. If one encountered him and his amiable fivepiece band in a Texas club, one could appreciate them as a highclass bar band. Mr. Ely looks rather like Arlo Guthrie, and he spins out his repertoryincluding many originalsof western swing, rockabilly and quasipoetic laments in steady succession.

title: In Memorium
description: STERNSara Brosseau, passed . away Feb. 17, 1970. She still lives on earth In the good deeds she performed and In the hearts of those who loved her.

title: CARTER SAYS CUBANS MAY LEAVE ANGOLA, IS RECEPTIVE ON TIES
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16  President Carter said today he had received information from indirect sources that Cuba intended to remove its troops from Angola and remarked that such a step would make it possible to consider normalizing relations with the Government of President Fidel Castro.

title: A.T.& T.Payout Up 10c
description: In the latest of a record number of favorable dividend actions this year, the American Telephone and Telegraph Company yesterday raised its quarterly dividend by 10 cents to $1.05 a share, or $4.20 a share on an annualized basis.

title: Union Yields in Contract To Aid American Motors
description: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 16 (AP)Negotiators for the American Motors Corporation and the United Automobile Workers have reached a tentative settlement less beneficial to workers than agreements the union made earlier with Ford, Chrysler and General Motors.

title: Lawsuit Is Brushed Off By International Paper
description: A class action lawsuit charging that the International Paper Company knowingly withheld pessimistic earnings forecasts while reporting markedly improved profits was brushed off by International Paper as just another lawsuit.

title: Louise Yim, Seoul Legislator, Dies; Educator and Women's Leader
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Thursday, Feb. 17 (AP)Louise a legislator, educator, and women's movement leader, died here today. She was 77 years old.

title: RELIGIOUS SERVICES JEWISH
description: Rudeph Sliolom7 WEST 83rd ST

title: Pan Am to Run Westchester Field For County for $175,000 a Year
description: WHITE PLAINS, Feb. 16Westchester County Executive Alfred B. DelBello signed an agreement today with Pan American World Airways to run the countyowned airport under a management arrangement thought to be unique among domestic airports.

title: President of Rabbis Calls. City Paralyzed By Increasing Crime
description: The president of the New York Board of Rabbis said yesterday that the city stands practically paralyzed in the face of,rampant criminality on the streets, in subways and in schools.

title: People in Sports
description: The interim period has come to a close, said the Buffalo Braves general managercoach, Bob MacKinnon, after turning over the coaching reins to his assistant, Joe Mullaney. The move came after a 126114 defeat by the Washington Bullets Tuesday night.

title: Fishers Island, With Gentry. Scarce, Fights Obsolescence
description: FISHERS ISLAND, L.I.To Francis Doyen, Town Justice and the local Mobil Oil purveyor, to Tony Marshall, owner of the Bouton Services Construction Company, and to Henry Walsh, owner of Fisher Island's only food store, it doesn't make sense that a pretty, easypaced and virtually crimefree community should be hurting for enough citizens to keep the place going.

title: Reruns of TV Series Being Edited To Delete Violence for Syndication
description: MIAMI BEACH, Feb. 16Reruns of such network series as Hawaii FiveO and The Rookies are being sold to local stations in heavily edited forms, with most of the more violent sequences deleted. The Rookies, in fact, has lent itself to such editing that the programs, which had been an hour in length when they played on ABC, have been compressed into halfhour shows for syndication.

title: SOUTH AFRICAN PREDICTS NEW RHODESIA INITIATIVE
description: CAPE TOWN, Feb. 16 (UPI)Foreign Minister Hilgard Muller said today that represent atives of the United States, ??????and South Africa would meet in the very near future to discuss a Rhodecian settlement.

title: AIRLINE COMPLAINTS REACH RECORD LEVEL
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (AP)Airline passengers are complaining in record numbers to the Civil Aeronautics Board about delayed flights, baggage handling, overboekings and other shortcomings in service.

title: F.B.I. Official Is Reinstated On PolicyMaking Board
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16A Federal Bureau of Investigation official who was removed from the bureau's executive conference after he became a target of Justice Department investigation of illegal breakins by F.B.I. agents in New York has been reinstated, a bureau spokesman said today.

title: Penmanship Counts At a Brooklyn Bank
description: A wouldbe robber was thwarted at a Brooklyn bank yesterday when the teller told him she couldn't decipher his handwriting.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Special State Prosecuter John F. Keenan announced yesterday that he would not appeal a State Supreme Court justice's ruling last December that dismissed a perjury indictment against Carmine G. De Sapio, former Tammany Hall leader. In a onesentence announcement. Mr. Keenan said he had reviewed the case and the dismissal by Justice Leon B. Polsky and had concluded there were insufficient grounds to appeal the ruling.

title: Marines First Ashore in TV Recruiting
description: The Marine Corps, which prides itself on being first ashore in many combat situations, was also the first of the military services to go to regular paid television advertising for recruiting.

title: School Results
Gold
description: London: Morning fixing $135.95, u? $0.05; afternoon fixing $135.90, unchanged. Paris: afternoon gold fixing $137.32. up $0.42.

title: Shootings Still Haunt Moving Company Employees
description: NEW ROCHELLE, Feb. 16  When Frederick W. Cowan opened fire from an office of the Neptune Worldwide Moving Company here on Monday morning, killing four employees and one police officer, company representatives got on the phone to explain to customers that Neptune's Weyman Avenue depot was under siege and no trucks would move from the yard that day.

title: Britain Says Decision to Deport 2 U.S. Writers Will Be Carried Out
description: LONDON, Feb. 16 (AP)Home Secretary Merlyn Rees told Parliament today that the Government would reject ???? and carry out its decision to deport a former employee of the Central Intelligence Agency, Philip Agee, and a journalist, Mark Hosenball, both Americans.

title: Meadowland Unit Pushes Baler Land Acquisition
description: LYNDHURST, Feb. 16The Hackensack Meadowlands Development Commission intensified today its negotiations for ownership of a 12.3acre junkyard in North Arlington where construction of a new garbage compactor is to start by April 15.

title: Richard Harkness, Newsman on NBC , Added Innovations
description: Richard Harkness, an important personality in the formative years of NBCTV's news coverage, died yesterday at his winter home in Naples, Fla. He was 70 years old.

title: NEW M. A. C. POWERS PROPOSED BY BEAME AS FISCAL SOLUTION
description: Hoping to break a deadlock on New York City's debt problems, Mayor Beame proposed yesterday that the Municipal Assistance Corporation be given new power to go to court to force the city to balance its budget and adhere to strict fiscal controls in the years ahead.

title: Look Who's Already in Jersey
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Feb. 16While the Jets continued to battle their way westward block by block in handtohand fighting from Shea Stadium to City Hall, the Cosmos quietly crossed the Hudson today. After six frustrating years of searching for a decent abode in New York, the soccer team moved into Giants Stadium with a 10year lease, 76,500 seats and no hassles. And at the opening of their training camp for the North American Soccer League season, there was no Pel either. His contract exempts him until April 1 from any obligation to break a sweat. Oddly, the world's most famous soccer player is in New York City on business. But he was not being held there by Mayor Beame for ransom. Politicians are not concerned with soccer playersyet. The soccer vote apparently is not important. But perhaps some day it will be. Perhaps then somebody in the Mayor's office will investigate why the Cosmos were permitted to cross the Hudson without machine guns having been set up at the tunnels and bridges.

title: A Stretchy Maillot, Suited for Summer
description: Mary Beame was among the women who applauded the introduction of Gucci's first beachwear collection at a luncheon at the St. Regis yesterday, though she didn't really think she'd try to get into the minimal bikini. She didn't have to. The Gucci collection of swimsuits includes some perfectly covered onepiece maillots, which are, after all, the newest things to be worn by the sea, lake or pool.

title: The U.N. Today
Bell Vows to Tighten Curbs Against Illegal Aliens
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 16 (AP)Attorney General Griffin B. Bell says that le Will increase efforts to prevent aliens from entering ,the United States illegally.

title: S.D. Leidesdorf Accounting Firm Failed to Find Fraud, S.E.C. Says
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16The Securities and Exchange Commission charged today that S.D. Leidesdorf, a large national accounting firm, ineptly failed to uncover fraud by a shippingcompany client that collapsed in 1972.

title: Federal Agency Finds Westway Pollution Peril
description: The controversial $1.6 billion Westway project in Manhattan was branded environmentally unsatisfactory yesterday by the Federal Environmental Protection Agency. The proposal has been approved by the Secretaries of Transportation in both the Ford and Carter Administrations.

title: LyeSprinkled Pretzels Recalled By F.D.A.,Which Cites 6 Brands
description: WASHINGTON Feb. 16 (UPI)Consumer were cautioned today that 19,000 cases of pretzeis. some distributed nationwide, are sprinkled with lye crystals that can burn the tongue mouth and throat.

title: Women's Run Mark Set
description: EAST BERLIN, Feb. 16 (Reuters)Marliee Oelsner of East Germany set a world indoor record in the women's 100meter run today, clocking 11.37 seconds, threehundredths of a second better than the previous mark set by Sybille Priebsch, also of East Germany, last year. Marita Koch, from Rostock, finished second in 11.41.

title: Two Are Told to Testify on Payola
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (UPI)Two Washingtonarea music promoters were ordered today to testify at a public hearing on payola, a form of broadcastingindustry bribery that the Government began investigating in 1964.

title: Concert: Y's New Music Series
description: A new series called Y New Music devoted  interestingly if somewhat idiosyncraticallyto music for pianos and percussion presented the second of two concerts Tuesday night at the 92d Street Young Men's  Young Women's Hebrew Association.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: Article 3  No Title

title: Market Place
description: After all the depressing news this winter about fuel shortages, inflation and other effects of the cold weather, stock buyers may need an external spark to stimulate them, Newton D. Zinder, an analyst at E. F. Hutton & Company, said yesterday morning. Perhaps American Telephone. directors will help at their dividend meeting today.

title: Unemployment Claims Up Sharply, Reflecting FuelRelated Layoffs
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (AP)New claims for unemployment insurance benefits for the week that ended Feb. 5 rose to the highest number in nearly two years because of heavy layoffs caused by the severe winter weather and fuel shortages, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Racal Bid for milgo Is 2,600 Shares Away
description: Racal Electronics Limited of Britain disclosed yesterday that it needed fewer than 2,600 shares of Milgo Electronics Corporation to achieve control of Milgo.

title: Briton Visits the Falklands To Weigh Islands Fate
description: PORT STANLEY, Falkland Islands, Feb. 16 (AP)A British official arrived today to consult with 1,900 hardy British settlers over their future and that of the windswept islands they inhabit in the South Atlantic.

title: Detroit Class Still Bears the Scars of Teacher's Slaying
description: DETROIT, Feb. 15Had it not been such a bizarre incident, the fatal shooting of 45yearold Bettye McCaster might have been recorded on the police blotter here as just another chapter in the nation's tragic story of violence and crime.

title: College Basketball
description: FIRST GAME

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Feb. 16An insurance industry spokesman told a legislative committee today that an important segment of the industry believed a competitive stateoperated insurance fund might be needed to prevent New Jersey's auto insurance system from collapsing.

title: Goldin Cuts Off City Payments To Bronx Drug Treatment Center
description: Charging widespread irregularities in the operations of a Bronx drug treatment program, Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin announced yesterday that he was halting immediately all city payments to the Hispanic Association for a Drug Free Society, also known as SERA.

title: Colombia Offers New Pricing Plan On Coffee to Stem Further Rises
description: BOGOTA, CplombiaAs a major coffee exporter, Colombia has proposed a plan that could, if widely accepted, prevent further coffee price increases and perhaps reduce prices gradually.

title: Jury in Chesimard Murder Trial Listens to State Police Radio Tapes
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Feb. 16The jury in the Joanne Chesimard murder trial listened today to state police radiotapes calling for patrol cars to help in the impounding of a white Pontiac on the New Jersey Turnpike that the state says was the vehicle used by the killers of Trooper Werner Foerster in May 1973.

title: Body of Slaying Victim Is Found
description: The body of an unidentified man between 25 and 30 years of age was found yesterday in bushes at the parking lot of the Riverdale Country Day School on Spauldings pane and Independence Avenue in the Bronx. He had been beaten and shot in the chest. The victim was blackhaired and wore a threequarterlength black coat and sneakers.

title: 77 Westminster Final Rated Finest in Years
description: Dogdom's new monarch is virtual perfection. That's the opinion Haworth Hoch of St. Louis, the 1977 Westminster bestinshow judge, voiced about Ch. Dersade Bobby's Girl, the Sealyham who reigned supreme over more than 3,000 competitors at the end of America's foremost show Tuesday night. Close to 200 enthusiasts filled the grand ballroom of the Statler Hilton yesterday at the Dog Fanciers Club luncheon to hear what the judges had to say about their selections.

title: 38,000 IN ARMED FORCES FOUND USING FOOD STAMPS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16 (AP)As many as 38,000 members of the armed services are drawing food stamps and thousands more would be eligible for the aid if they were not moonlighting or did not have working wives, a Pentagon study says.

title: Countdown at United
description: Working with the knowledge that 60 percent of airline pleasure travelers are business travelers on their days off, United Airlines is for the first time combining its business and vacation travel advertising campaigns in an $11.5 million summer effort with a little kicker.

title: The Execution of a Courthouse
description: Consumer culture dealt one more body blow to the environment last week when a twoyear battle to save the old White Plains Courthouse ended in failure. But to interpret this failure as just the loss of another landmark is to miss the more important picture. This is one more dispiriting, unnecessary rerun of the old, discredited brand of bulldozer urban renewal and the substitution of that new commercial and cultural icon, the shopping center, for anything in the American past that stands in its way.

title: BELL SEEKS TO DELAY TAX PRIVACY RIGHTS
description: WASHINGTON,Feb. 16  Attorney General GriffinB. Bell has asked leaders of Congressional tax committees temporarily to suspend new privacy provisions in the tax law that he has contended would impede investigation of political corruption and socalled white collar crimes.

title: College Basketball
description: GEORGE WASHINGTON (90)

title: Issue and Debate
description: The United States has always placed high value on local control of schools, and, nowhere is this tradition more visible than in its method of supporting public elementary and secondary schools. The basic means of raising school funds is the local community's principal source of revenue for all purposes: the property tax.

title: Training Drama Stars Brothers In Ice Rescue
description: Training Drama Stars Brothers In Ice Rescue

title: Canadiens Tie Penguins, 44, On Late Goal
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 16 (UPI)Guy Lafleur's second goal of the game with 6:44 gone in the third period gave the Montreal Canadiens a 44 tie with the Pittsburgh Penguins tonight.

title: Mets Compromise Spurned by N.F.L.
description: The New York Jets burned another bridge behind them and advanced closer to New Jersey yesterday when the National Football League rejected the compromise offer of the Mets on staying in Shea Stadium.

title: CONCORDE FLIGHTS BACKED BY CARTER
description: President Carter, in messages to the leaders of Britain and France, has reaffirmed the decision of the previous Administration authorizing a 16month test of Concorde landings in Washington and New York City. But the President's press secretary said yesterday that Mr. Carter still thought the authorization had been a mistake and that the President had said in his messages that he cannot direct authorities in New York as to what decisions they should make.

title: Dow Signs Saudi Accord
description: The Dow Chemical Company has signed an interim agreement preliminary to negotiation of a contract for construction of an $800 million petrochemical complex in Saudi Arabia, according to a company spokesman. The project, tentatively scheduled for completion in the mid1980's, would be built in the Jubail industrial area, for which Saudi officials are planning multibilliondollar investments in steel, chemical and other manufacturing plants. The Dow agreement was made by Dow ChemicalEurope of Zurich with the Saudi Basic Industries Corporation, the company representative said.

title: California Computer To Appeal in I.B.M. Suit
description: California Computer Industries, Inc., said that it would appeal the dismissal of its $300 million antitrust suit against the International Business Machines Corporation. The suit, brought three years ago, was dismissed last Friday by Federal District Judge Ray McNichols on the ground that California Computer had not submittted enough evidence to justify submitting the case to a jury.

title: Dividends
description: WEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 16, 1977

title: Hunt to Be Released From Prison on Feb. 23
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 16 (UPI)E. Howard Hunt Jr., a former White House consultant and convicted Watergate conspirator, will be paroled from prison two days earlier than originally scheduled so he can make a court appearance next week, the Parole Commission said today.

title: Song Series At Pub Hits A True Note
description: After the first two weeks of its scheduled eight weeks, the series of programs at Michael's Pub based on Alec Wilder's radio series, The American Popular Song, which, in turn, was based on Mr. Wilder's book of the same title, has dropped the trimmings of the radio productionthe betweensong discussions of songwriters and songsand is concentrating on the songs themselves. Even the cutoff date of Mr. Wilder's book, 1950, is being disregarded, as post1950 songs are being performed, although this is not necessarily to the detriment of the series.

title: Tennesseeans Use a Lake To Flush Water System
description: MORRISTOWN, Tenn., Feb. 16 (UPI)Millions of gallons of water were channeled today from Cherokee Lake into 'Morristown's water system in hopes of flushing out a vile and noxious chemical that has been plaguing the water company's 70,000 customers for nearly a week.

title: Deaths
description: ANGELLena. Beloved wife of Sam, devoted mother of Sarah Sotto and Michael Angel. Dear grandmother or David, Laurie, Lisa and Stefani. Serv Ices 1:30 P.M. today at Hellman Memorial Chapels, Mc., 1532 Grand Con course, Bronx. Toledo, Ohio papers please copy.

title: ISAAK Y. BOLESLAVSKY, 58; RUSSIAN CHESS MASTER
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 16 (AP)  Isaak Y. Boleslaysky, a chess grandmaster and journalist, has died after a short illness, the newspaper Sovetsky Sport reported today. He was 58.

title: Telephone's Dividend Rise Gives Market a Lift in Livelier Trading
description: A dividend increase by American Telephone and Telegraph gave the stock market a lift yesterday. Prices made a broad advance in accelerated trading.

title: Vatican Radio Is Building Giant New Antenna
description: ROME, Feb. 16 (AP)The Vatican radio has built the largest rotating antenna in the world to strengthen the voice of the Pope around the globe and try to overcome jamming in Eastern Europe.

title: Accountants Ask Pledge In Writing to Auditors By Management Groups
description: The public accounting profession's top rulemakers on auditing have proposed that independent auditors be required to obtain written assurances from company managements on a lengthy list of topics.

title: Case Against a Youth Indicted In Attack on S.I Home Dismissed
description: An indictment against a youth, who reportedly was in a group that allegedly invaded and damaged a black family's home on Staten Island Aug. 16 was dismissed Tuesday by Judge Theodore Barlow in the State Supreme Court in Staten Island.

title: The Mets and Jets on Barren Turf
description: Conventional wisdom has It that the battle Waterloo was won on the playing fields of Eton. New York's battle for survival may not be so bloody, .but certainly a part of it must be won on the playing fields of Shea. The threat of further loss to the city's prestige and fiscal health should elicit more cheerful cooperation than so far shown by the management of the baseball Mets and the football Jets, joint occupants of the cityowned Shea Stadium. Since the Mets got there first, and hold the most comfortable seats, a larger share of real team spirit will be asked of them if the Jets are to stay in town.

title: College Results
Rhodesia and the Diplomacy of Chrome
description: At last, the economic underbrush around the issue importing chrome from Rhodesia can be cleared away. For years it was successfully argued that American industrial and strategic interests required continuing the chrome imports, even in violation of a United Nations economic boycott of Prime Minister Ian Smith's white Government. But now it is plain that the impact of a boycottor no boycottis minimal, for both the United States and Rhodesia. That leaves clear and freestanding the diplomatic interest of the United States, and we applaud the Carter Administration for urging Congress promptly to vote to honor the boycott of Rhodesia.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: United Airlines Assails a Proposal For Discount CoasttoCoast Fare.
description: United Airlines branded as dangerous and potentially devastating yesterday an American Airlines proposal for new discount fares between New York and California that would lower the price of a roundtrip ticket from $412 to $227 if booked a month in advance.

title: TRW Net at Quarter and Year Peaks
description: TRW Inc., a widely diversified industrial company, reported yesterday increases of 16.4 percent in fourthquarter profits.

title: FED NOTE PURCHASE LIFTS BOND PRICES
description: The credit markets moved toward higher prices and lower interest rates yesterday as the Federal Reserve purchased Treasury notes and bonds and as the corporate sector took in stride the sale of a $150 million block of highgrade bonds offered by Scudder, Stevens & Clark, a leading investment counseling firm. The Federal Reserve first came into the market to enter into overnight repurchase agreements with Government securities dealers and later it purchased couponbearing Treasury securities for its own accountactions that inject reserves into the banking system and tend to push interest rates down.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Anaconda Output Cut 10% Due to Drought
description: The Anaconda Company became the second aluminum producer to announce production cutbacks in the Pacific Northwest because of the growing drought conditions in the area.

title: A Checklist for the Prospective Plant Buyer
description: With the plant boom, everybody and his uncle in the South began growing plants. All that was needed was an old garage with the roof torn off and redubbed a greenhouse, The market is now flooded with contaminated plants from undetermined sources. Here is some advice for the prospective plant buyer:

title: RCA and Kokusai Unveil A HighSpeed Printer
description: RCA Global Communications Inc., and Kokusai Denshin Denwa Company, Ltd. (KDD) of Japan demonstrated here yesterday a new highspeed, high resolution facsimile system that can deliver a printed page in 26 seconds. The new system, designated QuickFax, is aimed especially at eliminating translation problems for Far Eastern and other businessmen who do not use Roman letters in their daily transactions by permitting transmission of documents in the original languages.

title: Senate Farm Bill Can Cost Billions, Budget Office Says
description: WASHINGTON Feb. 16The Federal costs of a new farm program like one now before the Senate could he substantial, running into several billions of dollars. a study by the Congressional Budget Office said today.

title: Books of the Times
description: LANCELOT. By Walker Percy. 257 pages. Farrar, Straus & Giroux. $8.95.

title: Auto Output Expected to Increase 22.3% in Week to 198,246 Units
description: DETROIT, Feb. 16American auto production is expected to total 198,246 units this week, an increase of 22.3 percent fro' last week's 162,114, according to the trade paper Automotive News. It said that output would be 11.2 percent ahead of the 178,776 cars built in the yearearlier level.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n;
description: AT LANDOVER, MD.

title: Seized After a Rally
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Feb. 16 (UPI)The Anglican Archbishop of Uganda, Burundi and Rwanda and two Government ministers have been arrested in an alleged plot to overthrow President Idi Amin, the Uganda radio announced today.

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: Horses listed in order of Post positions

title: American and European To Team Up in Space in 80
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 16 (AP) An American scientist and a European scientist are to fly in orbit together when the first Spacelab is launched in 1980, the National Aeronautics Space Administration said today.

title: Panel Delays Action on Sprague; Gonzalez Terms Him Deceitful
description: WASHINGTON.Feb. 16Overriding the objections of its chairman, the House Select Committee on Assassinations adjourned today without discussing what action should be taken regarding its controversial general counsel, Richard A. Sprague.

title: Belmonte Sweating Out Another Comeback
description: A few years ago, Eddie Belmonte was riding high as one of America's top moneywinning jockeys. His mounts were earning $2 million or more every season, and the flamboyant Puerto Ricanbred rider was paying as much as $1,000 apiece for fancy custommade suits of velvet, silk and ruffled lace. He used to have them whipped up just to wear at parties before and after important stakes races, and frequently they matched the colors of the racing silks he would be wearing in the big race. Now the suits hang unused in Belmonte's closets, and the overweight jockey spends his afternoons at Aqueduct sweating in the steam room or watching 16yearold Steve Cauthen boot home winners.

title: JOHN F. DOWD DEAD; EXTIME AIDE WAS 60
description: John F. Dowd, chief editorial counsel for Time Inc. for 28 years until his retirement in 1973, died Tuesday in Massachusetts General Hospital, Boston, after suffering from heart disease. He lived in Plymouth, N. H., and was 60 years old.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Two New Jersey companies have entered guilty pleas to Federal charges that they fraudulently sold jewelry and cosmetics through the mails to more than one million women. The companies, MakeUp Club of America Inc. of Elizabeth and RPHI Inc. of Short Hills, admitted that they had placed misleading advertising for $1 cosmetic packages in such magazines as McCall's, Redbook and Seventeen.

title: Rep. Brooks Sets March Hearings On Carter's Reorganization Plan
description: WASHINGTON,Feb. 16 (UPI)Reprasentative Jack Brooks, Texas Democrat who is chairman of the House Government Operations Committee, said today that although he opposed President Carter's government reorganization plan he would begin hearings on it March 1.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: AT PITTSBURGH

title: Shift in Obscenity Trial Barred
description: WICHITA, Kan., Feb. 16 (AP)A lawyear for Al Goldstein, the publisher of Screw Magazine, has lost a bid to have an obscenity trial moved from Wichita, to New York. United States District Court Judge Frank Theis yesterday denied the motion by Herald Fahringer for a change of venue and scheduled the trial for April 13.

title: Vance Opposes a Seat for P.L.O. At Talks Unless It Accepts Israel
description: JERUSALEM. Feb. 16Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance said today that until the Palestine Liberation Organization revised its national charter to recognize Israel's right to exist it, had no basis for participation in a conference on the Middle East.

title: Judge Bars Reporter, A Woman in Trousers
description: LONDON, Feb. 16 (AP)Judge Marcus AnwylDavies ordered a woman reporter out of his court here today for wearing trousers.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: Front Page 1  No Title

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Article 2  No Title

title: Stage: Skilled American Buffalo
description: Certainly the most curious and perhaps the most interesting thing about David Mamet's drama American Buffalo, which opened at the Ethel Barrymore Theater last night, is that it is a comedy about violence, and a play about action that is curiously inactive. Yet it is also one of the foulestmouthed plays ever staged, at a time when very few writers produce dialogue that actually smells of roses. Yet it holds the attention, is often very funny and is at times exciting.

title: Washington & Business
description: WASHINGTONIn an era of minicomputers and multinational conglomerates, the individual inventor might be assumed to be a relic of a simpler time.

title: $2 Million NBC Pact Is Set as a Settlement With Women of Staff
description: Specific goals for the hiring and promoting of women by the National Broadcasting Company were included in a $2 million agreement that was presented in court yesterday as a proposed settlement of a sex discrimination suit by women employees of NBC.

title: CARLOS PELLICER DIES; MEXICAN POET WAS 77
description: MEXICO CITY, Feb. 16 (UPI)Carlos Pellicer, the poet and critic, died today at the age of 77. He had been taken to hospital yesterday afternoon suffering from hypertension.

title: NaturalGas Prices
description: MILWAUKEEA great deal of confusion exists in the public mind regarding the naturalgas shortage and the price increase approved by the Federal Power Commission, now being contested in the courts. For clarification, let us consider a few fundamental facts.

title: JULES G. HAFT DIES AT 78, SPECIALIST ON BIG BOARD
description: Jules G. Haft, a financier and philanthropist who was a partner and vice president of Robb, Peck, McCooey & Company Inc., trading specialists on the New York Stock Exchange, died Tuesday night at his home in Palm Beach, Fla. He was 78 years old.

title: Women Restaurant Cooks in Paris Strike Back
description: PARISFemale cooks in restaurants in France are successfully using their own national association to further the cause of women's haute cuisine.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: 1984 Olympics Delusion
description: Expressions of disbelief emerged from Olympic observers yesterday over Governor Carey's remarks about bringing the 1984 Summer Olympic Games to New York City.

title: Health Projects Approved
description: TRENTON, Feb. 16 (AP)The State Health Department has approved certificates of need for 25 health facility projects around the state with a combined estimated cost of $12.2 million. State Health Commissioner Dr. Joanne E. Finely said yesterday the renovation of the critical care unit at St. James Hospital in Newark would cost $1.1 million.

title: Falstaff and Dixie Brewing Face Charges of Bribery in Louisiana
description: NEW ORLEANS. Feb. 16The Falstaff Brewing Corporation, based in San Francisco, was charged today by a Federal grand jury with conspiring with a New Orleans brewery and a beer industry lobbyist to use a $30,000 bribe to obtain the passage in 1974 of a Louisiana law that has saved the two companies $900,000.

title: Chile Plans Foreign Debt Payment
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Feb. 16 (UPI)The Chilean Government plans to pay $$00 million of its foreign debt this year, Economics Minister Pablo Baraona announced today. Mr. Baraona said that this country would not need to renegotiate the payments due in 1977. Chile's foreign debt is calculated at $4.5 billion.

title: Radio
description: 67. A.M., WNCNSinfonia from La Senna Festiggiante. Vivaldi: Sonata in C minor, Handel; Waltz in A, Dvorak; Gavotte from 1phigenia in Aulis, Gluck; Flute Sonata. J.C. Bach; Overture to L'Inganno Felice, Rossini.

title: Notes on People
description: Rosalynn Carter agreed yesterday to be a patron of the Marion Anderson salute, to be held Feb. 27, the contralto's 75th birthday, at Carnegie Hall. Mrs. Carter will sit with Miss Anderson in her bo:; during the benefit concert, sponsored by Young Audiences, nonprofit organization devoted to introducing millions of young people each year to classical music, theater and dance. Featured in the concert will be Leontyne Price, Clamma Dale and Shirley Verrett. Miss Anderson, who has been in poor health, is expected to come here for the salute from her sister's home in Philadelphia.

title: Mark Twain Returns to Vassar
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N.Y., Feb. 16Mark Twain, who described his 1885 visit to Vassar as ghastly, has just become the pride of the old college.

title: Uncle Sam as Sugar Daddy Again
description: Our Secretary of Agriculture, Bob Bergland, has quite a sweet tooth, developed, it seems, while he represented the Minnesota sugar beet country in Congress, and oversensitive to any difficulty in the domestic sugar industry. in Federal office now, he might chew over the fact that most Americans are consumers, not producers, of sugar.

title: Carter Job Stimulation And New Inflation Fear
description: There are three major inhibitions on the Carter Administration's effort to stimulate the economy enough to cure unemployment. The first is fear of reigniting inflation. Consumer prices have slowed down from the doubledigit rates of 1974 but are still rising at an annual rate of about 5 percent. The second worry is about rising interest rates. For instance,

title: People and Business
description: John F. O'Leary, Federal Energy Administrator, told the House energy and power subcommittee yesterday that the strategic oil reserve program is an embargo Insurance policy for America.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: SOURCE AND SAFARI Gail Rubin's new collection of 42 color photographs of wildlife from Biblical times, now on view through April 24 at the Jewish Museum, is the result of a onewoman camera trek across Israel, with the Hebrew Bible as reference guidebook.

title: Diomedes Olivio, ExReliever, Dead at 56 in Santo Domingo
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic, Feb. 16 (AP)Diomedes Olivo, a former major league relief pitcher, died of heart attack yesterday at the Santo Domingo Hospital center. He was 56 years old.

title: Alleged Boeing Payments In Japan at $16.7 Million
description: The amount of questionable transactions allegedly made by the Boeing Aircraft Company in Japan was put at $16.7 million by Hiroichi Sakai, a member of the Clean Government Party, according to a United Press International report from Tokyo.

title: General Foods Budget Switch
description: General Foods announced yesterday that it was taking $480,000 out of its regular TV network advertising budget and putting it into the Operation Prime Time, an MCATV syndication. Universal Studies will produce six onehour dramas from Testimony of Two Men. the Taylor Caldwell novel. They will run in prime time on weekday nights in May.

title: JACOB FRIEDMAN
description: Jacob Friedman, president of Charles F. Guyon Inc., a tubular steel products company in New York City, and also head of the A. & J. Friedman Supply Company of Passaic, N. J., died Monday in Doctors Hospital after a long illness. He lived at 475 Park Avenue and was 79 years old.

title: South Africa Tells Catholic Schools to Oust Nonwhites
description: JOHANNESBURG, Feb. 16 (UPI)The administrator of Transvaal Province today ordered integrated Roman Catholic schools to expel their nonwhite students by the end of this week. The church refused.

title: CeaseFire in the Southern Philippines Is Holding, but There Are Serious Doubts About Its Lasting
description: COTABATO, Philippines, Feb. 16Watchful by day, tense at night and anxious about the future, the Moslems and Christians of the most troubled region of the Philippines live under a ceasefire that the Government of President Ferdinand E. Marcos tells them will be turned into lasting peace. They have their doubts.

title: Amtrak Accuses Coleman of Derailing Its Progress
description: WASHINGTON, FEB. 16Amtrak, the national rail passenger system, says that the Ford Administration's Transportation Secretary deliberately impeded its progress and ignored or undermined the intent of Congress far a countrywide passenger service.

title: Cummins Unit to Expand
description: The Cummins Engine Company of Columbus, Ind., announced that its British unit would build a $51 million diesel engine plant at Shotts, Scotland. Construction is scheduled to start in the next few months. By 1980, the plant is expected to be producing 90 heavyduty engines a day. When in full production, the plant will provide 1,200 jobs.

title: Snow Falls in Tallahassee, Fla.
description: TALLAHASSEE; Fla., Feb. 16 (UPI)Up to an inch of snow fell in sections of Tallahassee and Leon County over a 20minute period today. Toni Rush, a National Weather Service meteorologist, said that the snow extended in a band 15 miles wide north into portions of south Georgia.

title: NEW M. A. C. POWERS PROPOSED BY BEAME AS FISCAL SOLUTION
description: Roping to break a deadlock on New York City's debt problems, Mayor Beame proposed yesterday that the Municipal Assistance Corporation be given new power to go to court to force the city to balance its budget and adhere to strict fiscal controls in the years ahead.

title: New Rochelle Acts To Improve Image By Ordering Study
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y. Feb. 16New Rochelle, beset by a troubled reputation even before Monday's rampage by a racist killer, decided last night to spend $10,000 to improve its image.

title: E.R.A Progressing Slowly Despite Some Reversals
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16Despite offorts to prevent or reverse its ratification, the Equal Rights Amendment to give women constitutional protection against discrimination appears to be progressing slowly.

title: NEW HOUSING STARTS FELL 27% IN JANUARY, RECORD DURING MONTH
description: Further evidence of the slowdown in the nation's economic recovery caused by the recent cold wave was provided yesterday when the Commerce Department reported a record 27 percent decline in the number of new houses begun during January.

title: TRUDEAU STRESSES SPENDING RESTRAINT
description: OTTAWA, Feb. 16Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau's Government, facing public pressure to control inflation and stimulate employment, today announced spending estimates that promised to hold official expenditures in the next fiscal year to the lowest rate of increase in several years.

title: David Jay Bachrach Dead at 73, Past Head of Osteopathic Society
description: Dr. David Jay Bachrach, a past president of the New York Society of Osteopathic Physicians and Surgeons and the New York State Osteopathic Society, died Tuesday in Leroy Hospital after a short illness. He lived at 245 East 63d Street, and was 73 years old.

title: Opera Guild to Screen Old Clips
description: Film clips of 10 famous opera stars of the second quarter of the 20th century will be shown at Alice Tully Hall on March 10. The Metropolitan Opera Guild in association with the American Film Institute will present the special program.

title: Nuggets Build Early Margin, Trounce Nets;
description: DENVER, Feb. 16 (AP)Bobby Jones hit nine of 10 fieldgoal attempts, and finished with 23 points tonight as the Denver Nuggets crushed the New York Nets, 116102.

title: Schlesinger Calls Strip Mining Bill Prerequisite to an Energy Plan
