The town is that still rare American urban beast: the city that can provide the performing arts at a high level for a large community. In Europe such cities are common, in the United States they may be somethine of an endangered species.

title: Grammy TV Show Is Smooth but a Bit Silly
description: Give an awardto anyone, anywhereand television will carry the event. These particular ceremonies, billed as The 19th Annual Grammy Awards have been concocted for the recording industry. The production was flawed with technical difficulties, most notably in an elaborate and expensive liveviasatellite transmission of Stevie Wonder from Nigeria.

title: Spaniards in Emergency Takeover Of 4thLargest Puerto Rican Bank
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation announced today an emergency takeover of Banco Economias, a $183 million Puerto Rican institution, by Spain's second largest bank.

title: In Memoriam
description: KAHANE. Manfred S. Feb. 21, 1969. More than yesterday, less than tomorrow. Also remembering you on your birthday, Frb. 28. Loving wife, Eilly and devoted daughter, Vivian.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: A photograph published in Saturday's Times was incorrectly identified as that of Mayor Jesse P. Miller of Highland Park, Mich. The photograph actually showed Sylvester Bost, the director of human relations for Highland Park,

title: CALIFORNIA PONDERS THE UNTHINKABLE
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 20California officials are urging local communities to think the unthinkable'to prepare for the possibility that terrorists or others Might obtain nuclear weapons and use that threat for extortion.

title: Exploring for Gas, in the Attic
description: Exploring for natural gas in the attics of America? It's not a mad notion but a practical idea, based on the fact that the biggest gas supply known, a third bigger than that in Alaska, is the gas wasted because of inadequate insulation in American homes. It is possible to recover that gas at half or less the cost of Alaska gas. Especially after the Ford Administration's emphasis on production rather than conservation, we're delighted to hear the Carter Administration begin to talk about it. But why just talk? Why not capitalize on the present, precious stimulating power of the public sense of crisis?

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: GENERAL

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Article 4  No Title

title: Opera FansUndeterred by TearGas Incident
description: People lined up as usual yesterday at the Metropolitan Opera for tickets to tonight's performance of Meyerbeer's Le Prophete, apparently undisturbed by the setting off a tear gas canister Saturday night in the Lincoln Center lobby.

title: Western Governors Upset by Plan To Cut Funds for Water Projects
description: DENVER, Feb. 20Top officials of 18 Western states who came here today to meet with Secretary of the Interior Cecil D. Andrus on the drought expressed shock, anger and astonishment over the Administration's proposed plans to cut from the next Federal budget funds for 18 major water projects around the country.

title: scientists at Tokyo University Say They Launched Satellite Into Orbit
description: TOKYO, Feb. 20 (UPI)  Tokyo University scientists said yesterday that they had successfully launched an experimental satellite into orbit around the earth.

title: Scranton Named to Head U.N. Group
description: A committee of the united Nations Association of the United States has unanimously nominated William W. Scranton, the former chief United States delegate to the United Nations, to be the group's next chairman, the association announced in New York yesterday. Mr. Scranton would succeed James S. McDonnell, the chairman of the McDonnell Douglas Corporation.

title: From the Police Blotter:
description: A 39 year  old Brooklyn man was shot critically by the police outside the 71st Precinct station house in the Crown Heights section when he allegedly pointed a revolver at two officers and pulled the trigger three times. The gun misfired each time, the police said, and the officers shot Charles Pearson, of 1540 President Street, who was taken to Kings County Hospital. . . . James McCloskey, an attendant at a gas station at 5805 Broadway at 238th Street in the Bronx. accidentally discharged a rifle and killed an acquaintance. Andrew Crupp, 17, of 269 West 254th Street, the Bronx, according to the police, who said the case would be sent to a grand jury. Mr. McCloskey, 22, of 4996 Broadway, was said to have kept the rifle at the station for protection. . . . Thomas Sullivan, 27, a security guard licensed to carry a gun, shot and killed Jose 0. Jordan, 37, of 2371 Second Avenue, Manhattan, in an automatic laundry at 9532 Northern Boulevard, East Elmhurst, Queens. The police said Mr. Jordan, who had a record of 15 previous arrests, had drawn a gun, fired a shot and was attempting to rob the laundry owner when he was slain.

title: Advertising
description: Once the research in the marketplace had been completed and the client had decided on an advertising solution, it did what any client would do: It went looking for an advertising agency.

title: Meadowlands
description: Horses listed in order of Post positions

title: Carter Teaches Sunday School Class
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20 (UPI)President Carter told a Sunday school class today that he saw very close parallels between his own attitude in life and that of a biblical man who refused to give up his wealth for God.

title: PROJECTS A BURDEN TO MOSCOW ALLIES
description: VIENNAMoscow's allies in Eastern Europe are having trouble fulfilling their commitments regarding big investment projects in the Soviet bloc, a study by experts on Communist economies shows.

title: Lovely Skin and Hair Apres Ski
description: The forecast on the slopes is for snow, followed by skiers wearing chapped faces and stringy hair. There's no doubt that skiing does wonderful things for the figure. But all that wintry atmosphere plays havoc with complexions and with hair that's confined under a closefitting cap for hours.

title: Chess:
description: TORREMOLINOS, SpainGrandmaster Florin Gheorghiu of Rumania, Larry Christiansena new international master, from Modesto, Calif.and I were tied for first place after eight rounds of the Costa del Sol International Tournament here in the Cervantes Hotel. We had each scored 5 points in the 13round event.

title: Nat'l Hockey League.
description: AT PITTSBURGH

title: Happy Birthday to Red Blaik
description: Col. Earl Henry Blaik, U.S.A. (Ret.), celebrated his 80th birthday last week, more than somewhat to his surprise. It wasn't the discovery that he was 80 that surprised him, but rather the fact that he celebrated at all, and especially the way he celebrated.

title: Beaten and Threatened, Prostitute Turns In Her Man
description: The other day Marie J. turned in a man she said was her pimp. The lanky, browneyed, 16yearold street prostitute said she was tired of working 15 hours a day and then having to turn over most of her $300 trap (profit) to him.

title: China Names a Rails Chief
description: PEKING, Feb. 20 (Reuters)China has named a new minister, Tuan Chunyi, to take charge of the factionally troubled administration of the nation's railroads, Hsinhua, the official press agency, reported tonight. Mr. Than is to replace Wan Li, a political moderate who was dismissed last year in a drive against rightists, and later restored to office.

title: BROADER CONTROLS ON ENERGY STUDIED BY CARTER PLANNERS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20  To most Americans, energy conservation means turning down the heat, shutting off the ornamental gas lamp in front of the house and obeying the speed limit of 55 miles an hour.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: A dispatch in The Times of Jan. 19 from the Panama Canal Zone incorrectly attributed to Louis J. Fattorosi, an official of the A.F.L.C.I.O., a statemcn: that the integration of children of West Indian descent into the school system there was a reason for the high esignation rate of canal pilots. The statement was made by Leonard Bell, a pilot.

title: Black Republicans
description: WASHINGTONHow is the Republican Party going to get up off the floor? What voter groups, now solidly Democratic, offer some hope for disaffection from President Carter?

title: Rio's Streets Jammed By Carnival Dancers
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Feb. 20 (Reuters) Rio de Janeiro exploded into a sea of color and a barrage of noise tonight as tens of thousands of people danced the samba through the streets for the preLenten Carnival.

title: QUESTIONS REMAIN ON TOXIN IN RIVER
description: HUNTINGTON, W. Va., Feb. 20The Huntington HeralaDispatch said it this morning with a picture: a panoramic view of the Ohio River stretching across page 1. Superimposed on the river was huge, black question mark.

title: A Cincinnati Basketball Star Is Held In the Robbery of Decoy Policeman
description: A freshman star guard for the nationally ranked University of Cincinnati basketball team was arraigned in Queens yesterday on charges of robbing a decoy policeman who was disguised as an old man.

title: Leonard Silk
description: Wall Street has been suffering from a case of inflationary jitters. These were aggravated last week by news of the jump of eighttenths of 1 percent in consumer prices in January. For those determined to achieve maximum anxiety, eighttenths of I percent can he multiplied by 12 months to give an annual rate of inflation of 9.6 percent. And inflationary fears can be compounded by expectations of a tighter Federal Reserve monetary policy, sharply rising interest rates anddespite President Carter's reassurances to the contraryprice controls.

title: 8 Upstate Towns Weigh Proposal To Use City Sludge as Fertilizer
description: A group of eight Columbia and Dutchess County towns is giving serious consideration to a plan to take some of New York City's sewage sludge and turn it into a composted product for application to soil in parks and forests.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Winter's 8th Storm, Freakish and Loud, Intrudes on Holiday
description: A wrumsical storm, wan temperatures flirting about the freezing level, pelted the metropolitan area with alternating falls of snow, sleet and hail yesterday and drew some weatherweary New York City residents to their windows when produced some unlikely thumps of thunder as well as some lightning.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Zukerman Recital Is Marked By Ravishingly Pretty Sound
description: Pinchas Zukerman is the most amiable, sweettempered of violinists, one who seems incapable of making a strident tone or curving a phrase without a suavely elegant caress. His recital yesterday afternoon at Fisher Hall with Marc Neikrug at the piano consisted of music that mostly suited his temperament. It may have been a bit limited in mood and a shade somnolent here and there, but the sounds were never less than ravishingly pretty.

title: Deaths
description: APPLEBAUMden. Beloved husband of Anna. Loving lather of Arierie ssreen berg. Cnerlsned brother of Mary lancer, Paula Greenfield and Roslyn Applebaum. Uevo.ed gianurather of Andrea and Laurie. Services Tuesday, 1 P.M. The Riverside, Brooklyn, Ocean Pkwy at Prospect Park.

title: Carter Tells of Concern
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20 (UPI)President Carter today endorsed the opinion of his chief delegate to the United Nations that the deaths of Archbishop Luwum and the two Cabinet ministers were assassinations. A message from the President was read by the Episcopal Bishop, John Walker, at a memorial service at Washington Cathedral.

title: Esposito's 2d Goal Wins in Final Period
description: Using the shower room as an echo chamber for a booming rendition of Happy Birthday, the Rangers congratulated Phil Esposito last night on his 35th birthday and on his tie breaking goal that enabled New York to beat the Detroit Red Wings, 32, The Rangers captain twice put his team in the lead and his second goal, the winner, came with 10:51 remaining in the National Hockey League game at Madison Square Garden.

title: Homeowners Seek Insulation Answers
description: Insulation may be good for America, but for homeowners, a dollar spent isn't always a penny saved.

title: A Most Ingenious Paradox
description: BOSTONFederal law establishes a policy objective for the country: to reduce air pollution, for instance, or hire more women and minorities. In trying to enforce the policy, the Government should have an easier time persuading its own agencies than private industries.

title: Lawsuit Says Police Radar Poses a Health Hazard
description: TULSA, Okla., Feb. 20 (AP)Woody Bussey has filed a lawsuit to stop the police from using radar, which he contends is a health hazard, to monitor traffic speed.

title: Mrs. Ford Comments on Carter
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Feb. 20 (UPI)Betty Ford was asked how she felt about President Carter advising Government employees, who were living in sin to get married.

title: F.A.L.N. Blast Suspect May Be Disguised as Woman
description: The New York City police said yesterthat a fugitive suspected of belonging to a Puerto Rican terrorist bomb group and of having had a bomb factory in his home might have disguised himself as a woman while in hiding.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: Article 5  No Title

title: Judy Rankin's 69208 Wins by 5 Strokes
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 20 (UPI) Judy Rankin shot a finalround 69 today and captured the $50,000 Orange'Blo'som Golf classic by five strokes. She had a 54hole total of 208, eight under par, to earn To the 57,500 first prize.

title: Salvadoran Opposition Charges Government With Election Violence
description: SAN SALVADOR, Feb. 20 (Reuters)The centerleft opposition accused the Government today of beating or arresting hundreds of its men as voters In El Salvador took part in a presidential election.

title: Industry Hopes for Revival Of Investment Tax Credits
description: American industry is hoping that the Senate will restore the tax incentives for new investment President Carter included in his economic stimulus proposals, but which the House Ways and Means Committee cut out last week.

title: Andrew E. Mishkin Weds Ellen Lister
description: Ellen Barbara Lister, daughter of Prof. and Mrs. William Gordon Lister of Huntington, L. L, was married at noon yesterday to Andrew E. Mishkin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Michael Mishkin of Manhattan.

title: Mayor Establishes Arts and Culture Awards
description: Mayor Beame announced yesterday the establishment of the Mayor's Awards of Honor in Arts and Culture, to be presented each year to outstanding individuals for distinguished achievement.

title: Election Campaign In India Takes On A Whirlwind Pace
description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 20India's political leaders fanned out across the country this weekend, opening whirlwind tours that will occupy much of the three and a half weeks between now and the parliamentary election.

title: Weissenberg's Adroit Pianism
description: Alexis Weissenberg is a pianist of such relentless brilliance that his performance can hypnotize anyone who knows the keyboard and its problems. The Bulgarianborn virtuoso surmounts difficulties without seeming effort, even when the case under study is so fearsome a monster as Rachmaninoff's Concerto No. 3 in D minor, which he performed at Carnegie Hall yesterday afternoon with Michael Tilson Thomas and the Buffalo Philharmonic.

title: The Facts Still Speak for Amnesty
description: As President Carter's advisers study the next and, we hope, final step in the matter of the pardon for violators of the draft and other military statutes during the Vietnam War, they will inevitably come under heavy pressure to temper mercy with vengefulness. The President's pardon thus far covers only draft resisters, leaving unresolved the fate of deserters and of recipients of lessthanhonorable discharges.

title: Msgr. J. Emmett McDonald at 71; Was Pastor of Church in Queens
description: Msgr. J. Emmett McDonald, pastor emeritus of St. Robert Bellarmine Roman Catholic Church in Bayside, Queens, died Thursday after a short illness at Flushing Hospital. He was 71 years old.

title: U.S. Testing Six New Windmills As a Source of Power for Farms
description: ROCKY FLATS. Colo., Feb. 20On the barren Great Plains here today the Federal Government unveiled six little windmills straining at the knots of breeze sweeping from the Rockies in an experiment testing the thesis that, for some energy requirements, smaller may be better.

title: Steele Captures Ski Jumping in Michigan
description: ISHPEMING, Mich., Feb. 20In recent years rarely have Midwestern jumpers been outclassed at a major tournament in their backyard, but such a development occurred today at the 90th annual Suicide Hill skijumping event. Competing in temperatures that remained in the midteens all afternoon, Ron Steele of Lcvenworth, Wash., and Walter Malmquist of Post Mills, Vt.finished one, two in Class A after a tight struggle.

title: Churches Urged to Challenge Amin
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Feb. 20 (AP)More than 1,000 worshipers, some weeping openly, packed Nairobi's All Saints Cathedral today to mourn the death of Archbishop Janani Luwum of Uganda. The Methodist Bishop of Kenya declared that it was time for the church to speak out against President Idi Amin's regime in Uganda.

title: Pennsylvania Pork and Public Works
description: To help stimulate the economy and create jobs, President Carter is proposing to allocate $4 billion for public worksthe construction of new schools, sewers, roads and whatever else local governments would like from a Federal list of qualified projects. At the moment. the list of eligible projects is about $22 billion long, so spending the money should present no problems. But Congress finding problems anyway.

title: O'Neill Defends Congress Raise
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20 (AP)House Speaker Thomas P. O'Neill Jr., defending the pay rise for members of Congress this weekend, said today that sometimes it was in the best interests of the nation for Congress to vote against the will of the people.

title: National
description: The $120.3 billion defense budget approved by President Carter for the next fiscal year, which will go to Congress Tuesday, is $2.75 billion smaller than $123.1 billion budget proposed by former President Ford, Administration sources said. It also is an increase of more than $10 billion over the $110 billion budget for fiscal 1977, which ends Sept. 30. In his campaign, the President had pledged to reduce defense spending by $5 billion to $7 billion. Both he and his spokesmen have since maintained that he meant a cutback not from the present Ford budget but from the new and higher Ford budget. This was impossible, the sources acknowledged. [1:6.]

title: Trudeau Expected to Tell Carter That Quebec Separatists Will Fail
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20In the absence of any major issues between Ottawa and Washington, the question of Quebec separatism is expected to be the dominant subject of Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau's talks with President Carter here tomorrow and Tuesday.

title: Edward J. Green, Former Officer Of Westinghouse Air Brake Co.
description: PITTSBURGH. Feb. 20Edward J. Green, a former vice president of the Westinghouse Air Brake Company, died today in West Penn Hospital. He was 68 years old.

title: Market Place
description: Various kinds of news can send the price of a stock soaring in Wall Street: sharp earnings gains; a hefty dividend increase combined with plans for a stock split, or, for oil exploration companies, the announcement of a new field.

title: ANKER DEPUTY LEANS TOWARD RESIGNATION
description: Dr. Bernard R. Gifford said yesterday that he had all but decided to leave his $50,000  a  year post as deputy chancellor of the New York City school system because he felt the Board of Education had failed to give proper support to his efforts to fight corruption and make needed changes in the system.

title: VANCE FINDS SYRIANS DOUBT AN EARLY PACT
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Feb. 20Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance, after receiving support for his mediation efforts from Saudi Arabia, arrived here today to learn that Syria doubts quick progress can be made toward a Middle East solution.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: It is a biological fact that I am in my 30's and that people my age tend to be less protective and less tolerant than older people of what they regard as wrong. Everybody tells me that the condition will pass. In the meantime, I intend to do what I think is right. Dr. Bernard R. Gifford, who has all but decided to quit as deputy chancellor of the New York city school system because he believes the Board of Education has failed to give proper support to his efforts to fight corruption. [36:5.]

title: Philadelphia Publishers Consider Guild Proposal
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 20 (UP)The publishers of The Philadelphia Inquirer and Daily News, hit by a strike almost two weeks ago, will consider tomorrow,a second counterproposal by the Newspaper Guild of Greater Philadelphia.

title: Demonstrators at Nursing Home Protest Medicaid Bed Shortage
description: GUTTENBURG, Feb. 20The son of an 86yearold widow led a demonstration today against a nursing home to protest the shortage of Medicaid beds that is keeping his mother in a hospital weeks after she should have left.

description: One of the most complex international military problems that faces President Carter and his Secretary of Defense, Harold L. Brown, is the modernization and reorganization of the tactical nuclear weapons force committed to the North

title: Reporter's Notebook: Vance's Style on Mideast Tour Very Different From Kissinger's
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Feb. 20As Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance winds up his quick trip around the Middle East, all the results are not yet in, but he will probably return to Washington having at least achieved one of his principal aimsintroducing himself to the Arabs and Israelis whose decisions will ultimately shape the future of the region.

description: BASKETBALL

title: VENEZUELANS ARE DENYING PEREZ WAS PAID BY C.I.A.
description: CARACAS, Venezuela,. Feb. 20 (AP)Venezuelan officials denied emphatically today a report that President Carlos Andres Perez received payments from the United States Central Intelligence Agency while he was the Interior Minister.

title: NEW YORK HELD FIRST IN U.S. RECESSION AID
description: WASHINGTON,Feb. 20New York State, with the sixth highest unemployment rate among the states, is receiving $55.8 million this quarter in special antirecession Federal funds to rank first in per capita aid, according to an analysis of the national program released today.

title: CARTER TO PROPOSE DEFENSE FUND CUTS AS SIGNAL TO SOVIET
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20The defense budget approved by President Carter includes spending cuts intended to signal restraint to Moscow and to spur strategic arms negotiations, as well as modest increases to improve the combat readiness of Western forces in Central Europe, according to authoritative Administration sources.

title: WASHINGTON'S BIRTHDAY
description: Today is the observance of Washington's Birthday. Public and parochial schools, libraries, post offices, banks, security and commodity markets, government offices, and nearly all business offices will be closed. Most large department and specialty stores will be open. Alternate side of the street parking regulations are suspended for the day in New York City, but all other regulationsincluding those covering parking metersare in effect.

title: Renaissance and Sea Level Give A WellBlended Concert of Rock
description: Renaissance and Sea Level, who gave the second of two Radio City Music Hall performances Saturday night, might have seemed something of a mismatch. Sea Level is the principal offshoot of the old Allman Brothers Bandprincipal in the sense that no other spinoff has ar many as three members  and as such might have been expected to produce downhome Southern rockandroll. Renaissance is a fairytale artrocking ensemble from Britain.

title: The U.S.Stand On Italy's Reds
description: ROME, Feb. 20DurIng the recent visit by Vice President Mondale, a State Department official remarked that American policy toward Italy was basically unchanged under the Carter Administration. That is, Washington prefers to see the Communists kept out of the government, but the decision News is up to the Italians. Still, Analysis some changes are expected. Under the incoming ambassador. Richard N. Gardner, the embassy is likely to widen its contacts with Communists, and in time they may find it easier to enter the United States.

title: DETROIT WILL SET UP PANEL ON MORTGAGES
description: DETROIT, Feb.20This city's mortgage lending community and city leaders have reached agreement on a voluntary program that could significantly reduce the widespread practice called redlining.

description: WASHINGTONBetty McGee is poring over microfilm in the Dayton, Ohio, library. Janette Hoston Harris is taping her family's oral history. Elizabeth ClarkLewis thinks she may be only generation or two away from tracing the birthplace of her greatgreatgrandmother.

description: LONDON, Feb. 20 (AP)Regina Fischer, mother of Bobby Fischer, the former world chess champion, was arrested tonight when she refused to leave a camp bed on which she had maintained a protest vigil outside the British Home Office against the pending deportation of two Americans.

title: Taconite Dust Study Finds Little Effect on Breathing
description: DULUTH, Minn., Feb. 20 (UPI)  A health study commissioned by the Reserve Mining Company says that exposure to taconite dust caused no significant changes in the breathing patterns of wnrkers.

title: Alton Welcomes Sadat Proposal
description: JERUSALEM, Feb. 20 (Reuters)Foreign Minister Yigal Allon of Israel said today that President Sadat's statement that a JordanianPalestinian link should be established before a Geneva conference is held was a step in the right direction.

title: Yarborough Triumphs in Daytona 500 a Second Time
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Feb. 2?Cale Yarborough, who in 1976 finished last in the Daytona 500, the world's richest stockcar race, won its 19th running today, and maybe President Carter has powers not provided for in the Constitution.

title: The Boston Symphony to Play in Montclair
description: MONTCLAIR, Feb. 20On Tuesday night, the 105member Boston Symphony will take a 45minute bus ride from Manhattan to this Essex County community. a year and a half in the planning.

title: Chlorine Gas Escapes From Louisiana Plant
description: PLAQUEMINE, La., Feb. 20 (AP)A cloud of poisonous chlorine gas leaked out of the Dow Chemical Company plant here today but dissipated without forcing major evacuations or causing serious injuries, the authorities said.

description: MONDAY, FEBRUARY 21, 1977

title: Midtown Beat: Stalking the Pimp
description: It was 8:05 P.M. Two plainclothes police officers were patrolling up Eighth Avenue near 52d Street when they spotted what they had been looking for: A parked navy Eldorado with a telephone inside and the initials FEC on the license plates. It was, the officers said, Frank Cruz's pimpmobile

title: 3 TeenAgers and Girl, 3, Found Slain in Australia
description: GYMPIE, Australia, Feb. 20 (Reuters)Three teenagers and a 3yearold girl were found battered to death on a farm near this town in northern Queensland today, according to the police, who said they had been alerted to the killings by a teenaged girl who escaped from the farm.

title: A Furbelow Is Restaged With Elan
description: There was a time, and it lasted up to just before World War I, and maybe a little longer, when the normal outlet for American patriotic sentiment was a clockwise halfturn on the tail of what was still a British lion.

description: LONDONThere are many reasons for the present deplorable state of the British economy and why I don't think it will change.

title: National Jazz Ensemble Opens Fourth Season
description: The National Jazz Ensemble opened its fourth season on Saturday evening at the New School with a program that succinctly set forth the three basic approaches that Chuck Israels, the ensemble's founder and director, is taking to the whole body of the jazz repertory.

title: ALBANY FIGHT LOOMS OVER 2 REGENT POSTS
description: ALBANY, Feb. 20Two vacant seats on the State Board of Regents must be filled by the Legislature in the next two weeks, and if past experience is any guide, there will be a furiously partisan struggle with perhaps a comicopera ending.

title: Clifford Arrives in Ankara For Talks on Cyprus
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Feb. 20(UPI)Clark M. Clifford arrived here today for talks on Cyprus that Turkish newspapers said were mistimed and unnecessary. Government spokesmen said Mr. Clifford could achieve nothing.

title: Ocean County Study Rejects Energy Center
description: PRINCETON, Feb. 20  An energy center of 20 nuclear reactors suggested in the United States Energy Reorganization Act of 1974 would not be acceptable in Ocean County for a variety of technical and political reasons, according to conclusions released today by research teams.

title: Siberian Husky Is Best in Show At Hartford
description: HARTFORD, Feb.20Ginger Scott of Syracuse guided her American and Canadian champion, Dudley's Varska, a Siberian husky to a spectacular bestinshow victory over 1,626 other contenders tonight at the allbreed dog event conducted by the First Company Governor's Foot Guard Athletic Association in the Civic Center.

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: When we recently printed a recipe for that irresistible dessert known as dacquoise, we admitted our total ignorance as to the origin of the title. The morning after there was a telephone call from Meyer Hurwitz, president of the ParisAmerican club, informing us that anyone who knows anything about food, knows that the dessert is named after the town of Dax, a thermal bath station on the Adour River in the Landes region of France, about 30 miles north of Bayonne. Now I know, and apologies to the good people of Dax.

title: South's Black Legislators Develop Harmony With White Colleagues
description: COLUMBIA, S.C., Feb. 20When the South Carolina House of Representatives convened one morning last week, members found homebaked cakes on their desks, sweet reminders from a women's group that opposed adoption of the equal rights amendment.

title: Commodities
description: Much has been said about the bumper supplies of bread and feed grains this season. Indeed, the 197677 season should be the first in five years to produce a comfortable worldwide surplus of grains.

title: Jill Volner to Become General Counsel to the Army
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20Jill Wine Volner, the Watergate assistant special prosecutor, has accepted the position of general counsel to the Department of the Army.

title: Purtzer Edges Wadkins For First Tour Victory
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 20In his fantasies Tom Purtzer figured he would win his first pro golf tournament by staging a rally. Today he had to manufacture a comeback situation. After blowing a threeshot lead he had held at the start of the final round, Purtzer fell one shot behind and then worked his way up through four ties and went on to win the Los Angeles open by one stroke over Lanny Wadkins.

title: U.S. to Push Teamster Fund Inquiry
description: BAL HARBOUR. Fla., Feb. 20The Carter Administration has moved to speed up the Federal Government's long investigation into alleged malpractices in the huge Central States pensio nfund of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters.

title: Employee Suspected In I.B.M. Explosion
description: A small explosion shattered a large plateglass window in the I.B.M. building at 575 Madison Avenue, at 57 Street, at 7:15 last night, causing slight damage, but no casualties, the police reported.

title: Study Ranks New York State No. 1 In PerCapita U.S. Recession Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20New York State, with the sixth highest unemployment rate among the states, is receiving $55.8 million this quarter in special antirecession Federal funds to rank first in percapita aid, according to an analysis of the national orogram released today.

title: BRITISH GOVERNMENT IS FACING KEY TEST
description: LONDON, Feb. 20The House of Commons faces a significant procedural vote tomorrow on a bill to grant limited selfgovernment to Scotland and Wales, a proposal that has dismembered the parliamentary temper if not yet, as its critics fear, the United Kingdom.

title: Bridge:
description: When a slam is in prospect a good player will often make a slightly eccentric bid in a weak suit in the hope of inhibiting a lead. Such maneuvers are safe enough, and hardly qualify as psychic bids in the true sense of the term. But they can sometimes start a train of consequences.in the subsequent bidding and play, and did so on the diagramed deal.

title: International
description: President HafezalAssad of Syria was said to have told Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance that prospects for a Middle East settlement this year were not good unless the United States was prepared to put pressure on Israel to make major concessions after the Israeli elections in May. Mr. Vance and president Assad had a threehour meeting in Damascus as the Secretary neared the end of his Middle East trip. [Page 1, Column 5.]

title: Providence Finds That U.S. Help Sometimes Becomes a Hindrance
description: PROVIDENCE. R.I., Feb. 20Here, the unemployed are more than just statistics. They are men and women who live here, who have names and faces and problems and needs.

title: ANKER DEPUTY LEANS TO LEAVING SCHOOLS
description: Dr, Bernard R. Gifford said yesterday that he had all but decided to leave his $50,000 a  year post as deputy chancellor of the New York City school system because he felt the Board of Education had failed to give proper support to his efforts to fight corruption and make needed changes in the system.

title: WASHINGTON'S BIRTHDAY
description: Today is the observance of Washington's Birthday. Public and parochial schools, libraries, post offices, banks. security and commodity markets, government offices, and nearly all business offices will be closed. Most large department and specialty stores will be open. Alternate side of the street parking regulations are suspended for the day in New York City, but all other regulationsincluding those covering, parking metersare in effect.

title: U.S.TestingSixNewWindmills As a Source of Power for Farms
description: ROCKY FLATS, Colo., Feb. 20On the barren Great Plains here today the Federal Government unveiled six little windmills straining at the knots cf breeze sweeping from the Rockies in an experiment testing the thesis that, for some energy requirements, smaller may be better.

title: Winter's 8th Storm, Freakish and Loud, Intrudes on Holiday
description: A whimsical storm, with temperatures flirting about the freezing level, pelted the metropolitan area with alternating falls of snow, sleet and hail yesterday and drew some weatherweary New York City residents to their windows when produced some unlikely thumps of thunder as well as some lightning.

title: New Corporate Bonds
description: UTILITY BONDS(For week ended Feb.18, 1977)

title: Pravda Article Rejects Comments by Carter
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 20 (AP)The Communist Party newspaper Pravda said today that constructive relations between the United States and the Soviet Union could develop only when each kept out of the other's internal affairs.

title: North Carolina Holds Off Virginia, 66 to 64
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va., Feb. 20 (AP)With Phil Ford, Mike O'Koren and Walter Davis providing virtually all the offense, North Carolina built a 12point halftime lead and held off a late Virginia rally for a 6664 victory in an Atlantic Coast Conference college basketball game today.

title: McGuire Goes Out With Typical Flare at Marquette
description: The act was vintage McGuire. The Marquette coach prowled the sidelines, snarled at the officials, screamed at his players and slammed at the numbered cards used to designate fouls. He. was even assessed his first two technical fouls of the season.

title: Progress, They Say
description: LANCASTER, Pa.I write from a part of unmelted America, where one can stand in the shade of a maple on the edge of an open field of growing crops and breathe clean air, and hear neither plane nor truck for the better part of a morning. Things are different here.

title: Minister for Outreach Program Installed at Riverside Church
description: The Rev. George Thomas was installed yesterday as minister of outreach and institutional relations at Riverside Church, Riverside Drive and 122d Street. The Rev. Dr. Jitsuo Morikawa, senior minister, presided at the service.

title: Kentucky Study Suggest 100 Ways to Save Money
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20 (UPI)Most American families spend more than half their income on food and housing, including utilities, a study by two facuIty members at the University of Kentucky has found.

title: World Hockey Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAM?S

title: Going out Guide
description: HIS OWN THING The first local performance by Son Seals as leader of his own group, tonight through Wednesday at the downtown Bottom Line, has provoked considerable interest in popjazz circles. Writing in The New York Times, Robert Palmer has hailed the musician from Arkansas as the most exciting young blues guitarist and sineer heard in years.

title: Midtown Beat: Stalking the Pimp
description: It was 8:05 P.M. Two plainclothes police officers were patrolling up Eighth Avenue near 52d Street when they spotted what they had been looking for: A parked navy Eldorado with a telephone inside and the initials FEC on the license plates. It was, the officers said, Frank Cruz's pimpmobile.

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: Horses listed in order of post positions Letter Designates OTB listing

title: Electric Utilities Rates of Return Better From Industry Than Home
description: The Electricity Consumers Resource Council reported over the weekend that a survey it conducted had proved that industrial users of electricity produced higher rates of return for utilities than do residential customers.

title: Business/Finance
description: Businessmen are unhappy with the House Ways and Means Committee's deletion of a tax incentive for investment in plant and equipment from President Carter's economic stimulus program and they hope the Senate will restore the incentive. The Ways and Means package does not address this country's longterm need for more productive investment, said Robert C. Holland, president of the Committee for Economic Expansion, which represents many large companies. The Chamber of Commerce of the United States, which has a membership of about 65,000 companies, also does not agree with the change. [33:56.]

title: Hamlin Defeats Dixon, Samara, Wins A.A. U. Eastern Pentathlon
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa., Feb. 20Al Hamlin of Milford, N.J., and College Park, Md., scored 4,113 points, the third highest,total in history, and won the Amateur Athletic Union 1!astern Pentathalon Championship today at Lehigh University's Saucon Field House.

title: Connors, Hurt, Loses Final by Default
description: TORONTO, Feb. 20 (UPI)Jimmy Connors, trying to play with an injured left knee, defaulted his singles final match to Dick Stockton today in the first set of a World Championship Tennis Tournament.

title: 300 Friends of the Subways Give 6 New Stations Token Approval
description: A roving, underground band of more than 300 men and women, identifiable to themselves and curious onlookers by their green labels, hopped on and off trains yesterday behind megaphonewielding guides who led them like pied pipers through the city's most impressive subway stations.

title: Grain StocksHow Ample?
description: A question is raised by a commodity specialist on whether current world gra?n stocks are as ample as market prices seem to indicate. Page 35.

title: Snow Forces Yonkers To Cancel Program
description: YONKERS, N.Y., Feb. 20  Yonkers Raceway canceled its afternoon harness racing program today because of the snowstorm. The nexttolast Sunday program will not he rescheduled since the track's winter program ends with, next Sunday's racing card.

title: Books of The Times
description: You understand automotive mechanics? Very good. Happy for you. But the point is I don't understand them. Never did. And I loved John Jerome's Truck: On Rebuilding a Wornout Pickup, and Other PostTechnological Adventures. Here's Mr. Jerome on the camshaft of a beatup 1950 Dodge he bought for $200 and named the Harry S Truman: The camshaft comes out next, slid

title: Peking Appears To Be Stressing Economic Goals
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 20Four months after China's new leaders came to power, analysts here are becoming increasingly puzzled by what seem to be conflicting signs of the regime's performance.

title: ALBERT NAUD DIES AT 72; LEADING FRENCH LAWYER
description: PARIS, Feb. 20 (AP)Albert Naud, a celebrated French defense lawyer and lifelong opponent of capital punishment, died of a heart attack today in a Paris hospital, doctors said. He was 72.

title: ARCHITECTS CRITICIZE CONSTRUCTION CODE
description: FAIR LAWN, Feb. 20New Jersey architects today urged modifications and adjustments in the state's new uniform construction code to make certain that the law became the boon to the building industry that it was expected to be.

title: City's Food Costs Drop
description: The warming that followed last month's freeze caused a decline in the wholesale prices New York City paid for fresh food for hospitals, jails and other facilities, John T. Carroll, the Municipal Service Administrator, reported, Mr. Carroll said the frigid January weather and snarled deliveries had earlier caused the wholesale prices to shoot up by nearly 14 percent. But, he said, the cost of food purchased last week was down by more than 10 percent.

title: LongTerm Federal Welfare Aid to Indochinese Refugees Is Feared
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20There is some concern here that special Federal assistance to the sizable number of welfare cases among the 145,000 Indochinese refugees in this country might become another unending program of Government handouts.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Article 2  No Title

title: Viking 1 Keeping Daily Rendezvous With Martian Moon, Taking Clos eUp Photos for Clues to Its Origin
description: PASADENA, Calif., Feb. 20The Viking 1 spacecraft, in a change of its orbit around Mars, is now keeping a daily rendezvous with one of the Martian moons, Phobos, and is radioing the first closeup photographic and scientific data from the satellite of another planet.

title: VIOLENCE CONTINUES IN ARGENTINE POLITICS
description: BUENOS AIRES, Feb. 20The third terrorist attempt in less than a year to kill President Jorge Rafael Videla and the kidnapping of a prominent labor leader have dramatized Argentina's continuing political insecurity and violence.

title: Dividend Meetings
description: Partial list Of scheduled meetings for week follows:

title: Metropolitan
description: Police morale in New York City is apparently worsening, along with absenteeism and job performance, as internal dissension has risen after almost two years of budget and personnel cuts. The malaise seems to be spreading from the lower ranks to the lieutenants, captains and inspectors, troubled by a freeze on promotions and discouragement about future advancement. These problems and their possible effects on crime control may become an issue in this year's mayoral race. [1:12]

title: Soviet, French Also Have Mideast Envoys
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon. Feb. 20 While Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance has been touring the Middle East, envoys have been sent to the area by France and the Soviet Union.

title: Jan De Gaetani, Mezzo, Enthralls With Never a Note Out of Scale
description: Jan De Gaetani has been creating a good deal of excitement with her recitals this season at the Grace Rainey Rogers Auditorium. Saturday night she sang the last of her three concerts there, and one can only subscribe to the breathless accounts of the previous ones.

title: Ondine Captures Lipton Cup In 110Mile Sail Off Florida
description: MIAMI, Feb. 20Ondine, Huey Long's pale blue whale out of New York, sailed around the Lipton Cup course as swiftly as a stock car zooming around the speedway at Daytona and today was declared the overall winner of the 110mile race which begun on Friday and ended here yesterday.

title: News Summary
description: MONDAY, FEBRUARY 21, 1977

title: Campaigners for Rabin and Peres Sure Their Candidates Will Win
description: TEL AVIV, Feb. 20With 72 hours remaining in the contest for the leadership of Israel's ruling Labor Party, the campaign headquarters of Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin and of his challenger, Defense Minister Shimon Peres, both said they had the election sewed up.

title: Virginia Moves to Halt Sending Wards Out of State
description: RICHMOND, Feb. 19The persistence of a handful of Virginia legislators has started important reforms here in the treatment of delinquent, handicapped and abandoned children who become wards of the government and then disappear.

title: Architecture Goes to Harlem 7th Graders
description: When it comes to the basic principles of architecture, Mario G. Salvadori believes that seventhgraders in East Harlem are easier to teach than graduate students at Columbia University.

title: Enlarged OTB Urged
description: Assembly Speaker Stanley Steingut said he would propose legislation to legalize betting on all sports in New York State, probably through the Offtrack Betting system. On a television interview program in Schenectady, the Brooklyn Democrat said the move could produce $100 million a year in revenue for the state. He estimated that illegal gambling in the state totaled $5 billion a year.

title: Stevie Wonder Collects 4 Grammys
description: Returning to the Grammy wars, Stevie Wonder was again victorious at the 19th annual awards ceremonies of the National Academy of Recording Arts and Sciences, add Saturday night at the Hollywood Palladium and televised nationwide for two aours by CBS.

title: GUR RABBI DIES IN ISRAEL; LEADER OF HASIDIM WAS 82
description: TEL AVIV, Feb. 20Rabbi Yisrael Alter, leader of the Gur sect of Hasidim, died in Jerusalem today. He was 82 years old.

title: Saturday's Late College Scores
description: MEN'S BASKETBALL

title: Opponents of Death Penalty Picket Byrne's Home
description: PRINCETON, Feb. 20About 75 placardcarrying demonstrators representing a coalition of New Jersey and Philadelphia organizations opposed to deathpenalty legislation chanted and picketed yesterday for an hour and a half opposite Governor Byrne's home, Morven.

title: Communist Candidates Announced in Spain
description: MADRID, Feb. 21 (Reuters)  The Spanish Communist Party put new pressure on the Government tonight by announcing its list of candidates for the general elections even before the party was declared legal.

title: Radio City is an Ideal Salsa Setting
description: Radio City Music Hall reverberated to the sound of salsa for the first time on Sunday, and it seemed to be an ideal setting for the music. The hall's arsenal of effects  the rising stage, strobe lights, mirrorsinsured visual interest, and the acoustics seemed almost perfect for the biting brass and chattering percussion of a typical salsa orchestra.

title: CrossCountry Skiers Enjoy Life Without a Downhill Struggle
description: GOSHEN, Vt.Provide a crosscountry skier with any kind of excuse these days, and he'll don his skis and be gone. No longer is the justification for a fivemile march through the woods in subzero weather just a need to exercise. The modern tour of the ski trails has switched from need to ingenuity.

title: J. E. CHAFFIN
description: GREENWOOD, S.C., Feb. 21 (AP)J. E. Chaffin, editor and copublisher of The Greenwood IndexJournal, died yesterday at the age of 62.

title: BIG BOARD AND AMEX TERMED VERY CLOSE TO MERGER FORMULA
description: The New York Stock Exchange and the American Stock Exchange are extremely close to finding a formula that will permit them to merge, according to Wall Street sources. The sources added, however, that certain unresolved issues might delay the merger.

title: About New York
description: The Stradivarius is in pieces, stripped and gutless and an anxious sight. And the news that this unglued creation truly is a Stradivarius is startling, like being told that a man found weeping on a psychiatrist's couch is Plato.

title: The Two Faces of Diplomacy
description: A dissident in the Soviet Union is not someone who talks back to the traffic cop or grumbles about the price of vodka. He is a critic of the structure of society, the performance of politics, the aim of economics. He is a threat to the Communist hierarchy that determines the ends and means of all national activity. That hierarchy, by definition, cannot exist in competition with others, and though it is not menaced directly by an unorthodox poem or painting or private letter, orthodoxy itself is. Without a monopoly to define the orthodoxy of everything, the Soviet power structure lacks all legitimacy to rule.

title: New York State Ranked 10th in U.S. In Per Capita Aid Received in 1976
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21Although New York led all other states in Federal aid received in the fiscal year 1976, it slipped from sixth to 10th place in per capita assistance, new figures from the Treasury Department showed today.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: Article 5  No Title

title: California Fears a $3 Billion Loss As Drought Parches Rich Farms
description: MARICOPA, Calif., Feb. 18Jerry Cappello looked around his 1,500 acres of farmland here in the southern end of the state's huge Central Valley and said he would be able to plant only 350 acres this year. Like other farmers in the area, he owns land that is among the richest in the world when it is properly irrigated but that is now drying up because of a 17monthlong drought.

title: The 7.3 Percent Solution
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va.The temperature in room 314 of the old Executive Office Building in Washington was 42 degrees Fahrenheit at noon on Friday, Feb. 4. When the President had asked the country to turn thermostats down to 65, the Office of Management and Budget, wanting to be more Jimmy than Jimmy, decided to turn its radiators off completely, pushing the temperature down to 50. Not to be outdone, the Council of Economic Advisers had opened the windows in their offices: hence, 42 degrees.

title: HIGH COURT IN GEORGIA WILL TEST TV COVERAGE
description: ATLANTA, Feb, 21 (UPI)Chief Justice H.E. Nichols, striving, to move the legal system of Georgia into the 20th century, said today that the State Supreme Court would experiment with allowing cameras and tane recorders in its chamber.

title: GUR RABBI DIES IN ISRAEL; LEADER OF HASIDIM WAS 82
description: TEL AVIV, Feb. 21Rabbi Yisrael Alter, leader of the Gur sect of Hasidim, died in Jerusalem yesterday. He was 82 Years old.

title: An Unconvincing Sea Gull Staged at Universalist Church
description: A strippeddown stage needs to be filled by something: an extra degree of imagination and dramatic conviction, and enough power and skill on the part of the actors to populate it.

title: Jacob Holman, ExRealty Man, Is Dead at 91
description: Jacob Holman, a former school principal and realestate broker, died yesterday in his Manhattan home. He was 91 years old and lived at 285 Riverside Drive.

title: Dave Anderson
description: Out on the basketball court, Albert King was showing why he is the nation's most recruited high school player. He was shooting, softly and accurately. He was rebounding, his hands soaring high above the rim and grabbing the ball as a snapping turtle might. He was passing and he was hustling. He wasn't even asking for the ball. And if he didn't get it, he didn't sulk. This skinny, 6foot6inch 17yearold might even remind the Knicks what team basketball is. He would score 26 points and get 14 rebounds as Fort Hamilton advanced to Saturday's guar of the Public Schools Athletic League championship with a 6241 victory over Stevenson yesterday. But even in the final the he raised his arms whenever his teammates scored. the last row of the bleachers at South Shore High School the Flatlands neighborhood of Brooklyn, Jerry Tarkanian, Tark the Shark, the basketball coach at the University Nevada, Las Vegas, leaned back against the wall and shook his head.

title: Britain's New Foreign Secretary
description: LONDON, Feb. 21It was not the average American's, picture of any minister in Her Majesty's Government, let alone a minister. who would soon fill the shoes of Palmerston, Salisbury and Eden. David Owen, a Member of Parliament for Plymouth, was dressed in a worn green sweater, and his black hair kept falling in his eyes as he putted around the drafty old rectory in Wiltshire that he bought as weekend house several years ago. His wife, Deborah, was cooking a Dover sole for supperno sauce, she told a guest, because David is on a diet.

title: U.S. Steel Appoints Officers
description: PITTSBURGH The United States Steel Corporation announced the appointment of Dale L. Armstrong as vice president and general manager of the Western Steel division, succeeding Ralph W. Seely, who is retiring. Reuben L. Perin Jr. was named vice presidentsales, Eastern Steel division, replacing Mr. Armstrong. Henry B. Peterson, who has been superintendenttin finishing at United States Steel's Fairless Works in Bucks County, Pa., has been appointed manager of salesNew York district.

title: Radio
description: 67 AM, WNCNFM. Prelude to Tristan and Isolde, Wagner; Divertimento da Camera No. 1, Bononcini; Andante from Sylvia, Delibes; Aragon, Albeniz.

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 22, 1977

title: Television
Senate Confirms Tax Expert
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (AP)The Senate confirmed the nomination of Laurence Woodworth today to be Assistant Secretary of the Treasury for Tax Policy. He served for several years as Staff director of the Joint Committee on Taxation, which made him Congress's chief tax expert.

title: CHAVEZ UNION AIMS TO MOVE INTO STATE
description: VINELAND, Feb. 21The Californiabased United Farm Workers has completed preparations to open a headquarters here, according to Angel Dominguez of Vineland, who will direct the organizing effort among seasonal farm workers in the vegetable fields, blueberry fields and ?rchards of New Jersey.

title: South Korea Ambassador To Washington Resigns; A New Envoy is Named
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Tuesday, Feb. 22 (AP)South Korea's Ambassador to the United States has resigned and is being replaced by a veteran diplomat and former Foreign Minister, the Foreign Ministry announced today.

title: Accounting Board Faces Unhappy Business People
description: Does how you keep score affect how the game is played? The Financial Accounting Standards Board, the private sector's top rulemaker on accounting, has a stake in finding out. Repeatedly it has faced unhappy business people who warn of dire consequences if the board changes their accounting.

title: Fighting Drives Angolans Into SouthWest Africa
description: WINDHOEK, SouthWest Africa, Feb. 21 (UPI)About 200 Angolan villagers have fled to SouthWest Africa to escape new fighting between Angolan Government troops and guerrillas, an official in the border region said today.

title: Public TV: This Far By Faith
description: This Far By Faith, being presented on public television tonight at 8, is described as the littleknown story of the black church and its impact on American culture.

title: Events Today
description: Music

title: NEW YORK SEEKS CHANGE IN CHILD CENTER'S ZONING
description: New York City will ask the Westchester town of Bedford for lessrestrictive zoning so the city can sell its 169acre former Hillcrest Child Center in the town, Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin said yesterday.

title: The Drill Instructor is a Woman
description: TEL AVIVIf your vision of a military drill instructor is someone with a face resembling sequoia bark, a voice compounded of gravel, dragon's breath and the lung power of King Kong and the disposition of a rabid werewolf, think again.

title: Bridge:
description: If both members of a partnership pass on the first round of bidding and the fourth player opens with one spade or any higher bid it is hardly ever right to come to life. Even when the action appears normal on the face of it, there is a considerable danger that it will backfire, giving the opponents information that they can make good use of.

title: Market Place
description: One of the cherished goals of investors is to find the next I.B.M. or the next Xerox and thereby cash in on the dynamic growth of some relatively unknown company. But, in the face of Wall Street's changing environment, investors may have to do more homework and digging on their own or else turn up new sources of information.

title: DuPont Elects a New Director, Votes Interim Dividend of $1.25
description: The directors of E. I. du Pont de Nemours and Company, meeting yesterday at Wilmington, Del., elected a new director and approved a $1.25 a share firstquarterly interim dividend. It will be paid on March 14 to holders of record on March 2 and is at the same rate as was paid in the second and third quarters of 1976. The company paid a 51 quarterly dividend in the first quarter of 1976.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Protest on Fishing Quotas
description: The pangs of birth are assailing the various regional councils formed to implement the new 200mile fisheries legislation, which takes effect March 1.

title: Choreography In New Mode Gains in Favor
description: Fifteen years ago Nancy Topf and Jan Wodynski would have had the devil's own time finding a space to present their work. Both choreographers, in entirely different ways, would have violated the unwritten rules of what was permissible in dance terms, and audition committees undoubtedly would have turned them down in favor of someone more conventional. On Sunday Miss Topf presented her processoriented program, Game Structures and Situations, at Public School 1 in Queens and Miss Wodynski Showed her dramatic Nidus at the Merce Cunningham Studio in Manhatthn

title: Davidson, Back in Rangers Goal, And Westfall Get Good Guy Honor
description: Coach John Ferguson welcomed John Davidson back to the Rangers' net this week. Ferguson had missed the big goalie's puckstopping talents. Yesterday Davidson was honored by the New York chapter of the Professional Hock

title: Conference Standings
description: By The Associated Press; (Includes games at Feb. 19.)

title: CARACAS ASSAILS U.S. FOR PAYOFFS REPORT
description: CARACAS, Venezuela,Feb. 21The President of Venezuela has declared that a newspaper article linking him to alleged payments from the Central Intelligence Agency formed part of a maneuver against Venezuela, and suggested that high American officials were behind the action.

title: Panel Reports Carter Has Power For $100 Million CityState Grant
description: President Carter's administrationwith a figurative stroke of the pencould make 20 administrative changes that might bring New York City and state more than $100 million in Federal funds without Congressional action, according to top leaders of social agencies here.

title: St. John's Beats Howard, 9269, For 18th
description: St. John's overcame a slow start last night and defeated Howard University, 9269, to post its 18th victory of the season before 3,063 fans at Alumni Hall, Queens.

title: Accounting Battle
description: The American Institute of Certified Public Accountants, preparing for hostile Congressional hearings, has retained A, A. Sommer Jr., a former Securities and Exchange Commissioner, as special counsel and Washington strategist. Page 48.

title: House Panel to Hold Hearings On Teamsters Pension Inquiry
description: A subcommittee of the House of Representatives will hold a twoday hearing next month on the Federal investigation of the teamsters Central State, Southeast and Southwest Areas Pension Fund, it was disclosed yesterday.

title: GOLD IS UP $1 IN ZURICH; DOLLAR MIXED IN EUROPE
description: LONDON, Feb. 21 (AP)The price of gold jumped $1 an ounce today while the dollar's performance was mixed.

title: FREE RIDES BY POLICE TIED TO CITY BUDGET
description: Responding cautiously to a proposal by Police Commissioner Michael J. Codd, Mayor Beame said yesterday that he would not endorse free rides on city subways for offduty policemen in civilian clothes unless there were assurances that the move would not upset the city's austerity budget.

title: 2 Spacecraft Prepared To Survey Outer Planets
description: PASADENA, Calif., Feb. 21The finishing touches, an instrument Installed here and a thermal vacuum test there, are being put on two spacecraft designed to make the most extensive reconnaissance thus far of the outer solar system.

title: Advertising
description: When the first issue of Nuestro (The magazine for Latinos) comes out in March it will mark the culmination of a long and thorough effort by a few dedicated people. At their head is Daniel M. Lpez, the 37yearold publisher, who is the Chicagoborn son of Mexican parents. Sitting at his right hand as editor in chief is Charles R. Rivera, 43, born in Puerto Rico and raised in New York with a Cuban stepfather.

title: Spanish Radio Station In Miami Goes Off Air
description: MIAMI, Feb. 21An allSpanish radio station here ceased broadcasting today on orders from the Federal Communications Commission. An effort will be made later this week in Congress to renew its license, temporarily at least.

title: CITY UNIONS REJECT BERME PLAN TO ADD TO POWER OF M. A. C,
description: Leaders of the municipal employee unions yesterday rejected as vague and unacceptable Mayor Beame's proposal to strengthen the Municipal Assistance Corporation, but they said they were prepared to negotiate with both the Mayor and the banks on the means to return New York City to credit worthiness.

title: Kegon Restaurant Called Violator Of the New York City Health Code
description: The Kegon Restaurant at 78 East 56th Street, one of the city's bestknown Japanese food establishments, was cited yesterday by the New York City Health Department as one of six violators of the health code.

title: Nat'1 Hockey League
description: AT MONTREAL

title: 3 Britons Ordered to Jail For Violating Secrets Act
description: LONDON, Feb. 21Two British journalists and a former British soldier were ordered held without bail for seven days today by a Magistrates Court here. They were charged with violating the Official Secrets Act.

title: Saints Hire Nolan
description: NEW ORLEANS, Feb. 21 (UPI)Dick Nolan, who coached the San Francisco 49ers for eight seasons, has joined the New Orleans Saints as a linebacker coach, the National Football League club announced today.

title: Human Rights a Topic
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21Prime Minister Trudeau arrived here today for two days of discussions with President Carter, and the two leaders devoted much of their first session to differing approaches to the cause of advancing human rights and aiding dissidents in Eastern Europe.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: Front Page 1  No Title

title: Dale B. White, Senior Editor Of U.S. News &World Report
description: Dale B. White, a senior editor of U.S. News & World Report, died yesterday of cancer in George Washington University Hospital in Washington. He was 59 years oId and a resident of Oakton, Va.

title: Nightmarish Dummy Pulls Off Nightclub Cantata Power Play
description: Aha, I thought, we're going to fool around with that nightmare again. I was sitting at one of the cabaret tables that jostled one another at the Top of the Gate in Greenwich Village, trying not to jab my trusty notetaking arm into the unoffending ribs of the woman sitting nearest, and trying harder to attend to the swiftly cackling, marionetteprecision performance of Nightclub Cantata going on just slightly above my nose. The composer Elizabeth Swados had put together a program of some 20 lyrics, most of them her own but a few culled from other sources, and eight actors were spattering them at us like machinegun fire to the accompaniment of piano and drums. They'd just arrived at a number called Ventriloquist and Dummy.

title: Thomas E. Mullaney
description: History suggests that corporate investment for new plants and equipment should be rising strongly at this stage of the business cycle. The strength of the economy itself, which has been even more vigorous for almost two full years now than some of the broad economic data have indicated, also would normally have prompted a significant enlargement of captal expenditures. But no such boom has developedand there's little optimism in the business world that the situation is likely to change soon,

title: HENRY JORDAN DIES AT 42; STAR PACKERS TACKLE
description: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 21Henry Jordan, an all pro defensive tackle on five Green Bay Packer teams that won National Football League championships in the 1960's, died today at the Milwaukee Athletic Club. After a workout, he collapsed in a rest room. Oxygen and heart massage were administered, but he was pronounced dead at the scene. He was 42 years old.

title: DR. RUTH BRICKNER DIES; NEW YORK PSYCHIATRIST
description: Dr. Ruth Pilpel Brickner, a psychiatrist who helped develop the parent counseling service at the Child Study Association, died yesterday at her home, 10 Hollywood Drice, HastingsonHudson, N.Y.. She was 76 years old and still active in private practice.

title: Economic Satire, Economic Stimulus
description: Prof. Herbert Stein has some fun on the opposite page with the Carter plan to stimulate the economy. His satire is deft; we're less enthusiastic about his economics.

title: Impact of Drought on Trade and Politics is Feared
description: DENVER, Feb. 21Politics, foreign policy and world trade could soon be disrupted by the drought that has hit the Western United States, speakers told jammed session today at the opening of the annual meeting of the American Association for the Advancement of Science.

title: Manhattan Takes Met Track Title as 4 Marks Fall
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Feb. 21The green Tshirts read, Jasper Track is Back, and Manhattan athletes wore them with defiant pride today after winning the Metropolitan intercollegiate indoor track and field championShips.

title: Topics
description: We have already declared ourselves on the Larry Flynt case. The obscenity conviction of the publisher of Hustler is without redeeming social value. Nonetheless, the fullpage advertisement that appeared in this paper on Sunday under the headline. LARRY FLYNT: AMERICAN DISSIDENT, struck us as a parody of the genre. If the signers of the statement were serious in comparing Mr. Flynt to dissident writers and artists in the Soviet Union, then they misconstrue either the character of this case or what has been going on in Russia.

title: CROSLAND AIDE NAMED BRITISH FOREIGN CHIEF
description: LONDON, Feb. 21Prime Minister James Callaghan tonight chose as Foreign Secretary David Owen, who at 38 is the youngest man to hold that position since Anthony Eden was appointed in 1935. Dr. Owen, who is a physician, has been serving as Minister of State in the Foreign Office, the No. 2 man there.

title: PITTSBURGH'S MAYOR UP FOR JUSTICE POST
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21Peter F. Flaherty, the Democratic Mayor of Pittsburgh, is expected to be nominated as Deputy Attorney General, the No. 2 job in the Justice Department, a number of Government sources said today.

title: Fires Ravage Timberland In Southeastern States
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Feb. 21 (UPI)Thousands of acres of dry timberland have gone up in flames in several Southeastern states and the situation could become worse. officials warned today.

title: Loiterer Shot Dead in Hallway, Assailant Wounded by Police
description: A 25yearold man, reportedly annoyed at the throngs of pimps and prostitutes congregating in the hallway of his Harlem apartment building yesterday afternoon fatally shot one of the loiterers and wounded another, according to the police. The suspect was shot in the hip when he fired in the direction of two policemen, and they fired back at him.

title: C.I.A.Data Indicate Foreign Agents Helped Spy on U.S.Citizens Abroad
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 21The Central Intelligence Agency apparently made use of friendly foreign intelligence services to help it obtain information about United States citizens traveling abroad, according to documents that the agency has declassified but not made public.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Feb. 21Governor Byrne has hacked down a bit from his endorsement of a suggestion by Governor Carey of New York that the New YorkNew Jersey metropolitan area try to ge? the 1984 Summer Olympics.

title: Tributes, Free Cherry Trees And Bargains Mark Holiday
description: A cherrytopped birthday toast to George Washington was lifted yesterday at the MorrisJumel Mansion, the general's 1776 headquarters in Washington Heights, and more than 500 Boy Scouts staged a ceremony at the scene of his 1789 Presidential inauguration at Federal Hall. 26 Wall Street.

title: Sheriff Says Drug Gang Kidnapped Heart Patient
description: VISALIA, Calif., Feb. 21 (AP)A gang trying to gain control of narcotics in central California was involved in the kidnapping of a man convalescing from open heart surgery, the authorities said today, adding that the gang may have kidnapped the wrong man.

title: Hanging On To the Tail Of a Bear
description: If Adm. Stansfield Turner didn't know it when President Carter called him home from Europe to become director of the Central Intelligence Agency, he surely knows it now. He's got a bear by the tail, one that even the most bold and determined director probably can't control.

title: Armenian Prelate of Mideast, U.S. Plans to Relinquish Post in May
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Feb. 21 (AP)Catholicos Khoren I has announced he will Step clown in May as spiritual leader of ?00,000 members of the Armenian Orthodox Church in four Middle Eastern countries and the United States.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Flu Shot Victim Sues U.S. for $1.5 Million

title: Article 3  No Title
description: Article 3  No Title

title: Deaths
description: ADLERMrs. Martha (nee Romanoff), ago 78, of Miami Shores, Fla., passed away Sunday, beloved mother of Bar.bara Lee Adler Orvieto, darling grandmother of five grandchildren and one greatgranddaughter. Mrs. Adler was a Life Member of the Deborah Hospital of N. J. and a member of the United Order of the True Sisters and the Order of the Eastern Star. Services Tuesday, Feb. 22, at 10 A.M. at the Newman Funeral Home, M?am? Beach, Fla. Interment Miami, Fla. Shiva will be observed at 1240 N. E. 1034 St., Miami Shores, Fla.

title: WBAI Head Says Takeover Recalls 60's Commune
description: Anna Kosof, WBAIFM's station manager since last September, said she had been hired to create changesubstantial changeand that that is what she intended to do.

title: CROSLAND AIDE NAMED BRITISH FOREIGN CHIEF
description: LONDON. Feb. 21Prime Minister James Callaghan tonight chose as Foreign Secretary David Owen, who at 38 the youngest man to hold that position since Anthony Eden was appointed in 1935. Dr. Owen, who is a physician, has been serving as Minister of State in the Foreign Office, the No. 2 man there.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Cauthen Takes 3 Trips To the Winner's Circle
description: A holiday crowd of 27,585 horse fanciers at Aqueduct saw Steve Cauthen emerge from a oneday slump yesterday, as he triumphed in the first, second and fourth races. Cauthen, who had nine mounts, also turned in a thirdplace showing in the fifth race.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Czech Group Of 13 Players Is Enjoyable
description: The Czech Chamber Soloists, who appeared for the first time in New York Sunday at a People's Symphony Concert in Town Hall, are not to be confused with the Prague Chamber Orchestra. Sunday's group dates back to 1948 (1963 under its present name) and consists of members of the Brno State Philharmonic Orchestra.

title: Lewis Galantiere, Translator of French Works, Dies
description: Lewis Galantiere, writer, critic and authority on modern French literature, died Sunday evening at Presbyterian Hospital after a brief illness. He was 81 years old.

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 22, 1977

title: Two Lost Skiers Found in Maine
description: PHILLIPS, Me., Feb. 21 (UPI)Two Darien, Conn., teenagers. lost yesterday while skiing on Sugarloaf Mountain in a heavy snowstorm, were found today. Scott Goodhue, 14 years old, and Dave Burt, 15, struck out down the back of the mountain and became lost in woods. Both were discovered asleep in the snow after an allnight search by Sugarloaf rescue units led by Phil Howe. The youths were hospitalized for exposure.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: YOUNG AND WILLING Daniel Adni, a 26,yearold Israeli, is tonight's pianist in the latest program of the Young Concert Artists series, in which the nonprofit, management unit introduces new classical talents to New York audiences. The program starts at o'clock at the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A. near Lexington Avenue. Door admission is $2.50 and $3.50.

title: Meany Warns Carter Against Pay Rise Notification
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Feb. 21George Meany, president of the A.F.L.C.I.O., warned today that organized labor would refuse to cooperate with an antiinflation measure proposed by President Carter under which the Federal Government would be notified of unionnegotiated wage increases before contracts are signed.

title: Israel's` Bank Chief Confers in New York
description: Even as Cyrus R. Vance, the United States Secretary of State, was introducing himself to Israeli leaders last week, on the first leg of his Middle East tour, Israel's new Central Bank governor. Anion Gafni, was doing the same around New York's financial community.

title: Gas Shortage a Fundamental, LongTerm Economic Threat to U.S., Experts Say
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 21America's natural gas shortage is fundamental, according to many experts in the industry and in government, and the resulting economic disruptions and personal hardship cannot be prevented in the next several years.

title: Jazz Ready to Spend Big to Rebuild
description: The New Orleans Jazz, a basketball team in trouble, are ready to take the route of the Knicks, Philadelphia 76ers, Chicago Bulls and Detroit Pistons and spend big dollars for established players. The Jazz have lost four in a row, nine of their last 11 and 15 of the last 20. Since Elgin Baylor replaced the dismissed Butch van Breda Kolff as the coach, New Orleans has a 1030 wonlost record, and is sinking quickly to battle the, Atlanta Hawks for last place in the Central Division of the National Basketball Association.

title: Report on King Inquiry Unlikely to End Suspicions
description: WASHINGTON, Feb, 21The report by Justice Department investigators that reviewed the Federal Bureau of Investigation's inquiry into the murder of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. should dampen, but is not likely to end, suspicions that James Earl Ray, the convicted murderer, was only one member of a larger conspiracy.

title: San Francisco's Arts Groups Beam Through City's Fog
description: SAN FRANCISCOIt is Herb Caen, San Francisco's columnistcumpoet laureate, who calls the town the misty city. It is not a bad description. Arriving last week on a seemingly sunny day, this critic circled Boeingfashion for more than an hour before the plane was allowed to land. And then it waded in through a dense fog that would have left Dante's Inferno or even Bremen AirportEurope's fog championashamed. Yet the mist is not the story. The story is sunlight, cheerfulness and California orange juice. If you can take orange juice.

title: March Auto Surge Expected
description: DETROIT, Feb. 21The domestic auto industry, confident of a spring sales surge and trying to recover from winter plant shutdowns, is scheduling production of 916,000 cars in March, highest monthly total since the Arab oil embargo over three years ago.

title: U.S.T.A. Seeks Purchase Of West Side Tennis Club
description: The United States Tennis Association is seeking to buy the West Side Tennis Club in a twofold move: to end constant bickering over renewing the club's contract to conduct the annual Open championships and to facilitate plans for renovating West Side in expectation of drawing greater crowds to the tournament.

title: VINNIE VINES, 59, FIGHTER HAD 11YEAR PRO CAREER
description: SCHENECTADY, N.Y., Feb. 21 (UPI)Vinnie Vines, a former welterweight fighter, will be buried tomorrow in this Saratoga County community.

title: Mediator Seeks to Avert Strike In New York Schools Tomorrow
description: A New York State mediator met yesterday with the New York City Board of Education and union negotiators in an effort to avert a strike threatened for midnight tonight by 2,500 maintenance workers and helpers in the city's public schools.

title: Bus Plunge in Haiti Kills 8
description: PORT AU PRINCE, Haiti, Feb. 21 (AP)A bus crashed yesterday on a mountain road leading to Jacmel, south of Port a? Prince. killing all eight persons aboard, the police said today. A spokesman said 123 persons had been killed in accidents on the highway since it opened seven months ago. The high accident rate has been attributed to inexperienced drivers and poor vehicle maintenance.

title: Texas Millionaire Faces Trial for Murder Today In Stepdaughter's Death
description: FORT WORTH, Tex., Feb. 21T. Cullen Davis, a 43yearold Forth Worth oil man, will go on trial tomorrow for the murder of his 12yearold stepdaughter, Andrea Wilborn, in the family's $7 million Forth Worth mansion.

title: BUNGLING CHARGED ON FOOD STAMP PLAN
description: Steingut and Rep. Richmond Score State and Local Government for Losing Up to $300 Million Aid

title: Article 6  No Title
description: TAXABLE

title: Lively Piccolo Recital by Trott
description: Laurence Trott's piccolo recital late Sunday afternoon in Cami Hall was billed, timorously, as the city's first. It's hard to believe that such a wellknown instrument hadn't had a program all its own, but apparently nobody can remember a precedent. As it happens, Mr. Trott made a most persuasive case for his instrument, so perhaps this recital won't be the last.

title: CASTER TELLS CONGRESS OF WATER PROJECTS CUT
description: WASHINGTON, Feb.21 (AP)President Carter notified Congress today that he was recommending cutting off funds for 19 water development projects totaling $289 million for the fiscal year 1978.

title: Carey's Proposals for Court Reorganization Jeopardized by Partisan Disputes in Albany
description: ALBANY, Feb. 19Proposals for reorganizing the state court system, due to be submitted to the voters in a referendum next November, are embroiled in a partisan dispute in the Legislature that could nullify the whole package.

title: 3 SEIZED IN LITTLE ITALY IN RAID ON NUMBERS RING
