description: Three men were arrested in an apartment at 118 Mulberry Street in the Little Italy section of Manhattan last night on charges involving what the police described as a largescale policy operation connected with organized crime.

title: Carter a 6Gallon Blood Donor
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (UPI)President Carter said today that he was sixgallon donor in the Red Cross blood drive and planned to give another pint this month.

title: NEW PARTY IN INDIA PRESENTS MANIFESTO
description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 21Congress for Democracy, the new political party led by former Agriculture Minister Jagjivan Ram, pledged today to lift all the restraints imposed on citizens of India by Prime Minister Indira Gandhi in 20 months of rule under a state of emergency.

title: Roe Enters Contest for Governor; Calls for End to State Income Tax
description: BORDENTOWN, Feb. 21Representative Robert A. Roe, Democrat of Wayne Township, announced his candidacy for Governor today by calling for an end to the state income tax and the convening or a state tax convention to come up with a replacement.

title: Rise in Unleaded Gasoline Price Expected to Outpace Other Grades
description: The price of unleaded gasoline, which must be used in almost all new cars, expected to rise substantially faster than prices for leaded gasoline in coming months, according to industry and Government sources.

title: At Harlem Project, Tenants Switch Leaders in Fight Against Crime and Faulty Maintenance of Housing
description: After nearly a year's divisive struggle over who was going to head the Tenants Association of the St. Nicholas Houses a federally subsidized lowincome development in HarlemMinnie Moore recently emerged victorious with 159 of the 300 votes cast, a total that exceeded the area's vote in the Democratic primary.

title: Church in Spain, Badly Split, Approaches Election Warily
description: MADRID, Feb. 21As representative democracy dawns in Spain, the hierarchy of the Roman Catholic Church is urging its bishops and priests to stay out of politics

title: Computing Tax Credit For Internal Revenue
description: Among early filers, the most common mistake on Federal returns was computing the general tax credit wrongly. The Internal Revenue Service says the credit was figured incorrectly in three of every 100 forms 1040 filed and in almost four of every 100 forms 1040A.

title: Music: Concordia Choir Flexible
description: The Concordia Choir, from Moorhead, Minn., returned to Alice Tully Hall Sunday night for a concert of sacred music. Paul Christiansen, who has directed the Concordia for the last 40 years, presented audible proof that he has not lost his touch in molding these college students into a responsive and flexible musical group.

title: BOND PRICES SHOW UNCERTAIN PATTERN
description: The credit markets are having difficulty deciding which way to jump next because different forces are pulling in opposite directions. Fixedincome prices fell sharply late last week, first because of an increase in the money supply and then because of the soaring Consumer Price Index, but money market economists conclude that the Federal Reserve is not likely to tighten monetary policy soon, and bond salesmen report that there is a large volume of investment funds facing a light volume of new corporate financing.

title: Indian Papers, Free of the Censor, Again Lustily Attacking Regime
description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 21The Indian Express, this country's largest newspaper, carried a frontpage picture of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi the other day, as it had so many times in the last couple of years.

title: VANCE, ENDING TOUR, SAYS DEEP DIVISIONS PERSIST IN MIDEAST
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Feb. 21At the end of his Middle East mission, Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance said today that although Arabs and Israelis had expressed to him a strong desire for peace, they remained deeply divided on how to resolve the key issues that have blocked a settlement.

title: PROXMIRE FOR LEGISLATION AGAINST ARABS BOYCOTT
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (AP)Senator William Proxmire today called for legislation prohibiting companies from participating in the Arab boycott against Israel, even if it resulted in American workers losing their jobs.

title: Wife of Man Sought in Bombings Has Disappeared, Police Report
description: The wife of Carlos Alberto Torres, the man being sought in connection with terrorist bombings that have occurred in New York and in other cities over the last three years, has disappeared, the police said yesterday.

title: California Fears a $3 Billion Loss As Drought Parches Rich Farms
description: MARICOPA, Calif., Feb. 18Jerry Cappello looked around his 1,500 acres of farmland here in the southern end of the state's huge Central Valley and said he would be able to plant only 350 acres this year. Like other farmers in the area, he owns land that is among the richest in the world when it is properly irrigated but that is now drying up because of a 17monthlong drought.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: Article 8  No Title
description: Article 8  No Title

title: There's a Loving Confrontation, If Parents Keep on Smoking
description: They are the most loving of adversaries: parents who smoke and their children who object. But they are also implacably unyielding, unless the parent renounces the habit or the child gives up in defeat. Usually, the confrontations result in a standoff that leaves children upset and parents guiltybut still smoking.

title: Foe of Marcos, Jailed 4 Years, Is Still a Threat
description: MANILA, Feb. 20Before President Ferdinand E. Marcos proclaimed martial law nearly four and a half years ago, two men stood out in the confused and noisy political life of the Philippines: the President and his principal opponent, Senator Benigno S. Aquino Jr.

title: Tanzanians Report Archbishop Was Shot by Amin
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, Feb. 21 (UPI)The newspaper of the Tanzanian Government said today that President Id? Amin of Uganda personally shot and killed his country's Anglican Archbishop last Wednesday,

title: DONALD M. DOWD AT 72; OF BREAKFAST CLUB SHOW
description: Donald M. Dowd, a radio announcer on the Don McNeill Breakfast Club from 1943 to 1955, died yesterday in Punta Gorda. Fla., where he had been living sinc his retirement from ABC in 1970. He was 72 years old.

title: Bukovsky Visit to the White House, Scheduled for Today, is Postponed
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21A visit to the White House by Vladimir K. Bukovsky, the deported Soviet dissident, which had been scheduled for tomorrow, has been postponed until early next week, an Administration official said today.

title: Books of The Times
description: Our body, says Dr. Samuel Dunkell, is at all times a part of our own particular way of relating to the world. This is no less true in sleep, which turns each of us, as the author puts it, into a pantomimist. It is not only in dreams that we act out our defenses and our desires, but in our sleep positions. Yet while we have had countless books on dream interpretatation and something like 600 papers a year by sleep researchers in the last two decades, the psychological literature on sleep positions is surprisingly sparse. 14a

title: Police in Peru Occupy University Campus
description: LIMA, Peru, Feb. 21 (UPI)The police today occupied the National Educational University campus, which the Government charged had become a center of propaganda for Maoist Communists and a clandestine arms depot.

title: Quebec Government Plans Bid for the Asbestos Corp.
description: MONTREAL, Feb. 21Jacques Parizeau, Quebec's Minister of Finance, said today that the Government is seeking to buy control of the Asbestos Corporation from General Dynamics, which has 54 percent of the shares.

title: Yachts Leave Miami In Race to Nassau
description: MIAMI, Feb. 21The MiamiNassau Race, which had seen two boats sink in the last three runnings, an unusual experience, began today under mild circumstances. A fleet of 74 yachts took off for New Providence Island in the Bahamas by way of Fort Lauderdale, a 193mile course, and they all should make it with no trouble whatsoever, as the wind was a dying northerly that had dropped to six knots by dusk. It may just take a while.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Article 4  No Title

title: DR. ROSS THALHEIMER, 71, LED PSYCHOTHERAPY GROUP
description: Dr. Ross Thalheimer, a psychologist who was executive director of the Community Guidance Service and founder also of the American Institute for Psychotherapy and Psychoanalysis, died Sunday after suffering a heart attack at his home, 161 West 54th Street in Manhattan. He was 71 years old.

title: To Catch a Train
description: Henry is afraid of flying, so he set out by train for New Orleans, and we met him there next day. Afterward we headed for Florida by car. Henry is also afraid of driving and refuses to learn, being persuadedpossibly correctlythat he will kill many people the first time he tries to operate heavy machinery in hottempered traffic.

title: Fukuda to See Carter March 21
description: TOKYO, Feb. 21 (AP)Prime Minister Takeo Fukuda plans to leave March 19 for Washington to meet with Prsident Carter on March 2122, he told a Parliame ntary committee meeting today. He said he would return home March 25.

title: Youth Killed,5 Injured By Blast in Classroom
description: POWHATAN, Va., Feb. 21 (AP)One student was killed and five others injured today when. a 40millimeter artillery shell exploded in the classroom of a private school here. One of the injured teenagers reportedly brought the projectile into the building, but the authorities were not sure why. The shell had been locked in. a vise and was being drilled open when it exploded.

title: Church Groups Seek Inquiries
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Feb. 21Church groups here and abroad are understood to be seeking to maintain publicity about the three deaths in Uganda last week in the hope of spurring international protests or inquiries into allegations of mass murder by the Amin regime.

title: PITTSBURGH'S MAYOR UP FOR JUSTICE POST
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 21Peter F. Flaherty, the Democratic Mayor of Pittsburgh, is expected to be nominated as Deputy Attorney General, the No. 2 job in the Justice Department, a number of Government sources said today.

title: Hall of Fame of Black Movies Presents 4th Micheaux Awards
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Feb. 21Rootsthose cultural, familial, racial and social links to our personal pastswere very prominent here yesterday, during the fourth annual Oscar Micheaux Awards ceremony of the Black Film Makers Hall of Fame.

title: Socialists Say Americans Should Get Jobs as a Right
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 21 (UPI)The Democratic Socialists Organizing Committee adopted today a program calling for a guaranteed job for every American who wants to work.

title: 3 New York Publications Ran Articles on Galante Over the Last Weekend
description: Three New York City publications published investigative articles over the weekend on the rise and prominence of Carmine Galante within organized crime.

title: Bertram Wolfe, Expert on Marxism And Early Foe of Stalin, Dead at 81
description: Bertram David Wolfe, the scholar, Writer and one of the country's foremost experts on the Soviet Union, died yesterday at the Santa Clara Valley Medical Center in San Jose, Calif., at the age of 81. His death came hours after he had suffered severe burns when his bathrobe caught fire from a wall heater.

title: Allen Ginsberg Will Share Stage With Robert Lowell
description: Allen Ginsberg and Robert Lowell, two poets considered as coming from the opposite ends of the poetic spectrum, will share the platform jointly at a poetry reading at the Poetry Project, St. Mark's intheBowery (10th Street and Second Avenue), tomorrow night at 8:30.

title: 10 Cornell Women Hurt in Crash
description: LENOXVILLE, Pa., Feb. 21 (AP)Ten women remained hospitalized today, two in serious condition, after a chartered bus carrying the women's swimming and basketball teams of Cornell University skidded about 30 feet off snowy Interstate 81 and overturned in a field.

title: Ocean Grove: Secure in Its Way of Life
description: OCEAN GROVE, N.J.. Feb. 21If you tell people here a hurricane is coming, they will tell you it won't hit Ocean Grove, said Ed Noll, the proprietor of Nagle's Pharmacy. Right or wrong, people feel very secure around here.

title: SUN ACTIVITY LINKED. TO DROUGHT AND COLD
description: DENVER, Feb. 21A group of solar physicists and climatologists told a national science convention today that the bizarre weather of the last year might have been caused in part by abnormal activity on the surface of the sun.

title: Meany Warns Carter Against Pay Rise Notification
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Feb. 21George Meany, president of the A.F.L.C.I.O., warned today that organized labor would refuse to cooperate with an antiinflation measure proposed by President Carter under which the Federal Government would be notified of unionnegotiated wage increases before contracts are signed.

title: Holiday Closings
description: All stock exchanges and commodity markets in the United States as well as banks in most states were closed yesterday in observance of Washington's Birthday.

title: Promotional Date Upsets Bayi
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Feb. 21Filbert Bayi today criticized officials of the national Amateur Athletic Union's indoor track and field championships for disrupting his training program in order to promote their meet Friday night at Madison Square Garden.

title: Anglo American and Rand Selection Agree to Merge
description: The Anglo American Corporation of South Africa and the Rand Selection Corporation reported yesterday in Johannesburg that they had reached an agreement in principle for a merger. Harry Oppenheimer chairman of Anglo American,

title: Jews Seeking to Emigrate Stage SitIns in Soviet
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 21 (UPI)About 150 Jews in 12 Soviet cities staged sitin demonstrations at their local legislatures today demanding written explanations of why they have been refused permission to emigate, Jewish sources said.

title: Yonkers Racing
description: Horses listed in order of post positions Letter Designates OTB Listing

title: 4 Children Die in Maine Fire
description: ROCKLAND, Me., Feb. 21 (AP)Four children died last night in a fire that swept through a home in Rockland's South End. They were identified as Donald Craney, 14 years old, Ellie Mae Turner, 10: Edward Turner Jr., 9, and Katherine Turner, 9. The children were asleep in a secondfloor bedroom when the fire broke out shortly before midnight. The authorities said that Mr. and Mrs. Edward Turner and two other children escaped.

title: Notes on People
description: Members of Parliament indignantly urged the British Government yesterday to help Sarah Spencer Churchill, widow of Winston Churchill, pay her rent and other debts. As the greatest servant the state has ever had, said John Stokes, a Conservative member it seems incredible and quite disgraceful that Sir Winston's widow, at the age of over 90, should be in financial hardship. The state owes that family an immeasurable debt. Lady Clementine's grandson, Winston Churchill, a Conservative in Parliament, disclosed over the weekend that Mrs. Churchill had fallen on hard times, had already had to sell some furniture to meet expenses, and now faced selling off some family heirlooms. Another member of Parliament, Michael Brotherton. said, I am appalled by this revelation, which shows a lack of gratitude on the part of the nation that belies belief.

title: CARTER COUSIN BACKS OUSTED PLAINS CLERIC
description: PLAINS, Ga., Feb. 21 (UPI)  Hugh tarter, President Carter's cousin, said today that members of the Plains Baptist Church had crucified the Rev. Bruce Edwards and forced his resignation because of the pastor's attempts to desegregate Mr. Carter's hometown church.

title: Joy at Seeing Baby Causes Father's Death
description: BREWSTER, N.Y., Feb. 21 (AP)Funeral services were scheduled for tomorrow for a Brewster man who fell and hit his head after fainting from excitement at seeing his newborn son.

title: Carter Discusses Future of Quebec; He Meets Trudeau
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (Reuters)President Carter said today that he would prefer that Quebec remain part of a united Canada but that that is a decision for the Canadian people to make.

title: The U.N. Today
Article 7  No Title
description: Article 7  No Title

title: A $500,000 Gift Delights Numismatists
description: The American Numismatics Society has just received a collection of ancient coins that, to its delighted officials, is the closest thing to pennies from heaven. $500.000 worth.

title: Inaction Cited in 75 Gas Hoarding
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (AP)The Interior Department knew of production cutbacks in offshore natural gas leases in 1975. but failed to do anything. the chairman of a House subcommittee studying gas shortages asserted today.

title: Issue and Debate
description: Two days ago, a top jockey at the Fair Grounds track in New Orleans agreed to accept a $2,000 fine and a suspension for using an illegal battery device to make a horse run faster in a Feb. 5 race there.

title: CITY UNIONS REJECT BEAME PLAN TO ADD TO POWER OF M. A. C.
description: Leaders of the municipal employee unions yesterday rejected as vague and unacceptable Mayor Beame's proposal to strengthen the Municipal Assistance Corporation, but they said they were prepared to negotiate with both the Mayor and the banks on the means to return New York City to credit worthiness.

title: PARKING RULES
description: Alternate sideofthestreet parking regulations will he suspended today.

title: VANCE, ENDING TOUR, SAYS DEEP DIVISIONS PERSIST IN MIDEAST
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Feb. 21At the end of his Middle East mission, Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance said today that although Arabs and Israelis had expressed to him a strong desire for peace, they remained deeply divided on how to resolve the key issues that have blocked a settlement.

title: LaSalle and Loughlin Take Track Titles
description: Vince Mutarelli, a junior at Mount St. Michael Academy, posted the fastest time by a schoolboy yesterday for the 1.000yard run in the metropolitan area, this reason. With a clocking of 2 minutes 16.4 seconds, he lowered the meet record by more than a second in the New York division of the Catholic High Schools Athletic Association sectional track and field indoor championships at the 102d Regiment Armory.

title: West Berliners Donate $475,000 for U.S. Aid
description: BERLIN, Feb. 21 (AP)The German Red Cross said today that it had raised. about $475,000 in West Berlin to aid Americans suffering from this winter's bitter cold weather.

title: Relief Effort Urged For Black Refugees At South Africa Site
description: QUEENSTOWN, South Africa, Feb. 21 (Reuters)Thousands of black refugees could die of malnutrition and disease in a camp, near here unless immediate help is forthcoming, the leader of the camp's medical team said today.

title: Summaries of Met Intercollegiate Track Meet
description: AT PRINCETON MET. INTERCOLLEGIATES TRACK EVENTS

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: By better than a 2to1 margin, New Jerseyans oppose any extension of the state income tax package past the June 1978 expiration date, according to the latest poll by the Eagleton Institute of Politics. The statewide telephone survey of 1,005 residents between Jan. 27 and Feb. 1 found 59 percent were opposed to the State Legislature's extending the present income tax package. According to the survey, 28 percent were in favor, 8 percent said wait and see and 6 percent were undecided. Results of the poll were announced in New Brunswick.

title: Asians, 7 to 10, Getting to Know About Auditions
description: Joshua. Mitsuo Weiner. age 7, took his first steps toward stardom yesterday. He marched across a Broadway rehearsal stage. He bowed regally. He tried hard to remember the words to the sone Getting to Know You.

title: pennPrinceton Basketball Playoff Appears Likely
description: Princeton and Penn are traveling a collision course that seems destined to carry them into a tie for the Ivy League basketball championship. With four games to go on the league schedule. the Tigers and Quakers remain deadlocked for the Ivy lead, and both are strong favorites to win their remaining games. If the two Ivy leaders finish the season, March 5, tied for the title they will meet in a playoff game, Tuesday night, March 8, at St. John's Alumni Hall in Jamaica, Queens. The winner will, get the Ivy League berth in the National Collegiate Athletic Association, championship tournament that starts March 12.

title: 2 Rivals Claim Victory In El Salvador Voting
description: SAN SALVADOR, Feb. 21 (AP)The two rival candidates claimed victory today in El Salvador's presidential elections.

title: Clifford Meets Turkish Leaders
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Feb. 21 (Reuters)Clark Clifford held intensive talks with Turkish leaders today and reported progress on the problems troubling relations between the United States and Turkey.

title: Taxes & Accounting
description: Girding Itself for hostile Congressional hearings, the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants has retained A. A. Sommer Jr., the former Securities and Exchange Commissioner, as special counsel and Washington strategist.

title: Corner Finds Levesque Not Liable in Auto Death
description: MONTREAL,Feb. 21The Montreal coroner said today that Premier Rend L vesque had unavoidably killed a man with his car Feb. 6 and was not criminally responsible for the accident.

title: George Van Gorder, Dies in Florida at 8l; Drug Concern Head
description: George Van Gorder, retired board chairman of McKesson & Robbins, Inc., died Sunday at the Sarasota (Fla.) Memorial Hospital. He was 81 years old and maintained homes in Sarasota and Bronx ville. N.Y.

title: For Mrs. Trudeau, A Bit of Informality
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (UPI)Margaret Trudeau wore a streetlength dress to the White House dinner tonight given by President and Mrs. Carter for her and Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau.

title: Following Trend, Jeweler Puts Its Name on Perfume
description: Dress designers do it. So do luggagemakers. Virtually everybody who has a recognizable name can't resist putting it on a perfume bottle.

title: What's Afoot in Shoes for Next Winter?
description: What women will wear on their feet next winter is being decided right now. The 15,500 shoe buyers from stores all over the country are mulling over their notes and memorandums of the thousands of styles they reviewed during the National Shoe Fair, just passed. More than 1,000 shoe collections were displayed at such places as the New York Coliseum, the Americana, St. Regis, St. Moritz and Barbizon Plaza hotels and individual showrooms, with some of the hoopla associated with the opening of new fashion collections.

title: $119.2 Million Netted by Chrysler In 4th Quarter. Triple 1975 Period
description: DETROIT. Feb. 21The Chrysler Corporation today reported net earnings of $119.2 million, or $1.98 a share, for the fourth quarter of 1976more than triple the $34.9 million it earned during the same oeriod in 1975.

title: U.S. Military Looks to Soviet for Reciprocity on Carter's Arms Cuts
description: Reductions in the total explosive power of the Soviet Union's intercontinental nuclear missile force or in the production Of a longrange bomber wouldif verifiablebe interpreted by United States military sources as indications that Moscow is prepared to follow President Carter's lead toward talks on the limitation of strategic arms. Authoritative Administration sources in Washington disclosed yesterday that the President had decided to stretch out purchases of the B1 bomber, to slow development of the new MX mobile missile and to halt production of 60 new Minutemen III ICBM's.

title: A. Day for Toasts, Cherry Trees and Sales
description: A cherrytopped birthday toast to George Washington was lifted yesterday at the MorrisJumel Mansion, the general's 1776 headquarters in Washington Heights, and more than 500 Boy Scouts staged a ceremony at the scene of his 1789 Presidential inauguration at Federal Hall, 26 Wall Street.

title: Senate Presses Carter on M.I.A.'s
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (UPI)  The Senate adopted a resolution today calling on President Carter to demand a full accounting of all Americans still listed as missing in action in Vietnam. A second resolution called on Carter to form a commission to pursue the matter.

title: LEO AUERBACH
description: Leo Auerbach, a lifelong Zionist who was born in Warsaw and came to this country at the turn of the century, died yesterday of a stroke at the Jewish Home and Hospital for the Aged, 120 West 106th Street. He was 87 years old and had lived there in recent years.

title: Meadowlands
description: Horse listed in to FIRST$6,000, pace, c1., mile.

title: Air Force Sergeant Killed After TwoHour Siege
description: SPOKANE. Wash., Feb. 21 (UPI)Military police at Fairchild Air Force Base shot a sergeant to death early today after a twohour siege.

title: Adoption Agency Adopts Rejected.
description: WESTFIELD, Feb. 21We feel that every child has a right to belong to someone out there, says Phyllis Gold, the founder of Spaulding for Children. a free adoption service for socalled hard to place children.

title: Sri Lanka Warned of Emergency As Communists Leave Coalition
description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka, Feb. 21 (UPI)The proMoscow Communist Party of Sri Lanka has ended its coalition with the Government, and Prime Minister Sirimavo Bandaranaike said today she might have to reimpose a state of emergency to ward off chaos.

title: Can the Oil Companies Wait for Indonesia?;
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Feb. 21Indonesia, the onetime boomtown prodigy of the world's oil industry, which turned quickly into the prodigal son, is now making what appears to be a desperate effort to reattract more than 30 of the world's oil companies.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: City U. Tourney to Open In Gloom of Budget Cuts
description: Because of the holiday, no schools were open yesterday. So some of the City University of New York basketball coaches and athietic directors gathered at the Board of Higher Education on East 80th Street to discuss good news. In the process, though they got some unsettling bad news.

title: Ocean Grove: Secure in Its Way of Life
description: OCEAN GROVE. N.J., Feb. 21'If you tell people here a hurricane is coming, they will tell you it won't hit Ocean Grove, said Ed Holl, the proprietor of Nagle'S Pharmacy. Right or wrong, people feel very secure around here.

title: Of Arts and Politics
description: In his 19771978 budget, Governor Carey asks for $27.3 million in grant money for the New York State Council on the Arts  nearly $3 million less than he requested last year. This may be a disturbing portent for the future of the arts in New York State, but a graver one is a proposal tucked away in his budget.

title: Fed Forbids Ownership Of S. & L. Associations By Commercial Banks
description: The Federal Reserve Board in Washington ruled unanimously yesterday that it would not allow commercial banks to own or take over savings and loan associations.

title: Deaths
The New York Times/Teresa Zabala
description: ALL IN THE FAMILY: After addressing Congress, Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau blew a kiss to his wife, Margaret, in gallery. Vice President Mondale and House Speaker Thomas P. O'Neill Jr. watched her reaction. Page A6.

title: Music: Acis Jollity to Pathos
description: Acis and Galatea, which Johannes Somary's Amor Artis Chorale and Orchestra presented Monday night at Alice Tully Hall, was Handel's first dramatic work in English, probably composed in 1718. The text is an amalgam of pastoral conventions, in a sort of English that seems sometimes rather humorous to modern earsTo kindred gods the youth return Through verdant plains to roll his urn.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: WHAT'S THE LATEST? There are quite a few night haunts around Sheridan Square for show performers and hopefuls, in this crossroads area of theaters and clubs. Gottlieb's, on Bleecker Street, midblock between Christopher and West 10th Streets, is an attractive oasis with charm and character. Look for a small, hanging sign, brightly lighted windows with greenery and whitepainted woodwork.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: FROM PORTFOLIOS TO PANCAKES: Wall Street took

title: DEADLINE FOR TOLLS ON 13 BRIDGES IS SET
description: Tolls must be imposed on 13 East River and Harlem River bridges by Aug. 31, 1977. under a timetable that a Federal judge ordered yesterday for a transportation control plan designed to curtail air pollution in New York City.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: Article 3  No Title

title: Chess:
description: TORREMOLINOS, Spain  Larry Christiansen of Modesto, Calif., broke clear of the field to take the lead after 11 rounds of the Costa del Sol International Tournament here in the Cervantes Hotel. His 83 score put him a point ahead of Florin Gheorghiu of Roumania and me.

title: I.B.M. Invests in a Blue Chip
description: The International Business Machines Corporation, Wall Street's perennial favorite as a growth stock, decided yesterday that its best investment now is in its own shares. The company that produces more than half of the world's computer hardware is offering to buy up to 4 million of its shares at $280 net in cash for each sharewhich adds up to a potential outlay of $1.12 billion.

title: To Bribe or Not to Bribe
description: Should the United States give money to foreign friends? By now, 30 years and billions of dollars after the Marshall Plan, almost everyone would find it easy to say yes. But change the question slightly and it becomes troublesome indeed: Should the United States give money to foreign friends secretly?

title: More Sound Than Fury
description: PARISThe Carter Administration has generated considerable momentum during its first month of conducting foreign policy but it is still far from certain that all this momentum will produce beneficial results. Moreover, the publication of names of distinguished leaders abroad who allegedly received C.I.A. subventions, especially names of governmental chiefs then being visited by special Presidential envoys, was a bit of unanticipated bad fortune.

title: Street Scene: A Window on the Past
description: Generations of New Yorkers have used the window as a fastfood service and quick communicator in an upstairsdownstairs interchange that linked maternal command in the apartment above with offspring in the street below.

title: 2Highly Professional Men Rob a Yonkers Bank Of Part or All of Receipts of 3 Nights at the Track
description: Two highly professional robbers es caped with what authorities would describe only as a very large amount of moneyincluding part or all of a deposit of receipts from three nights of racing at Yonker Racewayyesterday morning from a Yonkers bank.

title: The Editorial Notebook
description: Critics of the university tenure system have made a persuasive case in recent years that an arrangement which gives a professor virtually permanent right to his job is rather too much of a good thing. Simply stated, the teacher who knows that he cannot be dismissed unless he sets fire to the gym is deprived of an incentive to keep awake. But proposals to scrap tenure run up against the fact that it does have a purpose: Even in these enlightened times, teachers need protection against extracurricular.

title: BBC Series to Honor Elizabeth's Jubilee
description: Q UE EN ELIZABETH an other family, possibly including the Queen Mother, are participating in a series of nine onehour documentaries tracing 900 years of Britain's monarchy. The television programs, entitled Royal Heritage, are to be the major contribution of the British Broadcasting Corporation to the observance of the 25th anniversary of the Queen's ascension to the throne.

title: CORRECTION
description: A news analysis that appeared ln The Times last Friday was edited to ascribe to House Speaker Thomas P. O'Neill Jr. a statement that was the writer's that, as Governor of Georgia, Jimmy Carter had a reputation of appealing over the head of the legislature when a pet program was blocked.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Feb. 22State officials are developing plans that include strict water conservation and possible rationing to deal with a possible drought this summer because of a lack of rainfall that has left reservoirs across the state at lower than normal levels.

title: Maryland's Late Basket Tops Wake Forest, 8180
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., Feb. 22 (AP) Brad Davis hit an eightfoot jump shot tonight as Maryland upset Wake Forest, 8180, in an Atlantic Coast Conference basketball game. Wake Forest had taken an 8079 lead with 1 minute 11 seconds remaining when Leroy McDonald stole an inbounds pass and drove in for a slam dunk.

title: Cairo Paper Harshly Rebuffs Soviet Attack on Sadat
description: CAIRO, Feb. 22A strong personal attack by the Soviet newspaper Pravda against President Anwar elSadat has evoked a harsh response from the Egyptian newspaper A1 Akhbar.

title: LAND CONCERN PLEADS GUILTY TO 19 COUNTS OF CRIMINAL FRAUD
description: DENVER, Feb. 22McCulloch Properties Inc., a major landdeveloper in Colorado and Arizona that is a subsidiary of the McCulloch Oil Corporation, pleaded guilty today in a Colorado court to 19 misdemeanor counts of criminal fraud connection with sales at its 27,000acre Pueblo West subdivision.

title: Newark MedicalDental Students File Suit to Cancel Tuition Rise
description: NEWARK, Feb. 22 Lawyers filed suit today on behalf of 800 students at the College of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jersey seeking a rollback of the tuition increases of up to 40 percent that went into effect this semester.

title: Scope of Activities Widens For Amature Astronomers
description: UNION, Feb. 22  Arthur Cacella of East Brunswick, president of Amateur Astronomers, Inc. says he never tires of looking at the sky. It changes all the time, but it remains beautiful, he says.

title: Kialoa is First to Finish In MiamitoNassau Race
description: NASSAU. Bahamas, Feb. 22Kialda, the big white 79foot ketch from. Los Angeles, which sails the oceans of the world, came barreling into the harbor here today leading the fleet of 74 yachts in the annual MiamitoNassau race, which began yesterday afternoon.

title: Letters
description: We in the black community have long opposed the brutality, the oppression and the injustices of the white minority governments of South Africa and Rhodesia. We are equally outraged by the violations of human rights and the murders committed by President Idi Amin Dada of Uganda. Neither the character nor the quality of oppression is altered when it is a black tyrant who is killing other blacks.

title: ExSharecropper Rising To One of Wealthiest Black Men
description: Charles Wallace, orphaned at birth, Georgia sharecropper at 19, a Bronx high school graduate at 27, is on the threshold of becoming one of the wealthiest black men in the United States, if things continue to go as well for him as they have since he got his first loan from the Small Business Administration in 1971.

title: Putting Off the Offshore Leases
description: Federal Judge Jack B. Weinstein's order canceling offshore oil leases in the Atlantic delays a process that its promoters have pushed with more urgency than discretion. Specific blame for the delay must fall on the Ford Administration's Secretary of the Interior, Thomas Kleppe. Before he opened the socalled Baltimore Canyon tracts for bidding, he was put on notice by scores of local and state officials that they would not allow oil and gas operations on the Outer Continental Shelf to endanger their beaches with spills, their resort areas with industrialization, their wetlands with irreparable damage. The gist of Judge Weinstein's findings is that Mr. Kleppe ignored all such warnings in his haste to get the exploration and drilling program under way.

title: News Summary
description: Mexican coffeegrowers in impoverished villages are beginning to benefit from high American prices for their product, earning six or seven times more than in 1974. The increase in world coffee prices is important, but for them the action of the staterun Coffee Institute in reducing profit margins of middlemen may be almost as significant. [Page A1, Column 3.]

title: Britain Calling for Investigation
description: LONDON, Feb. 22 (Reuters)Britain is calling for an investigation by the United Nations Commission on Human Rights into the deaths of the Anglican Archbishop of Uganda and two Uganda Cabinet ministers, Prime Minister James Callaghan told Parliament today.

title: PARKING RULES
description: Enforcement of alternatesideofthestreet parking regulations will be resumed this morning following a twoday suspension because of the snow.

title: 6 BIG BANKS DIVIDED ON ISSUE OF UPTURN FOR BUSINESS LOANS
description: New York's six major banks are divided right down the middle on the question of whether there will be a significant up.turn in business loan demand as the economy recovers from the recession, John F. McGillicuddy, president of the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company, said yesterday.

title: P.L.O. Sends Units Into Southern Lebanon
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 22Palestinian guerrillas today were reported to have sent reinforcements to southern Lebanon where Lebanese rightwing Christian militiamen captured a town two days ago.

title: Mr. Trudeau's Solemn Message
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22The private talks between President Carter and Prime Minister Trudeau of Canada were much more solemn than their public statements suggest. For the Prime Minister had to make clear in private that while he did not believe the people of Quebec would secede from Canada, even the possibility of secession raised fundamental questions for the future of both countries.

title: Rise in Rate of Fed Funds Trims Prices on Bonds
description: The credit markets declined sharply yesterday for the second trading day in a row as Government traders became disappointed that the Federal Reserve did not move more forcefully to keep the Federal funds rate, the basic short term interest rate of the money market, from rising Credit as high as 4 percent. Markets The fixedincome markets, which had dropped on Friday in a reaction to the news that the Consumer Price Index had climbed in January at a 9.6 percent annual rate, opened with prices little changed at first yesterday after being closed Monday in observation of Washington's Birthday. Some dealers became encouraged when the Federal National Mortgage Association annouced plans to sell $1 billion of debentures Friday in a financing that will result in a reduction of 5350 million of Fannie Mae securities outstanding.

title: Carter's Budget Message
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (AP)Following is the text of President Carter's message to Congress accompanying his komposed budget revisions.

title: Civil Service is Said to Shield Bad ad Prison Guards
description: TRENTON, Feb. 22The State Prison Commissioner testified today that New Jersey Civil Service regulation hampered the effective of the corrections system regulations hampered the effective operation of the corrections system.

title: Israel Says Guerrillas Return
description: JERUSALEM, Feb. 22 (AP)  About 2,000 Palestinian guerrillas, aided by Syrian troops of the Arab peacekeeping force, have returned to former bases in southern Lebanon over the past month, the Israel radio said today.

title: A. H. Raskin
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla.George Meany believes in going for the jugular. When he wants to register organized labor's hostility to a proposed governmental policy in terms too emphatic to be ignored, the president of the American.

description: Enforcement of alternatesideofthestreet parking regulations will be resumed this morning following a twoday suspension because of the snow.

title: Companies List Earnings Reports
description: For verlods ended Dec. 31 unless otherwise Indicated. (N) Indicates stock Is traded on the New York Stock Exchange (A) American Stock Exchange and (O) over the counter.

title: In a Drugstore: Big Names, Small Talk
description: P.1. Clarke's it is not, but in Doc Dalinsky's drugstore of a Sunday morning one can catch a glimpse of Washington's version of the beautiful people. Brunch at Doc's is the innest thing in town.

title: Profit Gain Posted At 3 Big Agencies
description: J. Walter Thompson, BBDO International and Foote, Cone Sc Belding turned out annual financial statements yesterday. All showed improved figures for the year, but Thompson and Foote, Cone were hit in the fourth quarter by foreign currency translation.

title: Quake Hits Nevada and California
description: CARSON CITY, Nev., Feb. 22 (AP)A sharp earthquake jolted the CaliforniaNevada border region just before 10:30 P.M. yesterday, but no injuries or damage were reported. Residents of Carson City, Reno and the Lake Tahoe area reported feeling a sharp jolt.

title: Clifford Concludes Talks About Cyprus and Arms With Leaders of Turkey
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Feb. 22 (UPI)The United States special envoy, Clark Clifford, concluded two days of talks with Turkish leaders today and declared that the views of both sides on the Cypress issue were very close.

title: Events Today
description: METROPOLITAN OPERA, Lincoln Center, Puccini's La Boheme. 8.

title: A South African Black Receives Top Prize for News Photography
description: JOHANNESBURG, Feb. 22 (Reuters)A photographer who spent 27 months in detention has become the first black South African to win the country's highest award in journalism, presented for his coverage of the riots in Soweto, a black township, last year.

title: Carter Seeks to Cut $200 Million From Breeder Reactor Program
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22The Carter Administration said today it was cutting $200 million from the most controversial of the Government's nuclearenergy programs, the fast breeder reactor.

title: New Yorkers, etc.
description: THERE ARE PARTIES and there are parties, and some of them are given for fun, and some of them are given for a purpose. The parties that are given for a purpose may be fun, but the critical question is whether or not you read about them in the newspapers.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: ARRIVING TOMORROW, FEB. 24

title: ExSharecropper Rising To One of Wealthiest Black Men
description: Charles Wallace, orphaned at birth, a Georgia sharecropper at 14, a Bronx high school graduate at 27, is on the threshold of becoming one of the wealthiest black men in the United States, if things continue to go as well for him as they have since he got his first loan from the Small Business Administration in 1971.

title: AL MARLENS, 49, DIES; AN EDITOR FOR TIMES
description: Al Marlens, editor of The New York Week in Review section, collapsed last night while playing tennis at the Gramercy Racquet Club at 26th Street and Avenue of the Americas. Mr. Marlens, who was 49 years old, was pronounced dead at Columbus Hospital.

title: 60Minute Gourmet
description: IHAD never cooked before I was packed off on a train to go to Paris to become apprenticed as chef shortly after my 14th birthday. At that time I lived in the small village of St. Vinnemer in Burgundy, and the total population was said to be exactly 396 people. The town is not listed in most atlases. Legend had it that when anyone moved, someone else arrived; when someone died, another child was born, and so on.

title: Radio and TV to Carry President's Conference
description: The three television networks and their local stationsChannels 2, 4 and 7have scheduled live coverage this afternoon at 2:30 of President Carter's news conference. There will be live radio broadcast on WCBSAN, WINS, WMCA and WNYCAM.

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: RESULTS

title: INSPECTOR INDICTED IN INQUIRY ON POLICE
description: A special grand jury investigating whether high  ranking police officers maintain an organized system of collecting bribes from operators of illegal enterprises has indicted Deputy Inspector Daniel F. McMahon on charges of perjury.

title: 20 Spofford Youths Seize a Counselor in Escape Bid
description: Twenty adolescents, all but one under 16 years of age, attempted to escape from the Spofford Juvenile Center in the Bronx early yesterday after overpowering a counselor, seizing his keys and fashioning crude weapons from tornup furniture, according to the institution's officials.

title: ArmyNotre Dame in Jersey
description: United States Military Academy officials confirmed yesterday that Army and Notre Dame would meet in a football game at Giants Stadium the Meadowlands sports complex in East Rutherford, NJ., on Oct. 15. Army will also play Pittsburgh at Giants Stadium Nov. 12.

title: Republican is Victor In Minnesota Race For LI. S. House Seat
description: MOORHEAD, Minn., Feb. 22 (AP)Arlan Stangeland, a Republican farmer who campaigned alone against a galaxy of bigname Democrats, today won a special election for Minnesota's 7th District House seat, defeating a former aide to Vice President Mondale.

title: New York Legislature Sets June 7 as Primary Date
description: ALBANY. Feb, 22With a monthlong deadlock broken at the last minute, the Legislature tonight set June 7 as the date for primary elections in the state this year, with a runoff election to follow on June 21 if a candidate for any of the top three offices in New York City does not get at least 40 percent of the vote.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: Shirted to a T You were probably under the impression that nothing else could be done on, with or for Tshirtsother than scrapping them completely. But that's underestimating the creative, sometimes mindboggling ideas floating around the city. There is, for example, a young photographer named Iris Schneider who relaxes and has fun turning out custommade, handembroidered shirts. She starts with a pastelcolored cotton T or sweat shirt and embroiders a scene, object or motif of special meaning and interest to the wearer. The shirt can reflect one's life style, interest, profession (how about a typewriter?), favorite place or person. it better be pretty favorite, because the price for all the handwork (and shirt) starts at $75. Sketches can be approved before work starts and the finished product usually takes three to four weeks. The shirts can be ordered directly from Miss Schneider at 6285935.

title: State Dept. Messages Say Brazil Holds Back Coffee to Raise Price
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22(AP)State Department cablegrams made public today said that growers in Brazil were withholding coffee to get higher prices. But a State Department official asserted that Brazilian producers had not artificially created higher prices and added that he did not agree with the cablegrams.

title: Uganda Says Dissidents in Army Caused Strife Resulting in Deaths
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Feb. 22 (Reuters)Uganda reported today that some dissidents in the army had for a time overpowered other members of the nation's armed forces and that some people had been killed in the incidents.

title: DEADLINE ON ADDING NEW BRIDGE TOLLS PUT AT AUG. 31,1978
description: Tolls must be imposed on East River and Harlem River bridges by Aug. 31, 1978, under a timetable that a Federal judge ordered yesterday for a transportation control plan designed to curtail air pollution in New York City.

title: Carter Postpones U.S. Share In $1.5 Billion Loan to Portgual
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (Reuters)President Carter has postponed for one year the United States contribution to a proposed $1.5 billion loan to Portugal from a group of industrialized countries.

title: Wine Talk
description: MOST people think of soave when they think of Italian wine these days, but that is only because of the current prominence of white wine. if any wine really brings Italy to mind it isand always has beenchianti.

title: Business Records
description: Tuesday, Feb. 22, 1977

title: Personal Health
description: BY THE END of last year, national survey showed, 33 million Americans38 percent of those who had ever been regular smokershad given up cigarettes of the 54 million Americans who still smoke, two out of three say they would like to quit and have tried to at least once.

title: High Coffee Prices Bringing New Hope To Latin Peasants
description: HIJEHUETLA, Mexico, Feb. 19The high prices being paid for coffee in American supermarkets are beginning to benefit the impoverished farmers of this Indian village high in the Mexican sierra, five hours by donkey from the nearest road.

title: Four in Watergate BreakIn Settle For $200,000 From Nixon Fund
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22Four of the men arrested during the Watergate breakin have agreed to an outofcourt settlement that will give them $200,000 from former President Richa'd M. Nixon's 1972 campaign fund, a lawyer for the four men said today.

title: Oil and Gas Wells Going Deeper, Deeper, Deeper
description: Last year a record was set in the Andaman Sea off Thailand as the Esso Exploration Company (an Exxon Corporation subsidiary) used the drillship Discoverer 534 to drill a well in 3,461 feet of water. What was found has not been disclosed.

title: Carter, Disagreeing With Meany, Backs Federal Role on Labor Pacts
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22A White souse spokesman said today that President Carter thought that it was reasonable for the Government to seek agreement with business and labor on goals for stemming inflation and to develop approaches for meeting those goals.

title: Alcoa and Jamaica Pact
description: The Aluminum Company of America and the Government of Jamaica asked the International Center for the Settlement of Investment Disputes to discontinue the arbitration case filed before it by Alcoa Minerals of Jamaica. Both parties said they had reached agreement on settlement of their dispute, which revolved around the Government's imposition of a new bauxite production levy in June 1974.

title: Four in Watergate BreakIn Settle For $200,000 From Nixon Fund
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22Four of the men arrested during the Watergate breakin have agreed to an outofcourt settlement that will give them $200,000 from former President Richard M. Nixon's 1972 campaign fund, a lawyer for the four men said today.

title: Panel Expresses Fear of Curbs On Science's Freedom of Inquiry
description: DENVER, Feb. 22Fears were ex pressed here today that the freedom of inquiry that has enabled science to flourish since the Renaissance may become subjugated as if it were the Middle Ages by pressures from both within and outside the scientific community.

title: WILLIAM WYER DIES AT 81; AN EXRAILROAD EXECUTIVE
description: William Wyer, a former railroad executive and a retired transportation consultant, died yesterday at Riverview Hospital in Red Bank, N.J. He was 81 years old and a resident of Locust, N.J.

title: Students to Hear Women Engineers
description: For women high school or college students interested in engineering, the Polytechnic Institute of New York and the Society of Women Engineers New York section are holding a symposium next Saturday. it will run from 9:30 A.M. to 12:30 P.M. at the Polytechnic Institute, 333 Jay Street Brooklyn.

title: Serving an Elegant Dinner? Don't Forget the Consomme
description: No section of the American home has In the last two decades undergone a transformation on as vast a scale as the home kitchen. But presentday American cooks, for all their involvement in exotic and at times esoteric cookery, ignore, by and large, one of the great basic elements of fine dining. It is an element that would be particularly appropriate during these cold winter months, now seemingly endless.

title: Fuel Economy in '77 Cars Reported as 6% Better Than in the 1976 Models
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (AP)Overall fuel economy in 1977 model cars is 6 percent better than in last year's models, the Environmental Protection Agency reported today.

title: Politicians and Judges Criticized At Rally Decrying Rise in Crime
description: Chned during the hourlong rally near City Hall yesterday afternoon, Doris Masi clutched a small picture album that contained photographs of her daughter. All around Mrs. Masi, scores of men and women were shouting slogans and vigorously applauding speakers who condemned the recent outbreak of crimes, particularly against the elderly, in New York City.

title: World News Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (UPI)  The Senate Foreign Relations Committee voted 14 to 1 today in favor of repealing the Byrd amendment under which the United States has imported Rhodesian chromium ore in defiance of United Nations economic sanctions.

title: Red Smith
description: Jim Farley Jr. has a problem. The chauman of the New York State Athletic Commission believes the officials he assigns to referee and judge fights are better qualified for those jobs than the television announcers who broadcast the bouts, the sportswriters who cover them, the customers the hall and the viewers watching TV, but the announcers, writers, clients and viewers disagree. Because of this nonmeeting of minds troublesome controversy keeps breaking out over decisions, as in a recent case in Annapolis. Md. where Scott LeDoux, a heavyweight dissenting from a verdict in favor of Johnny Boudreaux, tried to kick the winner's face in and failed, but did succeed in dislodgin Howard Cosell's hairpiece. Jim aware that the situation is not brand new there is still no agreement as to who was winning when the cops stopped John C. Heenan's international match with Toni Sayers 117 years agohut he feels that television compounds the problem.

title: Turner Says Carter Wants C.I.A. To Adhere to Law and U.S. Values
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 22Adm. Stanfield Turner said today that President Carter had asked for assurances that he would conduct the work of all United States intelligence agencies strictly in accordance with the law and with American values.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The former executive officer of the Suffolk County Alcoholic Beverage Control Board and two of the board's license application investigators were indicted in Hauppauge, L.I., on charges of taking bribes in exchange for speeding up the issuance and renewal of liquor licenses.

title: All About: Apartment Insurance And What's in the Fine Print
description: FEW BUYERS would think of selecting a sofa, a stereo or diamond ring without first shopping around. But when comes to protecting these possessions, many consumers either disregard the issue of insurance altogether or sign up with the first company they encounter.

title: High Coffee Prices Bringing New Hope To Latin Peasants
description: HUEHUETLA. Mexico, Feb. 19The high prices being paid for coffee in American supermarkets are beginning to benefit the impoverished farmers of this Indian village high in the Mexican sierra five hours by donkey from the nearest. road.

title: Best Buys
description: A LITTLE BIT or coincidence and a little bit of design have combined this week to make such foods as light tuna, eggs and macaroni and cheese good buys in time for the arrival today of Lent.

title: Renee Richards to Play In New Women's Group
description: Tracy Austin, 14 years old, and Renee Richards, 42, enlivened the local tennis scene yesterday, one with her shiny, blonde presence, the other in absentia.

title: Private Lives
description: ALTHOUGH EVERYTHING ELSE had changed, the restaurants were the same. That is, the same people went to the same restaurants. These people might have changed wives or jobs or psychiatrists, but not where they went to lunch, not their banquette. it was important to have a banquette, an upholstered foxhole, with your back to the wall. That way, nobody could sneak up on you, and you would never have to look your luncheon partner directly in the eye. At least at lunch, the periphery was the place to be. Thus, oddly, being peripheral meant being in.

title: L.I.R.R. Train Kills Man
description: NEW HYDE PARK, L. I., Feb. 22 (UPI) An unidentified man was struck by Long Island Rail Road train late Monday or early today and his body was dragged for more than threequarters of a mile, the Nassau County police reported. The police said the incident occurred at the Floral Park station.

title: Farmers Block Highways
description: MADRID, Feb. 22 (AP)  Farmers blocked highways in north central Spain for the second day today as a protest against government agriculture policies spread.

title: Letters
description: To THE LIVING SECTION: The other night I had a dinner party to entertain a recently divorced friend of mine [Private Lives, Jan. 19]. She's a novelist, quite witty, and glamorous, and I invited a bevy of my divorced men friends to meet her. These guys are all in their mid40's going through their midlife crisis. They are having their first palpitations. They're buying their first jogging suits; going easy on the French sauces; don't hold their liquor like they used to; hair receding like an army in retreat.

title: Gloomy Report on Durable Goods Sends the Dow 0.33 Point Lower
description: A Government report that durablegoods orders fell sharply in January helped send the stock market slightly lower yesterday in continued slow trading.

title: TALKS SEEK TO AVERT SCHOOL STRIKE TODAY
description: Critical negotiations began in a glum atriosphere yesterday afternoon in an effort to avert a strike threatened for 12:01 A.M. today by 2,500 maintenance workers and helpers in the New York City public schools.

title: About Education
description: The National Assessment of Educational Progress has produced new evidence that American schoolchildren are deficient in basic writing skills.

title: Italians Snuggle Up To New York's Cold
description: Marella Agnelli, left, and Countess Consuelo Crespi, center, fancy Russian sable for the New York winter while Mirella Petteni learns her squirrel coat may be right for Rome but not for February in Manhattan.

title: Radio
description: 67 A.M., WNCNFM. Duettino Cone. ertante after Mozart. Busoni; Lullaby from Gayne, Khachaturian; Concerto Polonaise for Violin and Orchestra, Wieniawski; Madrigals, Lasso.

title: Caller Who Said He Hid Explosives Demands Money From a Ski Resort
description: SHERBURNE. Vt., Feb. 22A substantial amount of money has been demanded of officials of the Sherburne Corporation manager of the Killington Basin ski area, by an unidentified caller who said he had hidden explosives around the bugy ski resort, the police reported today.

title: INSPECTOR INDICTED IN INQUIRY ON POLICE
description: A special grand jury investigating whether high ranking police officers maintain an organized system of collecting bribes from operators of illegal enterprises has indicted Deputy Inspector Daniel F. McMahon on charges of perjury.

title: Careers
description: The University of Wisconsin's college of engineering at Madison enrolled its first woman student in 1896, but she did not graduate. The first woman to graduate, 30 years later, was Emily Hahn, who became a novelist.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Associated Press

title: Justice and Juveniles
description: ALBANYPublic debate has begun again, and properly so, regarding juvenile justice in New York State. The news media have reported yet another crushing aspect of the desperate pathology of our inner citiesthe physical maiming of the elderly by the youngand all of us seek appropriate responses.

title: Some Frequent Questions
description: The following are some of the most commonly asked questions about tenants insurance.

title: Lockey Convictions Upheld
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 22 (AP)The Supreme Court let stand today the convictions of two jockeys and three other men for fixing a 1975 horse race at Bowie Race Course in Bowie. Md. the court refused to review a decision by the 4th United States Circuit Court of Appeals that the five men were fairly convicted and sentenced. Their appeals raised numerous allegations of trial error that they claimed should be reviewed by the Supreme Court.

title: Cosmos Are Giving Away Goalkeeper
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J. Feb. 22The case of Bob Rigby, one of this country's established soccer stars, has proved that owners in the North American Soccer League are not willing to pay even reasonable salaries to American players.

title: Bayi Maintains PaceSetting Role In Speaking Appearances as Well
description: Sooner or later, the question had to be asked, the way it is asked everywhere he competes. But Filbert Bayi is learning that the finish line doesn't stop with him.

title: SERVICE STAFF CALLS STRIKE AT SCHOOLS; CLASSES WILL GO ON
description: The city's 1.1 million public school children were put on halfday sessions this morning after 2,500 maintenance workers called a strike when negotiators failed to agree on a new contract.

title: Bendix Reports Improper Paymnets
description: The Bendix Corporation, the company hat was headed by W. Michael Blumenthal before he took over as Secretary of the Treasury in the Carter Administration, said yesterday that unidentified foreign affiliates had made $80,000 in improper payments. The company ssued a threesentence statement in which i said that two such payments had been discovered recently in the course of an ongoing compliance program.

title: Gold and Silver Price Rise Is Highlight of Trading In Commodity Futures
description: Highlighting activity in the commodity markets yesterday were rises in prices of gold and silver futures both here and in Chicago.

title: CATER BUDGET RAISES DEFICIT,ADDING FUNDS TO SPUR THE ECONOMYProposal for Fiscal 1978 Stresses Energy and Social Programs
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 22  President Carter proposed a revised budget today for the fiscal year 1978 that projects $57.7 billion deficit to make room for his economic stimulus package and for a set of priorities that puts more emphasis than former President Gerald R. Ford did on energy and domestic social programs.

title: Dynamics Denies Talk Of Asbestos Takeover
description: The General Dynamics Corporation confirmed that it had not been approached  there has been no contact by anybody of authority in the Quebec Administration of Premier Rene Ldvesque regarding reports of its pro???sed takeover of the Asbestos Corpo???tion. General Dynamics owns 54 perSent of the outstanding shares of the company.

title: A New Planner in New York: Anatomy of an Appointment
description: Deputy Mayor Stanley M. Friedman brought in the nominee's name. A good job$17,000 a year for parttime service. A good man  right out of the South Bronx organization of Ramon S. Velez. Cleared by his district leader, nothing detrimental on the record. Mayor Beame nodded. Send the man to see him, he said.

title: Exxon Chemical Output Up 30% on Energy Rise
description: The Exxon Chemical Company U.S.A. reported yesterday that its Baytown, Tex., Baton Rouge, La., and Linden, N. J., plants produced 30 percent more products last year than they did in 1972, the year before the Arab oil embargo, with only 5 percent increase in energy consumption. This means that there was nearly a 20 percent energy saving per unit of production. Exxon made the disclosure as a report on its fiveyear197479$125 million program for energy conservation and conversion from natural gas to more plentiful fuels.

title: Carter Asks Congress to Disregard Ford Proposals to Cut Funds for Social Programs
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22  President Carter asked Congress today to disregard most of the Ford Administration's proposals for cuts in the Government's social programs, and he requested a modest amount of additional money in some areas.

title: Consomme: Plain And Also Fancy
description: The question often arises as to the distinction between a broth or bouillon, a consomme or a double consomme Broth or bouillon is the product of cooking meaty bones and meat with vegetables, herbs and water. When this is clarified with egg whites and egg shells, it becomes a simple consomme.

title: Personal Finance Car  Rental Insurance
description: THE motorist was in a pinchpenny mood as he walked into the Budget RentACar office in North Bergen, N.J., the other day. His own automobile had just broken down, and there were already indications that the repair bill was going to approach the cost of a weekend:at the Mayo Clinic.

title: How a School Walkout Would Affect System
description: All schools will begin at their usual time today, and school buses will be in operation.

title: Technology
description: Electricity may be a handmaiden of conservation rather than its enemy, a recent analysis by advocates of energy conservation suggests.

title: East German Travel Ban Affirmed
description: WEST BERLIN, Feb. 22Erich Honecker, the Communist Party leader, said today that East Germans would not be granted rights of free travel to the West so long as West Germany maintained its contention that there was no separate East German nationality.

title: Spain Seizes 10 in Reported Plot By Rightists to Manufacture Arms
description: MADRID, Feb. 22 (Reuters)Spanish authorities said tonight that they had smashed an armsmaking plot by extreme rightists and detained 10 people.

title: Notes on People
description: THE widow of Winston Churchill, Lady SpencerChurchill, yesterday politely declined the many offers of help she has received since it was disclosed that she would sell five of Sir Winston's paintings and some heirlooms because she needs money in a statement noting that several members of Parliament had urged governmental help for her money problems, she said she would greatly deplore any idea that either special legislation or an appeal be initiated on her behalf. Lady Clementine inherited what was thought to have been an adequate sum when Sir Winston died, but inflation and hefty nursing and other bills in this, her 92d year, have made it difficult for her to make ends meet.

title: CORRECTION
description: A news analysis that appeared in The Times last Friday was edited to ascribe to House Speaker Thomas P. O'Neill Jr. a statement that was the writer's that, as Governor of Georgia, Jimmy Carter had a reputation of appealing over the head of the legislature when a pet program was blocked.

title: Amin Sees Hostile Propaganda
description: NAIROBI, Feb. 22President Idi Amin lashed out today against what he termed antiUganda propaganda emanating from Kenya, Tanzania and Zambia concerning the death in Kampala of Archbishop Janani Luwum.

title: Islanders Win From Rockies, 21
description: UNIONDALE L.I., Feb. 22The Islanders set a singleperiod team record of 25 shots at the Colorado goal in the final session tonight, but it took a long slap shot by Dave Lewis to forge a 21 victory for New York over the ambitious Rockies.

title: Child's World
description: THE night Sky is clear this time of year and the stars bright, especially Venus over there in the West. The sky, like a child's longing, is boundless. Through a telescope, it moves closer, ibecomes more comprehensible.

title: Payments to Rhee Denied
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Feb. 22Mrs. Syngman Rhee, the widow of the South Korean President, has denied the published report that her husband had received secret payments from the United States Central Intelligence Agency.

title: $50,000 in Coffee is Stolen
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 22 (AP)The Federal Bureau of Investigation is investigating the weekend theft of $50,000 worth of coffee. Frank Perrone, a bureau spokesman, said yesterday that a truck loaded with 500 cases of coffee was stolen Friday night from a terminal at Hayward. He added that the truck was found Saturday abandoned near Pleasanton. The coffee was gone.

title: Players Told Barons Are Likely Dead
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 22 (AP)The Cleveland Barons players were told tonight that it appeared likely the National Hockey League franchise was dead.

title: News Summary
description: Mexican coffeegrowers in impoverished villages are beginning to benefit from high American prices for their product, earning six or seven times more than in 1974. The increase in world coffee prices is important. but for them the action of the staterun Coffee Institute in reducing profit. margins of middlemen may be almost as significant. title: United Press International
description: George Meany, president of the A.F.L.

title: Better Pesticide Use Urged to Reduce Food Losses
description: DENVER, Feb. 22A group of plant scientists warned today that despite the vast increase in the use of chemical pesticides and better farming methods, about half of world food production still was being destroyed by insects, weeds and animals.

title: Dividends
description: IRREGULAR

title: Maple Upstages Cauthen With Big A Triple
description: A former farmboy dominated the jockey activity at Aqueduct yesterday, but this time it wasn't 16yearold Steve Cauthen. it was 28yearold Eddie Maple, who learned to ride on an Ohio farm.

title: Japanese Wrestler, His Prestige Hurt, Has New Thoughts on How to Fight Ali
description: TOKYOIf he had it to do all over again, Antonio Inoki, the jutjawed Japanese wrestler who fought Muhammad Ali here last summer, would definitely do a lot of things differently.

title: Fez, Former Morocco Capital, Salvages Some of Its Ancient Glory
description: FEZ. MoroccoIn an austere greentiled former courthouse, a group of Moroccan and international experts is tryini; to save this 1200yearold city.

title: New York Legislature Sets June 7 as Primary Date
description: ALBANY, Feb. 22With a monthlong deadlock broken at the lash minute, the Legislature tonight set June 7 as the date for primary elections in the state this year, with a runoff election to follow on June 21 if a candidate for any of the top three offices in New York City does not get at least 40 percent of the vote.

title: Yonkers Racing
description: Horses listed in order of post Positions Letter desigilates OTB listing

title: A Wellington In New York To Take Over Napoleon Relic
description: Insisting that I'm not still fighting the Battle of Waterloo, the Duke of Wellington appeared at the Sotheby Parke Bernet gallery yesterday to take possession of a military tunic of Napoleon Bonaparte's that was captured at the 1815 battle in Belgium.

title: Bridge:
description: On the face of it, bridge and fishing have little in common, but in those forms of tournament play in which greed is an essential element a defender may have to undertake the role of The Compleat Angler. He sets a sprat to catch a mackerel, and gets considerable satisfaction and a story to tell if the fish bites.

title: Champagne Maker in France, Mrs. Jacques Bollinger, Dead
description: RHEIMS, France. Feb. 22 (Reuters)The head of one of France's bestknown champagne producers, Mrs. Jacques Bollinger, died at her home near here today. She was 77 years old.

title: SENATE FOREIGN UNIT ENDOKES WARNKE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22  Paul C. Warnke was subjected today to a critical crossexamination by members of the Senate Armed Services Committee as the Foreign Relations Committee overwhelmingly approved his nomination to be President Carter's arms negotiator and Llirector of the Arms Control and Disarmament Agency.

description: The New York Times/Terrsa Zabala

title: Happy End is Finale For Chelsea Center
description: The Bertolt BrechtKurt Weill 1929 musical, Happy End, will be the fourth and final production of the Chelsea Theater Center's current season, beginning subscription performances on March 8 at the Brooklyn Academy of Music.

title: Advertising
description: Particularly interesting to the buyers now milling about the Toy Fair are the promotion plans of the manufacturers. How will the items be promoted? Where? What's the ad budget? Buyers know that advertising support can be translated to sales.

title: BRITISH GOVERNMENT LOSES ON KEY VOTE
description: LONDON, Feb. 22The Labor Government of Prime Minister James Callaghan suffered an embarrassing parliamentary defeat tonight that all but doomed, for this year at least, its plan to grant limited selfrule to Scotland and Wales.

description: FIRE HITS NURSING HOME: Residents of Willow Point Nursing Home near Binghamton, N.Y., wrapped blankets in the home's dining hall after fire forced

title: TRUDEAU SAYS CANADA MAY AMEND CHARTER
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau of Canada, in an address at a joint session of Congress, hinted today at constitutional revisions to counter the independence movement in Frenchspeaking Quebec Province.

title: Commission Opens Study to Locate BestQualified for New F.B.I. Head
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22Clarence M. Kelley told a Presidential commission today that will recommend someone to succeed him that there remained only a few pockets of resistance to reform in the Federal Bureau of Investigation, and that a great majority of its employees believed the next director should come from within the bureau.

title: Westchester Reports A Democratic Gain
description: WHITE PLAINS, Feb. 22Enrolled Westchester Republicans, who once outnumbered Democrats by more than 2 to 1, now lead them by only 15,485. the County Board of Elections, in figares released today, gave the Republicans 172,661 enrolled voters to 157,176 for the Democrats as of last Dec. 31.

title: Cancer Experts Warn of Dangers in Some Plastic Wrap Chemicals
description: The finding by a leading Italian researcher that a chemical used in some plastic food wraps can cause cancer in mice prompted two American cancer experts yesterday to alert the public and Government agencies to the need for closure scrutiny of this and related chemicals.

title: Gimbel Trims Staff After Store Deficit
description: The Gimbel New York stores, a division of Gimbel Brothers Inc. reportedly had a loss of more than $11 million in the 1976 fiscal yearthe largest deficit it has ever hadand in an effort to revamp is laying off about 200 employees, industry sources said yesterday.

title: Moscow, on Sakharov
description: MOSCOW  immediately after the unprecedented explosion in the Moscow Metro on Jan. 8, Andrei D. Sakharov, without any grounds whatsoever, publicly accused the authorities of being a party to the crime, which, he claimed, was perpetrated to sanction later repression of the dissidents.

title: Purge of Christians Reported
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, Feb. 22 (UPI)President Idi Amin has begun purge of thousands of predominantly Christian Langi and Achole tribesmen in Uganda's army, air force, police forces and prison service, refugees who fled the country said here today.

title: Books of The Times
description: LET'S not argue over whether monarchies are excusable, let alone necessary, in this socalled age of the common man. There can be no society, Emile Durkheim once wrote, which does not feel the need of upholding and reaffirming at regular intervals the collective sentiments and the collective ideas which make its unity and personality. For England that need continues to be fulfilled by the constitutional monarchy now presided over for 25 years by Queen Elizabeth II of the House of Windsor.

title: Sports Program Dropped By Dallas Baptist College
description: DALLAS, Feb. 22 (AP)A few weeks ago Dallas Baptist College had hopes of getting some regional and maybe even national recognition for its basketball and baseball teams. Today the school found itself without an athletic program. Trustees voted yesterday to drop the entire athletic program and shift its funds to academics.

title: A Taste of Tuscany
description: been doing for centuries exactly what French chefs claim to have invented with their new cuisine, Mr. Bugialli said. We use seasonings delicately so that the flavor of the food itself comes through. Too many different spices and herbs will spoil the dish, he continued, all the while checking the bread dough to see if it was rising, and giving a final turn to the chicken he was gilding in a wide skillet. Trained as a language teacher, Mr. Bugialli first taught English to Americans in Florence, and then came to New York to teach Italian at the Dalton School and for the America Italy Society. When that society began to hold cooking classes, Mr. Bugialli indulged his true obsession and taught cooking.
