description: THE CHEMICAL BANK has been Indicted on Federal charges of failing to report to the Government 500 cash transactions totaling more than $8.5 million, some of which were allegedly money washing operations to conceal illegal drug traffic. Four individuals were also charged... The Federal Communications Commission, ending an inquiry started In 1972, rejected proposals to split A.T.&T. and Western Electric, its eauinment suronlv company.

title: Suit Defending Klan Causing Dissension In Coast A.C.L.U.
description: SAN DIEGO, Feb. 26  Members of the American Civil Liberties Union in California have been split by an A.C.L.U. lawsuit filed in behalf of Ku Klux Klan members accused of terrorizing black enlisted men at the Marine Corps Camp Pendleton training base.

title: Pilot Reports On NearCrash Of Jet Jan. 14
description: The pilot of the Argentine jet airliner that almost plunged Into a Long Island residential area last month has cited snow on the plane, turbulence from jumbo jet, and piloting as possible factors in the neardisaster.

title: CAMERA VIEW
description: Like many other amateur or semiprofessional photographers, I decided last spring that I needed professional help if I wanted to improve my techniques further  in my case, my darkroom techniques. To me the idea of an intensive, livein workshop seemed to offer the most practical and rewarding way to accomplish this, and it would enable me to combine vacation time with learning experience in my chosen avocation.

title: Human Rights at DifferentWeights
description: President Carter has taken direct action to illustrate his often expressed concern for human rights: He has reduced foreign aid to three countries in which political repression is almost commonplace. But in a real sense, those were the easy ones. There are other countries in which the President feels the United States has strategic interests that outweigh his disapproval of their treatment of some of their citizens. To those, he wants to continue American foreign aid.

title: McCarter Gets A World Premiere
description: AS producting director of the McCarter Theater in Princeton for the last two and a half years, Michael Kahn has had the opportunity to select from a multitude of works the few that he chooses to produce. This wcek at McCarter marks the world professional premiere of Angel City, a play that he says chose him.

title: Boston Hospital Tries New Billing System
description: The Massachusetts Eye and Ear Infirmary in Boston has instituted a splitcost payment system that divides patient's bill into three categories: flat, onetime hospitall charge of $181.72; a daily room rate of $39.14; and a variable charge for nursing care.

title: Legislative Hearing Slated This Week

title: Getting Their Report Cards
description: IN the Second Congressional District campaign in Suffolk last fall, the Republican candidate, Peter F. Cohalan, made a major issue of Democratic Representative Thomas Downey's 100 percent rating by the liberal Americans for Democratic Action.

title: The greening of Griffin Bell
description: Consider the campaign aura of Griffin Bell's swearingin ceremony in the normally solemn Great Hall of the Justice Department. A few hundred noisy supporters and employees gathered, and after some opening remarks by President Carter, who joked that Bell's victory margin in the Senateconfirmation vote (75 for, 21 against) was greater than his own in the national election. Bell who had been waving and winking to friends, took the microphone and asked some of them to stand and take a bow. They did so, and the crowd cheered. Those called upon included two Senators (James Eastland and Birch Bayh, of whom he said. They helped me when I needed help), a few Supreme Court Justices, some Georgia friends and then, following an introduction just this side of the canon of ethics forbidding lawyers to advertise, a hefty contingent arose from his Atlanta law firm, King & Spalding.

title: COMMENTARY
description: Options, the money game that has been such a winner for the brokerage firms, has been a losing game for most of the players on whom it dependsthe options buyers. Sellers of calls on stocks they own, who use options hoping to increase income, are also finding that the game is not what it once was since option premiums have declined sharply.

title: Ideas &Trends
description: Hoping to ease the energy crisis little, the Federal Government has budgeted $24 million to improve on an ancient idea, the windmill.

title: GARDENING
description: FEBRUARY bottoms out this weekend and gives way to March. The flip of the calendar page should be significant to gardeners for its dormant spray time. This simple outdoor task is one of the easiest to do and one of major significance to start the new gardening year off right. Even organic gardeners can feel secure in following along on this one, for the dormant sprays are harmless to the environment and totally effective in doing the job.

title: The Standings
A.A.U. Meet Proves ProblemFilled Once Again
description: For a few minutes, it all seemed so warm and wonderful to Deby LaPlante. A national indoor hurdles title, an American record, photographers, reporters. Finally, her mind seemed free from the frustrating thoughts of Michigan's cold winter and her husband's unemployment.

title: Pilot Sentenced in Second Stunt
description: TOWSON, Md., Feb. 26 (UPI)  Donald Kroner, the pilot who crashed a small plane into Baltimore's Memorial Stadium in December after a football game, has been sentenced to 90 days in jail for another flying incident. The charges stemmed from an incident Dec. 7 in which an airplane flew low over a Timonium restaurant and the pilot threw out a roll of toilet paper. Mr. Kroner had been ushered out of the restaurant a few days before.

title: Special report
description: We will move this year, President Carter vowed in his Inaugural Address, a step toward our ultimate goalthe elimination of all nuclear weapons from this earth. It seemed a grandiose promise, yet arms control is a striking example of one field in which the Carter Administration has stressed substance over style.

description: Dr. and Mrs. William T. Fitts Jr. of Philadelphia have announced the engagement of their daughter, Catherine Austin Fitts, to MacDonnell Gordon, writer who lives in Santa Fe, N.M.

title: Court Refuses Approval For Massena to Proceed On Power System Plans
description: CANTON, N.Y., Feb. 26 (AP)  A judge has ruled against a plan by the Town cf Massena to set up its own power company, holding that the town had changed the provisions on which it had won voter approval for the action.

title: Tangle wood Area Balks at a Prison
description: LENOX, Mass.  Halfway up mountain, commanding a magnificent view of Mahkeenac Lake, the great estate of Shadowbrook stands empty nowadays, at the juncture, perhaps, of an extravagant, brooding past and a bitterly controversial future.

title: Mr. Carter Tried It in Georgia and He Liked
description: WASHINGTON  In the late 1960's Peter A. Pyhrr, a financial executive with the Texas Instruments Company, introduced a new concept of budgeting that involved a fundamentally different way handling money. In contrast to the traditional approach of adding new spending to old programs, required a total rejustification of every operation the company as if that operation had never existed before.

description: The last United States Ambassador to Uganda expressed serious concern yesterday over the safety of the approximately 200 remaining Americans there, nearly all of them Roman Catholic or Protestant missionaries and their dependents.

title: Wedding Bells on Wall Street (for the Exchanges)
description: Haying reached the conclusion that two can live as unhappily as one, the New York Stock Exchange on Wall Street and the American Stock Exchange, a few blocks away on Trinity Place, have at last decided to seek a formula for merging.

title: Moving in on the Met
description: The frontrunning contender in America's outwardly polite but smartly competitive museum field is a smooth combatant named J. Carter Brown, director of Washington's National Gallery of Art. Bright, tough and moving at a breakneck pace in a town not hitherto noted for its arts priorities. Brown is not as wellpublicized a name as that of his New York counterpart, Thomas Having, retiring director of the Metropolitan Museum of Art. But that is changing fast with the growing importance of Washington as a culture capital, the opentog of a major new addition to the National Gallery and Brown's aggressive tilts with New York's Metropolitan for the big international shows that mean prestige and box office.

title: LETTER FROM WASHINGTON
description: MR. SPEAKER,a member si since e becoming o of Congress, I have consistently opposed any increase in our salaries. The hardships of this bittercold winter have underscored in graphic terms our problems with unemployment and inflation. People in my district cannot even afford to pay their heating bills. Can I ask them to pay me $12,900 more?

description: TuesdayNew Jersey Association of Corvair Enthusiasts meeting at Strike N Spare Lanes, Route 22, Greenbrook, N.J., 7:30 P.M. Information: Bob Marlowe, phone (201)4453463.

title: I.B.M.'s Boon to Living Shareholders
description: Shares of the Internaticinal Business Machines Corporation have always had an otherworldly aura about them. As Adam Smith implied in his book, The Money Game, I.B.M. holders seem more interested in their grandchildren's profits than their own.

description: Deena Rosenberg is a freelance writer with a special interest in popular musk.

title: FOOD
description: THIS is clearly the wrong time to be talking tomatoes. As with peaches or corn, the only way to survive the offseason is: out of sight, out of mind. From midNovember, when the local crop disappears, until May, when the hothouse season begins to peak, they are not their crimson, juicy, glorious selves. During that period (and, all too often, at the height of surnmer as well), the pale, lithic spheres available in tidy cellophane packages are about as welcome in a good salad as nondairy creamer is in a good cup of coffee.

title: Charles C. O'Brien And Melissa Moran To Marry in May

description: Elizabeth Ann Magrino and Denis W. Bilodeau, both assistant buyers with Abraham & Straus in Brooklyn. Dian to be married next September.

title: If You Go ...
description: ... to Greenwich, you'll find direct river, rail and bus service from central London. Launches leave Westminster Pier (tel: 01839.4859) or Greenwich Pier (tel: 018583996) at frequent intervals during the day. The trip takes 40 minutes; the fare is about $1.60 for adults, 80 cents for children. Trains leave Charing Cross Station for Greenwich Station, about a half mile from the museum complex, on the half hour. From Waterloo Station buses No. 70 (MonFri.) and 188 (daily pass the main buildings of the National Maritime Museum, as does bus No. 185 from Victoria (daily).

Bailin, also of Forest Hills. The prospective bridegroom is a sales representative with the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company. His fianc works for Cunningham & Walsh, the advertising agency.

title: COURT SAYS NOFAULT LAW COVERS MOTORCYCLISTS
description: ALBANY (UPI)  The state's highest court has ruled that a motorcyclist injured in an auto accident can receive benefits uncfer the state's nofault init.:ranee law.

title: Unemployment Benefit Claims Up 48,411 From Previous Week
description: Layoffs caused by the recent cold weather and fuel shortages were the main cause of an increase in the number of unemployment benefit claimants during the week ended Feb. 11, according to the State Labor Department.

title: LETTERS TO THE CONNECTICUT EDITOR
description: I much appreciate your having extended me the opportunity to present my views on the Connecticut Legislature [Opinion Page, Feb. 6]. Please note, however, that the opening quote contained an important misspelling that showed an obvious confusion by your typesetter between the Washington scene and the Connecticut Legislature.

title: In Greenwich, Along the Thames, Britannia Still Rules the Waves
description: It brought Britannia's glories back to view, Dr. Johnson wrote 200 years ago of Greenwich, recalling the London riverside borough's heyday as the seat of his country's maritime strength. For here, in a narrow enclave sloping down to the south bank of the Thames, Henry VIII held court and oversaw the rise of the 16thcentury English navy; here also the great voyages of New World discovery and colonization were commissioned, and the science of nautical astronomy came of age.

title: Bhutto Faces Strong Challenge in Elections
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, Feb. 23  Prime Minister Zulfikar Ali Bhutto, who has been governing this troubled nation for five years with a very firm hand, is suddenly facing an unexpectedly strong challenge in his campaign for election to another term.

title: Wyoming Legislature Delayed by Computer
description: CHEYENNE, Wyo., Feb. 26  Wyoming legislators thought they were going to fight the last round of their battle over increasing the tax on coal and uranium mines today, but a balky computer made it impossible to end the the 1977 legislative session on schedule.

title: Three novels
description: Even in the hands of a great master, of a Cicero or an Austen, classically balanced prose can come too cloy. It seems. after a while, too smooth and tended, the concord of its cadences too inevitable. We want the jagged line, then, words in a rushing, Romantic jumble, the picturesquely awkward, even.

title: Of Things To Come
description: In general, the notion of Progress is alien to the arts. Artistic inspiration, unlike scientific knowledge, is not cumulative. Newton said that if he saw further into the nature of things than his predecessors, it was because he stood upon the shoulders of Giants. But no one believes that Sappho would have written better poems if she had been able to study the Oxford Books of Verse, or that Neil Simon has necessarily improved upon the comedies of Shakespeare, let alone those of George S. Kaufman. Nevertheless, a cult of Progress can sometimes be found at opposite ends of the literary spectrum; just as certain avantgarde poets expect praise merely for breaking the molds of the past, so do certain sciencefiction writers. The assumption in both cases is that history marches On and there is a special virtue in leading the parade.

title: Nat'l Hockey League

description: MEN'S BASKETBALL

title: Dayton Joins Falcons
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 26 (AP)  Charlie Dayton, assistant public relations director of the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, was named public relations director today for the Atlanta Falcons of the National Football League.

title: Jewish Groups Protest Soviet Ban On Importing Matzohs and Bread
description: The Soviet Union's ban on the importation of matzohsessential for the observ4nce of Passoveris stirring angry protests among Jewish groups.

title: Jane C. Webster Is Affianced
description: The engagement of Jane Coleman Webster to Peyton Randolph Gray has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Henry Coleman Webster of Ambler, Pa., parents of the future bride. Her fiance is the youngest son of the late Bowman Gray, former president and chairman of the R. J. Reynolds Tobacco Company, and the late Mrs. Gray of WinstonSalem. N.C.

title: The Luparelli Tapes
description: Among traditional forms of entertainment, the spectacle of violent death has gone the way of the bacchanal. Whereas Roman crowds once rejoiced in the satisfying whack of steel on cringing flesh, the Caesars of network television permit no mess on the livingroom floor. Death has been tidied up, cleansed of harmful ingredients and repackaged in primetime segments that pander to baser appetites but leave no unpleasant aftertaste. A groan, a grimace and it's all over.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Julian Rathbone likes Spain and knows Spain. His last novel, Bloody Marvellous, had a Spanish setting, and so does his new CARNIVAL! (St. Martin's, $7.95). Rathhone gives us a British historian who is a specialist on the Wellington campaign. He is writing the script for a television crew that is doing a program on the great British general's peninsular battles against the French. He is also having an affair with the wife of a minor Spanish grandee.

title: Votes in Congress
description: Senate

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Dining on Rabbit
description: WEST TISBURY, Mass.Presently, the owner of a beagle in this rural community could touch up a member of the hunting fraternity for a 1.0 spot without so much as a whimper.

title: ART
description: ON the face of it, the exhibition of contemporary American art at the Sarah Lawrence College Gallery might appear somewhat limited and vaguely misleading. Limited because the show restricts itself to painting done between 1975 and and present. Misleading because we might be given the impression that the last two years and a few months produced a golden age in American eat, renaissance of creative activity following a period of relative indistinctiveness. Otherwise why arbitrarily select these years of chronological brackets or guideposts?

title: A NEW KOREAN AGENT REPORTED IN CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, Feb, 26  Federal investigators looking into the covert Korean lobby have been told that the Seoul Government groomed a new highlevel agent to replace Park Tong Sun after he came under scrutiny here, sources Informed about the inquiry have reported.

title: ABOUT NEW JERSEY
description: IT'S happened again, thank goodness. Once again, our neighbor, Mrs. Kimberley, has instructed us in one of the niceties of Essex County suburban living, and once again we are in her debt because without her we could have become serious lawbreakers. Unwittingly to be sure, but violators nonetheless.

title: Maureen Gillen Affianced

Most admirably, it pays its respects to contemporary music, and on Friday night it gave the premiere of a work commissioned for it by the Koussevitzky Foundation. This was Fred Lerdahl's Eros: Variations for Mezzosoprano and Chamber Ensemble. The Wisconsinborn composer, who is 33 years old, has already won several other awards and commissions.

In the process, he incorrectly stated my position and omitted mention of the more sweeping criticism of agents practices contained in the public testimony of agents themselves before the House Select Committee on Professional Sports last year.

description: NO effort is spared to make you feel welcome and wanted in Ronnie Alpert s Restaurant in Lynbrook. Ronnie and Fran Alpert are nice folks who have perfected the gracious hover. They treat you like guests in their home.

title: Rabbi Mark S. Miller to Wed Wendy Balin, Hofstra Senior
description: Announcement has been made by Herbert M. Bann of Port Washington, LI., and Mrs. Daniel S. Cohan of Great Neck, Li., of the engagement of their daughter, Wendy Gay Balin, to Rabbi Mark S. Miller, son of Renee Rosen of Agoura, Calif.

title: School Funds on Piggyback
description: TALK to a homeowner in Nassau or Suffolk County and he's going to tell you his school taxes are very high. Talk to a school official or a Long Island state legislator and you'll hear about their strenuous effort to get the state to increase its contribution toward financing public education.

title: Caiati's One Week and It's All Over
description: Your last week of opportunity to discover fantastic reductions on all upholstery, Bedroom, Living Room, Dining Room and Occasional Pieces ... And it all ends Saturday March 5th! Don't delay. Visit Caiati, Westchester's only DrexelHeritage showcase furniture center. Over 30,000 square feet of inspiring furniture selections ... and savings to match.

title: Morality Has Always Had Its Limits in the Spy Business
description: WASHINGTON  Before the United States had a chief executive, let alone a profusion of rubber eyes only stamps, the Committee of Secret Correspondence declined to share all that it knew in 1776 with other members of the Continental Congress on the grounds that the Congress consists of too many members to keep secrets.

title: School Results
CHESS
description: An example of astute psychological insight can be seen in the way Emanuel Lasker occasionally adopted opening systems that were dubious ifas happenedhe knew that his opponent, secure in the certainty of his own superior judgment, condemned the opening as barely playable. Lasker's idea was that any time an opponent exaggerated a judgment about a position, he would be very likely to mishandle it over the board. And Lasker, who was world champion from 1894 to 1921, scored a great number of victories against embarrassed dogmatists.

title: Unwinding on the Island of Montserrat
description: Tonight, as every night for the last two weeks, I lie in bed and think I hear rain. The tree frogs have not interrupted their highpitched chirping, and the waves are rolling, not crashing, onto the shore, yet I'm sure those are raindrops soaking our vast green lawn. In fact, it's only the long, slender fingers of the palm fronds tapping against each other, a gentle, insistent rustling that lulls me back to sleep even as it fools me.

title: Dobbs's 2d Century
description: THE days are gone when winter flannel underwear was strictly required of Miss Masters Girls, when whispering in the halls between classes invited a demerit. But even though some things have gone by the board, The Masters School in Dobbs Ferry, one of the nation's leading preparatory schools for girls, is as strongly committed as ever to singlesex education.

title: Margaret Kernan to Be Wed
description: Margaret Kernan, a typist with the United Nations conference affairs division, and Thomas .1. Kehoe, a lawyer with the New York firm of O'Dwyer 8: Bernstein, plan to be married next fall. The future bridegroom graduated from Holy Cross College and the Hofstra University Law School.

description: ST. CROIX, V. AT A time when many private universities in New Jersey are reexamining their program offerings because of straitened fiscal conditions, Fairleigh Dickinson has made a firm commitment to continue and expand its marine biology and sciences laboratory on the eastern end of this Caribbean island.

Tulips, azaleas, dogwood, rhododendron, daffodils, roses and cherry trees will be in bloom in settings designed by 18 participating nurserymen and florists.

At 8. just down the hall, the curtain rose on Marco Polo Sings a Solo, John Guare's speculation about life among the rich in 1999. Upstairs, in another theater, the childless couple in David Rudkin's Ashes began a series of visits to fertility specialists. title: Narayan Undergoes Surgery
description: NEW DELHI. India, Feb. 26 (AP) Jayaprakash Narayan. a leading opposition politician, was operated on in Bombay today in connection with complications caused by a kidney ailment. The 74yearold Mr. Narayan was reported in satisfactory condition after the operation. If he continues to respond to treatment, he is expected to be in the hospital for only about a week, the hospital spokesman said.

Coffin of West Hartford, Conn., parents of the future bride. Her fiance is the son of Baron and Baroness Pierre d'Otreppe de Bouvette of Barse, Belgium.

title: New Finding in McCulloch Death
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 26 (UPI)  Robert P. McCulloch, 65 years old, who invented the oneman chain saw and brought London Bridge to America, died from a combination of drugs and alcohol, the County Coroner's office reported today. Mr. McCulloch was found dead yesterday in an upstairs bedroom at his Bel Air home by a maid. Original reports indicated the cause of death as a heart attack, but an autopsy showed his body contained barbiturates and alcohol.

title: Article 15  No Title
New Dances By Solomons Are Too Dry
description: A certain dryness of emotive content has always lurked around the edges of Gus Solomons Jr.'s choreography, but the new works presented Friday evening at the American Theater Laboratory were desicoated to the point of classroom exercises. It's startling to feel so totally unmoved by the firm, sharphoned vocabulary that always seems to be going somewhere purposefully, but doesn't quite get there.

title: FRANCO'S MOVEMENT A FADING INFLUENCE
description: With parliamentary elections about three months away, the National Movement, which Francisco Franco used to mobilize Spaniards at moments of his choosing, is still alive, though barely kicking.

title: Don't Like the Weather? Cross the Climate Line
description: IT'S invisible, intangible and eight miles long. But it touches the life for better or worseof every resident of Westchester. For many, its effects are felt in the form of higher fuel bills. It can, and has, determined the fate of cars and drivers. And it even makes a difference to backyard gardeners.

title: Burns Says No
description: Traditionally, nay sayers in Government are as common as bilingual parrots at the beginning of a new Administration. Thus, the quiet voice of Washington's leading no man, Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, again sounded like a roar last week.

title: SHOP TALK
description: TUCKED AWAY at the end of a short street in the Cannondale area of Wilton and perched on edge of a waterfall, the Mill House has a rural picturebook prettiness long gone from much of Fairfield County.

title: Alec McCowen Takes Equus For Another Ride
description: One morning last week, Alec McCowen relaxed in his hotel room while munching noisily on an apple. The night before, the distinguished English actor had received a standing ovation for his performance in EquusPeter Shaffer's drama about a tormented stable boy who blinds the horses in his keepingand he was in a good mood. McCowen had created the role of the eccentric child psychiatrist Martin Dysart in the original London production in 1973, but after playing it triumphantly for 10 months he refused to appear in the Broadway production because he felt that by then his performance would be stale.

title: A President Can Be Blocked
description: WASHINGTON  Sometime in the next month or so, Congress is expected to approve legislation giving President Carter the authority he wants to reorganize the executive branch. Under the legislation, the President will be able to recommend the creation, abolition or restructuring Government agencies and the transfer of agencies from one department to another. Each recommendation will go into effect automatically unless the House or Senate votes within 60 days to block it.

title: Blinds for Letting Sun In
description: When Matias Lozano and Arthur Fisher closed their windowcovering business here and left for Mexico nine years ago, interior decorators were just beginning to strip shades, blinds and curtains from windows so that the sun could shine through unimpeded.

title: A Record of Compassion
description: This coldest of winters added cruelly to the hardships of the poor, the sick, the old, the lonely. In this season of extraordinary need, concerned donors responded with extraordinary generosity to the appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund. At its conclusion tomorrow, the fund's 64th annual appeal will have reached an alltime recorda total of gifts and bequests amounting $1,068,427.06. We speak for the many anonymous recipients of badly needed help in saying Thank you to the more than 10,000 donors whose compassion built this heartwarming record.

title: Coyotes Spread Across Country As Friends and Foes Argue Control
description: DENVER, Feb. 24  The coyote, once essentially found in this country's West, is expanding its habitat that now extends from the Panama Canal to the Arctic Ocean, according to Federal and academic specialists.

title: U.S. and State Governments Test New Ways to Cut Hospital Costs
description: In a major effort to cut wnste and runaway costs, the Social Security Administration and state governments across the country are conducting a number of pilot projects that are introducing radical new ways of paying hospitals for the care they provide.

title: It's Time to Get Organized and Plan the Food Crops
description: Seed catalogues take aim at the palate. Illustrations in full color of plump red tomatoes polished to perfection and deep yellow corn with exquisitely regimented kernals that look like they were grown with a compass and slide rule strike with withering effectiveness.

title: Dance: African Pieces by Chuck Davis Company
description: The Chuck Davis Dance Company, which is performing through this afterno,on at the Brooklyn Academy of Musit, has always had a twosided repertory. One aspect uses the moderndance vocabulary. The other side of the repertory is concerned with African themes, ceremonies and various African dance idioms.

title: Calm Reported in Kampala
description: A spokesman for the West German Embassy in Kampala said yesterday that the Uganda Government had announced that a meeting President Amin has called Wednesday with American residents of the country was to be a normal thing.

title: Notes: Dial HAR For Road Advisories
description: For years radio stations have broadcast traffic advisories during peak morning and evening travel periods. More recently motorists with citizenband installations have been able to share information with one another about accidents or the presence of police radar units. Now, under a new Federal program known as Highway Advisory Radio (HAR), the car radio makes it possible for motorists to tune in to a given frequency on the AM band (usually 530 or 1610 KHz) and obtain uptotheminute reports on traffic, advice on parking facilities, warnings on fog and ice, suggested alternate routings and information

title: The Region
description: New York city has fallen again into a situation that has become all too familiar during the last two years of financial disarray: the possibility of imminent default on its obligations and thus the threat of bankruptcy.

title: Tokyo Group Seeks to Aid Koreans Held by Soviet Since World War
description: TOKYO, Feb. 26  More than three decades after the end of World War II, when most of the population groups displaced in all the areas of fighting have had their cases heard and some amends made for their losses, a few thousand men and women, most of them aged, remain in a bleak wilderness, stifled by general indifference.

American intelligence mistakes, has now been confronted directly with the same questions about United States covert activities abroad as were his predecessors. The answers he has given six and one half weeks after taking office are much the same as theirs:

title: Kansas Wins Big 8 Track
description: LINCOLN, Neb., Feb. 26 (AP)  KanSRS University swept to its eighth Big Eight indoor track championship in 12 years today. The Jayhawks onemile relay team capped a 76point performance with a victory in 3 minutes 14.15 seconds, eclipsing the Big Eight indoor record of 3:15.9 set by Kansas two years ago. Oklahoma was runnerup in the meet with 61 points,

title: Bruce Petersen Weds Jane Gillespie Bonner
description: Jane Gillespie Bonner, a managing editor of a news journal for the medical department of the National Council en Alcoholism in New York, and Bruce Royal Petersen, a management consultant, were married yesterday afternoon.

title: Perils of Detente
description: Some 18 months ago, the C.I.A. announced that it had revised its estimates on Russian military spending. The Soviet Union was not spending 6 to 8 percent of its gross national product on defense, but double that amount. Which meant, the agency pointed out, that Russia was outspending the United States by 50 percent, if one stripped away pensions and similar items from the U.S. defense budget.

title: Even Good Films Don't Know When to Stop
description: Los Angekes

title: Dungan Assailed on Tuition
description: ON MARCH 18, Chancellor Ralph Dungan will ask the Board of Higher Education to approve his plan for consolidating five New Jersey programs of financial aid to college students into onethe Tuition Aid Program. This sounds like progress in the struggle with bureaucratic duplication; five financial aid programs require multiple applications and frustrating delays. Unfortunately, it is progress at the expense of state scholarships, which presently help more than 13,000 acaclemically able but needy students to attend college.

title: The Battle for Western Coal
description: GILLETTE, Wyo.  For a year the giant earthmovers that are carving out five mammoth coal mines from endless acres of scrubland in the heart of the coal country here in Campbell County were silenced as a suit by environmentalists worked its way through the courts. Now the suit has been settled, the mines are nearing completion and, although initial production seems assured, no one is quite sure what will happen next.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: Simone Weil

title: Catharyn Teare Fiancee of Paul B. Cutright
description: Mr. and Mrs. G. William Teare Jr. of McLean, Va., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Catharyn Hall Teare, to Paul Brooks Cutright, son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul R. Cutright Jr. of Morristown, N.J. A wedding next June, in Hanover, N.H., is planned.

title: The Case Against Nuclear Power
description: DR. E. DE HAAS (Jan. 2) observes that nuclear power is going to stay and grow. As a close watcher of the growth of opposition to nuclear power over the last 10 years, I submit that nuclear power is an idea whose time has gone. The only thing that will keep it going for perhaps a little while yet is the enormous amount of capital  approaching $150 billionthat has been sunk into this high technology.

title: For the FarmerHosts of Denmark,
description: The Danish farm, Hojrupgaard, on a sparkling day in early summer: Acres of green peace ... a halftimbered, thatchedroofed, 250yearold homestead fronting on a cobbled courtyard ... a place where languid cows low and ducks elide.

title: Greenwich Remembers a Rare Teacher
description: THERE ARE those people who believe that Greenwich has drifted too close, in spirit if not miles, to the celebrated apathy of the megalopolis. And then there are those, like the 950 who gathered in Bryam's Harnill Skating Rink last Sunday on a snowy afternoon, who don't.

title: Honda One Man's Drive
description: SAYAMA, Japan  A Japanese businessman was on his way to an important appointment near here recently when his car became mired in one of Japan's innumerable traffic jams. Minute after minute ticked by. Finally, the impatient man abandoned his car and driver and scrambled across the street to a subway.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: THE EASIEST WAY to hang a heavy mirror, a large picture frame, or a set of shelves on a wall is simply to drive long screws or nails into the 2x4 studs behind the plaster. But this means that the object being hung must be positioned over, or in line with, the studs in that wall. Unfortunately, this seldom works out because the studs are seldom if ever situated just where they are needed.

title: Mary Edna Both Is Married
description: Old North Episcopal Church, Boston, was the setting yesterday evening for the marriage of Mary Edna Both, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Murray Both of Auburndale, Mass., to Robert E. Wise Jr., son of Dr. and Mrs. Wise of Wellesley, Mass.

title: Design
description: The Barcelona chair is the RollsRoyce of furniture. Designed by Mies van der Rohe in 1929, it as, almost 50 years later, cult object and status symbol nonpareil. The subtle curves of its X frame of polished stainless steel and its broad, buttoned cushions of natural leather are almost universally familiar; a matched pair gives the approved stamp of classic, contemporary elegance to e'..erything from corporate headquarters to the homes of the affluent.

title: Piping Home the Gas
description: The competition is hot for the profitable job of bringing natural gas from the North Slope of Alaska down other parts of the country. An administrative law judge for the Federal Power Commission has recommended one of three proposed projects for the contract. His advice is not binding on Congress or the President or even the commission, but it is certain to weigh heavily in the final decision and to arouse a storm while that decision is being made.

description: Peas: Mash and flatten into thin sheet on plate. Press the back of the fork into the peas. Hold fork vertically, prongs up, and lick off peas

title: Guest Observer
description: President Carter's intention to go on radio Saturday with a live callin session during which I can accept your phone calls and answer the questions that are on your minds is an impeccable piece of populism, but some of us arc concerned for him. Has he had the experience of life to equip him to meet the challenge of a callin show? If he has never been an author on tour, never been shipped across country by a publisher halfmad with being asked several times a day why one's work on the furbish lousewort isn't in the window of Brentano's, then he probably needs some counsel.

description: THE search for up to 2.6 billion barrels of oil off the New Jersey coast was about to begin when Judge Jack B. Weinstein of United States District Court called a halt to it on Feb. 17.

title: Peter A. W. Lewis, a Professor, Plans To Wed Rose Eve Kirschenbaum in May
description: State Supreme Court Justice and Mrs. Irving Kirschenbaum of New York and Harrison, N.Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Rose Eve Kirschenbaum of Paris, to Peter A. W. Lewis of Carmel, Calif., son of Charles Lewis of Johannesburg, and Mrs. Leo Brady of New York.

title: Fashion
description: Never has it been easier to have 10 greatlooking fingernails. What doesn't come naturally through the genes or consistent care is available in a variety of salon and home firstaid treatments. And nails may need special attention now after all the cold weather. When the thermometer hovers around freezing they go into a kind of hibernation, growing at only half the normal rate of about onetenth of an inch a month. During the colder months the natural oils that bind together the layers of cells that constitute our nail plates tend to dry out, leaving nails brittle and more susceptible to breakage.

title: What Schools Teach of Sex Is Still Controversial
description: Early this month, the junior class at Oxbow High School in Bradford, Vt was scheduled to hear a lecture by a representative from Planned Parenthood. But the lecture was canceled after community complaints. Bradford had become the site of just another episode in the decadelong controversy over sex education.

title: S.O.S. Phone Plan: Woman to Woman
description: AWESTCHESTER social worker who wants to see women help each other more likes to tell the (possibly apocryphal) story of how hundreds of years ago, woman in desperate need of help would run out of her cottage, bang loudly on a teakettle, and all the other women in the village would rush to her side.

title: New Haven Mayor Scores Tactics of His Opponents
description: NEV HAVEN, Feb. 26  Mayor Frank Logue protested at a news conference this week that a halfopen, halfSurreptitious campaign among his political opponents to brand him as antiItalian in this heavily ItalianAmerican city was divisive and irresponsible.
