title: Keeping the Peace in Mt. Kisco
description: MOUNT KISCO police officers spend most of their time directing traffic.. On rare occasions they make drug arrests or investigate burglaries. But on one memorable day last May, they broke up a ring of international gun runners.

title: Fire Destroys Landmark Church
description: WHITE PLAINS, Feb. 26  A centuryold church in the northern Westchester County hamlet of Croton Falls. a landmark that frequently attracted photographers as they drove by on Route 22, was destroyed by fire this week.

title: Post office jungel
description: Spears Annex seemed to breathe like a crouching animal, waiting to gobble up the people who came to spin out their lives in its grumbling bowels ... he hated it, this great lowering thing that chewed people up and spat them back out into the neat and sinister little row of bars across the street from it. How strange (and somehow restful) to find yourself back in the world of American naturalism after all these years!back in the atavistic, sweat stained, grimy arena of natural selection and feral instincts, where nature's indifference to man begins to look like hostility, where bloodlines determine fate and, tenements seek their prey like coyotes.

title: Campaign by Father Who Lost Son Improves Safety in Nation's Parks
description: WILMINGTON, Del.  In the summer of 1970, James L. Hecht began a oneman campaign to make the nation's parks safer after his 9yearold son died in an accident in Yellowstone National Park.

title: A Nursery School Has Men to Look Up To
description: LOS ANGELESIn a era when the tor of the house is becoming conApicuous by his absence, meet the man of the school. teachers seem less concerned about structure and regimentation. They are also more creative with the materials they use.

title: Park Service May Kill Off Death Valley's Wild Burros
description: DEATH VALLEY, Calif., Feb. 27 (AP) The wild burros of Death Valley National Monument may be killed off in $1.6 million project to reduce their damage to the desert environment.

title: OverCounter Supplementary Listings
About the Yankees
description: Thurman Munson reported to camp after being honored at a testimonial dinner at Kent State University and promptly replied to midwinter criticism from George Brett, Kansas City's

title: Church in Paris Occupied By Traditional Catholics
description: PARIS, Feb. 27 (UPI)With the organist vainly trying to drown them out, more than 1,000 followers of Archbishop Marcel Lefebvre occupied a Roman Catholic church today and vowed to stay until they got a church of their own.

title: CLEANERS IN SCHOOLS RATIFY NEW CONTRACT
description: Striking school cleaners and handymen at a stormy, dissentridden meeting ratified a new twoyear contract yesterday morning and Board of Education officials said they would try to restore normal service today in New York City's 994 public schools.

title: West German Is Identified As Moscow Fire Victim
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 27 (AP)The West Gdrman Embassy reported today that had identified the body of a German businessman at the Moscow morgue, the first Westerner known to have perished in the fire Friday at the Rossiya Hotel.

title: A Woman Chaplain Joins Institutions Dept,
description: TRENTON, Feb. 27In the midst of the controversy surrounding the rights of women to become ordained in religious orders, the Rev. Peggy Mesinger, a 30yearold minister from Rockaway Township, became the first woman chaplain for the State Department of institutions in ceremonies here today.

title: Supporters of Women as Priests Hold Vigil Outside St. Patrick's
description: Advocates of women in the Roman Catholic priesthood prayed to make their point yesterday across the street from St. Patrick's Cathedral on Fifth Avenue.

title: Results of Late Saturday's College Sports
description: MEN'S BASKETBALL.

title: Bombs Explode in Lisbon
description: LISBON, Monday, Feb. 28 (AP)Bombs exploded early today at a bank, movie theater and a subway station in a central residential area of Lisbon, the police said. Extensive damage but no injuries were reported. The biggest blast destroyed parked car and badly damaged the entrance of a Borges and Irmao Bank branch on United States Avenue in an upper class residential area.

title: Buyers of TV Programs Enticed With Stunts and Treats
description: Selling television programs from hotel suites during a broadcasters convention calls for a bit of Barnum. With scores of program distributors competing for the attention of nearly 2,000 broadcasters, the game is first to lure a station executive to the suite and then, with genial persuasion, get him to sit for a screening.

title: F.T.C. Proposes Ban on Vague Claims for Drugs
description: The continued freedom of the drug industry to sell remedies for conditions such as the blahs and occasional irregularity has been challenged by a proposed Federal Trade Commission rule. It would severely circumscribe the type of claims made for such drugs and the language used in advertisements for them

title: Making the Friendly Skies More Friendly
description: New York to Los Angeles by air for $89? World Airways wants to offer scheduled service at that price, but the Civil Aeronautics Board won't allow it. Similar bargains would be available between other cities, were not for Federal regulation that chokes off airline competition. Don't take our word. Ask the General Accounting Office, which estimated last week that competitive pricing could save passengers nearly $2 billion a year.

title: GEORGE KALMANOFF, 59, OFFICIAL AT WORLD BANK
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27George Kalmanoff, deputy director of industrial projects at the World Bank, died of heart ailment yesterday at University Hospital in Birmingham, Ala. He was 59 years old.

title: Deaths
description: Deaths

title: The Civil Service System
description: TRENTON, Feb. 27When Robert Mulcahy, the head of the state prison system, criticized the New Jersey Civil Service System, he may have opened the way to similar attacks by other state department heads.

title: Market Place
description: Investors buy railroad stocks for number of reasons: climbing dividends, low priceearnings ratios, traffic benefits from carrying coal, or even a play in oilproducing properties as, for example, in the case of Union Pacific.

title: Loughery Ejected, and Nets Fail to Outfox Warriorg.
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Feb. 27Jim Fox, the Nets journeyman center, made an unexpected debut as the team's coach today at the Nassau Coliseum and suffered his first National Basketball Association loss.

title: COLORADO SKI RESORT CELEBRATES BIG SNOW
description: BRECKENRIDGE, Colo., Feb. 27Half the town is still whooping it up in the Miners Camp saloon and other bars in this ski resort high in the Rockies in celebration of the area's first big snow of the winter, a fall apparently aided by an emergency state weather modification project.

title: A Station in Search of a Character
description: It could only happen at WBAI, New York. The FM station's staff100strong and mostly unpaidtakes over the studio, charging the station's new management with being authoritarian, disdainful of staff participation in programming, unfaithful to their freewheeling traditions. The managers, in turn, charge their employees with being unrealistic, insufficiently radical and unsuccessful at holding even their small audience. What's going on?

title: A Question of Humanity
description: WASHINGTON  The first question to ask about the Carter Administration's activity on behalf of human rights in the world is a practical one: Will it do any good? That is, will it actually help any of the thousands whom totalitarian governments have silenced and jailed and tortured?

title: Businessman, 36, Building Empire On the Amazon
description: ITAGUATIARA, Brazil  Carlos Alberto de Carli, a young clothing manufacturer from So Paulo, came to the Amazon hoping to recover from a respiratory ailment aggravated by the polluted air of the big city.

title: What 3 Surgeons Say
description: Joyce's own surgeon estimated that in about 5 percent of the cases of women who have had a facelift, a certain sagging is detectable within six months to a year after surgery.

title: Chess:
description: Once again the top prizes in the Costa del Sol International Tournament went to the United States entrants, Larry Christiansen of Modesto, Calif., who took first with a 94 score, and myself, placing second with 84. This reversed last year's outcome, when Larry finished a half point behind me.

title: WARREN KELLY, 84, DIES; EXNEWSPAPER OFFICIAL
description: Warren Kelly, vice president and advertising director of the nowdefunct New York Mirror from 1951 until his retirement, died Saturday at the North Shore University Hospital, Manhasset, L.I., after a short illness. He was 84 years old and lived at 22055 46th Avenue, Bayside. Queens.

title: In Memoriam
description: COLIN, May and Fred. In Memory. Day be day, Oh Dear Lord, three things I pray: To see Theo more clearly; To love Thee more nearly; And worship Thee morn dearly. St. Matthew.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The New York Times

title: Manhattan's Family Court: A Ravel of Emotion and Red Tape
description: It was 9:30 A.M., eight hours after Nora O'Brien's husband locked her out In the cold, according to her, when she arrived at Manhattan's Family Court, 60 Lafayette Street, near Foley Square, on her bicycle. Finding no place to put it outside, she upended the bicycle and to the initial displeasure of the uni: formed security officersgot it through one of the revolving doors and into the spacious lobby.

title: City Opera Presents Figaro For the First Time This Season
description: Yesterday afternoon's performance of Mozart's The Marriage of Figaro was the first of the New York City Opera's spring season, and the first City Opera Figaro for the conductor, Michael Charry.

title: Cable Television, CBS in Dispute Over the Showing of Nets
description: UNIONDALE, LI., Feb. 27A dispute between CBS and the companies that carry home basketball games of the Nets on cable television had a resolution of sorts today, though not to the satisfaction of the cable companies.

title: Marian Anderson Honored at 75 by Carnegie Hall Concert
description: The spotlight hit the third box on stage right and the applause from the orchestra seats rose to the ceiling, but It was not until Rosalynn Carter stood and began to applaud that Marian Anderson thought it proper to acknowledge the ovation.

title: BUDGET CUTS THREATEN PROGRAMS AT CITY U.
description: The City University of New York will face a variety of painful options if it forced to close a $50 million budget gap on its own during the coming fiscal year, the Citizens Budget Commission said yesterday.

title: Surging Canadiens Crush Rangers, 8 to
description: Steve Shutt of the mighty Montreal Canadiens put it simply and with touch of John Wayne grit to his tone. We just don't like to lose, said Shutt after the Montreal Canadiens crushed the Rangers, 81, last night, wreaking devastating revenge on the New Yorkers for a defeat in Madison Square Garden on Dec. 12, one of only seven losses the Canadiens have absorbed this season.

title: High Officials in Burma Are Stepping Aside
description: RANGOON, Burma, Feb. 27 (AP)Prime Minister Sein Win, Deputy Prime Minister Lwin and 14 other Government ministers have decided to resign to allow new blood into the top national leadership, the governing Burma Socialist Program Party said today.

title: Robbers Ruin Bank Front But Find No Cash in Safe
description: RYAN, Okla., Feb. 27 (AP)Wouldbe robbers almost reduced the People's Bank of Ryan to a mass of rubble early today as they tried to steal a 5.000pound safe Ithat turned out to be empty.

title: Kingman Pays a Visit to the Mets Camp but Leaves, Still Far Apart in His Bid to Be Their $3 Million Man
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 27Tom Seaver was reading a Japanese baseball magazine, Bob Myrick was petting his Basset hound puppy and the 38 other New York Mets were sitting around the locker room today when the door opened and in walked Dave Kingman, the missing manthe $3 million missing man..

title: Heiden of U.S. Captures His 3d World Skate Title
description: ALKMAAR, the Netherlands, Feb. 27 (AP)Eric Heiden of Madison, Wis., captured his third world speedskating title in three weeks today with a victory in the sprint championships. The triple triumph had not been achieved before.

title: Roosevelt
description: ENTRIES

title: Brass Proud, Trumpet Choir, At Jazzmania
description: Listening to Brass Proud, a jazz group organized by Malachi Thompson that features eight trumpets along with piano, bass and drums, one can well imagine the walls of Jericho tumbling down. But if Joshua's trumpet choir sounded anything like this one, the inhabitants of that city must have danced on the rubble.

title: Skilled Jobs Elude a WellTrained Refugee
description: SILVER SPRING, Md., Feb. 26Nguyen Van Huong, lean and still determined at 47 years of age, sat shuffling a sheaf of papers, smiling anxiously and with growing frustration.

title: Holy Cross High Advances On McMillan's Basket, 4645
description: Glen McMillan of Holy Cross High School seems to have developed knack for winning games with lastseond shots. For the second time this season, his late basket for the Crusaders yesterday was the winner in game against Mount St. Michael. Holy Cross's 46.45 victory gained for it berth in the semifinals of the Catholic High Schools Athletic Association.

title: Washington Star Offer Rejected
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27  Members of the Newspaper Guild at the financially troubled Washington Star rejected today the company's final offer of a $40 wage increase over three years and asked for renewed contract negotiations. However, the rejection was not accompanied by strike threat. We assume a strike would close the paper  kill it, one guild member said.

title: Soviet Institute Develops Skills Of Blind, Deaf
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 27Raise A. Mareyeva sat at a table in the Institute of Defectology, for the study of the handicapped, in the Soviet Union the other day holding hands with whitehaired Olga I. Skorokhodova. Their fingers fluttered in an exchange not of affection, though love was certainly there, but of simple conversation.

title: DEMOCRATS FOCUS ON BRONX ELECTION
description: A special election tomorrow for .am Assembly seat from the Bronx has built itself into a citywide campaign by the Democratic party's reform faction, to weaken the regular party rule of Patrick J. Cunningham the Bronx leader.

title: Figures on Hospital Drug Deaths Reduced by 11,000 in New Report
description: The number of Americans who die each year from the effects of drugs administered in hospitals appears to be lower than was previously estimated on the basis of a widely reported study of adverse drug reactions.

title: Ceausescu Visits Ivory Coast
description: ABIDJAN, Ivory Coast, Feb. 27 (Agence FrancePresse)President Nicolae Ceausescu of Rumania arrived here today from Ghana for a fourday official visit. Mr. Ceausescu is the first East European head of state to visit Ivory Coast.

title: New Yorkers in Congress Will Fight River Tolls
description: Members of the New York Congressional delegation said they would introduce legislation today to block the imposition of tolls ordered by a Federal court at 13 East River and Harlem River crossings. The court ruling supported a controversial Federal trafficicontrol plan designed to reduce air pollution in New York City.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: About 150 residents of a coop apartment building managed by Local 1199 of the Drug and Hospital Union demonstrated in front of the Queens home of its Union President, Leon Davis, against increased maintenance charges. The demonstrators, some of them members or Mr. Davis's union, complained that monthly maintenance charges at 1199 Plaza, 2100 First Avenue, in East Harlem, were being raised by 25 percent while living conditions were deteriorating,

title: Stunned Tennessee Quintet Tumbles Out of First Place
description: Coaches of firstplace teams have long dreaded matchups with lastplace squads in the waning days of a season. They fear their players complacency, versus the nothingtolose attitude of the opponents that such pairings often breed.

title: CARTER STIMULUS PLAN CRITICIZED BY FRIEDMAN
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (UPI)President Carter's economic stimulus package is inflationary and will not reduce unemployment, according to a Nobel Prizewinning economist. Milton Friedman.

title: Bear Market Thinking Prevalent, But Some Analysts Hold Out Hope
description: So Far this year the bond market has declined six weeks out of eight, and the two other weeks were nothing to brag about. Prices of fixedincome securities were unchanged during one of those two weeks and were up moderately during the week ended Feb. 5the only Credit week of 1977 to show net Markets gains of half a point or more.

title: CARTER FACES TEST ON EFFORT TO AVOID AT OTHER RECESSION
description: President Jimmy Carter's efforts to prevent the Western industrialized world from slipping into another recession next year face a critical test this week at series of highlevel meetings in Paris, accarding to American and European officials.

title: Pain in Hunter's Arm Persists, Causing Concern
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Feb. 27Of the multitude of expensive arms in the Yankee camp these days, the one that belongs to Catfish Hunter is the most expensive. Right now it's also the sorest.

title: Youth Home in Rockland, Serving City for Century, Will Suspend Operations
description: SPARKILL, N.Y.The St. Agnes Home and School for Children has announced it will soon close its doors after caring for troubled youngstersmost of them teenage boys from New York Cityfor mnre than 100 years.

title: 6 Die in Missouri Plane Crash; Ice on Wings Called the Cause
description: BOAZ, Mo., Feb. 27 (UPI)Federal in vestigators said today that ice on th wingtips had frozen the controls of light aircraft that crashed yesterday, kill ing six persons.

title: Vance Supports C.I.A. Payments As Appropriates
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance defended as appropriate the practice of channeling secret funds to foreign leaders through the Central Intelligence Agency for common intelligence operations.

title: Memorial Services
description: GALANTIERELewis. Memorial Service wilt be held at Walter B. Cooke Funeral Home. 85th St. and 3rd Aye., on March 2, 1977 at 10:30 A.M.

title: A Congressman Concedes He Used His Office to Help An Ailing Private Concern
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27Representative James R. Mann conceded today that his Congressional office staff had helped fill orders for a private company, but he said that it involved only 15 hours in the aggregate of staff time, about $100 worth.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: DETROIT, Feb. 27 (UPI)Topseeded Martina Navratilova today picked up her fourth victory on the Virginia Slims circuit this season when she turned back secondseeded Sue Barker, 64, 64, and became the first woman tennis player to win more than $100,000 in singles play this year.

title: Tnnrin With Shell Where Gas Flows Not
description: NEW ORLEANS, Feb. 25  The schedule read like one of those quickie European tours, when the cathedrals at Reims, Ronchamp and Rouen all tend to blend together. Only this time, the focus wasn't art architecture or even culture, but rather natural gas. And instead of Europe, the destination was the Gulf of Mexico.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Carter Attends Services At an Episcopal Church
description: CATOCTIN FURNACE, Md., Feb. 27 (AP)President Carter attended an Episcopal church service in rural Maryland early this morning and heard the priest request prayers for President Idi Amin of Uganda.

title: Credit Markets Gloomy
description: Despite some analysts suggestions that the bond market may be oversold, most traders in fixedincome securities seem to expect this year's downward price trend to continue. Page 41.

title: VIRGIN ISLANDS FACE ECONOMIC PROBLEMS
description: CHARLOTTE AMALIE, V.I.  It is hard to come by a hotel room now in St. Thomas, St. Croix or St. John as tourists fill up the United States Virgin Islands. But underneath the trade winds balminess are some serious problems ihat threaten to tax the ingenuity and resourcefulness of the islands 100,000 residents and their territorial Government.

title: EDWARD K. HASTINGS, 74; EXMANAGER OF WALDORF
description: Edward K. Hastings, a former general manager of the WaldorfAstoria Hotel died Saturday at his home in Waikiki Beach in Honolulu, Hawaii. He was 74 years old and had suffered from a long illness, according to friends.

title: Rabin Plans No New Proposals
description: JERUSALEM, Feb. 27 (AP)Prime Minister Yitznak Rabin will not make any new Middle East peace proposals when he meets President Carter for the first time next week, the Government said today. A Cabinet statement said that Mr. Rabin, narrowly reelected last week as head of Israel's governing Labor Party, had turned down a request from the smaller Independent Liberal Party that he discuss new peace approaches on the trip.

title: Another Cosmos Satellite Launched
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 27 (UPI)A Cosmos earth satellite, the 895th in the series hat began nearly 15 years ago, was launched today to continue space studies, Tass, the official press agency, announced.

title: TREASURY SECRETARY CAUTIONS NEW YORK ON EMERGENCY LOAN
description: The United States Secretary of the Treasury, W. Michael Blumenthal, warted, New York City yesterday that he could not approve its emergency loan appligi= tionaimed at averting a default next monthuntil the city had achieved an cord on a package to redeem its Si billion in moratoriuo.

title: Dance: Choreographic Sampler
description: What is an umbrella under an umbrella? A parasol perhaps. Or just a tiny umbrella? In any event, last week during Lar Lubovitch's season at the Dance Umbrella program at the Roundabout Theater's Stage One, the Saturday matinee was devoted to a oneshot appearance by three young women choreographers and their troupes  Rachel Lampert, Sara Rudner and Senta Driver.

title: Edward Dahlberg, Author and Critic, Is Dead at 76
description: Edward Dahlberg, the writer and critic, died yesterday in Santa Barbara, Calif., where he lived. He was 76 years old.

title: Nicklaus Wins Gleason Golf By Five Shots
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Feb. 27 (AP) Jack Nicklaus rallied with three birdies and a spectacular eagle on the back nine today, broke out of a threeway tie and captured the $50,000 top prize in the $250,000 Jackie GleasonInverrary golf tournament.

title: Chinese Showing New Interest in Buying Western Arms to Help Modernize Army
description: The Chinese Government, according to qualified sources in Washington, is showing renewed interest in purchasing Western weapons that will help modernize its army.

title: Yonkers Results
description: SUNDAY

title: Heather Harper New Met Countess
description: Heather Harper was the Metropolitan's new Countess in The Marriage of Figaro in Saturday's performance of Mozart's opera. Although this was the British soprano's Met debut, she is no stranger to New York concert audiences or to opera; she has long been leading singer on English stages.

title: A.F.L.C.I.O. Panel Backs B1 Bomber After Debate
description: MIAMI BEACH, Feb. 27 (UPI)A divided A.F.L.C.I.O. leadership called on Congress and President Carter today to appropriate the full $21.6 billion needed to complete the B1 bomber over the next 10 years.

title: Teacher in Connecticut Who Won't Wear a Tie Upheld by Appeals Court
description: A Connecticut teacher has won a major round in his court fight against a school regulation requiring him to wear a tie and jacket in class.

title: The Reform That Hurts
description: Vice President Mondale has undertaken to put together the Carter Administration's legislative package on electoral reform. As outlined by President Carter his latest news conference, the package will cover changes in the Electoral College, easier registration voters, and public financing of campaigns for the House and Senate. The first two proposals may cause some controversy but among most members 67 Congress, the thirdpublic financingisthe reform that hurts.

title: Polish Cardinal Has Checkup
description: WARSAW, Feb. 27 (UPI)Stefan Cardinal Wyszynski, the 75yearold Roman Catholic primate of Poland, has been hospitalized for a medical checkup, the Cardinal's office said today. The Cardinal is not ailing and is expected to leave the hospital within a few days, the office said.

title: Miss Navratilova Triumphs
description: Miss Navratilova Triumphs; Tops $100,000 From Singles

title: Labor's Wariness on Carter
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27  The trade union movement just is not comfortable with Jimmy Carter. So far, the relations between the White House and the A.F.L.C.I.O. have been warily cordial. George

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Hospitals Wage a Losing Battle to Curtail Smoking
description: A doctor holding an unlit cigarette in a fifthfloor corridor of Southern Baptist Hospital in New Orleans was asked by visitor if smoking was permitted in the corridors. The doctor cupped his hand over the cigarette and said, I'm the wrong one to ask.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Teams of two and three divorced fathers, part of a task force of 25, will fan out this week among six county courthouses to refile suits against the State Superior Court accusing the 120 judges of ignoring the equal standing law when ruling on child custody cases.

title: Guyana Leader Denies Receiving Secret Payments From the C.I.A.
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, Feb, 27 (AP) The Guyana Government has denied that Prime Minister Forbes Burnham received secret payments from the United States Central Intelligence Agency.

title: Carey Seeks to Block Endorsement By Liberals of Goodman for Mayor
description: Governor Carey is making a lastditch effort to head off Liberal Party endorsement of a Republican mayoral contender, State Senator Roy M. Goodman.

title: Handel Work Sung By Choral Society
description: If there was nothing flashy about Saturday night's performance of Israel in Egypt by the New York Choral Society under Robert DeCormier, Handel's oratorio is itself nothing if not impersonal. Compared to the chorus, the soloists have scarcely anything to do, and the story mainly comprises single, monumental eventthe children of Israel are freed from bondage.

title: Indian Community in Jersey City Continues To Feel Impact of Recent Double Murders
description: JERSEY CITY, Feb, 27News of the double murders spread rapidly last New Year's Eve and panic gripped this city's small but growing Indian community.

title: Count Cala di Bergolo, 89, 1943 Commander of Rome And SoninLaw of King
description: ROME, Feb. 27 (AP) Count Calvi di Bergelo, the Italian general in command of Rome when it was declared an open city in 1943, died Friday at his home here, friends announced today. He was 89 years old.

title: Study of a City's Ecological Impact on Area Shows St. Louis Increases Rain and Crops, but Harms Lungs
description: DENVERAn ambitious effort to document the effects of a major city on its environment has shown that one citySt. Louissignificantly increases downwind rainfall and farm productivity, intensifies hail damage and apparently reduces lung efficiency in its residents.

description: Like doctors before them, lawyers are increasingly becoming the targets of lawsuits, and they are finding that their malpractice insurance rates are soaring.

title: American Priest Says He Expects A Pleasant Meeting With Ugandan
description: Roman Catholic priests who have made their way to Uganda's capital said yesterday that they expected a pleasant type of meeting with President Idi Amm Wednesday and looked forward to a continued stay and friendly work in the country.

title: Powell Disarms White House Press With Irreverent Wit and Informality
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27Jody Powell slouched over the lectern. His gray vest was unbuttoned, his shirtsleeves were rolled up and his tie drooped from an open collar as he joked that he might produce Hamilton Jordan, the most potent of President Carter's assistants, at a news conference some day if he's still senior White House staff by then.

title: Virginia Called Supplier
description: RICHMOND, Feb. 27Federal Treasury agents say Virginia's comparatively permissive firearms laws have turned that state into a major East. Coast supplier of Saturday night specials and other small handguns that are sometimes used in urban street crimes.

title: Sadat and Asiad In Sudan
description: KHARTOUM, the Sudan, Feb. 27 (Reuters)President Anwar elSadat of Egypt and President Hafez alAssad of Syria today began talks with the Sudanese President, Gaafar alNimetry, in which they were expected to discuss security of the Red Sea region, the Middle East crisis and strengthening of political, military and economic relations.

description: International

Lower East Side Synagogue Receives New Lease on Life
description: Sixtyfiveyearold Moses Weiser, president of the Congregation of Chasam Sopher on the Lower East Side, was moving about the interior of the synagogue like a peppy stage director checking on props.

title: News Summary
description: MONDAY, FEBRUARY 28, 1977

title: Books of The Times
description: In the summer of 1954, two years after she had appeared on the cover of Life magazine, Brooke Hayward was 17 and got a driver's license. She and her Hollywood girlfriends went riding: With me at the wheel, Josie Mankiewicz, Jane Fonda and Jill Schary spent the better part of July and August zooming around Los Angeles on the trail of Marlon Brando. Although my optimism never flagged, the closest we came to him was the night I took everyone downtown on the halffinished freeway to see Viva Zapata! in a fleabitten movie house. I was in such a rush to get us there that drove, whenever traffic was bad, along the sidewalks. The others wouldn't get in the with for week.

title: U.S. Says Talks Reduced Indian Claims in Maine
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (AP)Indian claims to 60 percent of the land in Maine have been reduced through negotiations. a Justice Department spokesman said today. The department also said President Carter might appoint a conciliator in hopes of settling the dispute.

title: Machine Tool Makers Open Year Strongly
description: The machine tool industry got off to strong start in January, according to figures released over the weekend by the National Machine Tool Builders Association.

title: Those Oscar Nominations: Settling for Second Best
description: LOS ANGELESWhat does a studio do with an intelligent, lovingly crafted, critically praised $7 million motion picture that nobody wants to see? After Bound for Glory failed to attract audiences in its opening weeks, United Artists decided to put all its eggs into the basket of Academy Award nominations.

title: Blaming America
description: LONDONIt is high time that the blame for causing the next energy crisis is put where it belongs, not in the Middle East but in America. The land of big cars, overheated houses, stifling offices and halfempty airplanes is doing more to store up trouble for the rest of us on the energy front than the Shah of Iran and all the greedy hordes of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting. Countries put together.

title: Philadelphia Newspaper Strikers Vote to Protect Supporting Unions
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 27 (AP)Striking members of the Newspaper Guild voted today not to return to work until they receive assurances that members of other unions will not be penalized for honoring their picket lines, a spokesman said.

title: Sports Today
Planning Board to Seek Controls Over Building in Chinatown Area
description: New York City planning officials, fearing that largescale, modern construction will disrupt the character of the Chinatown area, are developing plans to preserve the low scale and the vibrant commercial, restaurant and street life of the worldfamous Lower Manhattan neighborhood.

title: CHARLES ROGERS, CURATOR OF PRINCETON BIRD EXHIBIT
description: Charles H. Rogers, who had been curator of Princeton University's ornithological collection since 1920, died Saturday atthe Princeton (N.J.) Medical Center. He was 89 years old and lived in Princeton.

title: Bangladesh Protests to India
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, Feb. 27 (UPI)Bangladesh filed a protest with India to over what it said was the kidnapping of 11 civilian workers by Indian border troops last week. The protest said that Indian forces abducted the civilians Wednesday inside Bangladesh territory.

title: Rumanian Rights Activist Charges Police Held 2 Signers of Appeal
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Feb. 27 (Reuters)Paul Goma, leader of a group of Rumanian human rights activists, said police had detained two of his supporters today when they left his home after signing a human rights appeal.

As a result, either Manhattan College or the University of Richmond will meet St. John's on Thursday night in the first round of the Eastern College Athletic Conference's Metropolitan Region tournament.

description: The number of jobs in New York City continues drop. Recent figures from the Bureau of Labor Statistics reveal a drop of 117,000 jobs between June 1975 and November 1976. This mean that 3.5 percent of the jobs at which New Yorkers were working 20 months ago have disappeared. Where is economic development?

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: LE GRANDE POMME This city's advantages are of course all well known: the movies, the plays, the music, the ballet, the art, the varieties of food and the plethora of choices. Another advantage is the oftime presence of the creative people who put these things togethernot only the stars, but the composers, the artists, the directors.

title: 4 Canoeists Die in Pennsylvania
description: OAKS, Pa., Feb. 27 (UPI)  Divers found the bodies of four canoeists today about a mile from where they began trip on Perkiomen Creek. Police Sgt. Donald Sherid said the four had left Perkiomen Park in Valley Forge, 12 miles northwest of Philadelphia, yesterday afternoon. He said they were reportedly excellent swimmers, but that the creek was swollen and there was a heavy undertow by a nearby dam.

Finding no place to put it outside, she upended the bicycle and to the initial displeasure of the uniformed security officersgot it through one of the revolving doors and into the spacious lobby.

description: Striking school cleaners and handymen at a stormy, dissentridden rrieeting ratified a new twoyear contract yesterday morning and Board of Education officials said they would try to restore normal service today in New York City's 994 public schools.

title: OPPOSITION LIMITED IN INDONESIAN VOTE
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Feb. 27  Indonesia has opened Its first election campaign In six years, and despite the banners that have begun to appear on the main streets, the two opposition parties appear to have virtually conceded defeat.

title: Sadat Says Soviet Is Sending Back 50 Egyptian MIG's After Overhaul
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27  President Anwar elSadat of Egypt said in a television interview shown today that the Soviet Union had informed him that Egypt would soon receive a shipment of 50 refurbished MIG21 fighter planes.

title: Heiden Takes 3d World Title
description: Eric Heiden of Madison, Wis., yesterday became the first ice skater win three world speedracing titles In one year when he took the sprint championship in the Netherlands. Page 33.

title: Princeton Defeats Columbia as Penn Loses
description: Princeton made its biggest move toward a successful defense of the Ivy League basketball championship last night when the patient Tigers, waiting for the kill, beat Columbia, 6649, while Cornell was upsetting Pennsylvania.

title: Yonkers Closes With Declines in Attendance and Handle
description: YONKERS, Feb. 27 The ghost of New York harness racing glory gave up the chase today and now it is Roosevelt Raceway's turn to worry about New Jersey.

title: Leonard Silk
description: Now that President Carter has laid out his fiscal policy for the coming two years, with the submission to Congress last week of his revisions of Mr. Ford's fiscal 1977 and 197S budnets the fnpus of any effort to diagnose the probable impact of government on The the economy must shift to Economi c monetary policyand particularly to Arthur F. Burns, Scene chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, the quasiindependent regulator of the nation's money supply.

title: Commodities
description: Agriculture Secretary Bob Bergland's invitation to Canada to join in a plan to fix wheat export prices raises basic questions among commodity market specialists. Page 44.

title: Human Rights Groups Are Riding a Wave of Popularity
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Feb. 27Human rights activists, after years of being ignored or disdained as cranks, are riding a wave of popularity because of President Carter's focus on the rights issue. They say the experience is at once exhilarating and unsettling.

title: Events Today
description: Music

title: Stage: Alec McCowen in Equus
description: Peter Shaffer's play Equus is remarkable for many reasons. And one of the more interesting of these is the fact of its survival. This has been, artistically at least, one of the best Broadway seasons in recent memory. But even so, the plight of the serious play on Broadway still seems perilous. Yet Equus is a serious play, and Equus is now in its third year on Broadway.

title: Red Smith
description: Bowie Kuhn is the most solicitous commissioner baseball ever had. Many pressing matters keep him occupied reviewing Nielsen ratings, promising to put a team in Washington, getting his thermal underwear laundered in time for night games in the World Seriesyet, he still finds time worry about how Charlie Finley spends his income.

title: Dr. Irving G. Raphael Weds Ava E. Shapero
description: Ava Ellen Shapero, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ephraim Shapero of Syracuse, was married there yesterday evening to Dr. Irving Gary Raphael, an assistant professor of orthopedic surgery at the University of California Medical Center at DavisSacramento.

title: S. E. C, TO SEEK RISE IN SUBPOENA POWER ON INQUIRIES ABROAD
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27The Securities and Exchange Commission will ask Congress this year for additional subpoenaenforcement powers for investigations involving Swiss banks and other foreign entities not subject to the jurisdiction of American courts.

title: Modernized Beth Israel Cancer Center in Passaic Introduces $325,000 Radiation Therapy Apparatus
description: PASSAIC, Feb. 27New Jersey, which has the highest cancer rate in the United States, now has one of the most efficient and effective cancertherapy tools available to modern medicine.

title: SitIns by 10,000 Basques Back Amnesty Demand
description: MADRID, Feb. 27 (Reuters)More than 10,000 Basques today staged sitins at town halls and parish churches in northern Spain to demand a general amnesty for political prisoners.

title: UGANDA INVITES. U. S. TO SEND OBSERVERS FOR MEETING
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Feb. 27A close aide to President Idi Amin of Uganda said today that his Government had sent message to Washington inviting the United States to send a diplomatic delegation to the meeting Mr. Amin has called with Americans working in Uganda.

title: RUTH RICHMOND
description: Ruth Richmond, former executive secretary of the Chorus Equity Association in New York City, died Saturday in Cleveland, where she had lived for the last few years. Miss Richmond, who suffered from a heart condition, was 75 years old.

title: Rethinking the Mideast
description: ARLINGTON, Va.Recent Arab summit meetings called for a renewed military coalition against Israel, and yet the prevailing consensus in the State Department, Central Intelligence Agency and Pentagon is for a return to wornout prescriptions. These include a renewed call for what is tantamount to an imposed settlement, based on the vulnerable 1967 lines and another state for the Palestinian Arabs alongside Jordanall to be paid in Israeli coin. In this view, unless Israel submits, World War III is at hand.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Center of an African Storm Idi Amin
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Feb. 27There is a scene in a Frenchmade documentary on President Mt Amin that shows the huge and muscular Ugandan presiding at a Cabinet meeting. Obviously aware of the camera, he harangues the minis

title: Businessman, 36, Building Empire On the Amazon
description: ITAGUATIARA, Brazil  Carlos Alberto de Carli, a young clothing manufacturer from So Paulo, came to the Amazon hoping to recover from a respiratory ailment aggravated by the polluted air of the big city.

title: L. PAUL BREMER JR.
description: L. Paul Bremer Jr., former president of Christian Dior Perfumes of America died yesterday of cancer at Norwalk, Conn., Hospital. He was 61 years old and lived in New Canaan, Conn. A graduate of Hamilton College, he was a consultant to the Atlantic Cement Company at the time of his death.

title: De Gustibus
description: Years ago we interviewed a fine cook Rene A. Ruch, who volunteered A recipe for came mechada, a stuffed beef dish traditional to the kitchens of his native Cuba. He attributed the recipe to a friend, Ana Gloria Flores.

title: TREASURY SECRETARY CAUTIONS NEW YORK ON EMERGENCY LOAN
description: The United States Secretary of the Treasury, W. Michael Blumenthal, warned. New York City yesterday that he could not approve its emergency loan applicationaimed at averting a default next monthuntil the city had achieved an accord on a package to redeem its $1 billion in moratorium debts.

title: Bell System Is Bracing for the Carter CallIn
description: BEDMINSTER, N. J.  Telephone experts here are girding themselves for an expected surge longdistance calls from all over the nation Saturday afternoon during a scheduled CBS radio callin to President Carter.

title: Meadowlands
description: ENTRIES

title: Recital: Freire, Brazilian Pianist
description: There was a lot that Nelson. Freire, the Brazilian pianist didn't do at his recital Saturday night at the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A. He didn't program anything from the ClassicalRomantic era of German music, nor did he assay anything uncompromising from our own time. Even within the predominantly flashy, exotic or lightweight music he did play, he was not always equally successful. In short, Mr. Freire is apparently a limited artist. But within those limits, he can be breathtaking.

title: Arthur Blythe Tapes Saxophone at Brook
description: Arthur Blythe, the alto saxophonist, recorded his first album at the Brook on Saturday night in front of an enthusiastic audience. Mr. Blythe has appeared on records before, most notably with Chico Hamilton, and he has been leading his own groups for several years, but he seems to have given the first album of his own music a great deal of thought. The tunes were tightly structured, and the group he assembled had a distinctive sound.

title: Some Congressmen Assail Proposal To Limit Outside Earned Income
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27Representive Mario Biaggi, a Bronx Democrat, does not understand why an ethics proposal before Congress should force him to withdraw, in effect, from a law practice that paid him $33.000 last year, while Representative Frederick W. Richmond, a Brooklyn Democrat, would be allowed to keep $300,000 in corporate dividends.

title: Critic Returns From Brief Respite To Find That Audiences Are Nicer
description: There is malice afoot in the world, believe me. For instance, one of the worst things about slipping away for a week's midwinter vacation is that you have to plan ahead, make plane reservations you'll be bumped from, hotel reservations you'll be free to use just as soon as the other people move out in a day or two, buy some hats for your wife so her hair won't get ruined in the rain. Hay

title: Bridge:
description: A record number of upsets marked Grand National Knockout Team play at the Vanderbilt Club, 1362 Northern Boulevard, Manhasset, L.I., Saturday. After two knockout rounds four of the eight topseeded teams had vanished from the scene, losing their chance for district, zonal and national honors.

title: State Modifies Closing of Sites For Alcoholics
description: Confronted with angry and vocal opposition from a growing number of state legislators, the Department of Mental Hygiene's Division of Alcoholism has modified an order halting admissions to five alcohol rehabilitation centers across the state and will continue to allow them to accept emergency cases.

title: U.S. Aims Its Sights At Polluting of Ocean
description: At the request of President Carter. New Jersey's Attorney General, William F. Hyland, will prepare a proposal for a Federal civil strike force to crack down on violators of environmental laws prohibiting ocean dumping and beach pollution.

title: Washington Is Watching Situation In Uganda Closely, Carter Says
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (AP)President Carter said today that the United States was watching the Uganda situation closely, trying not to upset President Amin, and trying to take advantage of his good wishes that he has expressed.

title: Study Finds Saturday Night Specials Were Confiscated Less Often Than Expensive Weapons
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27Small, cheap handguns may be used less often in crimes than expensive guns made by the largest American manufacturers, a new study has found.

title: Hospitals Wage a Losing Battle to Curtail Smoking
description: A doctor holding an unlit cigarette in a fifthfloor corridor of Southern Baptist Hospital in New Orleans was asked by a visitor if smoking was permitted in the corridors. The doctor cupped his hand over the cigarette and said, I'm the wrong one to ask.

title: U.S. Confirms Invitation
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27The State Department confirmed today that President Amin had invited the United States to send an official observer to the meeting he has called with Americans living in Uganda on Wednesday. But a department spokesman said that he had no comment at the moment on whether Washington would accept the offer.
